author: {'steamid': '76561197981747125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1578339891}
review:
I voti vanno da 1 a 10, dove pi√π il voto √® alto pi√π √® positivo e sono dati a gioco completato.  Nel voto viene tenuto conto il periodo in cui il gioco √® stato lanciato sul mercato.

-	Grafica 8
-	Sonoro 8
-	Storia 6
-	Giocabilit√† 9
-	Longevit√† 5

Giudizio finale:
Un Indie Game davvero molto carino. Graficamente simile a Zelda: Breath of the Wild, il gioco in realt√† si differenzia molto visto che non ci sono combattimenti, ma solo Puzzle da risolvere per proseguire nella vostra avventura. Nessuna mappa e nessun dialogo, solo qualche piccolo indizio per aiutarvi a risolvere i vostri enigmi che qualche volta risultano un p√≤ troppo semplici. Peccato per la longevit√†, alla fine il gioco risulta essere cos√¨ piacevole che vorreste continuasse ancora!

Ricordo a tutti che il giudizio, come il gusto √® sempre molto personale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073183976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1572170769}
review:

I would recommend it to someone who has not played too many indie games but wants to get their foot in. But if you've played enough indie games, you already know if you will like it or not

review:
I got this game a few days ago as a recommendation and I must say it's an amazing little game.
The puzzles weren't too hard, but the atmosphere was so engaging.
The soundtrack is wonderful too, so much so that I am still listening to it after completing the game twice.
The games story plays perfectly on your emotions, from happiness meeting a friend or completing a puzzle to sadness as you learn more or things happen out of your control. (no spoilers though xd)
It is an amazing game and totally worth your time to play and complete! 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198138252144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1636897199}
review: This game is incredible! It simultaneously broke my heart and blew my mind. I've never played anything like it and the graphics/animation of the sky both day and night in the first stage is just breathtaking, I could have (probably did) just spend hours looking up at the sky. Highly recommend but also be prepared for an emotional ending, it will stay with me forever and I cannot say that about too many games. Outstanding work!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051020329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1651131885}
review:
A wonderful, touching, melancholy game. This game doesn't do any one truly novel thing, but creates something that itself is quite an enjoyable journey unlike any other individual game. It does not fit neatly into a genre. While it has puzzles, don't expect to be challenged, and while it has platforming, the controls are extremely forgiving. It has a story but that's not the focus either. 


It's hard to give comparison, but it lies somewhere on the spectrum of The Witness, Outer Wilds, Talos Principle Superliminal, and even a bit of Firewatch. If you like all or most of those, you might enjoy flowing through this.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198137657929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1645770504}
review:
Would recommend this game despite the relatively short play-time based on the absolutely gorgeous presentation. Wait for a sale as the running-time is a detractor.
The presentation of the experience is beautiful and near flawless, from visual to sound design everything lines up to completely engage you into the flow of the action. Puzzle design is relatively simple because it is intended to allow you to progress and the act of solving the puzzles is built into the presentation itself.
This brings me to the crux of the "game", while the opening (the parts you mostly see in the screenshots) is breezy and light the actual theme of the game is emotional and themed with sadness. We has a great time playing until we started to realize the ultimate trajectory of the story's narrative, so be warned.
There's much in RiME to discover and collect but due to the nature of the story I don't think we will be replaying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971078704', 'num_games_owned': 1107, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1644985002}
review:
RiME is a puzzle platformer that focuses more on the experience than the difficulty (of both the puzzles and the platforming). If you are reading this review because you saw the screenshots and it looks like the kind of game that you would like then I would definitely recommend it: It's extremely well done for what it is, looks even better in motion, and also has really good sound and music design.

Based purely on game mechanics I would rate it as good but not great (although there are a handful of stand out puzzles). If you aren't interested in the more emotional/artistic aspects of games then there are probably other games that you would enjoy more. Even with that caveat, however, RiME has the feeling of being a labor of love, and it feels like the result of not only a strong initial design vision but also the result of iteration and polish so that everything works together well and the whole feels greater than the sum of its individual parts. I think it is a good example of a game that does exactly what it sets out to do.
(I think it's worth giving a special mention to the use of dynamic music in the game. I was constantly impressed with how the music seamlessly reacted to what I was doing, and not just by cross fading to a music cue but instead by actually having the music cue emerge from the music that was already playing.)

review:
Es probablemente, a mis 45 a√±os, el juego que m√°s me ha conmovido cuando poco a poco vas descubriendo la historia. Lo jugu√© junto a mi peque√±o de 5 a√±os. √âl disfrut√≥ como un enano con los puzzles, los paisajes, los saltos, los descubrimientos... Y yo con la m√∫sica, la est√©tica maravillosa, el que sea un juego con alma. 

Conforme avanza la historia y vas viendo lo que realmente sucede, la aut√©ntica historia tras el simbolismo, te deja hecho polvo y conmocionado, aunque mi peque no entendiera lo que realmente hab√≠a sucedido. Ser√° una buena oportunidad para ense√±arle ciertos conceptos sobre la vida de una forma hermosa dentro de un par de a√±os.

En fin, no digo m√°s. Es dif√≠cil seguir hablando y evitar los spoilers que en este juego m√°s que en la mayor√≠a conviene esquivar. Obra maestra, 10 sobre 10 absoluto.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009564590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1642451322}
review: Not sure what the issue is but am running this on a brand new (2021) top spec pc and the graphics are just making it unplayable.  Sadly no pc expert so no idea how to fix it.  When the character turns or looks at things  the view I get is on the other side of the wall.  So I turn around to look at, say a wall, and I see the view on the other side of the wall.  It makes the whole thing totally unplayable.  I read there were issues with this game when it was released and is best played on a console rather than a pc, even a good one.  The graphics settings on the game itself are very basic and don't help.  So for that reason I would not recommend this game on pc unless perhaps you have a really old one and then I guess it might play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996677654', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1641873282}
review:
Rime is like a miniature golf course. Every piece of it has been set up as a challenge for you to overcome. You're not exploring a world, you're going through a sequence of goals; and if you see a bunch of touch obstacles coming up ahead, you know you're going to have to get through it somehow.

In that, Rime isn't exactly my favorite kind of game. I like solving puzzles, sure, but I like the feeling that I happen to be finding a way through a strange land - not that I am finding THE only way through the strange land, the specific path that's been laid out for me. Every ledge in Rime is one you'll have to climb up onto, every item is one you'll have to use somehow, every side path leads either forward or to one of the bonus collectibles you'll find which fill in some of the story. (I'd have preferred this game if I only needed to complete *some* of the goals to proceed, whereas *all* goals completed would unlock an achievement or a bonus item, perhaps.)

And the story's not much to begin with. Kid washes up on an island and immediately starts figuring out how to get past the obstacles that have been set in his way. There's a fox companion, but unlike other games with fox companions (The First Tree, Lost Ember [actually a wolf], Never Alone, Spirit of the North), this one barks like a dog and appears to only have the purpose of showing you which way to go next, as the lavish environments sometimes make that difficult to figure out. Finding the collectibles helps explain what's going on, but I got tired of exploring every nook and cranny, so I was left in the dark. The endgame really brings the story to life and throws in some beautiful music, but I wish that had been part of the game all along.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067107893', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1655752164}
review:
Ya know... I'm mad. And I don't really care if it's a metaphor or whatever,,. I was having a good time. I was enjoying myself, getting lost in the ESCAPISM of a nice video game. When things got dark, I was confident that the light would show through again. That hope would exist at the end of the dreary march.

How dare you?

author: {'steamid': '76561198065710582', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1593108150}
review: RiME is a very nice, lighthearted vibe, with an interesting environment and story telling through said environment. The puzzles aren't anything extreme but they're fun and they often aid to the mystery of the world. Overall, it was a very fun experience, but I'm not sure if the amount of gameplay you get out of it is worth the original full price. If anything though, I would say that if you're looking for something to sit down, relax and play for a couple of hours without dedicating too much time or connection to a larger story, it's worth buying on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976122238', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1640625398}
review:
RiME, this game is stunningly beautiful, the music is god tier. In my personal opinion, this has the best soundtrack for any video game i've ever played and that's up in the 1000's or 10000's at this point. Buy this game, get it on sale, the length doesnt support the 30$ price tag, but on sale, even if it's 5-10 dollars off, please set aside, 5 ish hours, buy this game, and just enjoy the ride and have fun. The puzzles weren't too challenging, the mechanics work, sometimes a little wonky with climbing but its nothing too serious.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198195484943', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1640610812}
review:
[h1]8/10[/h1]

Very chill and intuitive gameplay, 5 hours well spent. If you like The Last Guardian this one is quite similar. Beautiful visuals and atmosphere.

The fox was very annoying at times and the robot chapter felt too much like a copy of The Last Guardian without the emotional connection. I didn't understand the plot until the very end of the game which I won't spoil for you because its worth discovering on your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213201365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1640500343}
review: I don't play a lot of games compared to most and so when I do,  I usually pick out a game when it looks to have decent art, a compelling story and challenging, yet not overwhelmingly so, puzzles. I wasn't sure RiME would be for me when I started and I left after playing for two hours. Months later I've come back and I have no idea why and how I did not complete this game in one straight sitting. I LOVE IT.  RiME was absolute worth my time. money, emotional investment and this review. Thank you team from Tequila works, its a beautiful game

author: {'steamid': '76561198090949962', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1639588366}
review:
Lato gameplay, puzzle inizialmente piuttosto divertenti, poi un p√≤ ripetitivi ma non esageratamente per quanto mi riguarda. Qualcheduno difficile, quasi tutti abbastanza intuitivi. Alla fine dei conti leggermente troppo lento ma comunque divertente.
La lentezza tra l'altro √® parte del filo narrativo che, mentre pu√≤ essere intuito durante il viaggio, si ricuce in un' opera completa portando a compimento il titolo.
Lato tecnico interessante, un buon aspetto, stile simile a quello delle favole della disney da qualche punto di vista ma generalmente pi√π scuro lato luci e colori. Peccato per l'ottimizzazione non proprio fenomenale.
Decisamente consigliato, dopo qualche ora pu√≤ capitare di essere un p√≤ annoiati ed essere tentati a lasciarlo incompleto ma suggerisco di finirlo, ne varr√† la pena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039190312', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1639572028}
review:
Pros:
- Nice soundtrack
- Minimalistic design

Cons:
- Absolutely terrible CAMERA controls, runs at 240 fps but feels like 60 due to the way it handles mouse movements
- Lack of FPS cap setting
- Poorly optimized as this game uses more resources than other AAA games
- Boring overall

I personally am not a fan of the shouting feature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198837969085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1639425366}
review:
Un jeu que je conseille absolument si vous aimez l'exploration et le questionnement.

En effet, le joueur est encourag√© √† chercher, et sa d√©termination est r√©compens√©e par des objets se r√©v√©lant pour certains √™tre des parcelles d'histoire. 
Les musiques sont magnifiques et se marient √† la perfection avec les √©v√®nements du jeu. Elles participent ainsi √† l'immersion. 
Les graphismes sont simples mais ils n'ont pas besoin d'√™tre plus pouss√©s. Ce style graphique fait parti du charme de RIME. Les diff√©rents protagonistes sont attachants et certaines s√©parations sont assez dur √† oublier.
L'histoire quand √† elle est po√©tique et soul√®ve beaucoup de questions. Les myst√®res sont nombreux √† demeurer non √©lucid√©s et cela ajoute selon moi une certaine profondeur √† cette ≈ìuvre. 
Il n'y a aucune parole, seules les images, les cr√©atures et les d√©cors sont l√† pour permettre au joueur de comprendre l'√©tendu de ce √† quoi il fait face. Et voyant un jeu qui arrive √† conter autant, sans un seul mot, est selon moi une preuve que l'on a affaire √† une tr√®s belle ≈ìuvre artistique. 

Pour conclure, aussi bien pour la puissance de son propos que son onirisme, RIME est √† mettre au m√™me niveau que GRIS qui m'avait aussi beaucoup touch√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258918707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1639343518}
review: Can't recommend this at all. Was hoping for some tricky puzzles and interesting story - but it has neither. The puzzles are all very simple, and most of the game is wandering around looking at fairly average scenery. All the exploration is on rails, and there is no reward for wandering off the beaten track of thinking imaginatively. It's just one poorly optimised step after another, plus it felt as though they totally forgot to write the plot.

review:
Les graphismes sont beaux oui, mais l'histoire l'est encore plus.
La difficult√© est, je trouve, bien dos√©e : on peut chercher un moment la solution d'une √©nigme ou s'y reprendre √† deux ou trois fois pour atteindre une plateforme mais rien n'est insurmontable. On se laisse happer par des univers tr√®s diff√©rents √† chaque chapitre, tant√¥t hostiles, tant√¥t apaisants. Il y a assez de libert√© d'exploration m√™me si on reste guid√© du d√©but √† la fin et des succ√®s √† n'en plus finir !

author: {'steamid': '76561198032510911', 'num_games_owned': 1859, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1638347776}
review:
Una maravilla de juego, con un estilo gr√°fico encantador y una banda sonora muy a tener en cuenta.
Cuenta con una historia muy emotiva y personalmente me gusto mucho, pero hay que tener en cuenta que tiene una narrativa donde no te explican la trama directamente, si no que debes poner mucha atenci√≥n a la exploraci√≥n del mapa y a los detalles. Al principio cuesta un poco que el juego enganche, pero d√°ndole la oportunidad descubres lo grandioso que es. Evidentemente es un juego que recomiendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045796441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1638147754}
review:
Every review about RIME is right:  it's visually stunning and has a breathtaking soundtrack, but its ability to stand out is hampered due to some clumsy control issues, repetitive puzzles, and poor graphics optimization.

But you're going to buy it anyway, and you should, because frankly you're not here for mold-shattering puzzle mechanics or The World's Most Optimized Graphics Engine. You're here because you know what you want:  a short but fulfilling game that keeps you occupied, visually impresses, and makes you want to re-play as soon as you finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985159146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1638152508}
review:
Don't buy this on Steam. It seems like an amazing game from what I could play but their optimization is so bad for PC that even on the lowest settings I can't get it to stop stuttering. Or if you do buy it, play it for a half hour and refund if it stutters on your rig. Get it for console if you can otherwise.

Bad Port/10 and no dev fix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085376246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1050, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1544910705}
review: Fantastic emotional exploration-adventure with a few puzzle elements. Don‚Äôt expect too much original gameplay from this, it‚Äôs again mostly about the journey. It also starts out slow in the first chapter, but after this, continuingly adds and adds more depth and variations. Second chapter needs some thinking to evade a threat, third chapter features some really majestic encounters, the fourth with the sapping black all around (need to see this on an OLED screen) just visually tears you down. But especially in the end chapter this game actually really managed to connect to my feelings and get me emotionally, can‚Äôt really explain why, but it truly did. So in hindsight, even if I at first wouldn‚Äôt have expected it, a very strong title indeed. Can‚Äôt really criticize much, visuals in their minimalism are superb, music is enchanting, lots to collect and explore. Only two downsides I have to mention. For one, the price tag might be a little steep in my opinion, but the game has been on sale and bundles many times at the usual places like Fanatical & Co, so it‚Äôs you‚Äôre decision what it‚Äôs worth to you. And the second thing, I was indeed kind of disappointed that Lindsey Stirling‚Äôs main theme ‚ÄòForgotten City‚Äô isn‚Äôt featured on the deluxe soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030529924', 'num_games_owned': 878, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 57, 'playtime_at_review': 1363, 'last_played': 1712268419}
review:
This game has a beautiful story full of symbolism, a top-tier soundtrack, and gorgeous visuals. I highly recommend it. 

That said, it does have some performance issues: at max settings, with AA and VSYNC on, I was hitting 30-60 fps on my 1440p 144 Hz monitor with a AMD 5800x + 6800xt build on a fast SSD. I found out that turning AA all the way off, and turning VSYNC off, and just sticking to freesync via AMD software, brought me up to 100-110 fps. 

Btw the game limits you to 60 fps max, but you can get higher fps by following these instructions: 
- Locate Engine.ini under C:\Users\*YourUser*\AppData\Local\SirenGame\Saved\Config\WindowsNoEditor
- Open engine.ini
- add the following 2 lines to the bottom:

[/script/engine.engine]
bSmoothFrameRate=false

-Lastly, right click on engine.ini > properties > check "set as read only"
-Enjoy 60+ fps!

author: {'steamid': '76561198443118727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1636763799}
review: Wow. I just finished this up and in my humble opinion it was a masterpiece of a puzzle game. For a long while I sat on the fence with this game, coming across it in various searches and reading through some of the reviews. It was something I'd wish-listed for several months. Then about a week or so ago I saw a recent review saying it could be argued the game had subtle elements of the game Inside scattered throughout it. This immediately piqued my interest as I personally view Inside as the greatest game ever made. At any rate, I Rime on sale and decided to pick it up. It's just as all the positive reviews have said: excellent puzzles, nothing too incredibly hard, absolutely gorgeous soundtrack, awesome animation and so on. Also thematically brilliant in that it borrows the concept of Elisabeth Kubler Ross's "five stages of grief" to great effect. But the part I perhaps liked the best was the world building throughout and that the developers managed to bring an element of exploration into the game. The world is, at times, very surreal and dark. It's true that there's a bit of an Inside-like vibe, and it also echoes the strangeness of games like "Vane," for instance, although Vane was quite flawed, overall, compared to this. Rime's game mechanics are pretty tight, loading times are good, and the glitches are essentially nonexistent. As I played through this I found myself thinking at various times of so many great games: The Talos Principle, Portal, Inside, Hob, Vane and even Ori in a few spots. I didn't cry at the end but I must confess there was a bit of a lump in my throat. But...when it comes to things like death and the loss of loved ones, we have no choice but to face up to our common fate. Rime handles all of this in a very beautiful, heartfelt and inspiring way. This definitely rates a solid 9 out of 10 in my book. Well done indeed, Tequila Works!!

review: RiME is an excellent adventure game with fun movement, puzzles just the perfect difficulty, and beautiful and varied environments. The overarching story is sad but with good closure to it, and it's one of those that in its final moments makes so much of what came before clear. The highlight of RiME is definitely the movement and exploration, which make for lots of rewarding environmental puzzles. I'd highly recommend playing through this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097650402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1635305168}
review: If you only judge this game by the complexity of its puzzles, you'll probably agree with the official reviews that it's just okay. The puzzles are creative, but nothing super special or challenging. Where this game stands out is its mystery and grandeur. It's the experience of wandering through these vast, ancient lands with a sweeping, relaxing score playing in the background that is really special. And that is why you should play this game. Don't play for the puzzles, play for the beauty of the experience that it offers, and you will not be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077161308', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1634090477}
review:
A masterpiece that deserved/deserves more polish.

RiME has some performance issues for many. I dunno if it's a bad port (or if it is even a port?) or if it is just a matter of finding what works on your components.. But it can be off putting and make this worthwhile game easy to turn away from far too early on. Most of the suggested fixes in the forums are a matter of switching away from default settings (windowed full to full, triple buffering to double, SSAO to another choice, etc etc). Perhaps they shouldn't have been the default? This game is a visual masterpiece in storytelling but by all means should "just work". Especially on powerful systems. I mean, the frame drops I had at first couldn't even be smoothed with G-Sync on. So it's a crying(pun intended) shame it isn't optimized for a wider breadth of builds. 

Beyond performance there are some gameplay hiccups as well. For a game so wonderfully animated and with a player character full of life(pun not intended); The controls can feel lackluster. Especially jumping. You just don't get a smooth feeling while making your character move. Then like many games before it, the movement on ledges is mind numbing at times. Shimmying along a ledge and leaping to the next is an exercise in patience of trying to figure out which way the game wants you to point your thumbstick versus the camera. Also of note, there is an odd design choice with the ledge stuff where there's a needless requirement to be hanging or standing on particular ledges. Seemingly identical gaps in different parts of the game require you to transition to one or the other before you can jump. And well, jumping and ledge work are the bulk of the platforming. Some more polish for a smoother wield of the controls would've led to me being completely lost in the amazing experience that is RiME. I have no doubt I would've played it through in one sitting if the controls were smoother.

I only point out these complaints for one reason though; To say they're well worth getting over. Figure out how to make the game run smooth enough on your machine. Take a break if you're annoyed by controls. But play RiME. The visual storytelling is spectacular. To think of how I felt exploring in the beginning and discovering this new world to the way I was rocked and along for the ride by the end is wild. I love narrative experiences like this in games. I'd definitely hesitate to say that the story isn't predictable as you go along, but I still felt more than I expected to when I got there. It really is a masterpiece that I'm glad I played. And the game is indeed fun to play most of the time as well. Sure there's jumps and ledges but there is also really decent puzzles and tons of exploring on foot. Plenty of hidden collectibles of various types as well. You can get lost in the experience at times and it is amazing. 

I really enjoyed the storytelling experience that was RiME and the unique world it presented. I highly recommend it. It is worth the effort to hurdle any issues you may run into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116423686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1657330774}
review: For me, 10/10. A Wizard of Earthsea, Abzu, Aegean myths, Inside, a Miyazaki film score. Awesome art direction, and yeah, again, that musical score. Critics liked but didn't love this. Not sure why. It doesn't break any ground with mechanics, but for puzzles that are a pacing mechanic rather than brain burners, just for overall impact, this is a gem. Long live Tequila Works!

author: {'steamid': '76561198334244409', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1633045483}
review:
Una historia emotiva para salir de la vor√°gine de la acci√≥n desenfrenada.

Rime no es un juego para cualquiera, aclaremos esto desde el principio. Es un juego que no requiere de habilidad casi en absoluto, sino m√°s bien de conexi√≥n con el momento. Todo, desde el dise√±o de los escenarios, pasando por los efectos visuales, la m√∫sica y paisaje sonoro y llegando a la historia (que tal vez no sea muy clara mientras se lo juega por primera vez, pero que cobra otro sentido, muy profundo e interrogante, una vez que se atraviesa la escena final y se vuelve a la pantalla de inicio -para esto podr√≠a incluir un Spoiler, pero siendo un juego tan breve quien decida probarlo lo va a averiguar muy pronto) exige que conectemos con el momento.

En mi caso por ejemplo, pas√© los √∫ltimos tres a√±os jugando PUBG y Rocket League. M√°s de  3 mil horas de juego a puro disparo, sangre, goles y explosi√≥n. Juegos muy cabeza de macho que lo mantienen a uno en constante tensi√≥n. Hace unos mese empec√© a trabajar muchas m√°s horas diarias que antes y necesitaba que el momento de sentarme a jugar fuera un momento tranquilo, para respirar, para bajar un cambio. Rime me aport√≥ un espacio para explorar con tranquilidad y descubrir los secretos a mi propio ritmo. La canci√≥n en los labios del chico protagonista transmite la ternura que acompa√±a todo el dise√±o, aun en las etapas m√°s oscuras del juego. Todo parece contrastar con el traj√≠n diario de trabajo, estr√©s y consumo. En Rime hay un juego que no exige apuro, resultados ni maniobras que deban ser ensayadas una y otra vez. Quiero decir, Rime lo recibe a uno con un paisaje estupendo y paletas √≠ntimas, el sonido del mar que despertar√° en m√°s de uno alg√∫n que otro recuerdo, con un mont√≥n de cosas que otros juegos no brindan con este tenor, con esta afectividad. Todo lo que se puede sospechar al recorrer los escenarios se confirma cuando al terminar el juego vemos los nombres de los niveles: Rime es una historia de interioridad y ternura, de conexi√≥n con los procesos inevitables de la vida, y lo hace a trav√©s de una maravillosa historia en la que no median palabras. El lenguaje universal del llanto y la risa.

Quienes hayan jugado otras joyas como ICO o Journey puede que encuentren que ciertos apartados del juego (controles, variedad de mec√°nicas, complejidad de los puzzles, escalamiento de habilidades, etc...) no sean memorables ni comparables a los de sus antecesores. Despu√©s de Prince of Persia y Shadow of the Colossus queda muy poco por hacer en los platformers de escalada y merodeo. Sin embargo, Rime lo hace de manera correcta, y todo en un ambiente cautivante con un trasfondo simb√≥lico m√°s que interesante.

Es un juego que, por su brevedad, no debe abandonarse. Recuerdo alg√∫n momento en que, sin entender bien qu√© estaba pasando, casi lo dejo para jugar a otra cosa. Puede que los cuatro escenarios parezcan inconexos, o que la falta de desarrollo del personaje lo haga parecer mon√≥tono por momentos. Curiosamente, todo eso deja de importar sobre el final. Cada figura, cada retrato cobra profundo sentido en el instante final, le parte a uno el pecho y lo hace resignificar cada elemento suelto de la historia que parec√≠a solo decorar.

Si la semana te agobia, pasar la tarde del jueves y viernes con el celular apagado y escuchando el viento pasar puede ser un buen plan para bajar a tierra.

review:

Alguns destes problemas que v√£o desde movimento de camera, extremamente grotesco e que tiram toda imers√£o, erros atras de erros ao girar ou movimentar a camera.

 E para fechar com chave de ouro ap√≥s o capitulo do passaro gigante o jogo em tela cheia simplesmente fica em tela preta, sendo necess√°rio reiniciar em modo janela, apenas para a porcaria da cutscene funcionar.

Por estas raz√µes n√£o tenho como recomendar o jogo.
Erros graficos ja s√£o chatos pra caramba, pessima performance em alguns momentos pior ainda, mas, tela preta ai ja √© demais.

review:
Una gran idea, una ejecuci√≥n pobre. El juego es precioso, tanto a nivel est√©tico como la banda sonora, y plantea una muy bonita forma de contar una historia emotiva. Sin embargo, tiene escenarios muy vac√≠os (aunque con cierta cantidad de coleccionables) y un ritmo bastante mejorable.

A nivel de jugabilidad no est√° mal, algunos puzzles son interesantes y otros son m√°s rutinarios, aunque no destaca por sus mec√°nicas. No es que sea malo, sino que sencillamente no es bueno. Quiz√° se apoya demasiado en su apartado art√≠stico para atrapar al jugador y llevarlo hacia el final de la historia, y esto resulta en varios momentos en los que se reduce la inmersi√≥n y el t√≠tulo pierde bastante fuelle.

review: Very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141835349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1630894532}
review:
TLDR, highly recommend this game, make sure to explore as much as you can because it actually pays off in the long run and is relevant to the story!

Now for the longer review:
Overall i want to give this game an 8/10
Visuals/music these 2 i would say carry the game for me solid 10/10
Story, i wont go into detail but it does definitely get a bit confusing as you play, but that did add to the enjoyment of it because i had freedom to make assumptions and guesses as to what was happening, and once i got the answers at the end i was very satisfied!
Puzzle wise its a bit lacking, so  6/10 the puzzles themselves are nice, and the concept is very fun BUT there were almost no moments of excitement when a puzzle would get solved, usually when i got stuck on a puzzle and finally would figure it out i would be annoyed not proud/happy.
Final thought, the thing that i loved a lot about the game, is the small detail of character animation. the fact that depending on where you are walking would change the walk cycle animation of the character was pure genius, down hill, in shallow water, in deeper water, up hill, all had unique animations and it was just a joy to watch! 11/10

review: Wieder so ein Spiel, dass weniger vom Gameplay lebt als vielmehr der Atmosph√§re. Die Musik ist gro√üartig, die S√ºdsee-Optik sehr angenehm und die Welt beeindruckend genug, um zu fesseln. Dennoch... hab ich nach zwei Stunden keine Lust mehr gehabt. Daf√ºr war mir das ewige Gelatsche zu viel und die Story, so sch√∂n sie ist, zu kleinteilig erz√§hlt. Dass die Figuren nicht sprechen ist ja ganz nett, aber reduziert die Geschichte noch mehr. Erst ganz am Ende kapieren wir worum es geht und m√ºssen daf√ºr viel Arbeit leisten, mit nur sehr wenig neuen Gameplay-Elementen hier und da. Wer damit umgehen kann, sehr zu empfehlen, f√ºr alle anderen reicht auch YouTube... so hab ich dann die zweite H√§lfte genossen und konnte die ganze Kletterei und Schieberei einigerma√üen √ºberspringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077663643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1630227074}
review:
Absolutely stunning art style and presentation. Audio and music are similarly top notch. Will be listening to this OST for years to come and i often just stopped to enjoy the view.

The game itself is a fairly standard platformer/puzzler that wont blow anyone away in terms of mechanics, but the passable gameplay pairs well with its fairly short length and additional mechanics are added often enough to keep boredom at bay. Combined with the previously mentioned top tier sound/visual work make this a memorable and standout experience. Journey is not a masterpiece of gameplay design, but has become a significant influence in the industry through it's presentation and story telling methods. The same can be said here, though to a lesser extent perhaps. 

Performance was rocky. Played at 4K on a 3070 and had many sections exhibiting stuttering. Shame because a game this old with an assumedly light graphics implementation should not stress a modern system this much.  That said, It was so beautiful at 4K i decided to just grin and bear through the stutters, that's how hard this game leans into its presentation and how well it pays off. 

OH, and if you get it, get the soundtrack bundle, a dollar or two is a steal for this OST. 

"If games are art, I want this on my wall."

author: {'steamid': '76561198093902509', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1628963946}
review:
An emotional game with a beautifully crafted world, lovely soundtrack and decent puzzles (which could have been a bit more varied though). The main game is on the short side (I completed it in two sittings), however I did not go out of my way to look for collectibles.

Its regular price is way too high for what you get though, and while the journey was great I thought the ending was a little anticlimactic after all the wondering about the world you just traversed. Get it while it is heavily discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031752600', 'num_games_owned': 2484, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1629096666}
review:
I just completed the game moments ago, so these are my fresh thoughts. 

This is a very beautiful, thoughtful, meaningful game. It's also extremely derivative of games you know and love. There is nothing special about this game mechanically, and sometimes it's trying too hard to be "cinematic" and it actually negatively impacts the way the game feels to play. That being said, you get the sense that this game is very important to the people who made it, and if you like games like Journey, Shadow of the Colossus, and the Zelda franchise, you will probably find something to enjoy in this game. I give it a strong recommendation, with maybe a caveat that you might want to get it on sale. My initial playthru took less than 4 hours total, and that was with a little optional collectible gathering and a healthy number of fail states. This doesn't mean it's not worth the money necessarily, but you have to decide for yourself what you value. There is some decent replay value in hunting for collectibles and achievements, which seem to all be very doable if that's your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995239792', 'num_games_owned': 1523, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1537173968}
review:
I've got some very mixed feelings about this game.

On the one hand it is a beautiful game with some amazing scenery and grand puzzles for you to solve and it combines a sense of whimsy and wonder rather well.

However it isn't what it might appear and there is a very dark twist towards the end that completely blindsided me which I didn't appreciate personally.

You're in for some serious emotions going through this game, but the journey at least will be beautiful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992237635', 'num_games_owned': 1573, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1659302909}
review:
Uno de los juegos m√°s bonitos que se hayan hecho nunca. Es un juego corto de exploraci√≥n y puzzles, los puzzles aunque sencillos son muy curiosos y plantean situaciones diferentes en casi todos los casos.
Los escenarios son realmente hermosos y muy diferenciados entre los cap√≠tulos de los que est√° compuesto el juego, son escenarios cerrados en su mayor parte con su peque√±a parte de exploraci√≥n para buscar coleccionables.
Gr√°ficamente el juego no es puntero ni pretende serlo pero art√≠sticamente es maravilloso. La m√∫sica es tremendamente bonita y acompa√±a a cada momento como debe.
Muy recomendable a los que les gustan los juegos como experiencia m√°s que por la jugabilidad en s√≠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052874621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1649835713}
review: A gorgeous visual style and intricate environment design make Rime the closest thing I've seen to "Ico" on PC. Enjoyable puzzles and platforming keep the adventure interesting, but I wish the story had revealed a better mystery. I kept waiting to find out who had built all these beautiful ruins, but then the plot twist rendered all my curiosity meaningless.

review: One of the most boring games I've played in a long time. As others have said, there are other games that pull off this adventure open world puzzlish vibe so so so much better. 90 mins in and not a single reason to stay and play longer, wish I could get a refund.

review:

[b]don't read any guides or the chapter titles if you don't want to spoil it for yourself![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198123501915', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1626690352}
review:
Maravillosa experiencia. 
Visualmente precioso y muy cuidado, puzzles sencillos pero satisfactorios y un dise√±o de escenarios super inmersivo. En cuanto a historia, no voy a hacer spoilers, pero todo cobra sentido hacia el final, impactandote donde nacen los sentimientos con la fuerza de un Boeing 747. La banda sonora es correcta y refuerza muy bien lo que busca transmitir el juego. Y si te sabe a poco, tienes coleccionables que recoger para apurarle unas pocas horitas mas. Recomendad√≠simo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025180032', 'num_games_owned': 1264, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1626643103}
review:
A pretty okay game. Think Limbo + Journey. Nobody speaks so it's easy to get into no matter what language you speak, no violence perfect for children and it has Spirited Away vibes!
Heavy on puzzles and does tell a story somewhat but mostly through gameplay (again no real voices).
Visually it's a very beautiful game that's nice on the eyes.
7/10 Play once and never come back kinda game but will be remembered even if it's 0.01% of you!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978561480', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1626045506}
review:
¬øQu√© se puede decir de un juego del que ya se ha dicho todo, lo bueno y lo malo? 
Gr√°ficamente es una pasada. Preciso a nivel visual y maravillosos sus escenarios (dicen que puede tener alguna ca√≠da en las cinem√°ticas, y francamente, si eso es lo que m√°s te importa en un videojuego, estamos "apa√±aos"... ).  La banda sonora es sublime: bien encajada, trasmite emociones donde tiene que hacerlo.... y la canci√≥n de cuna: pocas canciones pueden trasmitir "eso" como lo hace esta. 

No soy muy fan de los juegos de puzzles y exploraci√≥n (se me acaban haciendo pesados) y sin embargo con este no he tenido esa sensaci√≥n. Los puzzles con la dificultad suficiente para hacerte pensar pero no para frustrarte. Los juegos de luces y sombras... 
Me parece magnifico en todos los aspectos. 

No quiero hablar de la historia, porque el golpe de realidad que te llevas, te hace pensar. Cuando empec√© a jugar pensaba "¬øY de qu√© va el juego?. Pues de un ni√±o dando voces a todo... " Y tras haberlo terminado, s√≥lo puedo recomendarlo. 

Puede que no sea tu tipo de juego, como me pasa a mi, pero dale una oportunidad, te vas a llevar una muy grata sorpresa. Miradme a mi: d√≠as despu√©s de haberlo terminado (al 100% porque necesitaba m√°s y nunca suelo hacerlo, los logros me da bastante igual) me encuentro escuchando la BSO, leyendo noticias y rese√±as (algunas de ellas se nota que apenas han jugado media hora) pese a que hace ya 4 a√±os que se lanz√≥ y escribiendo la m√≠a propia, vaya.. 

Solo me arrepiento de una cosa. De no haber comprado la edici√≥n coleccionista cuando tuve ocasi√≥n. pero bueno, la vida sigue...

author: {'steamid': '76561197993922877', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 316, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1620515365}
review: I have some light problems with the end of the game, though to avoid spoilers I'll just say I think the final moments could have remained subtext while maintaining the material reality of the fairy tale. But it's a gorgeous game. Very imaginative and pretty, a real journey of discovery. If you like this sort of game then dig in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077531119', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1626027732}
review:
Jeu tr√®s sympathique dans un style entre The Witness et Journey. Les m√©caniques sont assez vari√©es entre les cris, les puzzles et les jeux de perspective. L'histoire floue au commencement se dessine au fil du jeu jusqu'√† atteindre un final que je ne spoilerai pas. Le jeu a une dur√©e de vie d'entre 4 et 6 heures qui vous marquera comme une bonne exp√©rience.

Le prix de 35 euros est cependant un peu trop √©lev√© √† mon go√ªt et risque de vous laisser sur votre faim. Je conseille donc de le prendre en promo pour un prix plus correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097635745', 'num_games_owned': 5733, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2661, 'last_played': 1625817592}
review:
I loved this game!!
RiME is set in a beautiful island landscape with crumbling ruins and tall towers and unfolds an emotional and bittersweet tale about a young boy's journey of discovery. The game has limited open world environments to explore by walking, running and using some elements of a 3D platformer. RiME's game play involves moving through different locations, by walking, running and often traversing sheer cliffs or walls using movements reminiscent of early Tomb Raider games such as shimmying, vaulting, pushing blocks and jumping- I usually find these actions frustrating, but they were quite easy to perform and the controls are very forgiving. The puzzles were not overly difficult and the solutions were always logical, making for a nice fluid progression through the story. The story is told through music( a very beautiful soundtrack btw), cut-scenes and drawings that are found as you move through the games locations. I needed a second play-through to get all the achievements as some are a bit obscure and can be missed as there are points of no return in some areas, that said I really did enjoy going back to search for missed items and this was simplified by the option to replay chapters once you have finished the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344888996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1625611295}
review: Lovely artwork and environments, very simple but never dull gameplay, and highly immersive. Puzzles are fairly straight-forward, but there's a huge amount of 'hidden stuff' you can collect and a lot of world to explore. A beautiful game for anyone bored of endless FPS and shooting things.

review: Fui jogar achando que seria apenas um jogo de explora√ß√£o com alguns puzzles e acabei me surpreendendo com um jogo com uma hist√≥ria sens√≠vel, visual simples por√©m sendo justamente o que se d√° um certo charme ao jogo juntamente com o foco nas poucas cores vibrantes, a trilha sonora combinando perfeitamente com cada momento do jogo e assim esse combo pelo qual RiME √© formado, passa toda a sensa√ß√£o que o protagonista sente ao jogador. author: {'steamid': '76561198077701412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1681339002}
review: A simple, relaxing exploration game with no combat. Highly polished but with little content outside some collectibles. Narrative also picks up slowly as you go with a surprising conclusion to the story. Pick it up at a sale as it is not very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195020071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 315, 'last_played': 1625097099}
review:
This game is really great. The graphics are perfect to my tastes, it was a whimsical atmosphere, and fantastic music. However, the end of the story, for me, ruined the entire game in an important way, recontextualising the entire game entirely in the span of about 5 minutes. I would recommend playing this game, but on a discount so you are not disappointed by the end. STOP READING NOW IF YOU DO NOT WANT SPOILERS

***SPOILERS***
The end contextualises the whole game as an illusion representing the 5 stages of grief. Not only is the connection extremely vague, but there are a number of whimsical elements - the fox, the man in the red cloak, the lights and fires responding to the voice, the magical robots - and it's not clear what in the world any of it even means given it was all some arbitrary dream about grief. I can see next to zero connection between the majority of the otherwise wonderful, magical parts of the gameworld to the overall theme, and so it really does make them feel meaningless, when they used to be interesting and mysterious. It is also a remarkably shallow meaning to put behind the story, as it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250189988', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2120, 'last_played': 1677292866}
review:
Este juego me dio mucho en que pensar, ademas, es hermoso, los graficos, las islas, como se desarrolla la historia y el que no tenga dialogos lo hace muy interesante ya que tu te vas dando una idea de lo que significa cada zona o tratas de entender a la historia.

Yo que lo jugue a los 11 a√±os, muy hermoso, creo que esta en mi top de juegos y este, es el unico que me han hecho llorar por 2 horas, incluso llegue a pensar que se podia obtener otro final en el cual el ni√±o sobreviviera.

si estan interesado, este juego es una joya, merese ser jugado tranquilamente, y espero que a Tequila Works les hayan dado un premio por esto

No tengo ningun problema con este juego, es perfecto en todos los sentidos, Visual, Psicologico, ETC.

10/10, HERMOSO, EL MEJOR JUEGO QUE TENGO Y EH TENIDO DESDE QUE CONOZCO LOS VIDEOJUEGOS

author: {'steamid': '76561198054186778', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1623757657}
review:
Don't buy this game at even close to full price, but its a decent game for casual players and "achievement hunters".
In this game, you control a boy who runs like a physically challenged kid, look at him from the side while running, I dare you! His special powers? He yells and sobs at things until something happens. I get what this game tried to do, but it just didn't pull it off. Its a very casual puzzle/exploration game., there isn't any real challenge and its easy to get all achievements. Especially since when its completed for the first time, you'll be able to select chapters and go back for the missing achievements if needed - This feature is one of the best things about the game.
Personally I had trouble looking past the very, uhm.. Special running of the kid, but if you can, I'm sure you'll connect more with the game and the story itself, but there is nothing original about it. The controls, espeically the jump, are very sluggish, but the game doesn't call for tight controls, so this doesn't effect gameplay - Again, if you can look past it.
I will say, the game is beautiful in its own way and the music is really nice, but that's just not enough for me. There are too many awesome games out there, similar style to this one, at a cheaper price point, that does it all way better.

If you want a casual game with super easy achievements, go ahead and buy this when its at a 80-90% discount, but I really do recommened you to keep looking for another game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970975120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1582495315}
review:
While the gameplay is only a mix of well known elements in the genre (climbing, jumping, puzzle solving) and the ending may be a bit disappointing, it's definitely been the absolutely wonderful soundtrack that made this game an outstanding experience for me. The art style does also work really well. 
This game has pretty nice and varied puzzles that are just easy enough to not being an obstacle in one's progress through the game. After all you'll want to figure out and understand what's actually going on here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965295646', 'num_games_owned': 3371, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1622665327}
review: I enjoyed that game very much! No game-breaking bugs for me, the only caveat is that the controls are sometimes fighting with the camera view. Otherwise it was a great experience. At times, the scenery and setting reminded me of Laputa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054713896', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1622777164}
review:
Relaxing and visually pleasing adventure that fails to stick the landing on most of its engaging elements. 

Narratively speaking, specially in retrospect, it's about as good as it can get in these kinds of games. Gameplay on the other hand leaves a lot to be desired, specially with its puzzles and traversal. 

Also worth mentioning an awful tendency to cause pretty severe motion sickness, even to people who generally don't experience it elsewhere.

While the final product is definitely not bad, it's also nothing to write home about.

6.1/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198356692849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1622513564}
review:
HANDS DOWN ONE OF MY TOP 10 FAVORITE GAMES OF ALL TIME

I went into this game expecting a fun puzzle game to play since I was bored and didn't have anything better to do. This game absolutely blew my expectations out of the water. 

The story in this game is amazing. It builds up slowly but the end is worth all of it and then some. (I actually cried at the end...)

If you are looking for an amazing game and you enjoy puzzles or if you just want a good story, then I cannot recommend this game enough.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040665600', 'num_games_owned': 1615, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1621964538}
review:
After a terrible storm on sea a boy is washed up on the shore of an idyllic looking island. In the background you can see a ruined tower at a cliff. After climbing up a cliff the boy notices in the far distance another tower. One that is gigantic, intact and having a keyhole like shape on the upper floor. The scenery is gorgeous. Everything looks like it is hand painted. It is a pleasant art style, not trying to be photo realistic but rather to convey being in a very artistic hand painted world. Furthermore there is a day and night cycle which nicely wraps the landscape in different tones, where the night is as atmospheric as the day.
Melodic compositions accompany the boy on his journey through this island and the tower. 

Not a single word is said to convey any goals or the story (besides some shouts of the boy). Therefor one could wonder how the game can tell its story and guide the player throughout the journey. Bits of the story are mostly told by mural paintings, secret keyholes (which show a picture regarding the boys past) and a few cutscenes between the chapters. You are never clueless about what it is you have to do next, even though the game is not stringently holding the players hand. The puzzles are not that challenging but more than often you are surprised by how interesting the mechanics are. In general I would say that the gameplay itself is very chill. The boy has the power to interact with certain objects with is voice. He can reignite torches, break specific vases and activate certain statues, all with a shout of his. Besides chapter 2, which brings an element of danger until right before the end of the chapter, you can almost always take your time exploring (chapter 3 had some areas you could not access after leaving them, so there is that as well). And even the element of danger in chapter 2 is rather there to be kind of a puzzle to be solved.
In some instances exploring was very rewarding, for example when you see a place in a distance not being accessible at first but when you examine the surrounding area you could find a way to get there and eventually find more collectables or achievements. I like that design philosophy.

What I really liked about the end is that the developers made it to tell a story and not have a love, peace and harmony ending (so be warned, if that‚Äôs what you always have to want!).
It was very touching and after having unlocked the chapter selection, the meaning of the chapters became more apparent in regards to the actual story. I love it.

For those achievement hunters: There is a chapter select after finishing the game, so there is nothing you can really miss. I was peeking in an achievement guide from time to time after the first chapter to make sure I did not miss anything though. Some achievements are indeed hidden, but if you get them on your own, just by exploring the world, you‚Äôll feel awesome. I‚Äôd say play the game mostly without a guide (or like me peeking there from time to time) and enjoy the game. Afterwards you can always replay chapters.

To wrap it all up: 
Rime is not on the lengthy side. It took me around 8 and a half hour, with getting almost all achievements and looking in an achievement guide in between. Even though a bit short, I would definitely say Rime is worth its money delivering a unique adventure with a hand painted look, a great musical score and in general a chill game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418386542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1028, 'last_played': 1622057904}
review:
This game is definitely overpriced. After you have completed the game once, it becomes too annoying to play again because of the cutscenes. They are unstopped, irrational, unsettling, super annoying and you can not skip watching them. 

Aside from that, the game plays with camera, takes away your point of view, and disables controls time to time. It will make you feel dumb and out of control.

If you find this game on sale at around $5 or less, you can try it, but any more than that it is a waste of money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212769343', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1621707289}
review:
Rime an adventure puzzle game. It focuses a lot more in art than anything else, so expect simple game mechanics.

Summary:
+ Good Disney like art style.
+ Easy to control.
+ Very calm game. Good to kill time.
- Too slow, should be faster.
- Puzzle are too easy.
- Short game, with big levels, instead of big game with short levels.
- No real replayability. It sums up to getting all items. It's pointless.

You control a kid that looks like a Mexican ancient roman that solves most of his problems with impressive physical ability and by screaming at objects. You can pretty much climb anything, push big stone statues, grab heavy metal spheres and swim for many seconds underwater. Very impressive but he is a kid so he can't jump very high. For some reason screaming at monkey statues, vases, torches, and so on, activates them. Makes no sense, and all that screaming can get annoying, but you just have to do it.

The main selling point is the art style. It's kind of like a classic Disney style and works well, though it could have more shading. There are different themes in each stage, so there is art variety (e.g., water stage, ruins stage). This does make the game a lot more interesting and essential for these kinds of games. The story was designed to fit the art style, meaning the kid is always happy, smiling and tagging along with friends he finds along the way. Kind of nauseating, but as you'll eventually find out, not all is what it seems. The music is nothing to brag about. It's not bad, not good, sometimes annoying and not memorable at all. This is one area the developer could have invested more.

In my opinion there are some obvious issues with the game. It's a very slow game were you spend most of your time running instead of solving puzzles. It's not as bad as it should be because at least you can enjoy the art style, but it could be a faster game. The puzzles are too basic and sometimes it's hard to understand what you're supposed to do. It should be the opposite, easy to understand, but hard to solve. You do have hints if you're lost, in particular a fox helps. By the way, someone should tell the developers that red foxes don't bark like dogs. Either way these two flaws can be off putting to a lot of people. The game does start boring, but gets better over time. It's also a short game, with big levels. Instead it should be a big game with shorter levels. But I guess the main focus was always art.

So it's a slow game with pretty graphics and basic puzzles. It's good to help sleep for sure, not that that's bad. It's a calm game and doesn't really require much skill. It's a good game if you like art and have patience.

review:
[quote]
[h1][b]TEST RAPIDE :[/b][/h1]
[i]Mots cl√©s : onirique, explorer, puzzles, plateformes, orchestr√©es, √©pur√©, apaisante, optimisation [/i]

[quote]On y incarne un enfant qui s'√©chou√© dans un monde [b]onirique[/b]. Le joueur doit alors [b]explorer[/b] ce monde, et y r√©soudre des [b]puzzles[/b] durant les phases de [b]plateformes[/b]. Rien de tr√®s compliqu√©, c'est un jeu au final assez modeste, avec une courte dur√©e de vie. 

Mais quel plaisir j'ai pris de faire ce jeu ! Les sublimes musiques [b]orchestr√©es[/b] accompagnent les s√©quences de jeu parfois avec m√©lancolie d'autre fois avec gaiet√©. L'atmosph√®re du jeu est tr√®s [b]apaisante[/b]. Et le style [b]√©pur√©[/b] des graphismes en cell shading renforcent cette impression. La composition des d√©cors du jeu m'ont fait, par moments, d√©crocher la m√¢choire. 

Il est important de noter que la version PC du jeu est malheureusement entach√© par une [b]mauvaise optimisation[/b], faites attention √† √ßa si vous devez le prendre.
En tout cas je n'ai pas pu m'arr√™ter de jouer jusqu'√† la conclusion. Au final c'est tout ce qui compte. Du d√©but √† la fin j'√©tais happ√© et c'est pour moi un sans fautes, bravo Tequila Works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973157611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 900, 'last_played': 1618950637}
review:
This is great game supported by an impressive soundtrack and a highly emotional backstory. This is perfect for anyone looking for a not super hard puzzle / exploration game (eg similar to A.E.R.) that won't take month to finish. Tequila Works put again a really impressive game after Deadlight. 

Just as personal note, I originally thought this game would be perfect to move my son from playing Hob to something similar but less violent. It was sort of OK for him until the ending (not spoiling here)... So avoid for your younger gamers.

review:
I should love this. On paper, it's like you're playing an early Miyazaki world. Phenomenal music, good visuals, decent control. But it's just sooooooo slow, tedious, and boring 90% of the time. 

Fantastic ending, which it doesn't earn, in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303983641', 'num_games_owned': 62, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1473, 'last_played': 1646364870}
review: This is a really beautiful puzzle game with a story and message that will touch you. A portion of the message, I felt, is put into the gameplay in a subtle, understated way. It's very enjoyable to watch and see it unfold. The puzzles are fun and challenging in a delightful way and the entire atmosphere changing when you complete a puzzle/area feels really good. The music is gorgeous and a great accompaniment to the goings-on in the game. The game feels and plays as smoothly as it sounds. Please play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109701387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1621004780}

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1618053546}
review:
At the end of Chapter 1, I was going to thumb down.

Right from the start, explorers are told to bugger off to another game, as there is no free saving. Devs show who is boss; unless they show who is insecure control-freak of the lazy one slot. Still claim it's open world though.
All right, no exploration then... I'll still give it a chance.

More faux freedom: you have control over the camera... except that devs keep taking it away from you, time and time again. This will be a recurring annoyance until the very end.

Considering that the gameplay is rather dull, and that the art isn't much to look art, I trod along with a growing itch to uninstall. It's not bad, it's simply not engrossing.

Fortunately, chapter 2 comes along and slowly wins me over. There is now a story, an objective, animation on the map. Plus, I like the design of the bird, of the ghosts, of the scenery, of the sea... I'm enjoying my time here.

The next chapter is rather dull again. The following one super-dull under the rain. And the epilogue is one of these railroads that never want to end, a cutscene that keeps begging for your pointless input, as if that would earn it some gravitas.

An average game with one good chapter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021800223', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 476, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1617570986}
review:
I thought this game is gonna be slightly more open exploration adventure game that takes place on mysterious ssland filled with cool puzzles but what I got was basically 
70% dull walking around basic environment, 
25% slow as molasses brain dead climbing 
and 5% ok'ish puzzles.

Heck, even developers compleatly gave up on the last chapter of the game by making you do more of dull walking and boring simple climbing while not solving a single puzzle.

With addition of tons of bugs, crashes, boring predictable story about loss, over focus on terrible placed collectibles 
and garbage ending so absurdly try harding to make you feel sad in the dumbest way possible 
(oh no, a fox that wasn't explained, 
oh no, that robot that wasn't explained, 
oh no, that kid that died long ago),
Rime was a huge disappointment for me.

Thank god this game was at least short which is the best part about Rime.

Trop crispant, surtout arriv√© √† un moment o√π je ne savais m√™me plus o√π il fallait aller (pourquoi le petit renard n'est pas plus utilis√©/utilisable ?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198346044256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1616812509}
review: The game took me a little while to get into, but once I was in it, I was IN it! The music is beautiful, the storytelling is emotional, the end is superb, and I mostly enjoyed the puzzle mechanics. Some puzzles weren't as intuitive as I would have liked and the controls could be a little clunky sometimes, but the game is all around very good! Definitely play if you're into the more abstract, atmospheric, and emotional titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1635525666}
review:
Rime is a console ported 3D puzzle platformer where you control some kid in ancient Greek/Roman type clothes and explore an island with ruins and stuff on it. 

This might work but of course it was developed for consoles, and as we know, consoles make gaming worse for everyone, and Rime is no exception.  The console port is pretty bad here, you can tell the game was designed for console peasant childrens toy gamepads, and KB+M was an afterthought.  For example, "Shift" makes you roll, not run.  Presumably the guys at Tequila Works got their name for a reason, and also, they never saw a PC with a keyboard before.  The sure as hell never played a PC game before, or they wouldn't bind "Shift" to "roll". 

The same console peasant centric design is followed along with completely gamer-hostile camera controls.  The camera is wonky as all hell, and the developers break one of the core rules of game development... [b]NEVER[/b] seize control of the camera from the player.  Except of course, the guys at Tequila Works drunkenly decided players love having the camera yanked off the player.   Well, we don't.  Maybe console peasants like that kind of thing. 

On a technical basis, 4K works, but only in Fullscreen mode.  You can't go that high if you like borderless window, because they either didn't bother testing on PC (a plausible scenario given how bad the controls are), or they just didn't see the sense in making it work properly in 4K because console peasant appliances usually don't go that high.  Also, the graphics are really low poly, again this is because consoles can't render PC tier graphics properly so compromises get made to make the best out of a bad platform.   Told you consoles make gaming worse for everyone.

Anyway, this is basically what might have been an okay game, but it's console ported trash with PC as an afterthought.  Also, it's stupidly overpriced for such a poorly done port.  $40 would get you a game developed for PC, with KB+M working smoothly, proper UHD support, and proper graphics.   This second rate "What's a PeeCee???" console port is not worth a 10th of their greedy asking price.

review: Great chillout game.  Beautiful art style, and mostly responsive controls.  Environments are so large, that sometimes you might get lost.  I think that's why they have those fires that you can make burn brighter.  Sort of like breadcrumbs or markers to make sure you can get back on track.  Plus you have your fox friend to help guide you most of the time.  Totally recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198836861080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1638084003}
review:
I adore this game, I already played it on console but wanted to try to 100% it here. This is a beautiful puzzle game with an even more beautiful story. Even though this game does have controller support, I would NOT recommend playing with controller. I'm not sure if it was something on my end or the games, but I had a horrible experience while playing with a Dualshock controller, the character and camera would constantly move and jitter on it's own making it damn near impossible to move in a straight line, and having a bluetooth controller connected also gave me a lot of frame drops.

TLDR: Game itself is amazing, has controller bugs and would only recommend playing with keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088528943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1614622876}
review:
Je suis d√©sol√©, mais au vu des avis post√©s, je me suis senti plut√¥t flou√© par ce jeu.
Je m'attendais √† un jeu "po√©tique" (pour ce que √ßa peut bien signifier...) et √©mouvant, et au final, l'aspect √©mouvant, c'est plut√¥t une r√©v√©lation sur la fin du jeu en mode "sois √©mu, si t'es pas √©mu, c'est que t'es un gros vilain pas b√¥ !". Je pense qu'on peut parler d'√©motion forc√©e.

Globalement, le jeu est beau, son univers est bien r√©alis√©, je n'ai pas de reproche √† ce niveau. Les √©nigmes sont assez basiques, pas franchement int√©ressantes, mais elles sont bien int√©gr√©es √† l'univers du jeu.

Techniquement, le jeu souffre de quelques drops de fps (jouant avec une RTX 3070, je n'ai tilt√© qu'√† peu de moments, mais je pense que sur une config moins puissante, notamment sur la fin du jeu, j'aurais pu avoir des mauvaises surprises).

Au final, je trouve le jeu assez lambdas. Des id√©es pas particuli√®rement bonnes, ni mauvaises, disons des id√©es sympas. Un bel univers, des jolis d√©cors. Mais tout √ßa pour une histoire qui ne m√®ne pas vraiment quelque part.

review: Beautiful open levels, an excellent soundtrack, and a moving story. The pace of this game is relaxing and encourages exploration. The only downsides are the occasional frame drops, and somewhat wonky controls during climbing. Otherwise flawless.

review: It's sad but beautiful. The secrets are difficult enough that you don't find them all naturally on your first play through. Good if you like secret collections, good if you like beautiful music, good if you like sad stories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007429338', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1415, 'last_played': 1613288717}
review: One of the most beautiful games I've ever played. The puzzles are set at just the right level to keep your progress steady. The story, which slowly reveals itself, is sad and wonderful. Play this game if you like beautiful, non-'shooty' puzzle / journey types of games. You won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260854478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1612734477}
review:
RIME ! ce jeu est tout simplement superbe ! 
Les d√©cors, la musique, l'histoire vous embarquent dans une aventure dont on ne ressort pas indemne...
On suit les a aventures d'un jeune gar√ßon √† travers des univers aux ambiances diverses, des plus lumineuses et f√©√©riques aux plus sombres. 
Les √©nigmes et puzzles demandent parfois de se triturer un peu les m√©ninges, mais restent accessibles au plus grand nombre.
Le twist de la fin vous r√©v√®lera le v√©ritable sens de l'histoire du jeu, que l'on comprend encore mieux en lisant les titres des niveaux une fois le jeu fini une premi√®re fois (mais je n'en dirai pas plus... √† vous de le d√©couvrir !)
Bref, RIME est un jeu √† d√©couvrir absolument !

author: {'steamid': '76561198184908250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1613041620}
review:
Things i like about this game (in no perticular order):
+ Pleasant artstyle and music
+ Nice, but not overly difficult puzzles, very nice difficulty curve.
+ Many well hidden collectables
+ Brilliant story, makes me cry every time.

Things i dislike about this game (in no particular order):
- Movement is slow, works well for cinematics, but makes navigating the first two areas a chore.
- Certain long and slow plattforming segments that could have been cut.

Conclusion:
I can reccomend this game if you like slow, action-free games, or artsy games.
Do try to go into this game blind as the story is easilly spoiled. (its still effective on second playthrough though, imho)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036312151', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1698516714}
review:
Ignore my playtime on Steam, as it's due to computer issues, not the game itself. I've earned the Platinum trophy on PS4 for Rime.

I love this game, and it's highly recommended. It's not very long, which is probably my only negative. The music is amazing, the puzzles/ledge jumping are tricky at times, but still fun all around. The story seems non-existent, until you get to the ending, and realize what was going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112596020', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 379, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1611800691}
review:
I got this game from a game bundle for charity. I must say if I bought this game at the price its at I would be highly disappointed. The majority of the game is puzzles that are nothing special that you likely have seen before, with a character that moves like an obese 8th grader and the climbing and stuff feels like its trying to be Uncharted AND THAT DOESNT WORK HERE. On top of that the game is 5 hours long for 30 DOLLARS. Its just not worth it unfortunately. If it was 10 to 15 that would be reasonable then on top of that it has questionable game design and choices its a pass that I sadly just cant recommend at its price for on top of what is a very meh platformer.

5.7/10 The price is too much for such a short game and its just kind of a copy of and paste of what you have seen in other bland puzzle games which I am pretty sure by the way they didnt add a run button to increase the time it takes to beat it, pretty sure it would be like 3 hours long then if you are really trying or know what you are doing...
