author: {'steamid': '76561198314193820', 'num_games_owned': 2118, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1687544069}
review:
[h1]So only after upgrading from my previous RX 580 (8GB) GPU to my current RTX 3060 (12GB) GPU was I able to play this game...[/h1]

And as interesting as the game was, needing a "battlestation" to run it is [b]COMPLETELY[/b] unacceptable.

[b]7/10[/b] - A rather compelling take centered on the five stages of grief. But again, the requirements/optimization are unsatisfactory to say the least.



[h1]ORIGINAL 2020 REVIEW:[/h1]

[b]The "System Requirements" section is a joke, as is the optimization...[/b]

I own a machine consisting of a Ryzen 5 3600X processor paired with an RX 580 (8GB) GPU, 16GB of DDR4-3000 RAM and an SSD on which I installed it [i](tried it on an HDD as well)[/i], so not only does my rig meet the "Recommended Requirements", but it has also surpassed them, only to get 50 choppy frames in 1080p with every graphical setting turned off.

Now the game itself looks really fun, nice, relaxing and whatnot, but I cannot recommend it because 3 years later, my experience with it [i](before I finally gave up and uninstalled it)[/i] consisted of benchmarking, mixing settings, switching screen mode and VSync, googling the issue and trying other potential fixes, to no positive end result though...

"Resolution Scale" is the only setting that gave me [i](along with everything else turned off and set to "Low")[/i] 60 frames without the game being choppy and stuttering constantly, but I was not about to play it downscaled from a simple 1080p resolution considering the machine I own...

So yeah...since I could not enjoy it until the end [i]([b]or at all for that matter.[/b]..spending almost 4 out of 5 hours benchmarking, mixing settings, googling fixes and whatnot)[/i], this is my verdict:

[h1]While it looks like an at least [b]7/10[/b] game, it plays and is optimized for a [b]3/10[/b] score at best...

You have been warned.[/h1]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198100929997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1592555688}
review:
A charming platformer game with treasures to collect, story to experience and beautiful environments to explore. If that sounds like your cup of tea, give this game a try.
Personal experience:
I think the idea for the game‚Äôs twist was born before a single asset was made. The game knows it is telling a dramatic story, but for new players it comes off as just weird or pretentious. In the first hour when the music swells with emotion, I have no idea why. It‚Äôs pretty, sure. But so what? Why should I care? This is what has been going through my mind as I played the game.
It borrows heavily from Journey, Ico, Shadow of the Colossus, Tomb Raider. It desperately wants to be just as deep, but comes off as juvenile. I don‚Äôt regret playing this game. It‚Äôs beautiful, it‚Äôs well done. I wish it was just a bit more well executed as a whole.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321091876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1592256449}
review:
Wasn't sure about this game at first. But it was enjoyable. Games I've previously played that were said to be similar are Abzu and The Witness. For the most part, the game is really enjoyable, even relaxing at times, to play through. Would recommend.

Except the first level - I hated the first level. It's long, it's tedious, it has the hardest puzzles (in my opinion), and it that point in the game you really have no reason to care about anything going on. Exploration felt limited (e.g. you can only climb up the rocks in a very specific way, when it feels as though none of them should be off limits), yet at the same time I was often confused where I had to go next. It honestly left me not feeling like I wanted to play anymore after the first chapter. Only reason I did was to get this game out of my backlog completely.

I'm glad I kept playing. The remaining levels were *significantly* more interesting and there was a much better sense of progression within them. The story actually (sorta) amounted to something, and I found the remaining levels more visually pleasing too. Besides the first level, I really enjoyed this game.

review: I legitimately hated this game. I hate the feeling of exploration being juxtaposed with the feeling of urgent completion. Like I have to move forward to finish but if I just push forward then I don't get the whole story? And I can only get the whole story by randomly finding hidden objects? That doesn't make me want to play again, I just hate it. Graphics are amazing, puzzles are good, but the layout and the randomness really pulled me out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984456066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1591324810}
review: I'm giving up on this game after 11 wasted hours.  I don't know where the favorable reviews could be coming from.  According to the Steam achievements, only about half of the people who start the game make it to the "Don't say no" achievement, which you have to pass to continue and is only about an hour into the game.  So, the other half are smarter than I am and give up almost at once.  I have the video down to minimum on every setting and still my frame rate is in the single digits.  Does my computer suck?  Maybe, but Tomb Raider 2013 went just fine at typical settings and that has much richer graphics than this.  The puzzles, when you can find them, are not challenging.  But it's hard to figure out where you're supposed to go to find something worthwhile doing.  The fox may lead you, but now it's just sitting there turning a circle when I sing to it.  Should I go through this door or will it be a waste of another hour?  Forget it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117054702', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1591220306}
review:
Puisqu'il n'y a pas de 3e option, je ne recommande pas RIME. Il me laisse un avis tr√®s mitig√©. Je n'ai pas √©t√© aussi √©merveill√© que les autres apparemment... Peut-√™tre que je ne correspond pas au bon public...

Clairement, le jeu a √©t√© soign√©. L'histoire, les graphismes, la bande son... je n'ai pas de reproches √† faire √† de ce c√¥t√© l√†. Alors d'o√π vient cet avis tr√®s mitig√© ? Trois points : le gameplay, la lin√©arit√© et la dur√©e de vie.

Concernant le gameplay, je n'ai pas not√© de bugs (√† la manette), mais je l'ai trouv√© tr√®s rigide. Je me dis que c'est voulu, pour rendre les d√©placements plus r√©alistes (on n'est pas dans un Crash/Spyro/...), mais c'est peut-√™tre un peu trop ? J'ai eu l'impression que le personnage avait du mal √† avancer, √† sauter, etc. M√™me dans un point'n'click, quand le perso marche, il avance √† peu pr√®s aussi vite qu'ici alors que notre perso est cens√© courir...

Concernant la lin√©arit√©, le jeu n'offre aucune r√©flexion, aucune action, rien. On avance, point. Il y a soi-disant un aspect exploration, mais il m'a sembl√© mal exploit√©. On d√©barque sur une plage apr√®s une cin√©matique qui ne nous indique ni pourquoi ni comment ni notre but. Ok, explorons... On fait trois pas, on comprend qu'il y a des choses √† activer. On les active, on avance un peu et √ßa recommence. Il n'y a pas grand chose √† explorer, il suffit d'avancer. Par ailleurs, lors de certains passages, vous ne pourrez plus faire demi-tour (porte qui se ferme, bloc trop haut pour repartir dans l'autre sens...). Mince, vous n'aviez pas pris le temps d'explorer l'autre passage avant : tant pis.
Certes, il y a des objets √† collectionner/trouver. Ici, je n'appelle pas √ßa de l'exploration, mais de la dur√©e de vie artificielle. D'ailleurs, j'ai rarement vu un jeu o√π les pourcentages des succ√®s sont si faibles sur des objets √† collecter (autour de 3-4%...). Et pourtant, un point positif, le jeu propose une option pour red√©marrer un chapitre ! Par contre, impossible de passer les cin√©matiques dans ce mode... Il ne faut pas se mentir, le jeu a beau √™tre soign√©, il ne donne pas envie de le refaire.

Concernant la dur√©e de vie, comptez 6h pour finir le jeu (sans d√©bloquer tous les succ√®s, mais sans se presser aussi). Pour 35‚Ç¨, je trouve que √ßa fait cher l'heure de jeu. Surtout que le plaisir de jouer n'est pas au rendez-vous. Le jeu est beau, mais √ßa ne suffit pas √† en faire un bon jeu. Personnellement, je me suis plut√¥t ennuy√©. Heureusement, je l'ai achet√© en promo...

Au final, je ne recommande pas RIME (√† d√©faut d'une autre option), mais peut-√™tre que vous correspondrez au public vis√©. Si pour vous, la passivit√© et la contemplation prime sur le reste, vous appr√©cierez sans doute RIME. Sinon... j'en suis moins s√ªr. A petit prix, vous pouvez toujours tenter pour vous faire votre propre avis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069877074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1676585064}
review:
Wonderful allegory of 'Rime of the ancient mariner' from poet S.T. Coleridge.
Play it without any culpability! it's an emotional roller coaster, hidden through your gameplay and only revealed to you at the endgame. Only 5h of playtime, but it will change you forever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045592217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1590791724}
review:
The art direction is stunning.
As is the music.
And even the very last scene suddenly touched me pretty profoundly.

Yet the game as a whole is lacking in two very important aspects:

The story is - besides the aforementioned last scene - non-existent.
I didn't know anything about the character, the world or the motivations - anything at all.
That's why, throughout the whole experience, I couldn't get myself to CARE about anything
in the game world. Nothing had any meaning to me.

The gameplay drives this point home even more, because it's soooooo slow and unfocused.
HOW MUCH I wished for a key to get the character to really RUN for once, as well as a MAP FEATURE
to finally get hold of where in the game world I was, where I already had been, and where I would have to go.
This goes down to some - really unexpected - details that frustrated the hell out of me:
Every miniscule edge you stumble upon your character has to climb. And he does so. VERY. SLOWLY.
Yes, I'm not even kidding - it drove me mad, that CLIMBING, one of the major movement mechanics of
the game, wasn't even fun - it was repetitive, sluggish and therefore overall frustratingly boring to watch.

So if you like colorful, artsy games, and walking simulations in particular, for all means - give this
game a go, one can tell it's a passion project.
But I really can't recommend this game to a broader audience for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154207446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1630595493}
review:
[spoiler] I see the "Spiritual Adventure" thing coming, but damn, things turn dark real quick in the end. (Well, not that dark) [/spoiler]
Overall this is a relaxing game... Actually, be careful in Stage 2, jump scares, other than that, not much problem.
If you miss the bonus stuff in your first play-through, don't worry, you have a "Stage Select" option when you finish the game.

Also, I wanna talk about something,
This is not at all a boring experience (someone at the review said it was), 
I don't know why people keep expecting every game to be easy,
(People who said crash bandicoot is "Dark-Souls", I'm talking about you)
and when a game IS easy for relax and chill, they say it's too boring and want it to be "more interesting". 
Not every game is for everyone, if you don't like it, get a refund and move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019572573', 'num_games_owned': 398, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1590089351}
review:
Well crafted game. Music, level design, art style, everything clicks well. Presentation is excellent and the puzzles are not too difficult, with some situations where it's easy to get stuck.

Negatives are not many. Camera can get wonky in few tight spaces. The game feels more demanding on the hardware than it should be based on its visuals. And the story, although solid, is a cliche by now, a kid alone in a strange world, death, loss, grief, yadda yadda... It gets the job of playing with your emotions done adequately, but I wish the developer had the guts to try a different approach. Still, well worth playing.

review: I started playing for the beautiful art style and music. Continued for the engaging puzzles. Did not expect to get my heart broken. This game is a work of art. If you are looking at this game, go ahead and buy it. It is worth the journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002514676', 'num_games_owned': 1040, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1590087667}
review:
Definitely worth playing. Nice story, some fun puzzles, lovely artwork. Controls on PC are good, except in some places where the camera automatically takes a certain angle and it can't be changed with the mouse as usually can be done. Makes some jumps a bit harder, but I assume it's better that way when using a controller.
I thoroughly enjoyed the 10h I put into it. First playthrough lasted about 6-7 hours. Second playthrough to look for the missed achievements was quite a bit easier, but still fun to do :)

review: The game is really horribly optimized. I'm playing on a GTX 1060 on medium-low settings, and I'm still getting a ton of frame drops that often put me at 30 FPS or lower. As such, while the gameplay isn't bad and looks pretty, it feels quite stunted thanks to the poor performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014579403', 'num_games_owned': 2336, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1589232270}
review:
Absolutely beautiful.

Art & soundtrack are stunning. The way the world is put together is very engrossing too.

Game play focuses primarily on exploration with a few puzzles. At times this game almost feels like a walking simulator, almost.

Puzzles are closer to Zelda than say Portal or Talos Principle.

The overall package though is simply beautiful.

5 - 6 hrs in length

review: Une grosse surprise, et tr√®s bonne. J'ai attendu avant d'y jouer et je ne regrette pas, cette aventure est √©mouvante, le level design tr√®s bien fait. On d√©but on croit que l'on va juste parcourir une √Æle... Mais il y a beaucoup plus! Les personnages sont attachant et l'histoire tr√®s bien men√©e, la r√©alisation est tr√®s propre et tourne bien sur une machine moyenne je pense. Je recommande ce jeu sans h√©sitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144752902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 843, 'last_played': 1589135275}

author: {'steamid': '76561198268575047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1589069128}
review: Holy cow, this was amazing. Might be my favorite game in the style of Journey. It has just a bit more interaction (like puzzles and platforming) and characterization (ie: your character has facial expressions) than similar games that put it over the top for me. The animation and music are [i]astounding[/i]. I was continually impressed by them throughout the course of the experience. The story is a bit more straightforward than it is in similar games and leaves less to interpretation, which I could see some people disliking, but I think it really works here. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970664089', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1246, 'last_played': 1588910844}
review:
It's beautiful, but the world feels empty.  There's not much to it other than some basic puzzles.

The problem is, if it were just a beautiful walking simulator, I could get into it.  But it's also a platforming puzzle game, and sometimes you just get stuck in a confusing puzzle.  That takes your enjoyment out of exploring and walking around in the beautiful environment.

review: Una autentica obra de arte visual y musical... Ojala los chicos de Tekila-Works sigan desarrollando juegos con tanto cari√±o como le han puesto a este. review:
DO NOT WATCH STUFF ABOUT THIS GAME JUST PLAY IT

I highly recommend you go into this game as blind as possible, in short it is a puzzle platformer heavily relying on it's story, atmosphere and world. If you've enjoyed games such as ABZU, Journey, Flower or anything along those lines I'd say this is right up your alley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198972942977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1586536034}
review: Opera d'arte a tutto tondo. L'esperienza videoludica proposta dal team Tequila Works si prefigge l'obiettivo dell'esplorazione di un'isola incontaminata e dai tratti quasi fiabeschi. Al gameplay piuttosto snello - salto, capriola, scalata di porzioni di rocce, interazione con qualche elemento ambientale - si affianca una gestione narrativa che fa dei misteri e il non-detto la cifra stilistica dell'intera opera. Una storia semplice che non colpisce tanto per il soggetto o l'intreccio, quanto per l'approccio poetico e la forza immaginifica degli ambienti che ci accompagnano durante l'esplorazione. Consigliato senza se e senza ma; unico limite √® l'oggettiva brevit√† (6-7 ore) che potrebbe far desistere all'acquisto a prezzo pieno.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215518564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1588381467}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072850414', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1603943402}
review:
RiME is an extraordinarily well-made and beautiful game, in every respect. The soundtrack fits the story progression perfectly. The polished graphics and mechanics match the atmosphere exactly. The character development progresses elegantly and meaningfully and contributes the bigger picture. Other developers can learn from the folks at Tequila Works.

Do yourselves a favor and avoid spoilers. You will get so much more out of this game's narrative if you experience it authentically.

The story arch gives subtle hints of what's really going on throughout, but the ending hits hard and by surprise. It conveys a feeling too deep for words. Amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983397248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1587850774}
review:
Je suis bien emb√™t√© par cette √©valuation n√©gative que je donne aujourd'hui √† RiME, apr√®s l'avoir termin√©, car ce jeu m'a vraiment √©mu. Il est bel et bien destin√© √† un panel de joueurs sensibles √† la po√©sie et √† la direction artistique, et j'en fais compl√®tement partie.
Seulement voil√†, pass√© ces notions tr√®s r√©ussies, que reste t'il √† RiME ? Aucune action, tr√®s peu de r√©flexion... en r√©sum√© : aucun challenge. Reste le c√¥t√© exploration, qu'on pourrait toujours appr√©cier √† condition d'y trouver des comp√©tences utiles au gameplay, mais ce n'est pas le cas : explorer la carte dans les moindres recoins ne sert qu'√† collectionner des goodies qu'on d√©bloque une fois l'histoire termin√©e.
En revanche, l'histoire est vraiment tr√®s r√©ussie, ravissante, √©mouvante, dans un univers qu'on sait √™tre un purgatoire, et on reste pourtant tr√®s surpris par la fin (au fond, aucun jeu vid√©o ne nous avait pris comme √ßa par les sentiments).
Mais au moment de l'√©valuation, je r√©ponds juste √† cette question, essentielle pour moi dans un jeu : est-ce que je me suis vraiment amus√© ? Non pas vraiment, je me suis m√™me parfois bien ennuy√©. Dommage, car RiME est pass√© de quelque chose : avec plus d'action et de r√©flexion (comme Riven en son temps), RiME aurait √©t√© un vrai chef d'oeuvre.

review: Great game...throughout the game I thought I was working towards one goal but the ending completely upended that in a good way. Story invoked emotions and the game has great atmosphere. Some reviews say the puzzles are "weak" or "simple" but that is subjective and were fine to me. Length was just right and overall, left a stronger impression on me than many other games. Definitely worth giving it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198073536304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1587005157}
review:
Este juego lo jugue sin grandes expectativa, con un inicio lento, sin que expliquen nada  , en donde en la primera hora diria yo el objetivo era muy simple y sin recompensa, pero cuando pasas de esa primera impresion y logras abrir la primera puerta "importante" es cuando RIME revela lo que realmente es y se vuelve un juego con una inspiracion diria yo cercana a ICO en varias cosas (aunque mejor), el juego al final se vuelve una experiencia exquisita, buenos puzzles, buena jugabilidad, la historia es muy simple y no la descubres hasta el final, durante el juego todo es interpretativo, no hay dialogos ni textos solo gritos y melodias, hasta que llegas al final y descubres cual era el proposito de tu viaje, sin duda es un juego que va de menos a mas, tal vez me hubiese gustado que mostrara su escencia mas rapido al principio, porque me da la impresion que muchos jugadores lo habran dejado por que el gamer actual necesita el placer inmediato, pero para el que se tome el tiempo el juego lo recompensa absolutamente. un muy buen juego, absolutamente recomendado.

Mi Nota Indie: 8.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198054637995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1587572416}
review:
Having recently bought a controller, I wanted to try a game which I could sit back, relax and enjoy and boy did Rime deliver that. I bought this game very cheap and a while ago. Having played AER, I liked the similarity of the graphics and gameplay of the two. 
Rime portrays you as a young boy who has been washed ashore a scenic island with main feature being a lighthouse like building. The game has a few puzzles (nothing too hard) but its mainly a walking simulator with very scenic visuals and an amazing soundtrack. There were a few frustrations when trying to jump on ledges but overall I thoroughly enjoyed the game. The ending was a bit sad but it doesn't change my view of this game. I thoroughly enjoyed the short game journey of the boy.

On price factor alone at the current listed price of 30 quid, I would not necessarily recommend it as the game is fairly short between 5-8 hours of gameplay but if you can get it cheap then its definitely worth time and effort.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151739374', 'num_games_owned': 492, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1587571538}
review:
Rime is a decent enough puzzle game. Great graphics, puzzles are not too hard or too easy. 
The music is probably the best part of it. However, it does have some really annoying flaws. It has no "Collectible" mode. Even though you can select stages when you finish it once, you still have to redo the level from scratch to access the collectibles. And there are a lot of them, and they're usually out of the way, so it's unlikely you'll get a lot of them just playing through the game. 
You can't skip cinematics (and some of them are just irritating). 
The controls can be a bit finicky (for example, if you are moving along a ledge, sometimes instead of left you need to press up, even though a second ago you were pressing left - because the camera changed a little).
In the end I replayed it for the collectibles not because I wanted to, but because I'm a bit OCD. I could just as well not replayed it again - it doesn't have high replay value.
If you pick it up on sale, that would be ideal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124098668', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1587167115}
review: Rime is a good game. You should play it. I would say that the highlight of the experience is the first part. Once the story gets itself going the game gets more linear and levels are less explorative. I enjoyed the whole game, but really the first part is the strongest. 9./10 for the first part, 7/10 overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970837919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1587240533}
review: It's all jumping and puzzles which gets both frustrating and old very quickly. I managed about 1.5 hours before I got bored and gave up. Up until that point there is no story in the game, just pointless find-the-key-open-the-door routine. The world is pretty and the art is fairly unique but it is all empty, there is no sense of adventure and there is no reason for anything, you don't care for the character either. Once I quit the game I have no desire to go back.  The game also has some major performance issues: I was getting 30-40 FPS on a 2080Ti.

review: I noticed some mediocre reactions to this game, especially in the games media here and there. I would just like to say that that's really unfounded. I played this game together with my 4yr old daughter, and it was really phenomenal. It reminds of things like Ico quite a bit, but that is a great compliment and not a whine about its authenticity! 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025229918', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1587337082}
review:
I decided to play this because it had a fox in it, and while the fox is a very minor part I am very glad I had the experience. To me this is very much like Ico, but with environments similar to The Witness. The platforming is not very difficult, but allows you to explore the cool environments in interesting ways. There are also a ton of hidden collectibles, most of which I don't know how you'd find without a guide, but provide more ways to interact with the cool environments. The soundtrack is also very good, going from subtle ambient to swelling orchestral. The credits song is particularly good.

It took me about 10 hours to complete, but that would be shorter if you did not try to get all the extras like I did.  I recommend you give it a try if you have the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039766073', 'num_games_owned': 1272, 'num_reviews': 220, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1557662773}
review:
Das Spiel macht viel richtig. Es sieht fantastisch aus, die Umgebungen in denen man sich wiederfindet sind abwechslungsreich. Die Musik und generelle Amtosph√§re sind sehr gut. Was gibt es also zu bem√§ngeln?
Also f√ºr mich ist die Story nicht immer nachvollziehbar gewesen. Auch finde ich es schade, dass hier ein Teil der Story in Collectibles "versteckt" ist. Dann habe ich das Spiel eher als "Walking Simulator" erfahren, als Jump and Run oder Puzzle Spiel. Da man hier oft l√§nger unterwegs ist muss man die Geduld und den Willen sich auf die Amtosph√§re einzulassen mitbringen. Es gibt zwar auch einzelne Action-Sequenzen, aber das macht das Spiel nicht aus.

Das Spiel ist f√ºr mich mit 4,8h ausreichend lang und brauch auch nicht l√§nger sein. Die Story hinterl√§sst einen bleibenden Eindruck. Ich kann das Spiel den Leuten empfehlen die sich entspannen und zudem eine Welt entdecken wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981386407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1606268289}
review:
Wow!

I've just finished Rime. What a memorable ride.

More than a game Rime is a beautiful experience beyond words. It feels like an interactive poem with the sweetest lullaby playing in the background.

There's a subtle but deep storytelling going on all at all times but you'll have to pay close attention to every minute detail. Everything will make sense when the story is revealed at the very last moment.

Visually gorgeous, music breathtaking, emotionally... well you'll have to play it and let your heart be the judge.

(My most sincere congratulations to Tequila Works crew. Enhorabuena y gracias!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198158227805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1586474145}
review:
I had a great time on this game!

The narration, the atmosphere, the graphic style are excellent.
The music was good but lacked personality, it was nothing extraordinary but I would have liked more remarkable music in the game.

There are a lot of collectibles, some of which help to understand the story which is good.
But some trophies are unachievable without going to see the solution on the internet which is a shame, but does not spoil the pleasure of finishing the game 100% either.
I finished the story in 7:30 am, and spend 5 more hours to finish it completely.

If you like independent games, with good puzzles, a good story and pretty music then I recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198841483827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1634107607}
review:
a game that works best on console and it isnt well optimized for pc, but if you can look past the framerate issues its beautiful, and the story, the build up qand oh the ending...

"The true brilliance is the games ending. It doesn't just reveal a characters motive, or change the context of what you're doing. It entirely changes the game in such a way that cant be undone, because once you beat the game, you cant unsee it. And the one time experience of that happening is beautifully done."

it truly is something

author: {'steamid': '76561198060357978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1703355212}
review: RiME is a truly beautiful game, atmospheric and rich, there's so much detail, i adore the music and the mystery, the wild feeling of freedom and tranquility that guides you so gently into one of the deepest and most moving stories i've ever experienced. I don't want to spoil it for anyone but its both uplifting and deeply moving. Please make more amazing games like this...

author: {'steamid': '76561198183263631', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1586108068}
review:
[h1]RiME[/h1]

Yalnƒ±zlƒ±ƒüƒ± tanƒ±mlamak ne kadar doƒüru bilmiyorum. S√∂ze d√∂kmek, okuduklarƒ±nda kendini bulmak herkesin i√ßinde ya≈üayacaƒüƒ± bir deneyim. Hi√ßbir zaman sona ermeyecek bir yalnƒ±zlƒ±ƒüƒ± ise kelimeye yansƒ±tmak en zoru olsa gerek √ß√ºnk√º ya≈üamadan √∂ƒürenilemeyecek derecede aƒüƒ±r ve i√ßinizde ya≈üamak zorunda kalacaƒüƒ±nƒ±z karanlƒ±k bir taraf olu≈üturuyor.
 
Kƒ±rmƒ±zƒ±, yƒ±rtƒ±k bir pelerin ne kadar anlamlƒ± olabilirse, o kadar anlamlƒ± olmu≈ü. Tequila Works ve QLOC‚Äôƒ±n ellerine saƒülƒ±k! Sonsuz bir √∂zlemin ba≈ülangƒ±cƒ±nƒ± anlatan ve her ≈üeyi yava≈ü√ßa anlayan √ßocuksu bir ruhla √ßizilmi≈ü bir hikaye, RiME. Orijinal bir √∂yk√º olmasƒ±nƒ±n yanƒ± sƒ±ra onlarca duyguya dokunan i√ßinizde bir yerlerde size kendini hissettirmeyi ba≈üaran harika bir √ßalƒ±≈üma olarak kar≈üƒ±mƒ±zda. Hepimizin yalnƒ±zlƒ±ƒüƒ±na bir par√ßa m√ºzik, anƒ±, resim, manzara... ortak olmuyor mu? RiME da bunlardan birisin olabilir sizin i√ßin!

Grafiklerden ve oynanƒ±≈ütan kƒ±saca bahsetmek istiyorum. Yine beni kendine √ßeken her oyunda olduƒüu gibi her detaya dikkat etmeye √ßalƒ±≈üarak oynadƒ±m. RiME, Unreal Engine tabanlƒ± bir oyun ve harika bir grafik kalitesine sahip. Bu kƒ±sƒ±mda grafiklerin ve olu≈üturulan manzaralarƒ±n ne kadar iyi olduƒüunu anlamak i√ßin SS‚Äôlerimden bazƒ±larƒ±na g√∂z atabilirsiniz. Sahile vuran kƒ±rmƒ±zƒ± pelerinli bir √ßocuƒüu oynamaya ba≈üladƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z bu puzzle-solving tarzƒ± oyunda, bulmaca ve sƒ±rlar sizi sƒ±kmayacak seviyede ayarlanmƒ±≈ü ve en √∂nemlisi tekrar tekrar √ß√∂zmek zorunda kalacaƒüƒ±nƒ±z d√∂ng√ºden kendini kurtarmƒ±≈ü bir ≈üekilde dizayn edilmi≈ü. Oynanƒ±≈üƒ± bu denli kolayla≈ütƒ±ran ve g√∂rselleri ile g√∂z√ºm√º g√∂nl√ºm√º doyuran RiME gibi bir bir √∂nceki yapƒ±tƒ±n adƒ± Hellblade: Senua‚Äôs Sacrifice idi. Bunu buraya not ediyorum. Bulmacalarƒ± √ß√∂zerken sƒ±kƒ±lmƒ±yor olu≈üunuz hikayeyi geri planda kalmaktan alƒ±koyuyor. RiME‚Äôƒ±n en g√º√ßl√º yanlarƒ±ndan biri de bu!

Sinematikler! Hikayenin ne olduƒüunu anlamanƒ±z i√ßin yeterli sayƒ±da ve doƒüru kesitleri kullanarak olu≈üturulmu≈ü. Bu kƒ±sƒ±mda senaryoyu oynanƒ±≈ütan ayƒ±rmadan ilerlemenizi saƒülayan √∂ƒüelerden biri olarak kar≈üƒ±mƒ±za √ßƒ±kƒ±yor ve yeterli sayƒ±da olduƒüunun altƒ±nƒ± √ßizmek istiyorum. 

RiME‚Äôƒ±n puzzle d√ºnyasƒ± g√∂rd√ºƒü√ºm en harika ve en ba≈üarƒ±lƒ± puzzle d√ºnyasƒ± deƒüil ama arka arkaya gelen puzzle‚Äôlarƒ±n birbirini tekrar etmeyi≈üi ve b√ºy√ºk resme bakmamƒ±zƒ± saƒülayacak yapƒ±sƒ± taktiri hak ediyor kesinlikle. 

Kontrolleri √ßok basit bir oyun. Ben Xbox One Controller ile oynadƒ±m ama klavyeden de √ßok ama √ßok rahat oynanabilecek kalibrede tasarlanmƒ±≈ü. 

Ve tabiki m√ºzikler, tƒ±pkƒ± Witcher 3: Wild Hunt ya da Hellblade:Senua's Sacrifice'de olduƒüu gibi g√ºzel manzara ve m√ºziƒüi bulunca ihya oluyorum desem yeridir. RiME i√ßin de aynƒ±sƒ± ge√ßerli! Beni g√ºl√ºmseten bir tesad√ºf√º anlatayƒ±m kƒ±saca. Yƒ±llardƒ±r m√ºzikle ilgilenen ve oyun m√ºziklerini ayrƒ± dinleyen ara≈ütƒ±ran biri olarak, oyunu bitirir bitirmez soundtrackleri ba≈ütan dinlemek i√ßin spotify, youtube ara≈ütƒ±rmaya ba≈üladƒ±m. Kar≈üƒ±ma √ßƒ±kan sonu√ß: David Garcia Diaz. ƒ∞sim olarak yabancƒ± gelmi≈ü olabilir ama Hellblade: Senua‚Äôs Sacrifice‚Äôƒ±n soundtracklerini √ßalƒ±≈üan ki≈üi kendisi. 2017‚Äôde RiME‚Äôƒ± yaptƒ±ktan sonra 2018‚Äôde Hellblade i√ßin repertuar √ßalƒ±≈ümasƒ± hazƒ±rlamƒ±≈ü ve ≈üunu s√∂ylemek gerekir: Bu oyuna can veren, nefes almasƒ±nƒ± saƒülayan melodiler √ßalƒ±≈ümƒ±≈ü. ƒ∞lgilisi i√ßin soundtracklerin bulunduƒüu √ßalma listesini buraya bƒ±rakƒ±yorum: https://open.spotify.com/album/4Vmv5JMd2k5ZweNMUugzqo?si=gkYKoGlkRlG2EOM4alBhsQ

Peki oyunun hi√ß mi k√∂t√º tarafƒ± yok? Tabiki var, bazƒ± puzzle‚Äôlar (benim i√ßin sadece 1 tanesi) rahatsƒ±zlƒ±k verecek seviyede deƒüil ama hadi √ß√∂zeyim devamƒ±nƒ± g√∂reyim raddesinde uzundu. Bunun dƒ±≈üƒ±nda oyundaki collectible item dediƒüimiz toplanan √∂ƒüelerin oyuna katksƒ±nƒ± oyun sonunda anlƒ±yorsunuz. Oynanƒ±≈üa bir artƒ±sƒ± yok. Bunu oyunun yarƒ±sƒ±na gelmeden fark ettim ve hikayeyi √ßok sevdiƒüim i√ßin her ≈üeyi toplayayƒ±m hissiyatƒ±na √ßok d√º≈ümedim. Mapleri biraz daha i√ßli dƒ±≈ülƒ± oynarsanƒ±z, her ≈üeyi bulmak m√ºmk√ºn! Bir de benim i√ßin tek ‚Äúcons‚Äù yorumu oyunun ba≈üƒ±nda RiME‚Äôƒ± tanƒ±tan ilk oynanƒ±≈ü hamlelerinin oyunu anlatmak i√ßin yeterli olmamasƒ±. Biraz daha a√ßƒ±k olmak gerekirse,  Papo&Yo, A Story About My Uncle vs. gibi oyunlarƒ±n hikaye tabanlƒ± puzzle-solving indie‚Äôler olduƒüunu biliyorum, RiME'ƒ±n da bu tarz bir oyun olduƒüunu biliyordum ama her oyunun kendi fiziƒüi ve oyun ritmi mevcut bu kƒ±sƒ±mda RiME diƒüer g√ºzel √∂zelliklerinin g√∂lgesinde bƒ±raktƒ±ƒüƒ± oyuna alƒ±≈üma s√ºreci ya≈üatƒ±yor oyuncuya. Benim a√ßƒ±mdan bu √∂nemli bir detay olduƒüu i√ßin bahsetmek istedim. 

Sonu√ß olarak, √∂zlem, yalnƒ±zlƒ±k, sevgi ve daha bir √ßok hissiyatƒ± 5-7 saatlik bir oynanƒ±≈üƒ±n i√ßine sƒ±ƒüdƒ±rmƒ±≈ü, benim gibi tek oturu≈üta bitirebileceƒüiniz bir yapƒ±da size sunmu≈ü olan bu hikayenin bir par√ßasƒ± olmalƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z. Kƒ±rmƒ±zƒ± bir pelerin ne kadar anlamlƒ± olabilir? Bir √ßocuk k√∂r bir umutla bilinmezliƒüin i√ßinde ne kadar mutlu olabilir? Deniz ve martƒ±nƒ±n sesi 5-7 saat arayla nasƒ±l farklƒ± hissettirebilir? ƒ∞nsana derin bir nefes √ßektirip, g√∂zlerini ya≈üartan bir sona maruz bƒ±rakan bu oyunu oynamanƒ±zƒ± tavsiye ederim!

Keyifli oyun zamanlarƒ± diliyorum!

Puan: 9.4 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 2977, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1238, 'last_played': 1586064966}
review:
Estamos ante un juego indie con una est√©tica atractiva que probablemente sea lo que nos anime a probarlo, el desarrollo se hace bastante ameno en escenarios grandes y coloridos con unos puzzles sencillos, todo ello mezclado con bastantes plataformas, animaciones de personajes muy conseguidas y una banda sonora de primer nivel.

Aunque sus enormes escenarios llenos de detalles invitan a la exploraci√≥n no obtendremos recompensa alguna con ello (solo coleccionables) ya que siempre hay un solo objetivo y varios caminos libres de enemigos u obst√°culos importantes, el resto es atrezo. La historia aunque sencilla ser√° un misterio justo hasta el final y la ausencia total de di√°logos no ayuda en ese aspecto. La verdad es que deja sensaci√≥n de no aprovechar todos sus recursos y ser demasiado pretencioso.

Amazing story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976452525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1566347739}
review:
Maybe there aren't more games like this because nobody knows what to call them. 

They're not really platformers, even though you spend a lot of time climbing and jumping.  There are environmental puzzles to an extent, but they don't feel like full-on puzzle games either.  And you're actually doing something, so they're definitely not walking simulators.  

We like to put names on things, and these games kind of defy categorization.  Each one is its own unique self-contained experience.  For that reason they might just be tough to make, too.  

Is this true?  Explain yourselves, developers!

This particular one lands somewhere between NaissanceE and Ico, which is a pretty good place to be.  It's not as pure and abstract as NaissanceE, nor as grounded in narrative structure as Ico.  

Like Ico, you play as a little kid who's not the slightest bit afraid of heights; but for all of the acrobatics, what they're really focused on here is creating a certain mood.  To do this they rely heavily on one of the most difficult and underappreciated skills in storytelling: knowing when to shut up. 

You wake up on a beach, alone.  A less confident game would immediately start dumping text onto you--maybe a flowery poem or a cryptic quote or something--to tell you how to act and feel; or even worse, they'd give you a chattering companion to follow you around like a nervous salesman trying to close the deal.
  
Not here, mercifully.  Just you, the wind, the waves, the rustling grass, the seagulls, some low-key music and the sun rising and setting as you head out to explore this strange new island on your own.  It's a totally different sort of immersion.  The game simply creates a space and invites the player to reach out and fill it.  Without saying a word they make you want to investigate every last corner; but not in a hurry.  This style slows you down to a point where you feel really present in this place.

They do speak to you along the way, but it's a visual sort of language, subtle little signposts of meaning that offer both guidance and new questions.  The little "i" up there in the title, for instance, is like that because it's supposed to look like a keyhole, a theme that shows up throughout the white tower that serves as the game's physical and figurative axis.  Other elements like the fox and the red cape appear to draw your eye and pull you gently down the game's path; and the road changes a lot as you go. 

At the beginning things seem perfectly tranquil.  Time and time again I found myself stopping just to listen and watch, looking out over some magnificent ocean vista.  Seriously, this first part is just absolutely gorgeous. At one point you interact with a puzzle that causes the whole sky to wheel around you, and I actually said out loud, "wow!" 
 
Arrive at the next section, though, and and the tranquility gives way to a frenetic, hunted tension.  Each new level brings with it a similar shift in tone.  By the time you get to the rain section, the atmosphere of crushing sorrow is so thick you practically choke on it. 
 
If you're more perceptive than I am, it might dawn on you at some point that there's a coherent purpose to what they're doing here; but rest assured they explain everything in the end and it makes perfect sense.

So while you might be thinking that this whole thing sounds awfully "artsy," they're not being pretentious about it at all.  It comes across as very sincere and heartfelt, like the authors had a genuine vision they wanted to convey.  They really are trying to show you something, not obscure it behind a cloud of oh-so-cleverness like some games do.

Of course, it'll surprise no one that the story is ultimately geared to make you feel bad.  That's pretty much par for the course with these things, huh? 
 
I wonder if that lingering bittersweet aftertaste is part of why this game doesn't seem to get talked about as much as, say, Ico.  Although Ico also had a more overtly personal story, too, with the girl and all that, whereas this one is more allegorical; so maybe Ico is a little easier to connect with in that sense.  Plus, nothing here quite matches that drawbridge scene, which was one of the most brilliant examples of visual storytelling you'll ever see in a game. 
 
Still, it's a worthy addition to the whatever-you-call-it genre.

And hey, developers take note: they managed to build this entire game of mystery and wonder without including a single sewer level.  Was that so hard?



You can find more indie game reviews at [url=https://oddlittlegames.com] oddlittlegames.com [/url] or visit my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34514756/] curator page. [/url]  Thanks, and enjoy!

review:
Die Beschreibung der Thematik des Spiels ist sehr gut umgesetzt. Und die Geschichte sowie die Musik gefiehl mir. Die verschiedenen Level waren wundersch√∂n und man konnte sch√∂n durchlaufen entweder wo man hinwollte oder man wurde gef√ºhrt, im gro√üen und ganzen konnte man sich auch nicht verlaufen.
Das einzige was mich st√∂rte war, dass man mit dem X-Box-Controller das Spiel nicht spielen kann. Sobald man nach vorne oder zur√ºck lief hat gleichzeitig die Kameraansicht sich mit bewegt. Ich weis nicht wie es bei den anderen Controllern ist aber mit diesem, war es schrecklich, weshalb ich dann auch auf Tastatur umgestiegen bin. Das negative bei der Tastatur ist, dass ich das Spiel nicht vom Sofa aus geniessen konnte (obwohl eben volle Controllerunterst√ºtzung bei Steam erw√§hnt ist).
Nichts desto trotz war es eine sehr sch√∂ne Geschichte und ein gutes Entdeckerspiel.

review:
Sehr sch√∂nes Spiel, allerdings solltet ihr weder Sprachausgabe noch Texte, au√üer den Interface Texten, erwarten, denn das Spiel kommt komplett ohne sie aus, dennoch ist die Story sch√∂n erz√§hlt. Ein wenig erinnert es dadurch an Journey oder Abzu und ich w√ºrde es auch grob in die gleiche Kategorie stecken, es ist von der Spieldauer nur l√§nger und hat eine etwas tiefere Story. Wer gerne erkundet kommt in dem Spiel auch auf seine Kosten, da es reichlich Dinge zu finden gibt, was den Wiederspielwert etwas erh√∂ht.

Nur die Steuerung mit dem Gamepad fand ich nicht 100% gelungen, vor allem wenn man an einem Absatz h√§ngt und nach hinten springen soll, ist es extrem kniffelig den richtigen Punkt f√ºr den Analog Stick zu finden, damit er nach hinten zeigt und nicht nach links/rechts klettert. Das finde ich in anderen Spielern mit √§hnlicher Klettermechanik besser gel√∂st.

Aber das ist schon meckern auf hohem Niveau, kann das Spiel nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048632839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1584909237}
review:
Una simpatica avventura madrilena da pollice grigio. Rime ha dalla sua un'indubbio fascino visivo, grazie allo stile architettonico delle rovine, ai colori vivi e ad alcuni effetti visivi, ma √® carente sul fronte ludico e di ottimizzazione dell'Unreal engine, che a meno di non avere una scheda recente, anche a impostazioni minime non dar√† mai una totale sensazione di fluidit√† e la cosa appare parecchio ingiustificata.

Inizialmente, l'impressione rimane comunque molto positiva nel nostro girovagare per la zona iniziale, tra spiaggia, sottopassaggi e alture, purtroppo, quello che Rime esaurisce in breve tempo √® il ritmo. Il gioco mostra una certa linearit√†, nascosta malamente dietro alcuni collezionabili poco utili, un paio di zone di scarsa visibilit√†/riparo da attraversare e in generale a rompicapi di basso livello, che altro non fanno se non rallentare "l'esperienza". Il gioco infatti avrebbe velleit√† narrative, bench√© la storia sia abbastanza modesta e prevedibile, vorrebbe imitare alcuni noti e sopravvalutati titoli dell'era Ps2/Ps3, e al pari di alcuni di essi non riesce a tenere vivo l'interesse, per via di una struttura incerta sul quanto essere gioco e quanto essere racconto. 

Le meccaniche sono poche, piuttosto familiari e stantie. Ci potremo arrampicare su alcune sporgenze in stile Assassin's Creed, senza neanche lontanamente avere la stessa divertente quantit√† di appigli e libert√† di scelta, potremo spostare alcuni piccoli blocchi alla Zelda, ruotare alcuni posti di osservazione per sbloccare delle porte, giochicchiare raramente con un globo per cambiare l'orario e, quando consentito, usare un gorgheggio in stile Sirenetta Disney, per interagire con un paio di statue, globi ed oggetti, anche quando un colpo di bastone sarebbe altrettanto efficace... se ci venisse permesso. Un elemento, quello del canto, quantomeno pi√π personale e presente degli altri, e che meritava per questo pi√π coraggio e fantasia nella sua implementazione.

Forse, per quanto banale, qualche nemico in pi√π sarebbe stato utile. Gli sporadici intermezzi risulteranno piacevoli e l'esagerato cielo stellato del veloce ciclo giorno/notte √® uno spettacolo da vedere, ma il tutto viene penalizzato dal poco interesse ad andare avanti. Rime non √® un gioco brutto, ma non del tutto riuscito nei suoi obiettivi. Il fatto che al tempo venisse anche solo ipotizzato che potesse concorrere con Breath of the Wild, appare pi√π che mai comico. 

Detto questo, un voto negativo √® probabilmente troppo severo, penso che Rime sia un onesto indie da 6,5, tuttavia, trovo pure che la media sia veramente ingannevole verso i giocatori.

Pros:
- beautiful art
- very nice soundtrack

Cons:
- it's a walking simulator (pro if you like walking and jumping)
- not much game play. they include things that seem like puzzles until you find out that they aren't
- the story or lack thereof. they want you to feel [spoiler] sad when characters die [/spoiler] but with no character development and a sudden jolt of perspective it felt more like a "see how tricky we are" instead of a "see how good at story telling we are"


This game is easy (but boring) for those hunting achievements and a chore for any casual players. My advice, save your money for something actually worth $30.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155645516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1584577928}
review:
¬øMerece la pena?

Respuesta corta: S√≠, pero rebajado. 

Respuesta larga:

Compr√© el juego sin conocer el estudio y sin haber escuchado de √©l en ning√∫n sitio. Me llam√≥ la atenci√≥n est√©ticamente y como estaba rebajado y ten√≠a unos euros en la cartera lo pill√© por probarlo. 

El juego no supone ning√∫n reto, es muy sencillito, pero la verdad es que la ambientaci√≥n y la m√∫sica es espectacular. A pesar de ser muy f√°cil, es muy divertido de jugar, ya que lo que pretende no es darte un reto sino mostrarte cosas y eso lo hace genial. Bebe mucho del team ICO este juego y se nota, pero en plan bien. 

El juego es muy cortito, 4 horas y pico me ha durado a mi, pero han sido unas 4 horas en las que no me he podido despegar del mando, cosa que no me ocurr√≠a desde hac√≠a mucho tiempo. Son 4 horas que valen oro, pero aun as√≠ me parece un precio excesivo 35 euros por 4 horas de juego. Pilladlo de oferta. 

Me sorprendi√≥ mucho el final cuando vi los cr√©ditos y vi que estaba hecho por espa√±oles, me alegra mucho que un equipo espa√±ol demuestre que puede hacer cosas a la altura del panorama. Eso s√≠, la pr√≥xima vez por favor, curraos m√°s la publicidad porque algo as√≠ no puede pasar tan inadvertido. Un saludo.

A banda sonora que acompanha os eventos e os momentos dram√°ticos do jogo √© fenomenal. Visualmente a direc√ß√£o art√≠stica √© simplesmente soberba. Recomendo vivamente!

author: {'steamid': '76561198253492927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1583877855}
review: RiME est un petit jeu d‚Äôaventure, avec une pointe d‚Äôexploration et un zeste de puzzle. L‚Äôambiance du jeu est tr√®s bonne, renforc√©e par de beaux graphismes ainsi que par une belle bande son. La jouabilit√©, √† la manette, est plut√¥t bonne, avec des contr√¥les simples et intuitifs ; il est √©galement possible de jouer au clavier et √† la souris. Concernant le sc√©nario, si celui-ci semble plut√¥t minimaliste et abstrait au d√©but, il se r√©v√®le plus profond au fil de l‚Äôaventure, avec une fin √©mouvante et qui permet de saisir l‚Äôensemble du message v√©hicul√© par le jeu. Si le c√¥t√© exploration, n√©cessaire pour obtenir tous les succ√®s, est assez pr√©sent dans les diff√©rents chapitres, qui sont chacun de petits mondes semi-ouverts, j‚Äôai regrett√© le manque de difficult√© des phases de puzzle/plates-formes, qui sont pour le coup vraiment trop simples. Concernant la dur√©e de vie, il faut compter environ sept heures pour terminer l‚Äôhistoire, et quelques heures suppl√©mentaires pour obtenir tous les succ√®s si vous en avez oubli√©. Heureusement, une fois le jeu termin√©, il sera possible de choisir le chapitre afin de gagner un peu de temps. Pour terminer, je trouve que le jeu est un peu cher au prix normal (35‚Ç¨), donc je recommande de le prendre en promotion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318359628', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1584013392}
review:
Premetto che √® la mia prima recensione, esse si divideranno in 3 parti: breve spiegazione della trama (no spoiler) e di che cosa emozionalmente mi ha lasciato, aspetti negativi e positivi, conclusione e consigli.

Rime √® un puzzle-platform che va a toccare nei suoi 5 capitoli le varie fasi del lutto, ti ritroverai nei panni di questo ragazzo che naufraga su un'isola, ti sentirai disorientato, perch√© nessuno ti dice cosa fare, non ti aspetti questo, come quando perdi una persona a te cara.
Soggettivamente ho trovato RIME dal punto di vista emotivo un gioco che ha saputo farmi piangere anche dopo la quarta volta che ho giocato il finale.

Aspetti positivi:
-Musica: la colonna sonora √® eccezionale, azzeccata in ogni suo minimo particolare sia tecnicamente che nella scelta del posizionamento nel gameplay, essendo un produttore probabilmente campioner√≤ qualcosa per farci una traccia;
-Grafica: la grafica √® molto semplice ma √® proprio questa la sua forza, pulita, senza troppe pretese;
-Gameplay: all'inizio si rimane un po' spaesati, perch√© non c'√® nessun UHD nello schermo, niente che ti da consigli o ti dica esattamente cosa tu debba fare, ma dopo qualche minuto di gioco si inizia a comprendere il tutto. Mi ha colpito molto la variet√† degli enigmi che fino alla fine sono riusciti sempre a trovare qualcosa di nuovo per non annoiare il giocatore. Il platform √® semplice, non √® di quelli che devi stare 30 minuti ad arrabbiarti, trovo che nel contesto del gioco ci stia bene.
-Dialoghi e narrativa: nel gioco NON ci sono dialoghi, ed √® proprio questo il bello, rime penso che non possa definirsi come un gioco ma un'opera d'arte, in quanto opera d'arte deve lasciare spazio all'interpretazione di chi la vede dall'esterno, il silenzio vale pi√π di mille parole e gli sviluppatori hanno saputo giocare molto bene questa loro chiave.
-Esplorazione: In quanto ad esplorazione √® veramente vasto sopratutto per quanto riguarda strade secondarie per prendere il collezzionabile di turno.
-Emotivit√†: Come ho detto prima dal punto di vista emotivo √® molto forte, perch√© finch√© non arrivi alla fine (tranne qualche flashback tra un capitolo e l'altro) ti rimane sempre questo alone di mistero che non capisci bene che cosa sia successo di preciso e l'impatto finale √® un qualcosa che ti fa venire i brividi.

Aspetti negativi:
-Ottimizzazione: Iniziamo con il pi√π grande dei problemi, l'ottimizzazione su PC √® veramente di bassa qualit√†, Unreal engine sfruttato malissimo sotto questo punto di vista, anche con schede video di fascia alta difficilmente tocchi i 60 fps e a volte si hanno cali veramente drastici (sopratutto nel capitolo 2). Una mia cara amica lo ha giocato su xbox e ha detto che l√¨ √® tutto ok, probabilmente √® un gioco che √® stato ideato per console e trasportarlo su computer ha rivelato dei problemi;
-Caricamenti: Anche questi risultano essere abbastanza lenti, non troppo, ma rispetto alla media di altri giochi anche molto pi√π complessi ci si aspetta di pi√π. L'animazione che si vede appena si apre il gioco dura un sacco di tempo e solo dopo 25 ore di gioco ho capito che la si poteva comodamente skippare con SPACE (non sempre per√≤ funziona);
-Achievement: a volte mi √® capitato che mi si buggassero un paio di achievement e quindi di dover ricaricare l'ultimo checkpoint per rifarlo;
-Luce e luminosit√†: ci sono dei trigger della luce che sono gestiti male, ti ritrovi da un passo all'altro a un ambiente con una determinata color correction a una totalmente diversa, personalmente mi ha dato un po' di fastidio. La luce in certi punti √® veramente ridotta al minimo e si vede poco e niente, in certe fasi di gioco consiglio di aumentarla un po' dalle impostazioni grafiche;
-Collisioni: In certi punti il gioco pecca nel realismo delle collisioni, a volte fai salti di pochi cm e ti aggrappi a non so quale sporgenza lontana di metri e altre volte accade il contrario. Nel capitolo 4 in certi punti la pioggia trapassa dei tetti coperti, sempre nel medesimo capitolo ti cadono macerie addosso ma il nostro protagonista le trapassa come se niente fosse, avrei gradito almeno una animazione del personaggio che si ripara ad esempio;
-Rigiocabilit√†: Sinceramente mi sono un po' annoiato nelle mie ultime ore per platinarlo, non √® di sicuro un gioco che tu possa rigiocare pi√π di 2 volte, quindi se lo volete finire consiglio di farlo tutto in 2 tentativi.

Tiriamo le conclusioni:

RIME √® un gioco che consiglio con tutto il cuore, sopratutto se avete appena perso una persona a cui eravate molto legati.
Gli aspetti negativi che ho citato prima sono infimi rispetto a quello che emozionalmente ti lascia a mio parere, un gioco che chiunque dovrebbe giocare e dovrebbe avere nella propria libreria.
Il gioco dura dalle 5 alle 6 ore.
Un po' altino il prezzo, consiglio di prenderlo in sconto, io ho fatto un affarone prendendolo a 2 euro e qualcosa.

Consigli:
Io per gusto personale l'ho platino senza l'uso di tutorial, ma cercando online su youtube ne ho trovato uno molto valido, il canale si chiama: PS4Trophies, parla un inglese molto comprensibile, ma se proprio lo volete in italiano vi consiglio la guida di "Il Vault di Jess", il suo video dura 4 ore ma spiega tutto nel dettaglio ed √® una ragazza molto simpatica.

Per chi voglia scambiare pareri ed opinioni o approfondire la mia persona nel mio profilo ci sono diversi contatti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1583928254}
review:
in questo gioco impersonate un ragazzo che si trova naufrago in un'isola deserta. Il vostro compito sar√† quello di esplorare l'isola e seguire la vostra amica volpe che vi indicher√† la strada giusta. Il gioco √® composto da un'unica strada principale cosparsa da varie stradine pi√π o meno nascoste che portano quasi sempre ai collezionabili, al max in un vicolo cieco. L'inizio del gioco sar√† un p√≤ traumatico visto che non ci sono indicazioni su dove andare o cosa fare, finch√® non troverete la volpe che vi aiuter√† a prendere la strada giusta. Per non parlare dei vari enigmi ambientali che bisogner√† risolvere per proseguire nel gioco. Le musiche sono buone con alcune d'atmosfera, anche graficamente √® carino, peccato per alcuni rari cali di frame fortunatamente durano pochi secondi, ma ci sono. ^^; La storia la capirete solo nella sequenza finale, o se prendete tutti i collezionabili al primo colpo. La longevit√† √® buona se come me fate la seconda run per prendere i collezionabili che avete mancato la prima volta, altrimenti vi durer√† al max 5-6 ore non di pi√π. Personalmente lo consiglio ma solo scontato, visto il prezzo e la durata del gioco stesso. ^_^

Avviso: Se lo giocate in finestra e uscite dal gioco. Steam non lo riesce a chiudere finch√® non uscite da Steam forzando la chiusura del gioco. ^^;

author: {'steamid': '76561198308099499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1585953125}
review: Une tr√®s belle exp√©rience de jeu, avec des d√©cors fabuleux, un univers magique, d√©paysant. Des √©nigmes bien dos√©es, de belles surprises. A noter aussi une dimension √©motionnelle et psychologique avec des passages tr√®s sombres qui pourraient ne pas convenir √† tout le monde. On finit le jeu avec une m√©lange de m√©lancolie, de soulagement et une envie de repartir dans cette aventure pour la d√©couvrir sous un autre angle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041887851', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1583917707}
review:
RiME est un jeu comtemplatif, comportant du gameplay de plateforme et quelques √©nigmes. L'ambiance est bien servie par la musique, et la beaut√© des paysages. Le style graphique en Cell shading rappelle un peu un Zelda Wind Waker, avec plus de d√©tails. Au cours du jeu, aucun dialogue, aucun texte. Vous allez d√©ambuler dans le monde, en suivant parfois les indications lumineuses, et deviner par vous m√™me ce qu'il faut faire. Pas de panique, c'est intuitif et naturel. Le jeu d√©peins au travers des diff√©rents mondes qu'on parcourt les diff√©rentes √©tapes du deuil, c'est plein de sous entendus, d'images po√©tiques et de repr√©sentations de sentiments. Petit b√©mol point de vue technique : j'ai eu du mal a garder des fps constants dans certaines zones. Rien de dramatique.
C'est une tr√®s bonne oeuvre, jolie et prenante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160974404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1583566681}
review: This game is a beautiful masterpiece of emotional imagery with exploration and puzzle-solving. The way the devs portrayed the journey of this game, throughout the game, has left such an impression on me. Like I already had my 'allergies' flare up at the end of the playthrough but I can't help but just remember my time spent within the game and putting the story together with the paintings on the walls, the overall conflict and pacing of each level alongside my viewers and it's just an amazing game. Please. If you have not played this game yet, you are missing out on a gorgeous and sincere journey. Whatever game these devs push out next, I am excited for just because of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274878356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1585159924}
review: What an incredibly beautiful game! This is a true hidden gem. Pure and simple. It's like ABZU meets Mysterious Cities of Gold. A gentle journey through a colourful island full of wonder and puzzles that aren't too taxing. It's a perfect type of game if you're looking to relax. If it's on offer and it looks like your kind of thing, go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092052349', 'num_games_owned': 1273, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1584827820}
review:
RiME est un jeu absolument merveilleux et...myst√©rieux !
Lorsqu'on commence la partie, on ne sait pas qui nous sommes et o√π on est. On se met r√©ellement √† la place du personnage : que faisons-nous ici ? Que s'est-il pass√© ? On part alors √† la d√©couverte d'une √Æle qui renferme bien des secrets...

En tout cas, je n'ai rien √† redire sur RiME !  Il combine un gameplay simple et efficace, un environnement bien construit et une musique fabuleuse ! Le jeu est √† la fois reposant et v√©ritablement poignant. Tout cela prend une tout autre proportion lorsqu'on arrive √† la fin et que le jeu r√©pond √† toutes les questions qu'on se posait au d√©but. Un v√©ritable moment d'√©motion.

J'avoue m√™me que sur la fin, j'ai failli l√¢cher une petite larme...

author: {'steamid': '76561198086486844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1583678103}
review: Tr√®s beau et touchant. Visuellement et musicalement magique. Une ambiance tr√®s douce et apaisante. Il n'y a pas vraiment de d√©fi ou de difficult√©s ici car ce n'est clairement pas le but vis√©. Les √©nigmes sont simples ce qui le rend accessible et √©vite des situations de blocages qui auraient pu √™tre frustrantes. Une aventure dont l'essence se concentre dans le final qui permet au joueur de comprendre la raison de tout √ßa (m√™me si pour ma part j'ai eu une id√©e juste assez vite). Ici il s'agit d'√™tre surtout spectateur de l'histoire de ce petit h√©ros et de l'accompagner [spoiler]dans son dernier voyage[/spoiler]. Un beau jeu comme je les aime tant, ceux qui vous rendent tout chose apr√®s les avoir faits et vous laisse un vrai souvenir : Ori, Life is strange (le premier), The Witcher 3...qui ont une vraie histoire et un peu de magie derri√®re tous ces pixels. Je tire vraiment mon chapeau aux cr√©ateurs qui ont os√©. Je ne m'attendais pas √† √ßa en l'achetant (en promo). Je pensais que c'√©tait une banale aventure comme tant d'autres alors qu'on est bien au-del√† [spoiler]sans mauvais jeu de mots[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198054728639', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1583630581}
review: This is a fairly light puzzle platformer with somewhat uneven pacing, but it also has a beautiful soundtrack, eye-catching graphics, and a very touching non-linear story. If the former is more important to you than the latter, don't pick this up. For everyone else, I can highly recommend with two thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185055734', 'num_games_owned': 1593, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1583230495}
review:
[h1] RiME Review ([i]spoiler free[/i]) [/h1]

Puzzle platform 3D indie, senza troppi dettagli dedicati a menu, interfaccia o altro. Dalla complessit√† crescente, RiME pian piano intavola anche una trama particolare tramite statue, animali, disegni sulle mura degli edifici e brevi cutscenes. Quasi ogni angolo di ogni mappa √® esplorabile e ci√≤ permette al giocatore di passare il tempo a risolvere anche enigmi secondari e di ragionare sul percorso seguito prima di passare per la strada principale. 

La difficolt√† non √® alta, ma serve comunque ragionarci un po' per capire cosa fare. La colonna sonora e la grafica rendono il tutto ancora pi√π bello, fino all'ultimo momento in cui si capir√† esattamente il senso della storia (facendo cadere anche qualche lacrimuccia). Completabile in 5-6 ore nei suoi 4 capitoli, non penso valga comunque il prezzo pieno di 34,99‚Ç¨. 10‚Ç¨ sarebbe un prezzo ragionevole, per premiare anche gli sviluppatori. Lo si trova anche a meno.

[b] Voto finale 7,8/10 [/b]

review:

The only annoyance I came across with this game is that I experienced frame stutter with the game on Ultra despite building a brand new computer days prior that can more than handle this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985232409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1582492105}
review:
This is probably the most visually and aurally beautiful game I've played. If you want to spend 5 hours or so hitting the screenshot key and saying "wow" audibly, then at least consider this. 

It's also an amazingly intuitive game. I an only assume that the designers did a ridiculous amount of playtesting to make every element of the game immediately clear. There was literally only one time in the entire game when I spent any time wandering around with no clear goal. This is despite it being a game with no tutorial, no dialogue, and with puzzles that feature teleportation and other elements that make that even more difficult.

That out of the way, this is a puzzle game. The puzzles are a mix of figuring how to get from one place to another by climbing and jumping, or making use of devices and objects in the world to do something. The best comparison I can think of is something like Tomb Raider or Enslaved: Odyssey to the West without the combat.

The plot is great, if you don't mind allusive mythopoetic nonsense. If you demand a plot be a group of opposed people trying to accomplish divergent goals or some such thing, then you'll be disappointed. There is no dialogue in the game, and, while it does come together at the end, it mostly consists of people doing allusive and enigmatic stuff in a world with its own logic. 

Overall, I think it was a fantastic experience.

review:
Ce jeu n'est pas Tomb Raider, ni Myst.

Pas vraiment un jeu de plateforme, pas vraiment un jeu d'√©nigme, RIME est avant tout un voyage √† travers une cit√© aux d√©cors onirique. Le manque de d√©fi rend le tout lassant √† la longue mais heureusement que c'est court.

Et dieu que c'est beau. Les d√©cors, la musique.

Bref, si vous voulez cracher du sang ou vous creuser le cerveau, r√©installez Tomb Raider 4 ou Myst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009995645', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1581881566}
review:
Un jeu √† savourer le temps d'un week-end pluvieux, avec un bon syst√®me audio si possible, pour profiter de la magnifique bande son qui ponctue chaque nouvel √©v√©nement de l'aventure : une vraie r√©ussite ! Le niveau de difficult√© n'est pas √©lev√©, et on se laisse porter au gr√© des √©nigmes dans cet immense √Æle pleine de surprises et √† l'ambiance de plus en plus sombre et myst√©rieuse. La fin du jeu vous laisse un peu groggy. (ne vous spoilez pas svp !)

La rejouabilit√© est limit√©e bien s√ªr, sauf pour les adeptes de troph√©es et autres succ√®s souhaitant terminer le jeu √† 100%. Par contre le prix d'origine sur Steam (30‚Ç¨) est bien trop √©lev√©. Un jeu de qualit√© certes, mais qui reste quand m√™me assez court : prenez-le √† moins de 10‚Ç¨ si vous le pouvez ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037897685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1584479735}
review: You know when you play a RPG, and you start exploring old ruins, and there is soothing music, and a sense of melancholy sets in as you look about? This is that, in a whole game. It's really good, the art is crisp and lovely, there is no real stress to it, you just crack on trying to solve puzzles in an ancient ruin. There are some little touches to the animation that I really enjoy, like when the kid hits knee-deep water and does that silly side-leg hop thing we all did as children at the beach, or how he shivers as the sun goes down. Its so chill, I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401207019', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 681, 'last_played': 1703040638}
review: RiME es una aut√©ntica obra de arte en todos los aspectos: Gr√°ficos preciosos, una m√∫sica hermosa y una historia muy buena.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089805810', 'num_games_owned': 1741, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1582320265}
review:
if only there was a "meh" option in steam I would give it that score. not sure what to say here except it is a boring game.

Pros:
- great soundtrack
- beautiful graphics/art
- good-looking areas
- alright story

Cons:
- with all those good sceneries and cutscenes, 70% of the game is just walking and walking and walking around into empty areas and copy/paste corridors of nothingness
- the gameplay is like all the other ten billion puzzle games in the market, nothing new added to the table or anything
- the story tries to make you cry or feel something but fails (except for the ending maybe) [spoiler] as some side characters die (?) but you don't know anything about them so you don't care [/spoiler]
- the game is daunting and a chore to play, took me 6 months to finish this game


this is a 5/10 game, but I don't really recommend it to anyone. Took me 5 hours of boredom to finish this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393825451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1582233364}
review:
I`ve come across this game when I was suggested paying a bit more and get it as a bundle.

I deeply regret paying whatever I have paid extra for this.

No story (there is no word in the game!), you just jump and walk around. It`s a platformer, and a very simple one, nothing more than that.

If you like walking around and jumping on rocks from beginning to end, you might enjoy it. Let`s be fair: it`s a mobile phone, not a PC game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097905877', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1571243686}
review:
I didn't think the story was good and the gameplay was extremely boring.

The art and the world are pretty nice but there is not much to do. You can't interact with most of what you see, the puzzles aren't interesting at all... it's just a good looking walking simulator.

Most people say that it's a great game. Maybe I was not in the correct mood.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983256500', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1581733905}
review:
Perfect.. I'm really impressed with how this game managed to convey such a clear story without words..

My thoughts on this game (SPOILERS)
-
-
-
I think the "boy" was the father all along, and the entire journey symbolized his journey through the stages of grief. The reason he started out as the boy was because in his mind, he'd rather he had been the one to die in the accident instead of his son, which is why we see the seemingly misdirecting scene at the beginning: it was his denial that started this whole journey. The world is seemingly beautiful and perfect, but there is always that nagging feeling of wrongness, symbolized by the red hooded figure he is always chasing, but can never quite reach. Gradually, anger sets in and the world is a desolate, scorched land plagued by monsters. We also begin to see the dark creatures that symbolize depression and grief. The giant bird represents our psyche that actively tries to fight back and continue our state of denial but as we pull out the stops and let the grief run free (the smoke), this opposing force weakens until we are able to face the fact that something  bad has happened. In the bargaining stage, the dark creatures become hostile but the boy can seemingly fight back against them using the light orbs and the robots, and for a while it seems that the boy could win. That he could change the world back into the sunny place it used to be. But then we see the last of the robots sacrifice itself to open a door into more gloom and darkness, and you see the boy finally break down. The last stage is pretty obviously grief and depression. Instead of lighting torches, you proceed by extinguishing them. There is no light, and the dark creatures leave you be because you are clearly not a threat anymore. As the last of your hope dies (the fox), you stop feeling and become numb (stone). Life feels pointless, you've screamed so much you've lost your voice and you literally become a shadow of yourself. In the last stage, the boy fights to open up the flood gates and let the light back into the world, and finally the truth is revealed and relived. The "boy" walks towards the corridor and confronts himself (as the father). He chooses to accept his fate and leaps into the void. The father then gets up and goes to his son's room for the first time in a long time. All the locks the boy opened through out the game culminates in the final, physical act of unlocking the door into the room. Finally, he lets go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970573876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1581717177}

author: {'steamid': '76561198288212154', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1699843858}
review:
Wow.

For a person that doesn't play single player games at all, that's all I can say about this game, really. You have to play it to get the full experience. For a normal person playing it, it should take around 6 hours. The soundtrack and story are so amazing. There are a few puzzles that may [b] seem [/b] difficult, and if that happens, just step back and take a look around. Nothing is impossible.

One other review said that bugs don't exist in this game. I actually managed to softlock myself twice when I played it: once, I got stuck between a pillar and moving box, and was basically floating and couldn't move my character. I also managed to get into an area that I wasn't supposed to be in yet, and couldn't get out of. Both were just minor inconveniences that I was able to fix with loading up a previous save.

You want this game. Buy it. It's worth the money.

I cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999274592', 'num_games_owned': 1119, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1579343107}
review:
I've only played 3 hours so I'm not sure whether the game ever gets better but in all the time I've been playing this game is an ceaseless exercise in frustration. Every single bit of this game is frustrating except the audio. The graphics are stylised and quite beautiful but this might be one of the most unoptimised messes I've played. The game was released almost 3 years ago and is the one game that chugs on my 2070 SUPER and somehow maxes out my i5 6600. My machine is no monster but is definitely not underpowered and that it lags is unendingly infuriating. The puzzles are quite cute but are exceedingly simple and barely use any brain cells to solve. The world is fairly beautiful and large but there's hardly anything anywhere. It somehow compels you into exploring every nook and cranny but there's almost nothing of note beyond the linear stuff outside of some dumb collectibles. The kid is animated pretty well but the controls are horrendous and infinitely frustrating because there's something about it that makes it just a [i]tiny wee[/i] bit unresponsive somehow and that makes moving the kid so goddamn irritating. The camera while sometimes capturing grand vistas and some superb shots is occasionally so frustrating I felt like throwing the controller.

I'll push through for maybe the story but this isn't some mediocre puzzle game. It's bad in a lot of ways and it's a shame.

review:
[h1]RiME[/h1]
Ohne jegliche Erinnerung wachen wir als ein kleiner Junge an einem verlassenen Strand auf. Die Insel kann nach Belieben erkundet werden, doch um weiter zu kommen m√ºssen wir R√§tsel l√∂sen. 
Ein kleiner tierischer Helfer, den wir zu Beginn finden, hilft uns dabei auf dem rechten Weg zu bleiben. Neben ihm ist unsere Stimme alles was wir haben, um uns aus dieser Einsamkeit zu man√∂vrieren. 
Dabei taucht immer wieder eine Gestalt auf, die am Anfang unerreichbar zu sein scheint. Durch den Fortschritt der Story k√∂nnen die verschiedenen Schaupl√§tze auf uns wirken, welche durch eine sehr sch√∂ne Hintergrundmusik begleitet wird. 

[b]Fazit[/b] Die Storyline ist tiefgr√ºndig und gef√ºhlvoll. Zum Ende hin f√§ngt man nach und nach an zu verstehen was man hier durch den Jungen erlebt. Dieses in sich stimmige erlebte Abenteuer hat RiME f√ºr mich besonders gemacht.

+ Storyline
+ Grafik
+ Hintergrundmusik

Spielzeit 5h
