author: {'steamid': '76561197993548532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1580804571}
review:
I don't think this is a bad game, it's just I am [i]so not[/i] the intended audience for it, it's hard for me to tell. 

This game is for people with a strong affinity for visual art and story telling. Are you the kind of person who can decode the ending of The Sopranos, either by yourself or with a couple of hints? Do you love "Ways of Seeing" by John Berger? Then this game is probably for you. 

If, like me, you would never, ever in a million years have figured out what happened to Tony Soprano without that Master of Sopranos guy explaining it, or you tried to read "Ways of Seeing" and didn't understand WTF Berger was trying to explain and didn't particularly care; then this will probably just be another blah 3rd person platform puzzler. If you like that gaming genre, you might like it, but the controls feel sluggish and unresponsive. I get a strong "poorly optimised console port" vibe from it.  

Every 3D puzzle game I play now gets compared to [i]The Talos Principle, Portal[/i] and [i]Portal 2[/i]. Those games had a narrative, atmosphere, and/or carefully crafted mystery that inspired me to persevere with the tougher puzzles. The plot in [i]RiME[/i]... exists[1] as far as I can tell and that's about it. Again, this is probably because it is told purely visually, so I'm no doubt missing a lot.

The difficulty of the puzzles (at least as far as I got with it) lies exclusively in decoding the visual cues that explain the mechanics. Once you understand the mechanics that the visuals are trying to communicate, they are utterly trivial. Compare with [i]Talos[/i] or [i]Portal[/i], where the mechanics are explicit, but the logic is challenging. 

[i]The Talos Principle[/i] evoked an incredible, simultaneous combination of joy and melancholy. My emotional response to this game can be summed up as either "that's pretty" or "that's annoying." YMMV.

I did not enjoy this game.

[1] [b]SPOILERS[/b] [spoiler]My best guess at the plot is: you are a prince. You have been shipwrecked/orphaned/killed (not sure which). You must navigate the ruins of what may or may not have been your kingdom. You are not given much of a reason to do this beyond figuring out what happened to you. You have a pet fox. It is not much help. I got to the windmills level with the big bird. It is pretty obvious you have to activate the windmills to drive off the bird so you can use the golden ball to set the time of day, then stand on the pedestal so yours and the statue's shadows open the portal.[/spoiler] I didn't care enough to bother.

EDIT: Just read the plot summary in Wikipedia. Unless there is a step-by-step "this symbolises X", "that symbolises Y" reveal at the end, there is no way I would ever have guessed what this was about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198270949559', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1580774897}
review:
The game is effortlessly beautiful. The art direction is inspired, and the music is breathtaking. 

An artistic delight fans of games like journey or abzu would enjoy.

Spoilers for the ending

[spoiler] The true brilliance however, is in the games ending. Seldom does a games ending completely reframe the experience. It doesn't just reveal a characters motive, or change the context of what you're doing. It entirely changes the game in such a way that cant be undone, because once you beat the game, you cant unsee it. And the one time experience of that happening is beautifully done.  [/spoiler]

review:
A gorgeous little game! Beautiful settings, accompanied with a sleepy music, create an intense atmosphere. 
Even though the story basically seems to be limited in a typical and not too tough jump-and-run puzzle with a lot of partly deeply hidden collectibles, [spoiler] it hits its peak in a literally soulful and retrospective ending [/spoiler]. A pretty good deal for a dumping price.

[b]RIME[/b] to rewelacyjna gra przygodowa, jak r√≥wnie≈º to kolejna gra z cyklu ‚Äûartystycznej przygody‚Äù, gdzie naszym g≈Ç√≥wnym zadaniem bƒôdzie odkrywanie piƒôknego, lecz tajemniczego ≈õwiata gry, rozwiƒÖzywanie przer√≥≈ºnych logicznych zagadek i ≈Çamig≈Ç√≥wek by na samym ko≈Ñcu odkryƒá prawdƒô ‚Äì kt√≥ra u niejednego gracza wywo≈Ça silne emocje.

[i]Ma≈Ça dygresja:[/i]
Uczulam wszystkich, zw≈Çaszcza osoby kt√≥re uko≈Ñczy≈Çy powy≈ºszy tytu≈Ç, by nie zdradzali nikomu (zw≈Çaszcza zainteresowanych tym tytu≈Çem) zako≈Ñczenia samej gry, nie oglƒÖdajcie filmik√≥w w sieci, nie czytajcie poradnik√≥w do gry, bo stracicie wa≈ºny element ‚Äì po prostu nie, zaufajcie mi w tej kwestii, bo warto!

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]

Powy≈ºszy tytu≈Ç to jeden z tych gier w kt√≥ry powinien zagraƒá, a co najwa≈ºniejsze uko≈Ñczyƒá ka≈ºdy gracz, gra jest rewelacyjna na wielu p≈Çaszczyznach. A emocje jakie za tym idƒÖ sƒÖ nie do opisania, zw≈Çaszcza fina≈Ç (koniec) samej gry ‚Äì zapamiƒôtacie go na d≈Çugo, to wam gwarantujƒô.

Ale zacznijmy od poczƒÖtku, w samej grze wcielamy siƒô w postaƒá ma≈Çego ch≈Çopca, kt√≥ry budzi siƒô na tajemniczej wyspie ‚Äì jedynie co pamiƒôta to ≈ºe by≈Ç na morzu w czasie wielkiej burzy, nic poza tym.

Naszym zadaniem bƒôdzie, jak ju≈º nadmieni≈Çem na poczƒÖtku, eksploracja cudownego ≈õwiata gry ‚Äì wyspy na kt√≥rej wystƒôpujƒÖ dzikie zwierzƒôta, tajemnicze ruiny cywilizacji jak r√≥wnie≈º wielka wie≈ºa, kt√≥ra z niewiadomych powod√≥w przywo≈Çuje nas do siebie.

Tu zaczyna byƒá ciekawie, gra jest skonstruowana w ten spos√≥b by daƒá graczowi mo≈ºliwe maksimum swobody, nikt nas nie trzyma za rƒôkƒô, nie m√≥wi gdzie mamy i≈õƒá i dlaczego. To gracz ma odkryƒá tajemnicƒô, poznawaƒá uroki wyspy, zanurzyƒá siƒô w ten piƒôkny ≈õwiat, odszukaƒá w nim ukryte elementy ‚Äì lecz nie jednokrotnie by przej≈õƒá dalej, dotrzeƒá do upragnionego miejsca musimy ruszyƒá g≈ÇowƒÖ i pomy≈õleƒá.

Gra bazuje na zagadkach i ≈Çamig≈Ç√≥wkach rozsianych po ca≈Çej mapie, co dodaje uroku samej grze i pozwala siƒô wykazaƒá nie tylko zrƒôczno≈õciƒÖ gracza lecz r√≥wnie≈º logicznym my≈õleniem.

[h1]Dalej:[/h1]

Pod wzglƒôdem graficznym gra wyglƒÖda cudownie, nie jednokrotnie bƒôdziecie siƒô zatrzymywaƒá by podziwiaƒá uroki wyspy ‚Äì biorƒÖc pod uwagƒô up≈Çyw czasu jaki wystƒôpuje w grze, ca≈Çy cykl dzie≈Ñ / noc, to bƒôdzie co≈õ wspania≈Çego.

Muzyka r√≥wnie≈º nie odstaje daleko od grafiki, mi≈Ço pie≈õci nasze uszy, wprowadza gracza w rewelacyjny nastr√≥j, motywujƒÖcy by graƒá dalej ‚Äì klimat jaki przy tym siƒô tworzy jest nie do opisania.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198027752357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1580186141}
review:
I wish i could recomend this game but it is so badly optimized that it has constant stuttering and crash issues despite my system having a threadripper 1950x and a RTX2080ti.

I cant recomend this game if even after 3 years of being out it still has crash issues, i even tried playing it on a GTX 1080 to see if maybe an older card would help despire issues being reported on the 10 series and i still could not get the game to run properly.

I even got this game on sale at 3$ and i have to say even at 3$ this game isnt worth it for all the issues it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132644312', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1580090823}
review:
RIME √© um √≥timo t√≠tulo, adquiri em uma promo√ß√£o, acabei pagando R$5,00 e mais alguns centavos.
vendo algumas prints e videos de apresenta√ß√£o do game, j√° esperava que fosse um jogo simples e belo, com jogabilidade comum desse g√™nero... consegui completar o jogo sem me preocupar em platinar, degustando apenas a hist√≥ria do jogo em 3 Horas registradas na steam.

O Jogo:
No jogo voc√™ controla um garoto que acorda em uma ilha sem saber como chegou ali, ao longo do jogo alguns lapsos de mem√≥ria s√£o preenchidos com lembran√ßas de como ele chegou at√© l√°. o jogo √© bem intuitivo, mesmo ele n√£o te dizendo o que fazer n√£o √© muito dificil deduzir qual seu objetivo. Voc√™ ainda conta com a ajuda de uma raposa que serve de guia espiritual para o garoto. voc√™ progride resolvendo quebra cabe√ßas, desvendando segredos, escalando lugares dif√≠ceis, interage com objetos para influenciar os NPCs, etc.
O jogo te faz sentir um pouco de ang√∫stia com o desenrolar da trama, a trilha sonora √© envolvente e condiz com os sentimentos que o jogo quer que voc√™ sinta no momento certo... O jogo todo √© uma icognita pois voc√™ fica o tempo todo tentando entender o universo do mesmo, os motivos para tudo que est√° acontecendo e qual o sentido do personagem estar inserido nesse universo, voc√™ vai avan√ßando e entendo mais e ao mesmo tempo "desentendendo" mais, voc√™ cria teorias sobre a raz√£o de tudo aquilo e logo derruba suas teorias e cria outras... 

PR√ìS:
O jogo tem gr√°ficos bonitos e cartunizados, um capricho para jogos do g√™nero, a m√∫sica do jogo completa a obra de arte que √© este jogo. A trama me lembrou muito o jogo "Brothers", a jogabilidade nos momentos de escalada lembra um pouco o God of War do Playstation, a explora√ß√£o do cen√°rio lembra um pouco o novo Zelda. O jogo consegue se comunicar com o jogador sem utilizar nenhuma palavra ou texto.

Contras:
O jogo tem s√©rios problemas na jogabilidade , principalmente nos saltos, √© frustrante morrer diversas vezes por um erro que n√£o √© seu, o jogo simplesmente n√£o reconhece sua inten√ß√£o de pular de um ponto a outro de forma precisa. em alguns momentos foi poss√≠vel ver algumas texturas sumindo do cen√°rio e jogo travando me fazendo voltar at√© o ultimo checkpoint.

O jogo vale a pena, foi um entretenimento digno a mim e minha esposa que pode jogar comigo e auxiliar na resolu√ß√£o de alguns quebra-cabe√ßas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287862594', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1580163026}
review: Bom , o jogo tem uma aventura e uma trilha sonora muito boa , os puzzles s√£o bons e a narrativa √© um pouco complicada , visto que , n√≥s apenas possuimos as cutscenes e algumas imagens tanto em colecionaveis quanto no ambiente do jogo para raciocinar e interpretar ; De qualquer forma , este jogo √© lindissimo e vale muito a pena cada centavo .

author: {'steamid': '76561197985817956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1607250000}
review:
This game reminded me of ICO, so i thought i would give it a try, now i got it on sale for next to nothing but after playing it i would happily pay full price for it, i know my game time is low, but i have completed this artisticaly beautiful game, its well worth playing, 

From the beginning its so peaceful with the lush art style and the fantastic music (with help of Lindsey Sterling) it just puts you into a relaxed mood for playing, now the puzzles aren't rocket science but are still enjoyable to do and rewarding to complete, yes the game is short but very enjoyable, i would say its less a GAME and more an interactive story
SPOILER AHEAD!!!




The story as far as i can tell as there is no real confirmation is about losing someone you love very Dearly, this is kept quite quiet till the end of the game and then it hits you like a tonne of bricks!! but its brilliant, beautiful and artistic, if you're a fan of story telling emotional games like 'To the Moon' then i can highly recommend this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198157201361', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 795, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1579950092}
review:
I thought it was ok

it had nice music and visuals 
the puzzles were ok 
the story was ok

a few bad things I ran into
the climbing controls was pretty bad
the minimum specs for this game should be much higher than what they list because with a rx 480 4gb gpu on lowest settings I still consistently in any large area dropped to at least 40-50 fps
the camera constantly kept being taken out of your control which was super annoying
a few of the puzzles that they give you they don't introduce basic mechanics so how was I to know holding down a button will throw an object
edit: oh and also they have really bright areas and really dark areas that you can't see at all so I had to keep changing the brightness in the settings which was also annoying

author: {'steamid': '76561198043433431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1664053700}
review:
[h1] Fantastic Game [/h1]

This game is one of the few games i truly enjoyed! The scenes in this game is beyond beautiful.
It is the game i took the most screenshots off.

It is a exploration platformer and a relaxing game, the love and dedication of the dev's shows clearly.

If they can bring out more games like these, i will buy all of them :) 

No one will make a mistake of buying this game, this game is more worth in Enjoyment that you pay for it. 

A must buy if you just want to have something to play that is just "chilled"

author: {'steamid': '76561197969738101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1579920994}
review:
This is a great game. I cannot recommend this game enough--but before you buy, make sure it is the type of game you are into.

Rime has amazing atmosphere, soundtrack, story, art design, music, and vibe. It is a piece of art as much as it is a video game.

That said, before you buy you need to keep the following points in mind -
-Rime is a relatively short game at about 5-6 hours of gameplay.
-Puzzles and jump mechanics make up essentially the entire game. None of them are super challenging. 
-Please don't read anything about the game before playing! This game more than any other I have played is one where you want to go in fresh with no spoilers.
-Prepare to feel some serious feels.

Overall, this is a 9/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131816676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1579042613}
review:
Review: RIME

Despite the critics that this game received, I think it is a masterpiece and a model.

Games are not made only of one component anymore, a videogame is a complex opera like a movie. It is made of many things.

RIME is a perfect union of elements, that despite not being excellent taken singularly they create a perfect and wonderful mixture of emotions and feelings.

I would not exaggerate defining this game pure art. What I felt trying this game was wonder above anything else, like usually, only a child is able to feel. And once again Tequila works is able to prove how good it‚Äôs storytelling in its games.

I think this time I have really to thank you, thank you for making me play RIME.

It is for sure one of the best indie game of the decade!

https://instagram.com/error404game?igshid=12w5qhwyras6y

author: {'steamid': '76561198326802386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1579836533}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078886112', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1579081531}
review:
I played RiME just recently, a couple years after its release, and I wish that I had picked it up much sooner. RiME is a beautiful game. The landscapes and stunning visuals just ooze a one of a kind atmosphere, developing tonalities that play a part in the larger narrative. It has the capacity to be meditative and small, in moments just a wonder-filled story about a boy encountering a magical island steeped in myth, but also larger than life and compelling if you'll listen.

I've played exploration puzzler games for years, starting with the Myst games when I was a kid, and I have to say that if you're looking for a game to wow you with complexity and crushingly difficult puzzles, that isn't what RiME is about. The puzzles in RiME are a mechanism of the story-telling and while they are often surprising and always fun to interact with, they just don't have that kind of difficulty as an object. That said, if you're looking for a story told in long dialogues and filled with characters verbally developed, this is also not what RiME is about. Instead, RiME is an exercise in the kinds of stories that can be told beyond words, and it tricks you into loving every part of the world that they made along the way.

So please as you play this fantastic game (and you really should!) take it slowly. Explore. Be playful. Take time to experience the world and feel your way through this masterful piece of story-telling. Too many games today tell the same stories, packaged in the same way, or have nothing to say at all. RiME is a breath of fresh air, from a team of developers who took the time to craft something poignant and meaningful. 

Hope you enjoy it as much as I have!

author: {'steamid': '76561198220142285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1579387150}
review:
RiME est l'histoire d'un jeune gar√ßon qui parcourt plusieurs "mondes" dans un but particulier. Le jeu est particuli√®rement court, il m'a fallu √† peine 7h pour le sc√©nario principal, mais j'imagine que cela suffit pour raconter et vivre l'histoire que le jeu veut nous faire parvenir. Il y a plusieurs choses √† r√©cup√©rer au cours du jeu si vous souhaitez le compl√©ter √† 100% ce qui rajoute facultativement de la dur√©e de vie au jeu.

Du coup pour r√©sumer : 

+ Une belle histoire, je n'en dit pas plus pour ne pas spoil non plus le contenu.
+ La bande-son est superbe
+ La prise en main est simple et sans prise de t√™te avec le clavier, j'ai fait tout le jeu uniquement avec le clavier et la souris, √ßa ne m'a pos√© aucun soucis pour jouer, c'est plut√¥t intuitif contrairement √† certains jeux qui demande une certaine aisance avec les touches.

- Je trouve que le jeu ne vaut pas son prix (35‚Ç¨) pour ce qu'il propose, heureusement que j'ai d√©cid√© de le prendre pendant les soldes steam, la note est moins sal√©e. Autrement le jeu vaut le coup d'oeil tout de m√™me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049222066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1579377382}
review:
It was a weird, but beautiful and fun game; a cross between Shadow of the Colossus's gameplay plus some Zelda-like puzzles, Journey-esque music, visuals (though not photorealistic renders) like you'd get in a Cyan game like Uru or Obduction, and an ending that sucker-punched me right in the feels and left me crying but smiling.

The levels were imaginative and fun, with about the right length - not too short as to be trite but not too long as to get tedious and boring.  That was helped by the level design with short, varied puzzles/locations so that any one level didn't get too stale.

If you want a casual, beautiful game with a bewitching soundtrack to listen to and reasonably logical puzzles/mazes to explore then this is your game.

review:

It's simply wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!

It is as beautiful as Journey and as impactful as Brothers: A tale of two sons.

Just do yourself a favour and play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042520187', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1578220217}
review:
I signed up for the Ghibli-esque art style, music, and adorable fox; and I got onions. Thanks.

The only major complaint I have is that the story feels incredibly disjointed, for reasons I can't exactly get far into without possibly saying too much. But basically it's like it set itself up as one thing and then all of the sudden decides it wants to be something else entirely. Which tbf it does kind of makes sense why, but it's more like 2 stories (or 3-ish depending on interpretation) awkwardly stitched together than at least one cohesive one. And one of those stories is still left with holes and kind of confusing.

The puzzles aren't that difficult, but I did get stuck a few times because a gimmick would just add in a new mechanic and just...never bothered to tell you about it, it seemed. Or at the very least when I finally found the solution I just felt embarrassingly dumb rather than having a "hell yeah" moment.

It's another I would probably wait for a sale. Though it is pretty to look at and the music is amazing, it's one of those games that's less a game and more of an experience, even if it is an experience that might stick to some people for awhile. There's not a lot of replayability unless you just want to collect everything (Which you definitely should, to get the best ending. Though most of them can be so easily missed unless you know exactly where to look). If you like Team Ico, this will probably feel pretty close to home.

author: {'steamid': '76561198318250633', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1579498460}
review:
This game is beautiful in its entirety. The art/graphics, the soundtrack, the story line...
I really enjoy being able to play a game and actually enjoy the story without watching my health. There are loads of puzzles, and while there are definitely intense moments where you can "die", there isn't any perma death...well, actually, let's kind of use that loosely here. That being said, I wouldn't necessarily call the game easy.  
It took me about 6 hours to complete (this was one of the rare chances I was enthralled enough to entirely dedicate my time to finishing this game), and the ending allows everything to click into place. You really don't get the weight of the game unless you play it through. 

I give this game a solid 20/10, and tbh, while I wish I had played this sooner, I found it at a time in my life that was better for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060149962', 'num_games_owned': 2270, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1578099438}
review:
I've never seen a game blend the goods of a movie with the goods of a game so well as rime. It was a truly beautiful experience. The soundtrack has to be one of the best i've ever heard in a video game, it just fits so well.

A truly solid adventure game, with a great focus on a story that is told with visual storytelling.

The only downside in my opinion was that a few character emotions were displayed too heavily (in general i felt like the character model was a bit off at some points), and some cutscenes were over too fast and thus, felt rushed with the slow paced music.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995282543', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1553987113}
review:
It's been a long time since I played this game, but I enjoyed it.  On top of that, I found the mood and theme of the story very touching.  It's seldom that I recall a game with an emotional sense as with this one.

There are possible spoilers beyond this.

I actually thought I'd given a brief review before, but since I did not one reason for writing it now is because a few days ago I witnessed the funeral of a 13 year old boy (young man).  He developed an infection that rather quickly put him in the hospital.  Within a couple of days more he was comatose and died within a day after that, leaving his family and two sisters just before Christmas.

At some point during all of this maybe I noticed a trading card in my inventory, but for whatever reason I felt a strong connection between the "kid with fox" card and the loss of the local boy.  I think that some players perhaps were not satisfied by the amount of action in this game, and if so they may not have appreciated the weight of the last scenes.

Maybe I shouldn't make this game seem epic, but for me it certainly was far above average, and it can be purchased very cheaply at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988450317', 'num_games_owned': 868, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1577920749}
review:
Paid: ~$10 (USD)

I beat it but didn't feel good about it.  8.25 HEY!/AAH!'s out of 10.

There are many (44) collectibles in this game: toys, emblem fragments, outfits, keyholes, strange statues, white shades, and lullaby shells.

I progressively got worse at finding the collectibles as my patience dwindled and as the game became scarier.

As a result, I beat the game in under 6 hours (went AFK with the game open) with a lousy 11/31 achievements unlocked.

Pros
- Great performance (on an i7-9700K & RTX 2070 SUPER at least)
- Great soundtrack (just listen for the subtle changes as you progress)
- Great controls (used both mouse & keyboard and Xbox One controller)
- Visually appealing (solid use of the Unreal Engine)
- The journey, not the destination
- Ability to review all obtained collectibles and additional artwork from the Extras menu

Cons
- Learning the hard way that there were hostiles
- Being gated from the collectibles (accidentally progressing via critical cut scenes and adventuring beyond points of no return)
- Feeling like I did something wrong upon beating the game (probably because I didn't pick up on the story)

I think it would have helped to have known that this game - in general - is about [spoiler]the five stages of grief[/spoiler].

Granted, I only got 25% of the achievements, but that means I get to go through this again. Overall, it's a very good game, if very short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058484487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1577826864}
review:
After washing up on an island that contains ancient, beautiful ruins a young boy sets out on a journey to find out what happened to him. After a bit of exploring he comes upon a meadow where there are statues. In order to activate them he must follow the lights that shoot into the sky. To reach them he has must climb, jump and swim to their locations then activate them with his voice.  Once he returns to the meadow a fox is waiting to guide him further on his journey of discovery!
As the boy leaves the meadow he can find hidden paths and places that reveal objects that are part of his story.  He will find some of these are easy to get to while others require much more to reach. He will learn as he climbs, jumps  and swims his way through locations and puzzles the story unfolds revealing who he is and what happened to him. Though the boy may not find all the hidden items the first time through....he will find it's worth playing again to find them.

I highly recommend this game.  It is one that requires patience because it's not just a walk in the park type of game. It requires lots of exploring and figuring out how to reach areas and solve puzzles along the way. I have just completed my first play through and found I did not locate all the extra items that can be collected. I know it may take several play throughs to find them all but it will be worth it. The only thing I wish is that the game was broken down better in to chapters or episodes to make game exploring for the extras after completing the game the first time through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133589463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1577211435}
review:
I really wanted to enjoy Rime... It's a beautiful surreal world to be dropped into and at the beginning I wanted to explore every corner of it, especially when I discovered there are collectibles to find! But they gave the boy an ungainly movement style that made exploring feel sluggish and annoying to me. Every time you run and stop the boy wobbles and almost falls over, as though he is an uncoordinated toddler rather than... maybe eight, ten years old? When you jump down off anything he takes his time picking himself up. It's just too slow and constantly interrupts your gameplay. I didn't find most of the collectibles because it was too annoying to go looking for them. 

The puzzles were not very hard or very varied. I got 'stumped' for a few minutes at two or three of them. I'm not a hardcore puzzle gamer. 

I had to look up what the story was about after I finished the game, though I got an inkling of it in the last chapter. It still doesn't quite make sense to me. There's a few things that I'm not sure what they are supposed to represent or be symbolic of. I think it was a nice premise that maybe could have been done better. It would have helped to have more clues about what was going on earlier in the game. 

Also I thought the fox would be more useful (like you could have had to duo puzzles with him in some way?) but he just runs ahead to show you the way to the next puzzle and yaps at you when you're going the wrong way. I wanted a fox mute button by the end. :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198282629603', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1577364574}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993368913', 'num_games_owned': 2098, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1577317745}
review:
The game looks nice but the gameplay is simplistic to the point of being a walking simulator and the story is non-existant so far.

There are some very light platforming and some simple puzzles which at least puts it ahead of pure walking simulators. It is just not very interesting however and i quickly grew bored of it. If the game was shorter then perhaps it would have been fine but the game keeps on going even though it lost my interest a while ago.

All of this would perhaps be acceptable to some degree if the game had a gripping story but there is no story to speak of. Nothing is explained properly and you have no idea who you are, what is happening and why you are doing what you are doing. I am sure it is symbolic and blablabla but i don't care and no story reveal in the later part of the game will make up for the total absence of story in the first part of the game.

On sent quand m√™me que le jeu h√©site entre √™tre une grande ou une petite aventure : 5/6h pour le finir, c'est long pour un jeu avec que des enigmes, et c'est un peu trop court pour faire une grande histoire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193589490', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1560381585}
review:
[i]RiMe[/i] hat es wie kaum ein anderes Spiel geschafft, mich von Anfang an emotional komplett abzuholen. 
Auch wenn das Spiel heiter beginnt, merkt man doch schnell, dass hier etwas nicht ganz stimmt. Sp√§testens wenn die sehr abwechslungsreich gestalteten Level immer d√ºsterer werden und die gefundenen Schl√ºssell√∂cher immer weitere Teile der Geschichte mit ein paar Bildern, wie aus einem M√§rchenbuch, erz√§hlen, wei√ü man, dass dies keine einfache Reise wird. 

[i]RiMe[/i] kommt ganz ohne "richtige" Sprache aus und schafft es allein mit der zauberhaft sch√∂nen musikalischen Untermalung, die mir regelm√§√üig G√§nsehaut bereitet hat, und der ebenso atmosph√§rischen Visualisierung, die Handlung zu erz√§hlen, den Charakteren Leben einzuhauchen und vor allem, jede Menge Gef√ºhle hervorzurufen. Auch die Spielewelt, wirkt trotz des cartoonartigen Grafikstils, mit der Hilfe der vielen und perfekt eingesetzten Soundeffekte, realistisch.

Springen, Klettern, Tauchen, dies ist eigentlich so gar nichts f√ºr mich und auch wenn ich nur selten den Xbox-Controller in die Hand nehme, war die Steuerung einfach zu lernen. Aber selbst wenn der ein oder andere Sprung nicht gleich sitzen sollte, gibt es kein "Game Over", sondern man bekommt einfach einen weiteren Versuch, was das Spiel sehr frei von Frustmomenten macht. Auch die R√§tsel haben einen angenehmen Schwierigkeitsgrad und bestehen meistens aus Schiebe- und Lichtr√§tseln, die ganz ohne Zeitlimit funktionieren. So kann man auch mittendrin innehalten und sich an der minimalistischen aber dennoch detaillierten Umgebung erfreuen oder einfach nur der Hintergrundmusik lauschen und dies ganz ohne das Gef√ºhl zu haben, das Spiel zu unterbrechen oder aus dem Flow zu bringen.

Ich hatte nicht eine Minute das Gef√ºhl, dass [i]RiMe[/i] k√ºnstlich gestreckt oder das Tempo zu schnell wurde. Einfach eine sehr ausgeglichene Spielerfahrung. Nur vor jedem, der insgesamt 5 Level, gibt es einen Ladebildschirm, der aber nicht lange dauert und von einer Cutscene abgel√∂st wird, welche uns dann wieder in die neue Umgebung entl√§sst. 

Gek√§mpft wird √ºbrigens in der kompletten Spielzeit nie und unsere zwei treuen Begleiter helfen uns, nicht den roten Faden zu verlieren, wenn wir auf Entdeckungstour gegangen sind. Denn [i]RiMe[/i] schafft es wirklich das Gef√ºhl zu vermitteln, als Kind die Welt zu erkunden und die Level laden gerade dazu ein, den Hauptweg zu verlassen.

Die Sammelgegenst√§nde sind zwar optional, aber um die ganze Handlung in den Leveln mitzubekommen und das vollst√§ndige Ende zusehen, braucht man sie. Diese kann man nach Abschlie√üen des Spiels aber in der Levelauswahl im Men√º leicht nachholen. Dort gibt es auch eine umfassende Galerie der Artworks, des Soundtracks, der Sammelgegest√§nde und der unterschiedlichen Skins des Protagonisten.

Die von anderen Reviewern beschriebenen Performance-Probleme gab es bei mir nie. Lediglich die Kameraeinstellung hat ab und an mal Schwierigkeiten bereitet.

[u]Kaufempfehlung[/u]: Im Sale f√ºr 5,59‚Ç¨

author: {'steamid': '76561197972337172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1576753036}
review:
RiME (pronounced like rhyme) is a game that was created because some dude decided he would try to impress his date and swam out into the sea with her towards a buoy off the coast of Spain.

True story.

He realized he had went past his limits but kept on going since he thought he could just rest while hanging onto the buoy. But this turned out to be wrong as the buoy was really slippery and it was a struggle to hang onto. He told the girl he was too tired to get back to land safely and she basically just said 'ciao' and ditched him. He struggled back to shore only to fail and he began to drown. As his life flashed before his eyes, he came up with the idea for RiME.

Fortunately, someone saw him, and saved him at the last moment. Then he married the girl who ditched him, and turned RiME into reality. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

author: {'steamid': '76561198067650120', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1576181721}
review:
This game is visually beautiful, and has a very good soundtrack, and for those reasons alone I'd recommend you get it when it goes on sale. 

However, the gameplay and story fall flat for me. The puzzles are shallow and reminiscent of every other puzzle game in existence (moving boxes, basic platforming, borrowing Journey's voice mechanic, etc.). Because of the lack of dialogue, the story is entirely told through occasional cinematics and environmental storytelling. Unfortunately, these things aren't executed as well as in many other games that use them, and for the majority of the game you're left guessing at what's really going on. I came up with my own interpretation of the story based off of the scraps of information the game provided, and was unsatisfied when the full story was essentially packed into the last 5 minutes and clashed with what I thought was going on. Even after the game was finished, I had to look up the synopsis of the game to answer the question: "What happened?" Even understanding now what the game is about, there are certain elements that are still confusing. 

[spoiler] This game is meant to represent the 5 stages of a father's grief over his son. Okay, cool concept. But there's just not enough concrete storytelling to have everything in the game make sense with this. What do the robots in the green temple area represent? What do they have to do with grief? Are the shadow people just grief personified, or are they something else? Sure, the monster bird thing probably represents anger, so what do the windmills represent? What does the storm in the windmill area represent? Why is the kid's voice his source of magic, besides to copy Journey? This game feels like it was supposed to be something besides an allegory for grief, but maybe that's just me. [/spoiler]

On the whole, this game was beautiful, but disappointing. I just wish this game was something slightly different.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035334990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1576261908}

review: This game was actually fantastic! You work your way through this game solving puzzles to progress. Seeking out Hidden treasures along the way. The further in the game you progress the more involved you get in it. For a game with no real dialogue I was highly impressed. Not a particularly long game maybe  8 -14 hours depending how hard you go at it and how many secret treasures you want to find.  When you finish the game you will have some emotions that you are not sure about to be sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031276759', 'num_games_owned': 540, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1576014411}
review: This game is beautiful. The art, the music, the theme, everything. It's not a long game (it took me 5 hours, with some of that time idling in the menu), and it's not difficult. I barely had to think as I played it, but it was still worth playing just for the ride. There is a section in the middle with a giant bird, and another with some creepy ghost things that marred the peaceful tone of the game for me, but I get why they were there. Overall it's a gem.

review: RiME is a fascinating journey of beauty and sorrow. Its soundtrack blends perfectly with its surreal landscapes. There is a sense of calm through most of the game but even in the early stages you'll feel a nagging sense of unease.  The puzzles aren't overly complicated but they give you time to think about your surroundings and start to piece together the context of the story. If you love exploration and discovery this game will reward you for your time. Take it all in. There is so much to see and experience here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198876299604', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1575869128}
review:
[H1]Amazing! Enjoyed every moment. Reminiscent of [I]Ico[/I].[/H1]

RiME is a delightful three-dimensional platformer sprinkled with symbolism that soup√ßon deeper, more emotional meanings. Gameplay is straightforward and casual with no expositions or character dialogues that detracts from the story, but still conveying it perfectly. (Please don't ruin the experience by looking up spoilers.) Audio accompaniment is well-suited; albeit, not as dynamic as one would hope for. In addition, there were no timed events, inventory management, or other annoyances; thus, one can really take in the world around the main character. Despite this and the apparent care put into the game, the game is simply overpriced on Steam; get it on sale.

[H1]At-a-Glance (5-pt Scale)[/H1]
[List][*]Fun Factor / Gameplay: 4
[*]Story: 3.5
[*]Visuals: 4
[*]Audio: 4
[*]Personal Tilt (¬±1): +1[/List]

author: {'steamid': '76561198420850899', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1575430032}
review: I thought I would like this game because it seemed similar to Journey. I didn't play a lot, but it's because I can't play more than that. Even if the graphics and the music are beautiful, this game is that boring. With Journey, I had no problem with exploring, but in this one, I just couldn't figure out where I was going. I really wasn't that interested in the story. Plus, the frame rate is bad and annoying. Really a disapointment for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996248677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1574916920}
review:
The first chapter is smaller than it looks. Explore, and get used to the controls.

The second chapter is nerve-wracking, and longer than you fear. If you're stuck, consider your surroundings more carefully before venturing into the sunlight.

The rest... get ready to start getting angry at a game for making you feel things. It will wind up its punch, and aim it straight at your gut.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996719470', 'num_games_owned': 1325, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1574570756}
review: A perfectly great puzzle platformer with plenty of collectables to find via exploration. Aesthetically pleasing, not too long and a perfect game to introduce someone to the genre with as the puzzles aren't very difficult, but it manages to evoke a lot of emotions with its wordless story told throughout the game. See if you can pick it up for under $10, I think it's worth ~$20 at most, Fanatical has it in bundles now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977293332', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1574031150}
review:
Throughout their continuing history, video games have defined and redefined what it is to be a video game: confounding puzzles, horrific experiences, cinematic journeys, thoughtful meditations, everything in-between, and every combination of the aforementioned. There is one quality that all video games endeavor to share, though: that they are entertaining, that they are fun. Lamentably, and as much as this reviewer wishes it were not the case, [i]RiME[/i] just does not deliver on that front, despite being created with so much apparent care.

[i]RiME[/i] sees you filling the sandals of a young boy shipwrecked on a mysterious island populated by ancient ruins, curious statuettes, a delightful red fox, and plenty of mysteries. Throughout your time on the island, you'll look to discover who you are and how you managed to end up here in the first place. Your journey will take you through a variety of beautiful locales, dizzying heights, and treacherous lows, all of which have been beautifully (and stylishly) realized with Unreal Engine 4. All the while you're accompanied by a haunting and lovely soundtrack. It's these qualities that make it so unfortunate that [i]RiME's[/i] gameplay is such a woeful slog.

Rest assured, it's not the lack of combat or the heavy focus on exploration that make the gameplay drag so. In truth, at the outset of the game there was hardly any notice of a drag at all. As [i]RiME[/i] proceeds, though, the block-pushing, climbing, and even the decidedly clever puzzle elements that are introduced early-on begin to wear thin. Bear in mind, this is not something that would make or break a game. It's the fact that on top of this, the simple act of movement in [i]RiME[/i] starts to become an irritation. It began to feel like every action made by our curious hero was mired in some way: his running [i]just[/i] too slow, his climbing [i]just[/i] too sluggish, the cooldown on his interactions [i]just[/i] too long. This even lead to a moment of shouting, "Move faster!" at our hero. At this time, the very game itself had become a draining experience and it was the curiosity about its story alone that kept me pushing onward to the end.

That being said, [i]RiME's[/i] ending is touching and heartfelt in a way that was unexpected...but getting there had felt like such a chore that the impact was lessened. I was shocked to find it had only taken around 4 hours to complete when it legitimately felt like it had taken five times longer. This is all written with a pang of regret: [i]RiME[/i] has so much good about it but moving around its world is simply not fun and the player spends most of the game doing it. I feel that the best way to express this is to point to Giant Squid's [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/384190/ABZU/]ABZU[/url], which has no combat, is only about exploration, but is an absolute joy to move around in.

There are so many things to appreciate about [i]RiME[/i] but it just was not enjoyable to [i]play[/i]. On top of this, the price of entry (at time of writing: $29.99) is far too steep a price for what [i]RiME[/i] brings to the table. All of this being said, I simply cannot recommend [i]RiME[/i]. As beautiful as it may be, as lovely as its soundtrack, its fatal flaw prevents it from being something that all games should aspire to be: fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065525173', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1574383100}
review:
WOW ! La grosse claque !

Via les reviews Steam, je savais que le jeu √©tait triste. Mais vraiment... c'est la premi√®re fois que je me prends une telle claque √©motionnelle en jouant √† un jeu. J'ai ador√©.

[i]Points positifs[/i] :

- Le jeu est tr√®s beau.
- Les d√©cors sont vari√©s et grands.
- L'histoire est tr√®s jolie et surprenante.
- Les temps de chargement sont peu pr√©sent.
- La possibilit√© de rejouer le chapitre de notre choix √† la fin du jeu. Parfait pour viser le 100% succ√®s.

[i]Points n√©gatifs[/i] :

- L√©ger probl√®mes de maniabilit√© lorsqu'on joue au clavier/souris. 
Finalement j'ai termin√© le jeu avec le pad de la 360. Et je n'ai plus eu de probl√®me.

- Le coup du "au pixel-pr√®s". Pour raviver les flammes des braseros, il faudra parfois se mettre au pixel pr√™t et dans le bon angle c'est un peu chiant.

- Peu de diversit√© dans les √©nigmes qui sont d'ailleurs un peu simple.

Mis √† part le probl√®me de maniabilit√© (esquiv√© avec le pad) les autres points n√©gatifs ne sont pas handicapant. Je trouve juste un petit un peu dommage qu'il n'y ai pas d'√©nigme un peu plus complexe. 

Autrement le jeu est vraiment pure et beau. L'histoire est √† faire chialer un mort.
Je me suis laiss√© emport√© par le petit renard qui nous guide dans le jeu avec grand plaisir. Je vais suivre les prochaines cr√©ation des la Team Tequila :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198353198148', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1573930124}
review: I enjoyed Rime. It felt like returning to Ico but with Windwaker Graphics. I have a full AMD setup and this game would crash my pc super hard and was not playable for more than 10min at a time. I ended up playing it on my partner's Nvidia-based PC. Very linear, but I expect that with many "games as art" titles. I felt engaged until the last level, which was very different that all the previous both in gameplay style and tone. Didn't realize there were collectibles until at least halfway through. Would recooment though if you like short, indie story games.

review: RIme has some awesome music and scenery but It's not a must-play game.. And even gives some good feels. This game is more for those looking for casual, atmospheric, story and light puzzles. I played this game after a heavy game to unwind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123973041', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1573100046}
review: Rime is definitely  the most creative game I've ever come across and the meaning is as heartbreaking as it is empowering! It starts very mundane  and  casual but it is all a smoke screen for what you are about to endure and boy is it exciting! The world building is the best I've seen to date and this game is a testament that stylized graphics can equally compete and hold their own against their photo realistic counterparts. The Puzzles here are outstanding and follow a single solid line of thought from beginning to end so as soon as you get a feel of how the game thinks all the challenges will become a breeze. But the game is not about the puzzles, it is a journey to the depth's of one's soul. The game is an epic poem filled with emotions that will completely consume you and transform you. It is an absolute masterpiece that will leave a permanent imprint on your mind, heart and soul. Similar game that comes to mind is Submerged and if you haven't played it you should. The movie Tree of Life by Terrence Malick is very much like Rime and the song Painted On My Heart by the band The Cult says it all. I would be very happy if my review convinces someone else to play the game, I am  paying my experience forward by telling you about it. I am proud to say that I am a completely independent person who is not in any shape or form influenced by any means to post positive reviews for this or any game. I am the average Joe who enjoys playing video games and in my opinion Rime is an Experience that can not be missed. Thank you for reading my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004781997', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1545519299}
review: Okay, hands-down, one of the best games I've played all year has been RiME. The world is breathtaking and immersive, and the game has a very minimalistic aproch to guidance and story (lack of dialogue, etc.), which only seems to immerse you more, as you get invested in the curiosities of this world. The puzzles are great, with lots of use of the 3D world and terrain. ... I really wish there were more games like this.

review:
Im Grunde genommen eine sehr gute Geschichte malerisch erz√§hlt.
Das Problem an dem Spiel ist ganz einfach, dass es wesentlich k√ºrzer sein k√∂nnte und besser programmiert.
Einige Stellen wirken unglaublich langatmig. Die R√§tsel sind die meiste Zeit zwar sehr gut aber irgendwie ist es h√§ufig nur eine Besch√§ftigungstherapie.
Ich mag R√§tselspiele aber so richtig wie ein R√§tselspiel hat es sich dann auch nicht angef√ºhlt.
Blackwood Crossing erz√§hlt meiner Meinung nach eine √§hnliche Geschichte... aber viel besser auf dem Punkt.
Rime lebt unglaublich von Atmosph√§re, die sie auch teilweise sehr gut und malerisch r√ºberbringt... wenn es auf der anderen Seite nicht so langatmig w√§re.

Ich empfehle das Spiel... aber nicht √ºber 5 Euro, weil es einfach daf√ºr teils "unfaire" als auch unn√∂tige Passage hat f√ºr eine gute "sch√∂n traurige" Geschichte

review:
Sorpresa may√∫scula. Aventura sencilla y tremendamente conmovedora cuya finalidad es m√°s narrativa y audiovisual que puramente jugable. La jugabilidad se basa solo en resolver peque√±os puzles bastante sencillos en su mayoria.

Para m√≠ lo mejor del juego es la historia, la cual se entiende en la parte final del juego y es realmente emotiva. Audiovisualmente de 10, el juego es realmente bonito y la banda sonora preciosa.

Lo peor es que el framerate es algo irregular en algunas zonas y que hay un par de situaciones que se repiten o se alargan en exceso en mi opini√≥n, pero poco m√°s.

En definitiva, un juego perfecto para relajarse y que es capaz incluso de emocionar. Recomendable para quien busque una experiencia de este tipo. Particularmente disfruto mucho de jugar este tipo de propuestas de vez en cuando, y m√°s cuando son de la calidad de este.

Os puzzles s√£o interessantes, mas nada desafiadores. √â poss√≠vel terminar o jogo em menos de 4h se for direto aos objetivos, mas h√° bastante espa√ßo para quem gosta de explorar cada detalhe dos mapas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043728918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1572333011}
review:
The problem with RiME is that it feels more like a tech demo for Unreal Engine 4 rather than anything substantive. It's certainly not a bad game; a positive of being so simplistic, but visually competent, is that there is nothing fundamentally flawed in the underlying structure. But it's not a game I can say I will remember or recommend people spend the time playing if they can play anything else.

Technically RiME looks fantastic, and will really work your PC if it doesn't have the most recent of cards. Your graphical options are fairly minimal, and even on max settings you aren't missing out on a lot from there to low settings and SSAO aliasing off. Regardless you get the visual equivalent of a water-painting, and even if you didn't have any choices with graphical fidelity the game would still stand on its own due to the good work underneath it. Ironically I can't say that this game blasts, say, Windwaker out of the water, but that's more a testament to how cel-shading endures the passage of time.

Typically I don't talk about 'graphics' in my reviews, and this next section should explain why.

RiME is a competent, albeit shallow experience. The game is a puzzle platformer, with you travelling 5 somewhat open but fairly linear areas. I'll give the developers a pat on the back for making this feel like an open-world game whilst not being one-that takes a bit of map design skill. The game mechanics focus on either pulling on objects, grabbing ledges, activating mechanisms, or rolling spheres to change shadow trajectories. There is no additional equipment to collect, which means that you never feel like you shouldn't be in an area, as every puzzle can be solved upon encounter.

With minimal narrative tools, the game really should be applauded over its ability to give no information whilst not leaving the player in the dark. Part of the fun is figuring out just what is expected of you, and perhaps as an outgrowth of its simplicity it's never too complex.

There is a story here, and a lack of narrative doesn't necessarily [i]hurt[/i] the game...but it also doesn't [i]aid[/i] it either. See, there's a twist at the end of sorts, but it's less impactful when its the only piece of information that makes any sense. In the end there wasn't much of a story to begin with. I can explain it in a sentence but it would spoil the whole thing. Just as shallow as everything else, the story is a lot of fluff until the reveal.

RiME's development history was tumultuous, and in the transition from an open-world tower defense/survival game the developers likely stripped everything to basics to get a finished product. It's a fine product, but a thoroughly unforgettable one that was perhaps too stripped down to amount to anything memorable. It will get praise by the "artistic" gamers in the crowd, but I can't find any solid merit to recommend this over anything else on the market. 

4/10: Below Average

Muzyka przygrywajƒÖca w tle bardzo pasuje do tego klimatu i potƒôguje go. Sterowanie postaciƒÖ jest wygodne, a eksploracja sprawia przyjemno≈õƒá. author: {'steamid': '76561198017003179', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1571448505}
review: Wonderful visuals, story, and music. Exploring the world is very nice, especially not having to worry about combat (game has none). Puzzles can be repetitive and some parts are kinda slow though. But if you can get to the ending, you may end up loving the game a lot and leave you thinking about it for a while to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046147646', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1599419418}
review:
I recommend this to everyone. Absolutely everyone.
A 10/10 game, no glitches, beautiful story, challenging and inventive puzzles and nice collectibles. Solving the puzzles gives constant rewarding feels, and the game looks absolutely breathtaking (even with a stylized look!).

As for my recommendations:
- Take the time to play this. Make sure you have a few days close to each other, because you want to keep this story fresh in your mind. 
- DO NOT look anything up about the game. Seriously, I mean it. Just press play and do not look at anything else besides the settings. This will allow you to self-discover the story, and I promise you, you do not want to know beforehand.
- Explore. Explore everything and everywhere and you will be rewarded with background story and just general feels.
- "yell" at everything.

Cons: 
One of the chapters (bird) has a large, open map that is very easy to get lost in. Otherwise, the game leads you on very well, but this chapter is simply not linear and got me frustrated. I spent a long time running back and forth trying to find the next place to go. Ugh. I have seen many a streamer struggle with the same issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987143801', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1691876601}
review: Rime is melancholy adventure of alone wanderer young boy who has to solve a variety of environmental puzzles to complete tasks. The world of the Rime is so beautiful that you will never get tired of looking at. I must say this is one of the most beautiful games I have ever played in my life, but the ending really got to me and I finished the game with tears on my face :(( One day, I would love to play it again and find all the collectibles I missed. And I know for sure, I will cry again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016429897', 'num_games_owned': 827, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1571211250}
review:
10/10.

Rime pulls you in with charm and adventure, like Uncharted but filled with childish fantasy.
The story slowly is chipped away and you realize what is going on, it's not what it seems.

Have a tissue box handy, it's going to get wet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024972696', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1571270137}
review:
[h1]Overall[/h1]
If I could give "RiME" a so-so rating, I'd do it.  Since I'm not all that enamored of it, I really don't think it's worthy of a Thumbs Up and I feel bad about giving it a Thumbs Down.  But, since there are plenty of positive reviews here, I guess I'll go the negative route and Not Recommend it.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
Aesthetically, "RiME" is a beautiful game both visually and aurally.  It's got a good, solid theme.  And, mechanistically, my only gripe is that the game tends to grab and reorient the camera for its own purposes instead of leaving it where it belongs for mine.  

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
Unfortunately, there are several big faults with it:
[list]
[*]The story is very weak, and, when you get down to it, what the story has you doing really has no logical connection to the end result.
[*]You don't even get an inkling of the story until you've completed the vast majority of the game.  Coupled with that, or perhaps because of that, you play the game without having any idea of what you're supposed to be doing or accomplishing (or even why you should be doing it).  I spent much of the game wondering if I was letting some vast, old evil loose into the world.  After all, someone locked all this stuff up for some reason, didn't they?
[*]Outside of aesthetics, the game doesn't know what it wants to be.  Is it a platformer, puzzle, adventure, or exploration game?  Well, yes and no to each of them.  There's platforming, but it's fairly pointless and easy (it works out to a search for guano since that marks places where you can climb).  There are puzzles, but they're all trivial.  The adventure aspect is marred by your having no idea what your goal is or why you're doing the things the game wants you to do.  And, exploration is scarred by the game locking paths behind you for no reason and having no way to go back since it's a checkpoint game.
[*]The game introduces some kind of "shadow people," gives no explanation for them or what you're supposed to do with them.  Heck, in most places they're entirely passive (basically, landscape).  But, in one area, they attack you for no reason.
[*]At the same point where the game introduces those shadow people, it starts putting sand statues of people in.  Again, with no explanation or apparent use.
[*]And, finally (and I have to be vague here because of spoilers), in one stage of the game, it uses a very silly thing as a key to a lock.
[/list]
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
It took me 8.6 hours to "finish" the game with only 13 out of 31 Achievements (41%) complete.  Aesthetically, I'm pleased with the game.  But, gameplay-wise, I'm not happy with it.  Also, at its current list price of almost $30, it's certainly not worth it.  Normally, I 100% all Achievements.  But, since I'm not all that happy with the game, I'm not sure if I'll be going back to complete them.  But, even if I do, I highly doubt they would add enough to the game to make it worth that price.  So, even though I'm mostly on the edge with the game, I'm Not Recommending it.

EDIT:  I went back through the entire game with an Achievement walkthrough just to get those Achievements I'd missed.  It took me another 6.9 hours to do so (totaling 15.5 hours for 100% Achievements).

author: {'steamid': '76561197999134652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2037, 'last_played': 1570926568}
review:
WONderful game.  It's original Tomb Raider without the sh#tty combat, Ghibli without anime, has an absolutely [i]beautiful[/i] score and a subtle dose of and/or nod to (if you're old enough to remember) the original side scrolling Prince of Persia.

The fox annoys me with its inCESsant barking when I'd rather explore than go and see wt[b]F[/b] he's banging on about however he's rarely about, and I loved him in the end.

Yes, I gender assumed the fox.


___________________


80 out of a 100 chocolate starfish.

Though I want to say that I enjoy this game and truth is no. I've already experienced much dizzy once playing the game for 10 minutes. I tried graphic modification and windowed mode and it's still not work for me.
There are many collectable items and technical achievements on the road. review:

A hist√≥ria tem uma aura de mist√©rio e a narrativa √© constru√≠da conforme voc√™ avan√ßa e vai decifrando o enigma do garotinho n√°ufrago que foi parar em uma ilha aparentemente deserta. author: {'steamid': '76561198000900287', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1694484325}
review:
Bom tenho que come√ßar dizendo que RiME n√£o √© um jogo para todo mundo. √â um jogo que deve ser jogado com paci√™ncia e absorvido com muita sensibilidade. Tendo isso removido do caminho, vamos aos pontos.
- Voc√™ joga com uma crian√ßa que desperta na costa desse mundo lindo e enigm√°tico. Logo se percebe que se est√° numa jornada m√°gica onde o fim realmente n√£o importa, mas tudo o que se aprende durante a jornada √© que conta.
- Os gr√°ficos s√£o minimalistas mas de muito bom gosto, feitos com bastante carinho e pensados para transmitir essa leveza e beleza conforme voc√™ avan√ßa nos mundos.
- Os controles s√£o bem simples e f√°ceis de dominar. O jogo √© praticamente um sandbox com trechos de plataforma e muita explora√ß√£o e alguns puzzles simples, mas deliciosos de resolver. Por diversas vezes a mec√¢nica me remeteu aos Prince of Persia do PS2. Dentro desse mundo bem desenhado, existem colecion√°veis que o ajudam a entender os motivos da jornada, mas n√£o o preparam nem um pouco para o final.
- A cada novo cen√°rio, o jogo te atinge com uma bela trilha sonora que , ao meu ver, foi meticulosamente composta para estimular uma grande variedades de emo√ß√µes. A cada acontecimento, descoberta ou avan√ßo, o jogo te atinge com uma combina√ß√£o de acordes que fazem o cora√ß√£o palpitar, tudo para construir e manter essa atmosfera leve de descobrimento.
- A hist√≥ria n√£o √© muito complexa e √© estimulada pela simples curiosidade de entender o que est√° se passando e qual ser√° o pr√≥ximo cen√°rio com o qual voc√™ ser√° presenteado. E aqui vem um ponto importante.
- Voc√ä consegue ter uma no√ß√£o do que aconteceu ao procurar por pequenas fechaduras. Elas prov√©m um pano de fundo para a pergunta "por qu√™ ele foi at√© a√≠?", mas a resposta para o "por qu√™ ele est√° a√≠" s√≥ vem bem no final e, se voc√™ for como eu, √© melhor est√° munido de len√ßos, pois para mim, conter a emo√ß√£o foi muito dif√≠cil.
- Em suma, √© um jogo simples, lento e projetado para, al√©m de contar uma hist√≥ria, lidar diretamente com as emo√ß√µes do jogador e ser uma experi√™ncia  de sensibilidade. E isso por si s√≥ j√° basta para convenc√™-lo de que esse √© um grande jogo. Uma obra de arte interativa.
10/10 na escala Leoman√≠aca e recomendado para todos que buscam profundidade e emo√ß√£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992689577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1672485303}
review:
I recommend this game because the experience you can have is beautiful and great. I must say however, that I didn't have such an experience. The game didn't feel very optimized, which partially ruined the experience for me. Besides that, the walking speed of the character is relatively slow. Usually I'm fine with this, but as you have to walk long distances regularly, it can kind of feel like a nuisance. I even lost interest in the game and didn't finish it for a while. I first thought this was an experience exclusively to me but it seems that other people found the game boring as well.

Otherwise the game looks good and has an interesting story. Though it does feel a little overhyped and definitely overpriced as the game is relatively short for it's price tag. The game is worth a cop but only on a good sale, the game is *not* worth it full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013874263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1555773222}
review:
This game is short and beautiful. If you enjoy meandering around picturesque landscapes solving not-particularly-taxing puzzles, and getting a bit of atmosphere and narrative thrown in, then you'll enjoy this game. I did prefer the first half more than the latter, but the story definitely comes into focus in the later areas.

Great art style, tight controls and good length - perfect for turning up the sound system or headphones, sitting back with a controller and being taken on a journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111663418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1568917289}
review:
I cant recommend this game enough. Probably not for everyone but its story is definitely worth it. Most of the game was relaxing and the parts that weren't were gripping and exciting to experience. The exploration is fun and easy to lose yourself in, and the mechanics feel unique and give the game character. Plus the soundtrack adds to the atmosphere very well.

The only problems were the controls based around the climbing in the game which felt like I was fighting the camera, but you can get used to it and by the end I figured it out and it wasn't a problem any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145029070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1568892213}
review:
RiME is a Puzzle/Plattformer game and an adventure in a beautiful world. The game is kind of open world and mostly relaxing. It has a line path to the story but you can explore any areas around. 
This game is more about story than gameplay, players who want complex and challenging puzzle games will probably not be satisfied here. 

[u] Story [/u]

Rime starts with a little boy being washed ashore on a mysterious island. There are many ruins and a huge tower in its center. When the boy, with a spiritual guide, a fox, explores the island, he encounters several times a mysterious man in a red cloak, whom he can never reach. 
[spoiler]As the boy climbs the big tower, the first level ends and he comes to the four other levels of play. It becomes clear, that the individual game levels represents each of the five stages of mourning and dying after Elisabeth K√ºbler-Ross:

Deny
Fury
Negotiate
Depression
Acceptance [/spoiler]
One wonders what we are doing here, why we are here and what our goal is. Gradually, we get to know the "before",  but at the end, there is a (surprising) disclosure, that reveals a much bigger picture of the storyline.
[spoiler] The feels man...[/spoiler]

[u]Graphics [/u]

I really really really enjoyed the grafics (took screenshots every 5 mins lol).
They create a magical world that changes more and more as the game progresses. Each section has its own well-rounded atmosphere.

[u] Music [/u]

The music is beautiful and creates the atmosphere of the game sections combined with the visual aspect.

[u] Overall / Achievements [/u]

If you only focus on the Storyline, you will probably get through the game in 6-7 hours. But you will miss a big part of the RiME-world. Most of the Achievements are collectibles, for which you have to explore and experiment a lot. Some of them are easy(er) to find, for others I needed a guide, because they were really hidden or you had to do some extra rounds. With that part of exploring, it doubles or triples the play time. Overall ,it is really fun to do them, mostly because there is so much so see and do, but some Achievements are a pain in the Ass [spoiler] "Hold your breath" had cost me all my nerves lol [/spoiler] 

I really liked it and enjoyed it very much. It was just the right mix between relaxation and excitement (even if the story at the beginning is confusing. Keyholes may help a little -. IF you can find them)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983369798', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1616337129}
review:
Don't let this game trick you by it's vibrant and beautiful graphics. 
I have never ever played such boring adventure game, it actually feels like demo with unfinished gameplay mechanics, the game really lacks something exciting to keep you playing.
It was a real challenge to complete slow and tiresome underwater levels, overcome buggy puzzles with lights and shadows, and to pass through black phantoms/demons. These parts are not challenging or intriguing a player with something new, the whole game brings nothing but a boredome. 
Don't even want to waste time finishing it as the story is not catchy at all. Disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015363486', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1556723833}
review: more like grime

author: {'steamid': '76561198133119160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1568802775}
review:
tl;dr ONLY A FEW HOURS MAX OF CONTENT, BUY ON SALE, STORY BASED GAME WITH LIGHT PUZZLE SOLVING. There is no "action" per se. If you don't want to lay back and relax with your videogames this isn't for you. If you still want to experience the story then watch a silent playthrough of the game or something.

RiME is a story told through the medium of a video-game and it's absolutely stunningly beautiful. It's "a book come to life" sort of "game". There are little secrets you can go out of your way to grab but they don't mean all that much in the end, it just meant you explored more of the world that was built. I personally don't recommend it cause it will take away from the experience of the game. What you're really here for is the meat/story of the game which is throughout the entire way through, incredibly vague and puzzling but intriguing which keeps you hooked constantly. The payoff of this game comes in the final parts where it all finally snaps together because the story is told without words. The game is adorable, the colors are vibrant, and the sound design is stunning. I could go into more depth but it would take ages. If you want to play this game I would suggest playing with a controller so you can lay back and relax from your bed or couch when playing this game. Being hunched up in a chair while trying to play the game will really take away from the experience. Comfort is key. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098609508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 618, 'last_played': 1568520573}
review: Estamos acostumbrados a juegos triple A semipornograficos (visto desde lo hecho para excitar los sentidos), donde nos hemos enfocado mas en las sensaciones efimeras que nos producen. Rime a pesar de ser un juego a nivel grafico impresionante y con un estilo precioso, a parte de tener una estetica muy caracteristica, nos sumerge en una gran historia que, nos mantiene al borde de la silla todo el tiempo. rime es la clara muestra de que hay que poner demasiada atenci√≥n y apoyar estos estudios peque√±os, quienes con esfuerzos inimaginables sacan a la luz estas obras maestras, estas alusiones a la perfecci√≥n y el trabajo duro de comunidades peque√±as. Me voy con un gran sabor de boca, aplaudiendo como tonto frente a la pantalla ,como si los productores lo fueran a ver. Me queda poco mas que agradecer por darme este huracan de sensaciones a nivel visual y emocional. Sin duda un juego por que el todos deberiamos pasar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044049652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1568465151}
review: A world full of metaphor, great value to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096079278', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1568502929}
review: This is quite a beautiful game. It is visually stunning and has beautiful music. It is very much an exploration game with some interesting puzzles to figure out as you navigate a strange world, figuring out the rules and logic of that world as you go. The story is almost secondary to the experience of the gameplay, and is a little fuzzy, but bittersweet. There are plenty of achievements to get, if you want to take the extra time and explore. The overall presentation of the game is quite polished and helps to immerse you in the world as you try to figure out where you are and what's going on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990700486', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1568490222}
review:
The whole game you are wondering about what it is about, and have no clue, and only in the very end it all comes together and it finally makes sense. [spoiler] It is about a boy's venture through the limbo, accepting his own death and in the end letting it go.[/spoiler]

It was a very chill game for the most part, with some platforming and some puzzles that were not breaking your head. I never felt stuck in one place. 

The art style was wonderful and there were all kinds of clues and alternative storytelling things that still, only made sense to me in the very end, so it would require a replay to fully get the meaning behind all of the paintings on the walls, hidden memories, messages and similar things found along the way.

The music was one of the best aspects of the game. It always created an atmosphere that felt other-wordly together with the visuals.

It was not running the greatest on my machine, and there were not too many options to bring down a lot of graphical settings, but all in all the game is a gem, considering I got it almost for free in one of the Humble Bundle game bundles. 5/5
