author: {'steamid': '76561198311267097', 'num_games_owned': 938, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1568321187}
review:
to be completely honest I went into this game without high expectations and thinking it would be just a fun/entertaining adventure game but I sure was wrong:


the Rime sets itself as an adventure for you and me to play through and the Rime sets the world and its characters to tell us a story about the rise of fall of you and me, and the Rime sets its lights, water and dust, drawings and artifacts as a way and a mean to gaze into ancient cultures and civilizations that tells so much without words, that tells so much without trying to and that tells so much without changing the reality of that a child who wakes up to find himself lying on a sunny beach somewhere in the world

the Rime excels at telling an adventure, a history and most importantly, a tragedy

You wake up on an island which seems overused but soon enough you start to realize that your voice is a way to control a certain...things lets call them for now, certain things in the island as if you were destined to wash up on that island's beach and if things were built for you and you only, you and me


but where are you and where did you come from and who are you and why are you doing what you are doing?
I had the same experience in many other games, as where some of them failed to explain the situation or give a simple explanation the Rime not only succeeded but it excelled at not only explaining itself, the world and its characters, you and your past and your future but it dug up ancient tribes and realms all through drawings on walls and on pieces of wood and cloth just as in real life because the Rime is nothing but an attempt to imitate real life... or perhaps an attempt to refuse the reality of real life and replace it?

Acceptance, Depression, Bargaining, Anger, Denial is what the Rime is and what it is here to tell and it does it so well that it makes it not only a puzzle adventure game but a puzzle within a puzzle which can only let the player think about the possibilities and options and perhaps... 
the realities 
it will leave the player wondering about life's worth and everything's price, freedom price and what's the captivity price too

from denial to acceptance, the eternal light controls all,  it guides us and it enables us to keep going, to never stop no matter what the price is, sacrifices are to be made and tears to shed because the price of freedom and the price of us and them raising from the ashes is never too much.

the Rime allows us to experience all that while us being nothing, a soul looking for guidance and the eternal light provides but will we make it? where to though? we don't know, we only know that we are just a soul, a lost one that is trying to reach its final destination to reach its ''acceptance''

the ending of the Rime re-frames the whole game, it re-frames everything, and allow us finally to be something and to finally let go, let the pain and let the past go and accept reality, that is most definitely not a denial that is indeed acceptance.

recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129771193', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1567977875}
review:
I thoroughly enjoyed this game, and found it contained a surprising amount of story considering it lacks text or speech. Anyone who enjoyed AER: Memories of old will likely enjoy it. I highly recommend it to people who enjoy puzzle games and being able to explore.

Pros:
- Beautiful, colourful art style similar to AER: Memories of Old
- Puzzles were not too complex for the most part
- Tells a story via cutscenes at the end of each chapter
- Collectibles expand on the story, but are not necessary to understand it
- Plenty of nooks and crannies (many containing collectibles) to explore

Cons:
- Some of the collectibles are *very* well hidden - I can't imaging many people would find them without a guide
- THAT EFFING BIRD IN CHAPTER 2. I was so happy with the finale. I found it discouraged exploration and made some areas frustrating as it gave me mere seconds to try and figure out the puzzle before dying
- Some areas, especially chapter 3 and later, are too dark. I understand the desire to make it atmospheric and realistic, but I found myself getting of the couch and up close to the TV to try and make out what was going on. I could have increased the brightness, but then non-dark areas look washed out. 

Verdict: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197998473100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1567962701}
review:
This is my first review EVER (I guess, lol), but this game made me do it.

I've been a gamer for 31 years and I'd say Rime is a beautifully crafted piece. It has great design and a nice soundtrack, with good enough challenges throughout the game (easy ones, but still entertaining). Rather short game, I was able to finish in under 6 hours, but you can get a lot of value on this game on various stores. The story is obviously great as well, and I surely hope you don't get any spoilers before playing the game yourself.

Rime, as many great games, is not just a simple puzzler or platform or walking experience. Don't expect a hard, unforgiving game, with loads of action. It is rather an all-around adventure and an emotional thrill.

author: {'steamid': '76561198407401949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1567882511}
review:
First of all ,lemme tell you one thing right of the bat, Rime is an amazing game which has been made by passionate devs.

pros(+)
Amazing level design and scenery
Beautiful sound design
Nice and subtle animations
Good platforming and puzzles(not very hard and pretty enjoyable and tolerable too)
If you like Fez,then there is a chance you will like this too(The Fez 2 we never got i guess)

cons(-)
Unoptimized in some areas (Turn off antialiasing completely for better results but still....)
+/-Story : [spoiler] Its pretty obscure till the very end .Its basically about a father who lost his son and is going through a greifing process and is trying to cope with the loss of his son[/spoiler]


OVERALL: I recommend this to people who like fun/relaxing puzzle games and have a decent enough pc to run this cause its pretty demanding at times.
: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198169486791', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1514, 'last_played': 1567861333}
review:
RiME is short platformer and puzzle-game that you will immerse yourself in over a relaxing weekend. The soundtrack is excellent, the art-style is nice, the story is simple but captivating and the puzzles are not very difficult. The story may be cryptic at times, especially in the beginning but if you decide to pick up the many collectibles available, then you may be able to decipher the story before it all unravels.

I highly recommend giving this game a shot, it's a short one. Treat it as an "interactive movie" and you will certainly enjoy RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069042874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1567133514}
review:
I didn't know much about this game when I got it, but it turned out to be a really fun and interesting game. The game was really well designed both from a story perspective as well as visually. The puzzles were difficult enough to keep it interesting, but not overly difficult that it turns you away in frustration. Its a really relaxing game to play (other than the desert level with the big bird).

Steam has it listed (as of this review) at $29.99. I got it as part of a bundle for less than $2. While I enjoyed it and would definitely recommend it, I don't think I would pay almost $30 for it. I finished it in under 10 hours, so I don't think that warrants $30 in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050750789', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1567159201}
review:
[h1][b]About game[/b][/h1]  
[b]RiME[/b] is a Puzzle adventure  game  and attractive beautiful world. the game has kind of  half open world and relaxing game [b]. [/b]it has  a line path to the story but you can explore any areas around.

[h1][b]Graphics [/b][/h1]
when i saw  the graphics in store page i thought it is a normal game nothing special [b], [/b]but after i played it i impressed by high graphics.

[h1][b]Gameplay[/b][/h1]
Solve puzzles in a different areas either in floor , under the sea , or  climb up in  high buildings.
in the beginning i found it a little bit weird  [b], [/b]because still didn't know anything also there is no tips to where i go and what i do , then after time i learned the way how to solve the puzzle and it has the same style  when proceed in game , but even more complicated.
[spoiler][b]in chpater 2 was  well made and challenged i enjoyed it[/b].[/spoiler] 
some people maybe can find this game so [u][b]EASY [/b][/u]and finish the game in[spoiler]3-5[/spoiler] hours to obtain everything.

[h1][b]Overall[/b][/h1]
this kind of games don't have strong story and mostly it focused on [b][u]gameplay [/u][/b]and [u][b]idea[/b][/u] , however It has a sweet end and the game gives excellent mystery And good depth without spoken characters.

        i complain and i always keep complaining the lack of performance and some stutters in open area only "shadow" from Low to High eats 40 Fps GPU trying hard up 96-99% all time never goes down  well i loved it and i give this game 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970545339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1566885444}
review:
Strong powerful story line.  This game ranks as a work of art right up there with Grave of the Fireflies, Barefoot Gen and Night on the Galactic railroad.  If you pay attention, the ending will hit you hard.  The game play is nice and simplistic.  The developers want you to finish this game.  The reason to play this game is for the story line and the beautiful scenery.  The music, featuring Lindsey Sterling, is stunning.  Often times peaceful and sometimes mournful and sullen.  I will sum up this game in five words. Denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance.

I hope you enjoy this game as much as I have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121270977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 874, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1592001875}
review:
Incredible game. Poetic, beautiful, and with a wonderful work, in terms of visual, sound, and story.

The act 4 is a TRUE PIECE OF ART, wnithout any exageration imoh. Graphicaly, it's simply amazing, probably the most impressive artistic performance in a video game, to me. I will not tell anything else about it to not reveal anything, juste play it on a good screen with a good resolution.

Just do this game, take your time, try to understand the story, what happened to this boy, and just enjoy your 7 hours of gameplay, it is truely worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812162622', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 1126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1566744979}
review:
What an extraordinary journey this was!  Clean graphics, no bugs, sublime music, lots of collectibles and not a word spoken.  Game really engages you.  Quite a bit of platforming, but doable even for oldies.  Interesting themes and scenery.
The ending broke my heart....tissues came out!!   Highly recommend.  9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198057671038', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1592793553}
review: Probably the saddest and most beautiful game I have ever played. This game is a must have for anyone who loves a Epic journey and a story told through emotions, and music. Not a word is ever spoken. It's been 6 months since I played through it, and feeling the need to re-visit the world.

The puzzles are easy and simple to execute enough to complement this experience without wasting your time, but still give you a little bit of challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961969805', 'num_games_owned': 348, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1566182450}
review:
It's very pretty. I recommend it if you just like running around big old ruins for no particular reason.

The game is extremely linear, so I never got any feeling of exploration. The puzzles were trivial to solve and very disappointing. I was hoping to work through them with my wife because we love puzzles, but they didn't even warrant discussion because they were so easy. Also, while the idea behind the story is kinda interesting, the way they decided to tell it divorces it entirely from the gameplay so for almost the entire game my wife and I had literally no investment in the character.

I would not call this a puzzle platformer. It might be a good choice for a younger gamer or someone who has never played a 3d game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025016532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1566181500}
review:
A beautiful puzzle/platformer with a seriously bitter-sweet theme (that ending.....damn, that ending.....was someone chopping onions nearby?!?).  The graphics are good, the music is phenomenal, and the puzzles are easy enough that you don't feel like beating your head against a wall and/or consulting a walkthrough, but challenging enough that you feel like a smart person when you solve them (well......some of them......most are truthfully on the "push a button to win" side of things, but that's okay once in awhile), and the signposting is largely good (there's a few points where I wandered around a bit before I figured out where to go next).

There are a few minor issues with the camera which can prove troublesome when trying to perform a jump of some sort from place to place, but they don't appear often (I only noticed it four or five times, so roughly once an hour....not bad at all!).

All in all, I quite soundly recommend Rime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993617589', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1566035002}
review:
A visually sublime journey of a young roboticist and a guiding fox.

I enjoyed the game but think it is misguided to use mundane gamey busywork as a metaphor for working through emotional issues. It only distracts the player from thinking about the author's message and ends up justifying playing rather than using it to advance understanding. It would have been more effective and far cheaper to deliver the message in a short film.

review:

The puzzles in the game are not that hard to solve - I would recomend this game if you like adventure games.

Bought the game in the steam sale for 5,59‚Ç¨ - and I am suppprised by the story and feeling this game gives you.
I would not purchase this game for the 34,99‚Ç¨ - since i saw the ending in 6 hours and took my time to look at anything in the world.

Would deffinitly recommend if its on sale again. Its the most special game atmosphere wise I played this year.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976408337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 347, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1566044069}
review:
[h1]Overall = 8 / 10[/h1]

A relaxing and imaginative game about a journey of discovery and puzzles that spends a lot of its time in the darkness.  The levels still look good and having beaten the game I understand why the levels are designed as they are, but they can‚Äôt compare to the bright and colourful initial impressions you get of the game.  

It‚Äôs relaxing to play, beautiful to look at and an enjoyable experience throughout, but there are times it could have done with more signposting as to where to go next and it had a lot more enemies than I was expecting.  The platforming is a bit clunky at times, but the great music, character animations, story and overall atmosphere more than make up for this minor issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067361840', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1690012494}
review: Un juego bell√≠simo en todos los aspectos. El dise√±o art√≠stico es bastante √∫nico, con unos escenarios repletos de arquitecturas y paisajes que evocan a Italia, Espa√±a o Egipto, sin dejar de ser un mundo fant√°stico y on√≠rico. Si a ese imaginario propio le a√±ades una pizca de Ghibli y otra de Ico, te puedes hacer una idea de lo que ver√°s en Rime. La m√∫sica raya a un nivel pocas veces visto en un videojuego, y menos en uno independiente como √©ste y ser√° la que ir√° conformando la parte emotiva y emocional de lo que vamos a ir experimentando durante el viaje. El juego nos ir√° presentando distintos escenarios que deberemos recorrer de una forma m√°s o menos lineal (dichos escenarios est√°n llenos de coleccionables que podremos encontrar siempre que nos alejemos del camino marcado), resolviendo puzzles lo suficientemente retantes como para distanciar al juego del walking simulator, pero que en ning√∫n momento suponen un reto que frene el fluir de la aventura. Estos puzzles son bastante entretenidos en t√©rminos generales. La historia es metaf√≥rica y se ir√° desentra√±ando con im√°genes y simbolismo, pero s√≥lo al final comprenderemos en toda su magnitud lo que hemos visto y vivido. Y esa comprensi√≥n te va a romper algo por dentro. En fin, un juego muy recomendable, un viaje √∫nico y una experiencia de las que dejan huella.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025195712', 'num_games_owned': 1489, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1566443370}
review: Pretty nice adventure puzzle game. Very peaceful and zen with nature. The artwork is gorgeous, the world complex, soundtrack superb and it changes subtly with the progression of the levels. The puzzles and the gameplay make me think of this as a more kid friendly Tomb Raider. The puzzles feel like they are the right amount of hard for me, with some decent queues on how to progress without much back-tracking or head scratching, younger players not used to the genre might get stuck on some of the sections of the game though. Overall, it feels good to explore the different locations of the world as the game progresses and that's it's main selling point. The feeling of wonder didn't seem to vanish. You do need to be in the right mindset to enjoy your sessions without the progression feeling like work (i had to keep them short and occasional) but the whole cinematic ambience is very quick to make you feel at home at once when you come back to it. It feels a bit pricey, i got it on a sale/bundle, otherwise i probably wouldn't have purchased full price, but you can see where all the development money went into as you progress through the game. I agree with some negative points mentioned by other reviewers that the camera movements sometimes feel a bit counter-intuitive and the character moving too slow to really make you want to explore every nook and cranny. The ending is pretty memorable and well worth the full play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088054524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1565644311}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161079661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1565527669}
review:
Rime es un juego de exploraci√≥n y plataformas en 3¬™ persona ambientado en un mundo imaginario basado en el paisaje de las costas mediterr√°neas. Durante unas 7 horas manejaremos a un ni√±o por espacios abiertos mientras recorremos acantilados, cuevas, bosques y templos resolviendo peque√±os acertijos y descubriendo sus misterios. Nos cuenta una historia m√°s sencilla de lo que creemos en un principio, siempre utilizando la met√°fora como recurso. Un juego que comienza muy fuerte con unos escenarios abiertos y jugosos y que, con el paso de las horas, va ofreciendo unos mapas m√°s sosos y se olvida completamente de introducir nuevas mec√°nicas jugables o hacer m√°s complejas las que ya exist√≠an. En general los retos m√°s interesantes y los mejores escenarios los encontraremos en la primera mitad de la aventura, resultando la segunda mitad mucho menos inspirada, lo que puede provocar cierta decepci√≥n tras el inicio tan bello del juego.
En cualquier caso es un hermoso juego, que transmite m√∫ltiples sensaciones, con un gameplay b√°sico de plataformeo y exploraci√≥n, pero con un potente dise√±o art√≠stico. Una aventura original, sencilla y muy personal que disfrutar√°n los jugadores m√°s calmados que no necesitan de grandes dosis de acci√≥n para divertirse con los videojuegos.

8'2

M√°s: https://yexreviews.wordpress.com/2019/08/11/rime-2017/

author: {'steamid': '76561198211553000', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1565769884}
review:
I liked this game, isn't the greatest platform puzzler, couple of parts I found a bit boring and a slog, but would still recommend for the themes and beautiful visuals, which make for some great screenshots. No glitches or bugs found during my playtime.

Out of the games I've played I'd say it was similar to INSIDE, LIMBO, The Witness & ABZU. So would recommend to people who enjoyed those experiences.
Also the story and themes are very similar to GRIS, but I'd say I liked RiME's take on them better... the heart-wrenching ending especially.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197987199515', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1565453917}
review:
Ein sehr sch√∂nes Spiel mit einen tollen Soundtrack. Nach langer Zeit hat es mal wieder ein Spiel geschafft mich zu Tr√§nen zu r√ºhren. 
Technisch ist Rime leider nicht gut umgesetzt. Ich hatte des √∂fteren nur 15FPS und hatte fast durchgehend nur 30 FPS. Nur an wenigen stellen, hatte ich meine Konstanten 60 FPS.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971050707', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1565243260}
review:
I like platformers. I like puzzle games. I like exploratory "emo" games. But for whatever reason, Rime was just supremely boring. I managed to plod through the whole game and the overall story is... sad, I guess? I don't know. It just felt like it was a lot of random imagery trying to convey "something," but I never really got exactly what that something was.

Visually, it's beautiful (although taxing even on my 2080). But the gameplay is just... so... boring. It's like it couldn't decide if it wanted to be an exploration or a platformer or a puzzler, so it just half-heartedly tried to be all of them, and none of it is even remotely challenging and, for me, none of it was engaging. Actually, it felt a *whole lot* like Abzu, just with a sadder story. If you really loved that game then you'll probably like this. I greatly prefer Limbo/Inside, which this game also seemed to rip off (or "pay homage to") near the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971276058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1564343853}
review:
Better than expected. Pretty long (maybe even too long for me; disregard my playtime, Steam does not count offline mode playtime). Exceptional control, easy movement, no impossible platforming sections in sight. It's a shame other games do not follow this path and ramp up the technical difficulty in fear of the game becoming "too short". 
Puzzles are easy, but original. And speaking of the story, let me assure you it is not what you think and it is not what you will think while playing it, untill the very end, that is. Which is great. On the other hand, the story is somewhat cheesy and pretentious (supposed to be deep and meaningful for the typical folk), but execution leaves no sour taste in the mouth, even if you're not into the spiritual bs. Great game.

review: Possivelmente o melhor jogo que ja joguei em toda a minha vida, a historia te prende nesse game te fazendo sempre querer mais e mais, os graficos do jogo s√£o espetaculares, a musica te prende ao game e a cada a√ß√£o sua a musica muda e te faz entrar na vibe que o jogo quer, os personagens mesmo nao falando eles tem seu carisma especial o que te faz prender-se a eles, qualquer pessoa pode jogar esse jogo e em qualquer idioma pois ele nao tem falas o que facilita o processo de aprendizagem sobre o game, sua intui√ß√£o come√ßa a resolver os enigmas que vc nem espera resolver, sem contar que os momentos de tens√£o realmente te deixa apreensivo de fazer certas escolhas, a mensagem que o jogo deixa √© incrivel, assim fazendo com que esteja no meu top 1 de melhor game que ja joguei.

I now have another game that i have a love-hate relationship with... So beautiful... but damn you game... Why do you do this to me...?

This game is a must have in my books

author: {'steamid': '76561197972039973', 'num_games_owned': 8254, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1578257075}
review:
[h1]RiME[/h1]


[b]Einleitung:[/b]
Ein flei√üiger Leser meiner Reviews meinte zu mir, ey ich hab das Spiel gespielt, mach mal bitte nen Review. Ich hab gesehen, es war in meiner Liste und ich habs dann doch einfach mal installiert und nun anderen Games vor geschoben. Ich bereue es nicht, denn es ergriff mich direkt allein durch den tollen Sound und der malerischen Grafik.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893010  

[b]Handlung[/b]
Man wacht an einem Strand auf, man wurde wohl an Land gesp√ºlt. Schnell merkt man, das hier absolut ein absolut Gewaltfreies Spiel gestartet wurde. Auf der Insel leben wilde Tiere und man kann Objekte finden und sammeln. Schnell sieht man auch, was man tun muss um weiter diese Insel zu erkunden. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893146  

[b]Pro:[/b] 
[list][*]+ atemberaubende Musik
[*]+ malerische und wundersch√∂ne Landschaft
[*]+ kleine Puzzle immer wieder
[*]+ versteckte Objekte zum Sammeln
[*]+ traumhafte Welt mit Geheimnissen
[*]+ regt zur Erkundung an
[/list]

[b]Contra:[/b]
[list][*]- schlechte Performance
[*]- teilweise schwammige Steuerung
[*]- kein richtiges Sprechen 
[*]- hoher Preis / wartet auf einen Sale
[/list]

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1814893341  

[b]Fazit:[/b]
RiME hat mich in den ersten paar Minuten schon so in seinen Bann gezogen, dass ich kaum raus gekommen bin, obwohl ich noch was anderes spielen wollte. Ich will hier auf jeden Fall auch nicht zu viel verraten, denn wenn man das Spiel einschaltet und dann beginnt, wird man gleich merken, warum ich daraus ein relativ kurzes Review mache, damit jeder selbst sich davon √ºberzeugen kann. Allerdings solltet ihr auf einen Sale warten.


Ihr m√∂chtet mehr Reviews von mir sehen/lesen [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32556113-Ratea%C2%B4s-Reviews-give-away%C2%B4s/]hier abonieren[/url] und bei gefallen auch gerne meiner [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/rateasreviews]Gruppe[/url] beitreten und bei meinen Give Away¬¥s teilnehmen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989754266', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1564010283}
review:
Bored me to tears and I couldn't finish it. It's neither fully a walking simulator with a gripping story (story is too absent), nor a true puzzle game (1 easy puzzle every few minutes), nor a zen ambient stroll-about (you have to do puzzles/platforming to progress), nor a decent platformer (controls are meh, sections are meh).

Not sure why this has such high reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182812506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1640062476}

author: {'steamid': '76561198087469548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1563673964}
review:
Amazingly beautiful game. Incredibly designed from the rewarding puzzles to the unique nature of environmental dangers that drive the challenge to the astounding soundtrack that instills emotion.

Zero dialogue, No words or captions, and still this game spoke to me.

My only qualm is the mechanics of the game are a little slow. Traveling the world can feel a bit tedious with the run speed, but it obviously didn't stop me from no lifing it in 2 days. Pretty short story, main quest takes about 4 hours, and 6.5 if you want to 100% it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217316873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1563593179}
review: I don't usually write reviews but this was WORTH IT! I bought this during the Independence sale and HOLY CRAP DID I GET MY MONEY'S WORTH! My favourite game of all time is "Journey" and this game had a LOT of similar themes and tones. Stick with the game until the end...please! This is the type of game that you'll find yourself thinking about weeks after you finish it. So many inspiring elements in this game...AGH. MY HEART. 10/10 would play again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045945692', 'num_games_owned': 1148, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 521, 'last_played': 1564119184}
review:
This was a absolutely wonderful game with beautiful graphics and AMAZING soundtrack. It was so moving, and was just so originally emotional. This was a silent game in that there was not any talking at all, and I believe that it enhanced the effects of the game. The puzzles were decently hard, and it was just overall amazing. I got stuck once or twice, but otherwise I loved the game and found it to be well worth buying. I had been wanting this game for a while, so I'm happy it went on sale. 

IF YOU CAN, BUY THIS! ITS JUST AMAZING!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198349068566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1545856332}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054842591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1563577744}
review: On the positive side, the OST of the game is excellent. Especially in the last level. Other than that, it's one of the most frustrating experiences I ever had with a game. Barebones story with key plot points hidden behind collectibles, huge levels without the ability to sprint in order to pan out the time needed to complete the game and even though the game is heavily inspired by Team Ico's works, there was nothing truly memorable at the end of each "chapter" for me. If the game's length was a quarter of what it is now and there was some concrete storytelling and direction, I would probably recommend the game. As it stands, a pretty safe pass for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260513436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1563568331}
review: A stunningly beautiful game in every way. Graphics, music, story -- all positively captivating. I don't usually care for puzzle games, especially if there's no combat, but this one kept me completely engaged. Definitely recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198383595381', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 588, 'last_played': 1563533328}
review: If The Last Guardian looked like Breath of the Wild and was made by Studio Ghibli. A relaxing emotional journey, don't expect a challenge but expect feeling feelings. Lots of them. Fellas, I'm crying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095927987', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1563155290}
review:
I'm giving this a thumbs up because overall it was a pleasant experience and I'm sure it will be amazing for a large group of people.  I want to start with what I don't like about this game first before I get to the good.  Beware of exactly what type of game this is.  Steam recommended it to me because I play a ton of puzzle games, and the trailer made it seem like it was going to be very puzzle intensive.  Well if you're a hard core puzzler, DO NOT expect to be challenged whatsoever by this game.  The puzzles were extremely easy.  There were less than a handful of times I was stuck very briefly, and that was always because I literally couldn't find an object I needed or a ledge I was able to jump to.  It was "pixel hunting" stuck, not mentally stuck.  I feel like this game had much bigger potential to take advantage of the types of puzzles it used.  Some of them were heading in the cleaver direction but the moment there would be the slightest hint of a challenge, that was the end of the puzzle.

This game also had huge potential to be challenging in a different way but again was made far too easy.  The platforming aspects.  It is heavily influenced by the original Tomb Raider games.  Often times that type of platforming can be puzzles in and of themselves.  Once again, this game touched to surface of that aspect but never presented an actual challenge.  It left it very ambiguous as to whether I was playing an atmospheric walking sim, or if I was playing a puzzle platformer.  

The game seems like an open world exploration game at first but it's actually straight up on rails.  Which I have no issue with.  That part is done very well because you feel like you're in a large world but you're always subtly steered in the correct direction without it being overtly obvious.  That's not an easy feat and they executed that well.  There are hidden bonus items scattered variously off the path, however I stopped purposefully looking for them early on.  I don't feel like this game rewards exploration because there is no way to make your character go any faster, and these areas can be quite large.  So if you go all the way to a far corner of an area just to find nothing, you have to trek all the way back to the main path every single time.  It really gets old after a while.  There needs to be a sprint key.

Onto the good.  The game is downright beautiful and the music compliments it perfectly.  I was very absorbed into the atmosphere of the game and I kept playing it just to see new areas.  Your character is very entertaining with all of his little quirks that you can trigger with the "shout" button.  He sings when he's in a good mood, pouts when he's frustrated and in a difficult area, shivers when he's scared, says hello to strange creatures.  The art is simply incredible and sound design is also outstanding.  There is no dialog at all but there is most certainly a story with an emotional twist.  I kind of predicted the ending but it was still very powerful.

If you are on board for a feel good experience with only slight challenges then this game is a 10/10.  If you love games like The Witness, Portal, Stephens Sausage Roll, etc., and are looking for something along those lines, then this game is a 2/10.  So choose based on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031264272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1563409023}
review:
Un tr√®s joli jeu, √† l'esth√©tique soign√©e et √† la bande-son merveilleuse qui, comme certains l'ont d√©j√† remarqu√©, semble √™tre inspir√©e des ≈ìuvres de Joe Hisaishi (le compositeur favori d'Hayao Miyazaki).

     Il n'est pas tr√®s long, comptez 6 heures pour le faire et le double pour compl√©ter les succ√®s, sachant que l'on peut revenir sur le chapitre que l'on souhaite revisiter une fois le jeu achev√©. Le jeu de plateforme et les puzzles ne sont pas tr√®s ardus et cela permet de profiter des environnements magnifiques et des personnages assez attachants, comme le gar√ßon et son renard.

     Seul b√©mol : une tendance √† la chute de FPS dans certains endroits (d√©but du chapitre 3 notamment).

     Derni√®re chose : pr√©voyez des mouchoirs pour la fin, vous allez en avoir besoin... 

                                                                                  <<<>>>

     A very pretty game, with a polished aesthetic and a wonderful soundtrack that, as some have already noticed, seems to be heavily inspired by Joe Hisaishi‚Äôs work (Hayao Miyazaki‚Äôs favourite composer).

     It‚Äôs not very long, give or take 6 hours and double if you hunt for achievements, and you can replay any chapter as you please once the game is finished. The platforming and the puzzle aren‚Äôt so hard, and it allows you to enjoy the beautiful environments and the endearing characters, as the boy and his fox.

     Only let-down: the framerate tends to drop in some areas (like in the first part of chapter 3).

     And last thing: don‚Äôt forget your tissues at the end, you‚Äôll need it‚Ä¶

Die Steuerung ist sehr angenehm. Um die aufkommenden Emotionen noch einmal zu unterstreichen, wird die Musik perfekt eingesetzt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158899342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 192, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1563325314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000816254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1598185606}
review: RiME is one of my new favorite indie titles. It's simple, intuitive and gorgious. The storyline will hit you deep in the heart, even though it's presented without a single word. The game is well integrated with the steam achievment system - theres a lot to do, see, collect and listen to, while you're solving the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133388550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1563293955}
review:
Voil√† un jeu bien magnifique et myst√©rieux. Tout est tellement √©nigmatique : on ne sait pas ce qu'on fait l√†, pourquoi, ce que l'on cherche.... justement √† savoir ce qu'on fait l√† sans doute ? Rien n'est s√ªr, on progresse juste, piano piano... aucun souci d'ailleurs de ce c√¥t√© l√†. D√®s le d√©but o√π notre petit bonhomme se r√©veille sur sa plage, on est tr√®s bien guid√©, impossible de se retrouver bloqu√©. Les √©nigmes - si on peut appeler √ßa comme √ßa - sont plut√¥t simples, mais ce n'est pas le seul but du jeu.

 On √©volue dans des d√©cors tellement somptueux, la bande son est magnifique et je n'ai pas pu m'emp√™cher de ressentir un petit air de Miyazaki.  C'est un jeu d'ambiance oui mais pas seulement, √ßa c'est juste ce que le d√©but nous laisse supposer : le jeu prend crescendo une dimension tout autre, sans perdre un gramme de sa beaut√©. C'est r√©ellement savoureux !

Il n'est pas tr√®s long, et en fait c'est tant mieux car au bout d'un moment il devient un peu lent et r√©p√©titif, on a la sensation de toujours faire la m√™me chose (crier et crier et re-crier ouais). Vous savez c'est comme ces livres tr√®s beaux, magistralement bien √©crits mais ennuyeux √† mourir... on aime bien car l'esth√©tique est √† couper le souffle mais on a du mal √† continuer et √† vouloir atteindre la fin car c'est pas √©vident de choper le fil rouge. O√π va t-on ? Quel est le but de ma vie ? Dans quel √©tat j'erre ? Ben euh, j'sais pas didonc. 

Bon, il y a tout de m√™me un enjeu, une histoire de fond, des dangers (attention ce n'est quand m√™me pas un jeu d'action hein x)) et UN RENARD, diantre ! Malgr√© ses aspects un peu "n√©gatifs", Il m'a √©merveill√©e √† maintes reprises et j'ai pass√© un bon moment. C'est relaxant et frais, sympa quand vous voulez vous d√©tendre et chiller devant votre PC et la fin est tr√®s belle. Je ne peux que conseiller !

author: {'steamid': '76561198056748508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1563109304}
review:
What can I say. Beautiful game, short but absolutely sad. Cried like a baby and that's what I like, having my emotions tickled.

Soundtrack was the most beautiful what I have ever heard and the best thing about it was that the songs didn't suddenly change - they adapted. I also can't hype enough the sound environment, I can feel my sandals being wet from rain  just by the sound they make. Lots of secrets to find. The game tells a story, but as a game there's not much to do. But does it need more? 

But I do have some cons too about this game, as beautiful and breathtaking as it was: 

The "puzzles" were quite straightforward so there was nothing to solve really. I was overthinking things and trying to do things ahead as I didn't know what was coming sometimes, but when I gave up I realized there was really nothing to solve as you walked ahead and the puzzles kinda solved themselves and I found out I was just wasting time. 

Also no way this game is worth 35‚Ç¨. This game is 4-5 hours at most when you don't know what you're doing but if you just play the game without doing excess stuff it might be an hour long. I'd buy this at sale max 10‚Ç¨.  Sorry devs, there's just not much to do after looking at scenery.

i'd like to see more this kinds of games but the price is way high compared to what it includes. You did amazing job with graphics and sound and everything but the GAME itself is lacking quite a lot if you want to call it a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156965768', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1563061376}
review:
Este juego es hermoso. Acabo de recibirlo como regalo, pero en realidad lo jugu√© cuando lo regalaron en la Epic Store. Las din√°micas son super sencillas; la est√©tica minimalista, cuidada, invita a la contemplaci√≥n de los paisajes y a la exploraci√≥n de un entorno maravillosamente dise√±ado.
Al jugar, se siente reminiscencias de otros grandes juegos tales como Ico y Brothers: Tale of Two Sons. La historia se desarrolla sin di√°logos, de una forma bastante abstracta hasta llegar a un final revelador que invita a rejugar y redescubrir cada aspecto del juego, ahora con un nuevo significado.
Como √∫nico aspecto negativo, voy a se√±alar que, en varios momentos del juego, no es raro quedarse sin saber qu√© hacer. A veces parece faltar un objetivo claro (m√°s all√° del de llegar a la torre) y terminaremos deambulando hasta dar, casi por casualidad con lo que hay que hacer. Lo bueno es que, en ese deambular, se pueden encontrar muchos coleccionables. Y es que el juego los tiene en gran cantidad y variedad, lo que suma rejugabilidad al momento de terminarlo.
En conclusi√≥n, RiME es un juego excelente. No duden en comprarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150705021', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1561600136}
review:
I don't like this game. It looks pretty and the music is quite good, but it feels like Rime wanted to be a painting, not a game. There is practically no story, beside the atmosphere that is, there are no character to speak of, and the puzzles feel arbitrary and shoved in as required to make it a game, rather than because the puzzles are inherently interesting themselves, which they‚Äôre not. 
      While I tend to enjoy some games like these, the visual and sound design should exists to support either gameplay or some kind of story, which it doesn‚Äôt, which is a shame. The Witness visual design supports the core gameplay of puzzles, which are challenging and interesting. Wandersong uses it‚Äôs visual and sound design to support its story, characters, and themes. Anti Chamber uses its minimalist design to draw attention to its space bending puzzles. Rime uses it‚Äôs nice and stylizes art direction and music to walk you through a pretty picture, but with little substance behind it.
      If you want something pretty, then go ahead, but don‚Äôt expect anything else other than ‚Äúpretty‚Äù

author: {'steamid': '76561198141595877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1562963036}
review:
I really enjoyed this game. The music, the artistic style, and the story were very moving, and it was through a second playthrough that I really took the time to enjoy every vista, every musical score, and every moment to really enjoy it even more. Most of the puzzles were simple enough but not so simple as to just blow past everything and not get satisfaction for completing the puzzle itself. 

I recommend this game for those who want to experience a story that is very compelling and captivating from the start to the very end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972598584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1562724187}
review: A surprisingly good game.  Metacritic ranks this at 78 - I'd rank it more in the low 90's.  Definitely one of the best games made in the last decade (uh...I play LOTS of games) and is also ESRB rated E10+.  Other than the second level, I enjoyed it very much.  The first level was an absolute treat - very relaxing, discovering what to do, easy game mechanics, beautiful visuals, long view distance, no enemies, etc.  The second level brought in the game's only real enemy that was very annoying and left me no time to freely view the landscapes.  Part of the second level and a good chunk of the third level missed a huge opportunity to have relaxing underwater puzzles.  Instead, the underwater bits involve frequent racing through the water just to get to the next section before the character would die.  Plus the underwater bits are quite beautiful but there's just no time available to simply stop and look around.  There's some replay value in the game to go back and find all of the missed secrets and to get the achievements.  Revisiting/playing the first level again is totally worth it but you'll have to decide for yourself if the other levels are worth revisiting.  The game can be beaten very casually in about 6.5 hours and the story is solid even though none of the characters really say anything.  The music and audio are fantastic and timed to the actions of the character.  Definitely recommend.  RiME is a game that gamers of all ages will enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232440356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1562467617}
review: This is a very chilled puzzle/exploration game. Even if you die, the game just puts you back where you were with no penalty. (I though I might be able to do some cliff diving instead of going the long way around.) The graphics are styled and beautiful and the controls are mostly straightforward. They've even tried to keep the open world illusion by putting jellyfish in the water outside the bounds of the map to stop you, instead of having you just hit a transparent barrier like in some games. Took me a little bit to work out that the trackpad is your camera angle though which you really need to know. None of the puzzles I've come across so far have been particularly hard, but young kids might need some help. Only thing that's a little annoying is there appears to be no button to save where you want to when you quit. IMO if you like this kind of platform worth picking up as it's currently has a big discount on the purchase price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072548551', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1649207619}
review:
This game actually got to me in a way very few games do. So, you're a lad who washes up on the shore of this island with a big tower off in the distance and you're led along by an adorable little fox spirit. The character's primary mode of interaction is simply shouting, which distinctly reminded me of a few similar style games such as The Last Guardian. But what really drove me were the underlying mysteries I'd start asking myself in this imagery driven game, such as "What's with the tower? Why is it important? And just what is the deal with the mysterious figure that always seems to be just out of reach?" The game is stuffed full of little collectibles that encourage exploring this beautiful world.
In my opinion, a beautiful game I absolutely recommend giving a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970330601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1562365930}
review:
M√§rchenhaftes, malerisch sch√∂nes Abenteuer mit originellen, wenn auch eher einfachen R√§tseln und einer gro√üteils angenehmen Steuerung. Letztere macht die h√§ufigen Sprung- und Kletterpassagen zu einem Vergn√ºgen ‚Äì hier k√∂nnten sich die Little-Nightmares-Sch√∂pfer eine Scheibe abschneiden.

Abgesehen von wenigen Leerlaufphasen wurde ich in den gut sechs Stunden prima unterhalten. Ein ideales Spiel, um nach Feierabend zu entspannen. Das Ende war einigerma√üen vorhersehbar und doch ber√ºhrend. Mit dem Hintergrundwissen lohnt sich im Prinzip ein zweiter Durchlauf mit anderer Sicht auf die Dinge ‚Äì bei der Gelegenheit kann man direkt die zuvor verpassten Geheimnisse l√ºften.

(Meine Bewertung bezieht sich auf die Windows-Umsetzung, gespielt mit Xbox-One-Controller.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964982166', 'num_games_owned': 2316, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1562557908}
review:
Not as much as a walking simulator as some other reviews may lead you to believe, but the puzzles in this game will leave much to be desired. This game takes some heavy inspirations from Ico including mesmerizing landscapes and epic orchestral scores. 

There are a lot of cool gameplay elements that seem to only be played with briefly and there are some that are frustratingly used to the point of annoyance, like the bird sequence in the desert...

I don't have to much to say about this game, but if you picked it up on sale or got it for free from the Epic Game Store or elsewhere, it's worth a playthrough. It's not too long and could probably be binged played in a weekend.

review:
Lovely Atmosphere. Lots of collectables, although the game pretends its guided you're actually meant to explore a lot more in the open levels than I did.
You don't really get to see much of the Fox, in fact the character you find in the later chapters gets much more screen time and has a better bond with the player. 
A few puzzles are a bit too stupid for the way I solved them to be right.
Supposedly multiple endings though I only completed the game once.
Controls leave something to be desired, and the player walks slow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072131826', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1562369704}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048659492', 'num_games_owned': 5460, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1562186797}
review:
RiME is a puzzle platformer, it isn't just decent but also cute.

The puzzles are challenging sometimes but not too hard, the platforming scenes ok, not too hard. Doable for anyone who not really good or like platformer games (like me).

The story is interesting, touching. No narration, no voice acting but you not going to miss any of those.

The graphic is decent, looks awesome, the game is colorful and beautiful.

RiME is kid friendly, you can purchase to your kid or nonadult relative.

Only thing I not liked in RiME is the camera movement/rotation, most of the time you can move it freely, then suddenly at most of the platforming scenes it moves to a fixed position and sometimes I had issue to realize which button to push for moving forward as sometimes it was A or S or D and not W.

I would recommend this game, it is very enjoyable and cute. I personally find the base price very expensive, but as an East-Middle European who cursed with West European prices, I find the full prices of all games overpriced with a few exceptions. RiME is a must to play once owned or very recommended to purchase during the sale.

[b]Hey, I am an achievement hunter! [/b]

Completing game without walkthrough would take about 8-9hours and that's the time you need to get 100% achievements in this game, if you use an achievement guide (achievement guide not means it is also include a walkthrough and puzzle solutions, simple achievement and collectible guide don't kill the fun). Many collectibles are very easy to miss. The good part is, that you can replay chapters once completed the game so easier to return to missed items and achievements.

[b]This review was created for Average Achievement Hunter curator [/b]

Follow my curator if you like to see achievement related information (completion time, difficulty to get all achievements) on store page of the games.

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/30168383-Average-Achievement-Hunter/ 

The curator group doesn't mark any game as recommended so it shows useful information about achievements on the store page of the games without influencing the main store page of steam with recommendations + all games sorted to lists based on expected completion times. No point not to follow!:-)

review:
For those People who played Games like  "Journey" "Abzu"  i totally recommend this one.
Reminded me of journey the most.
Don¬¥t expect deep Gameplay but a very emotional but short Story with a twist.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991884002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1562068618}
review:
Great game with great atmosphere and a moving story. It has good, intuitive puzzles that I found compelling and fun, though they might be a bit easy for some. Good platforming and environment variety kept it from being just another Journey-clone. 

I completed it in 4 hours, which might seem short, but was just right for what the game was going for.

I noticed some visual glitches, with the geometry disappearing when the camera collides with the terrain. This only happened within caves and tight spaces, and was most noticeable in the first area of the game. 

Apart from that, RiME is a very good platforming adventure, that i would recommend to any fan of games like Ico and Journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083627746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1561950191}
review:
Empecemos por las cosas buenas: es un juego precioso con un arte que quita el hipo, tanto que he perdido la cuenta de las screenshots que he hecho, la m√∫sica tambi√©n es incre√≠ble.
Realmente el juego no tiene nada malo, simplemente cosas regulares como los puzzles, que son demasiado f√°ciles, quiz√°s, para mi gusto. A lo mejor al principio no pensaba mucho en ello pero no hay, digamos, una curva ascendente de dificultad. En cuanto a la historia... (Sin spoilers) es muy bonita pero yo personalemente veo que en ocasiones quieren 'forzar' que le cojas cari√±o a ciertos personajes (en mi caso) sin √©xito, pero aprecio el intento y eso no afecta mucho a como la historia ha querido 'conectar' conmigo.
Resumiendo, en general es un buen juego que tiene todo lo que me gusta, es precioso, tiene puzzles y buena m√∫sica. Da muchas horas de juego por los coleccionables y tal, yo personalmente no me he molestado en buscar todo as√≠ que se me ha hecho mas cortito. Si te gusta la rejugabilidad este es definitivamete uno de esos juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986779330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1562533796}
review:
I really liked this game. Beside the obvious and previously mentioned similarity to Journey, I was also reminded of the Myst series (obviously not from graphics).
The game is not perfect:
[list]
    [*]I found many instances where controls were not in sync with the required action
    [*]There were far too many cases where the camera just goes wonky (usually at very inconvenient times)
    [*]The puzzles were decent, but as I only got stuck once, I'd say they could have been a bit more challenging
    [*]The length of the game is too short (like Portal 2, too little of a good thing).
[/list]
But, those issues were minor issues to me. I've read that some have had performance issues with this game. I experienced no such issues (i5-6600, GeForce 1070, 3440x1440 monitor with default game settings). I got the game on sale, and got more than my money's worth. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who likes this style of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067662753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1560228174}
review: I really want to like this game but unfortunately, I didn't. It seems like the developers put a lot of focus into making the game look good (which it does!) but neglected to make the game more interesting in terms of puzzles. The game basically turned into a walking simulator by the end, which is not the type of game I signed up for. The impact of the ~big reveal~ at the end is lessened by the fact that I just wanted the game to be over, and while the game was wrapping up and trying to hit me over the head with emotion, I was just exhausted and felt nothing. That shouldn't be what players take away from the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979978686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1517721977}
review: RiME was a true delight to play. I thoroughly enjoyed exploring and solving the puzzles. As the story unfolded I found myself thinking I understood the developer's message, only to be surprised in the end by how much I had missed or misunderstood. Unlike other games which have disappointed by the end of the game, this one gave me much more than I expected. The beautiful graphics are appropriate for the story being told and the musical score fits perfectly. My attachment to the little fox was greater than the one I had for a certain in-game cube, with my feelings for the 'robots' a close second. When asked to recommend games for friends, my first question is have they played RiME? I look forward to more like this from the developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209307757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1591571274}
review: This game is so beautiful, it's one of my all time favorites. The music and art is gorgeous, and I really enjoy the slow, relaxing pace of it. The story is lovely, and I love how it develops over time. It's a very simple and sad story, not too complicated or too hard to understand, but it does make you wonder when you get to the end. Definitely worth it, please play this you will not regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198811563791', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1558817144}
review:
RiME traz tudo aquilo que um bom jogo indie tem a oferecer: mec√¢nicas interessantes, hist√≥rias simples e envolventes e inova√ß√µes em alguns quesitos.
Esse √© um t√≠tulo quase que obrigat√≥rio para quem curte jogos de quebra-cabe√ßa, pois seus desafios s√£o, embora simples para quem j√° est√° acostumado com puzzles mais complexos, muito interessantes e a relativa baixa dificuldade n√£o prejudica a experi√™ncia.
Em rela√ß√£o √† hist√≥ria, a narrativa do jogo pode ser um pouco confusa, uma vez que ela n√£o apresenta nenhum di√°logo e diversas criaturas estranhas simplesmente aparecem pelo mundo (algumas n√£o fazendo nada e outras querendo te matar). Isso muito se deve pelo modo como RiME apresenta seu enredo, iniciando com o garoto deitado na praia e o jogador livre para explorar um novo universo que j√° existia antes da sua chegada da maneira que desejar, podendo ir atr√°s dos itens colecion√°veis ou apenas seguir o curso normal da hist√≥ria.
No fim, caso o jogador esteja atento aos pequenos detalhes ao longo do gameplay, a hist√≥ria n√£o ser√° surpreendente, pois o jogo apresenta o desfecho de maneria delicada. No entanto, se o jogador for apenas passando pelo game sem prestar aten√ß√£o aos detalhes, talvez o final fique um pouco confuso e seja preciso ir atr√°s de explica√ß√µes pela internet.
Em suma, RiME √© um jogo profundo e superficial ao mesmo tempo, tentado trabalhar a solid√£o, a companhia, o apego e o desapego do jogador ao logo de seu desenrolar.
No mais, para aqueles que querem apenas bons quebra-cabe√ßas, esse t√≠tulo √© essencial.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968610556', 'num_games_owned': 960, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1560967489}
review:
[code][h1][b]Relaxing and atmospheric[/b][/h1][/code]

RiME is a great game when you just want to chill and play a game on the couch. It's not very challenging, and therefore also very suitable for a young audience! On the flip side it can be a bit bland/slow at times because of it. Also, even though it doesn't seem like it for a while, there's actually a touching story beneath all the adventure. 

[b]Rating: 8.5/10[/b]

[h1]Halwin's 100% Completion Recommendation[/h1]
[b]Difficulty: 2/10.
Time: 7 - 9 hours [/b]
There is no challenge that comes with the achievements, and the primary obstacle is finding hidden objects. While they aren't expertly hidden, you will likely miss a few without a guide. You can use chapter select after you finish the game, yet since the game has zero replayability I would encourage you to use a guide while playing.

review:
Tequila Works define su propia filosof√≠a de trabajo como ¬´crear cosas peque√±as, con buen gusto¬ª, ¬°y vaya si lo cumplen!

Este juego es como un chupito (de tequila, no pod√≠a ser menos); es corto, deja buen sabor de boca y calidez en el coraz√≥n. Y, sobre todo, su esencia radica en el acompa√±amiento, en este caso el lim√≥n y la sal ser√≠an la melod√≠a y el arte visual. Me atrever√≠a a decir que es para paladares habituados, pues como en el caso de los licores, cada cual tiene sus gustos y, en este caso, han de gustarte los puzles.

No hay historia previa, no hay mapa, no hay di√°logos. ¬øQu√© tenemos? Una inmersi√≥n dif√≠cil de mejorar. A pesar de estar frente a un juego en tercera persona, la forma en que est√° planteado har√° que seamos ese personaje desde el primer instante. ¬øPor qu√©? Debido precisamente a lo que no sabemos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962066184', 'num_games_owned': 224, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1531803387}
review:
RiME is a stylish and at times beautiful puzzle and collection game that has quite the sad yet fulfilling message.  Each area has a different motif or a hidden meaning and I would say try not to spoil yourself on the ending or major levels before you buy it as it kind of ruins the experience.  You will go through a nice grassy starting island to a desert cliff side to an area that is always pouring rain with water drenched rocks reflecting what little light there is.  Visually and artistically speaking RiME is a very pleasant game to look at and experience.

You control a boy as he wakes up after being thrown out of a boat, the area is friendly in how it is presented to you and really fits the whole ‚Äústarting zone‚Äù type of thing that games like Mario 64 accomplished decades back.  You progress through levels by hunting through slight mazes, hitting switches and opening doors in order to progress to the next area.  The areas are somewhat open world, some zones you can run around everything that you see, back tracking all the way to the place that you started, others you are very clearly locked out of going backwards.  

I just wish that it was better optimized, from what I‚Äôve read the game running smoothly is a serious issue even on console platforms.  You will have a major machine but you may not even be able to break 40-50 FPS maybe see 60 every so often but it is very inconsistent.  I mean inconsistent as in you‚Äôll be seeing 50-60 then suddenly go through a tunnel and come out of the other end and suddenly you‚Äôre seeing 30 FPS!  That‚Äôs honestly one of my biggest problems with the game is that as much as I want to enjoy the story and the emotional ride it gets jarred constantly but the poor optimization.

I would say for the visuals and story alone to pick up RiME, as I‚Äôve gotten older I‚Äôve started to appreciate these ‚Äúwalking simulators‚Äù more and more (so long as they are good) but this one is far more of a 3rd person puzzle game than just a walking sim.  I ended up playing this a few times just to grab every secret, items and story fragments that the game has and each time I noticed something new (as you tend to when you revisit games that you‚Äôve already beaten).  Just a shame about the poor optimization.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968514561', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1559607888}
review: Rime was a little on the short side. I bought this title at a large discount and I'm glad I did. While the game is short, it's still enjoyable. A good portion of the puzzles are ridiculously easy, and then there are a few that had me  stumped for a good bit. The world and visuals are beautiful, but the optimization of this game at higher graphic settings is terrible. There should be no reason my new pc with an i9-9900k and RTX 2080 Ti should be struggling so hard when I can get a consistent 120fps with all settings maxed on AC: Origins. Aside from that, I still enjoyed my time with the game. The platforming didn't really pose much of a challenge but still felt somewhat nice. Overall I would recommend this game but only at a discounted price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064407080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 655, 'last_played': 1556243612}

Apr√®s y avoir jou√© quelques heures , je me suis retrouv√© bloqu√© dans mon avancement. Je ne savais plus o√π aller. Puis, quelques temps plus tard, j'ai d√©cid√© de m'y remettre. Une des meilleures d√©cisions de ma vie.
Un jeu que je trouvais de prime abord fade, vide et ennuyeux s'est r√©v√©l√© une des plus belles exp√©riences que j'ai pu avoir avec un jeu vid√©o. Une exp√©rience qui m'a tout simplement souffl√©. Ein wenig erinnert es mich auch an "Journey" weil man nicht nur die R√§tsel selbst l√∂sen muss sondern auch herausfinden, wie die eigentliche Mechanik hinter den R√§tseln funktioniert. author: {'steamid': '76561198167041974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1561811186}
review:
[h1]7/10[/h1]
RiME is an artistic game, made for the story and music.
- The graphics are cartoonish but very polished, they remind The Legend of Zelda: BotW.
- There's no HUD, just music, ambient sounds and nice visuals.
- The gameplay is a platform based mostly on puzzles, and they vary a little bit from start to finish but the controls sometimes are bad and not very responsive. Sometimes even if you do the puzzles right the game still doesn't count them right so you have to redo them, but it's not a big problem.
- The music is amazing, it's the most important part of this game, it helps you feel like you are truly into this game's world.
- The story's very nice, since there are no talking scenes or written collectibles, you have to understand the story by yourself (some collectibles help you understand more though).
- Even though the game is created using Unreal Engine and the graphics are very simple, this game still manages to lag even on good hardware and I saw on some forums that it's not the only game Tequila Works made that was very poorly optimised not only on PC but on consoles aswell.
- The game's not very long, 4-6 hours for the story and around 8 hours to get 100% completion, the only achievements you have to pay attention for are the collectible ones and some hidden ones which with the help of a guide are very easy. So I think the full price is not justifiable, I recommend you buy this on sale.

Now, even though the game is very beautiful, I didn't find it very captivating, actually boring at times. I would still recommend you buy this game and try it for yourself to see if you like it.
If I would have to rate the game, without any decimals, I would rate it 7/10.

review:
Great story telling with immersive gameplay and beautiful graphics.

Grading
''Graphics'' - 10/10
Awesome.

''Music'' - 9/10
Great music that appropriately adapts to the gameplay.

''Cinematics'' - N/A

''Story'' - 10/10
Incredible story dragging you forward to reveal the conclusion.

''Content'' - 9/10
Content can be found on each step. Variety of contents could have been a bit better.

Both using controller and keyboard and mouse will give you the experience that you deserve.

Fantastic.

Great story telling in beautifully designed world and stunning graphics will give you the reason to finish the game and reveal the mysterious story. All recommendations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047749315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1559977437}
review: A beautiful game. Interesting puzzles, immersive music, moving storyline, it's really quite a piece of art. I think some of the puzzles could be improved, particularly later in the game when some mechanics start to get rather repetitive, but for me that was not the sole reason I got the game. The puzzles were interesting, there was enough new ideas to spice things up from time to time, and the exploration of every nook and cranny of the world was optional. The puzzle mechanics could have been deepened with some additional development work, but the whole experience was still a very moving and positive one, and I recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017545067', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1644019510}
review:
Quick note: Don't watch the trailer. Don't watch a review. This game must be experienced firsthand; anything else would be a disservice to yourself and to RiME. Spoil as little as possible for yourself.


Original review: Unplayable. I'd really like to play this game, it looks beautiful. But I've got slightly above the recommended specs, and turning down the graphics gets me... 24 fps. That would be okay, but there's something about the extremely unstable fps and the fov that just give me a massive headache, which means I can't enjoy what seems to be an absolutely amazing game. 

This is the first time since seven years ago when I built this PC that I've needed to overclock my GPU to play a game.

Update Mar 2020: Even with a 1080ti, the game still stutters and crashes. Also, the gameplay is really, really slow. It might be beautiful, but I'm not sure it's worth my time.

Update April 2020: Welp, this game has THOROUGHLY redeemed itself. Seems like the one crash was a fluke, because the rest of the game has been relatively smooth, although still with some occasional frame drops. But now that I've played through the whole thing, I can easily forgive everything except the fact that those on less-capable hardware (The recommended specs listed, an R9 280x, are not enough to play this game at all). It's a shame, because everyone *should* have the chance to play this game, regardless of the hardware they run. It's truly a beautiful experience. Even the backtracking that I was annoyed with earlier was mostly a fluke as well. The devs really put some thought into what the player experiences. 

I would be doing a total disservice to this game if I tried to actually explain it, but typically a review is meant to tell you whether you should buy the game or not. The answer is not unequivocally "yes." But this game is not for everybody in the same way that any other game is not for everybody. It's just that "Zelda/Tomb Raider Reboot but prettier and with a more touching and more personal story" just isn't doing this game justice.

Let me put it this way:

The Witcher makes you fight.

Nier Automata makes you think.

This game makes you feel.

(The Witness makes you bored). 

...

Well, let's say you already knew that. You know you're getting an emotional story mixed in with some puzzles and some absolutely beautiful scenery. I'm sorry that I don't have much to compare this game to. Every other game that I can think of just hits different. This game is meditative. There's no fighting. There's next to no action. Its pacing is most similar to the Tomb Raider reboots, but TR_r feels absolutely empty by comparison. I can't remember the last time I played a game where the story felt this fulfulling, but I can't actually explain why without totally ruining the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006744', 'num_games_owned': 3873, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1558788548}
review:
Est√° muy bien este "RiME", un juego de exploraci√≥n, plataformas y puzles, todo envuelto en ese mundo m√°gico y lleno de color.

La historia est√° bien, jugando con el misterio hasta el final, quiz√°s sea algo ambigua si no te paras mucho a explorar o dar significado a la narrativa visual, aun as√≠ el juego quiere dar un mensaje y logra su cometido.

En cuanto a gr√°ficos pues ya veis, no es un portento pero si que logra crear un mundo muy vistoso y llamativo, al que dan ganas de explorar y que se siente un personaje m√°s de la historia, las animaciones y las f√≠sicas est√°n bien logradas as√≠ como el juego de luces y sombras, visualmente es una delicia.

La banda sonora tambi√©n est√° muy bien cuando la tenemos y acompa√±a sobretodo en los puntos importantes de la historia, en otros momentos solo escucharemos sonido ambiental que tambi√©n ayuda a reflejar y potenciar la soledad del mundo que nos rodea.

En cuanto a los puzles y el plataformeo pues cumplen, los obst√°culos que nos iremos encontrando suelen ser sencillos de superar, dejando claro el camino a seguir o el objetivo del puzle que estemos haciendo, esto sumado a una recogida de ciertos objetos de forma fastfood, y algunas zonas de ensayo y error suman las mec√°nicas principales del juego.

El contenido del juego es enorme, la historia principal sin pararte mucho ya son unas 8 horas, pero es que el juego esta plagado de coleccionables y de caminos ocultos, la isla se vuelve un laberinto y por cada zona bien explorada se recompensa con alg√∫n objeto opcional o peque√±as dosis de lore, se nota que el juego pese a tener una historia muy decente se ha centrado mucho en la exploraci√≥n y en dar vida al mundo que nos presenta.

En conclusi√≥n RiME es un buen juego, largo, interesante, bonito, con contenido, pero... no es perfecto, ya que quiz√°s su ultimo tramo se puede hacer algo pesado, los puzles aunque est√°n bien son algo repetitivos y nada que no hayamos visto en otros t√≠tulos similares, la historia aunque interesante es tan ambigua en ciertos puntos que no logras conectar todas las pistas, el contenido opcional es tan gigantesco que te da miedo dar dos pasos por si te dejas cualquier rinc√≥n sin explorar, algunos saltos, plataformas y animaciones podr√≠an estar mas pulidas...  Pero en conjunto es un juego muy recomendable y todo un orgullo que sea producto nacional, si te llama m√≠nimamente la atenci√≥n,hazte con el. Vale la pena.

Claramente influenciado pelos jogos criados por Fumito Ueda, o jogo n√£o decepciona e quaisquer escorregadas t√©cnicas que o jogo possa ter, na jogabilidade e na mixagem de som, n√£o atrapalha a experi√™ncia como um todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061069410', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1566748097}
review:
Del√≠cia. Um jogo que vale mais que mil imagens... que valem mais que mil palavras ^^
O tema me pegou de surpresa... e s√≥ deixou as coisas mais interessantes.
Sinta alegria, tristeza, encanto, medo, pavor... √© um jogo de muitas cores e formas. Uma obra de arte digital.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966748379', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1561063912}
review:
I cant recommend this game no matter how much i would like to. The game is good looking, has a nice story with a twist, and really tries to be a good game. 

It is however extremely boring. I actually fell asleep while playing it on multiple occations.
The puzzles are often pretty straightforward and while you know exactly how to solve things, it just takes too much time to do the actual solving.
To find out what happened in the story, i had to go to youtube and watch some lets plays of it...
