review: Sometimes a good twist during the ending can recontextualize the entire story, making it a whole new experience when replayed. Other times, the twist invalidates every last bit of a story that game had up until that point. This game has the latter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321528988', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1601424029}
review: Unfortunately, I would have never have bought this game if it wasn't for the cheap discount and good reviews. Happy I did because it was worth every penny. I like action and role-playing game but this has a Zelda feel to it for some reason. From the very beginning it makes you feel immersed with the sound and beautiful scenery. It's basically puzzle solving with a story. Need to give credit to the creators for making this very unique and creative game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262251865', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 350, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 673, 'last_played': 1560483497}
review:
This game is good by all normal accounts but I am not recommending it because I do not appreciate being sold one "world" only to have the entire idea of that world undercut by a twist ending. 

"A land of discovery stretches out before you. Explore the beautiful, rugged world of RiME."

But that's not what's happening. This game page makes you think it's a scenic fantasy game like if Ico and Journey had a baby. Instead, it's just a mediocre platform puzzler about grief. SPOILER: SoMeOnE LosEs A KId!!!?! 

There's NO COOL WORLD HERE. It's just sorrow. And I wanted a cool world not a charade, that's why I'm not recommending it.

review: Simplemente genial, una ambientaci√≥n fant√°stica y una realizaci√≥n art√≠stica sin precedentes, una grandiosa obra que todo aficionado a los v√≠deojuegos deber√≠a probar. Demuestra que el videojuego puede ser arte y transladarte all√≠ d√≥nde el autor quiere llevarte. Recomendado 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016699206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1599035157}
review: The last decade has seen a wealth of stylistic games able to pull at the emotional sensitivities of their players, with the likes of Journey,Abzu, Firewatch, Edith, Aer and Brothers to name but a few. And Rime is a similar, if not slightly inferior, experience. Fortified by the gorgeous stylized partially toon-shaded visuals and beautiful musical accompaniment,  Rime is able to tap into some real emotion as the game progresses and the brief snippets, glimpses and allusions begin to piece themselves together to give the full gravity of the adventure. It left me feeling something... although I'm not quite sure what that something is. I do know it was a worthwhile six hours of my life. If it comes up on a steam sale, I recommend giving it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004479818', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1580537129}
review:
If you like exploration and puzzle games, just buy this game. 

Fantastic visuals and atmosphere. Controls are tight. The world is fun to explore. Also, the themes of the game will grip you on the inside.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296949206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1560015510}
review:
This game is stunning. That is the first impression I got. And by that, I don't mean that the graphics are great - they aren't - but that the game is aesthetically beautiful. And not just the graphics, but the subject matter, the approach, the way the story is told, everything has a deeper layer of beauty to it that makes it all the more poignant and hard to ignore.

The game walks in the footsteps of ICO, there is no denying that. But instead of looming castles, solemn keeps and forlorn crags, you find yourself on a sunlit island with a Mediterranean climate. It might not come as a surprise that the studio is from Spain. White temple-like structures, green grass, blue sky along with a flora and fauna make the game a pleasure to play, the color palette is one of the cleanest and most pleasing out of any game I can think of. How the time of day is shown is better than any other game I've ever played; at first I thought I was imagining it, that the light had changed, but then it really did go from dusk into night, and then into a new morning, all with their own distinct light and colors. Truly amazing.

The story is for the greater part of the game a mystery, told in glimpses and fragmentary flashbacks. There is no dialogue (like ICO) and no combat, only exploration and puzzle solving, yet the game manages to continue to grip your attention without becoming boring or repetitive. The game does get darker, and the environments change, yet the clean, beautiful, crisp colors don't go away even when you descend into gloomier parts.

It is without a doubt a game that will bore some, but going into it not knowing anything about it (which is always the best way) will provide you with an amazing experience if you go all the way to the end - and I cannot stress this enough, you HAVE to go all the way to the end. The conclusion makes RiME what it is.

All in all, it's a visually and emotionally amazing game in a genre that is very sparse.
90/100

author: {'steamid': '76561197979881961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1701978646}
review:
Nice Game. I wasn't sure to buy it becaus of the graphics. But i was wrong. The optics of this game are incredible atmospheric. It uses a modern graphics engine and it works quite well on a 4k monitor.

Besides the optics, the game offers perfect sound and gameplay. It's a bit of an adventure game. You run around in a beautiful land with an atmospheric andscape and you try to find out what to do. And its not standard gameplay. 

It's a peaceful game from another world. I like that exspecially when you had a bad day. This games makes the day a bit better.

Please do more of this kind of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012126687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1559540724}
review: This is a beautiful visual experience, but sadly not much of a game. It falls into all the clich√©s typical of Indie Platformers, and while the scenery is at times mesmerizing, it also seems to punish the player for trying to explore out of the beaten part ‚Äî thanks to a walking speed unsuited to the scale of the game's environment. There is a final subversion to the narrative that worked really well, and it did a lot to differentiate this from similar experiences. but while I ultimately enjoyed my time with RiME, it lacks the cohesion it needed to be truly great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260132564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1561762088}
review: I'm marking this as a negative review while in fact it is more of a neutral review. It has positives as well as negatives that drag it down from being a game up there with Journey and Abzu. Upon experiencing the first hour or so the game's world which is a fantasy island filled with magical ruins and mystical spirits and it lures you into this false sense of what the story is about. It's not an enclosed fantasy like Journey with a simplified 3 act story. The final act of the story pulled a unexpected and rather rushed subversion of the narrative that had been going thus far and ultimately left a very sour taste in my mouth afterword. It is not a fantasy, but rather a metaphorical story pertaining to the 5 stages of grief, something I wish I had known going in. And I'm fine with sad/melancholy stories, I've played What Remains of Edith Finch and SOMA. But don't give me a plate of ham and later tell me it was someone's pet pot-bellied pig. Other than that, the mechanics are a bit too simple, leading to bland platforming. The level design and art is fantastic. The music, beautiful. The story, disappointing, which, sadly is the core of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063952806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1559426029}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987757264', 'num_games_owned': 2472, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1559209790}
review:
Really good graphics, but the character is slow, the platforming is mediocre, the puzzles are mediocre, the music is obnoxious, and each time there's a cinematic, it plays extra loud to hammer the point that's supposed to be important/emotional.
The game is also barebone at explaning the story, so if you're playing it, play it in 1-3 sittings, to get the full experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302696096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1640317379}
review: I'm going to be honest, going into this I wasn't expecting the amount of quality, time, and effort I was met with. I'm amazed by how this game didn't need a single speck of dialogue to blow me away. Outstanding work, I don't think I've played a better single-player story game in my life. I wholeheartedly recommend you buy this game and give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099499691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1559187223}
review:
You already see my opinion from the red thumbs down, and on a page of nearly universal acclaim, you might be willing to just assume I'm some disgruntled gamer and sweep on past.

Don't do that. This game is not for everyone, and it certainly isn't for me. Let's pick it apart by each of the features it touts as its selling points. At each moment, I'll compare it to The Witness, which is also a puzzle game featuring exploration of a mysterious island and secrets galore.

Exploration: The main point to exploring this game is to find secrets, which I'll talk about later, so I'll use this space to talk about the game's movement. First off, this game is linear. There's 'exploration' in the sense that you can step off of the obvious main path to find some secrets, but aside from that the game railroads you in a straight line forwards. Worse still is that your character moves so abysmally slow that I felt punished for exploring, in that it took so long to reach the end of a branch to see if there was a secret there. This game is desperately in need of a sprint key, and exploration feels more like a chore due to how the slow movement grinds away at you. Compare it to The Witness, which has a sprint key that moves you inhumanly fast across the landscape. A good speed in my opinion.

Puzzles: They were easy. Not just 'yeah i get this' easy, but 'why are they wasting my time with this' easy. In the first 100 minutes, I didn't find a single puzzle that I had to think for. Most were simple enough that I understood the solution from the first moment I saw them, and the few that weren't only took a few seconds thought to figure out what a new piece did. You can carry a game on the strength of good puzzles. The Witness, as a game, is exclusively about puzzles, but that ties into the game's deeper philosophy. In Rime, the puzzles were not only simple, they felt disconnected from the game itself. They were barriers barring progress and nothing else.

Find Secrets: This is where the game really fell flat for me. I'm a sucker for good secrets, and the ones I found in Rime just... aren't. There are 4 different kinds of secrets (that I found. there's 6 sections on the extras screen.) You can find new outfits, little wooden dolls, fragments of coins/seals, and conch shells that play a lullaby. The seals and dolls are, at first blush, literally useless, The outfits are... neat? But not a satisfying reward given the time it takes to find them. And the lullaby was... eh. It's a thing that exists. Maybe it has some deeper meaning once you put the entire song together. Again, let's compare to The Witness. Secrets take two forms; usb sticks that hold philosophical quotes and excerpts- usually about knowledge, learning, and the pursuit of both- and optional perspective puzzles, where the secret is an additional puzzle about finding the right place to stand, the right perspective to look from. Each USB, each philosophical quote, again, ties into the game's theme, while the bonus puzzles are exactly that; bonus puzzles. They have literally no purpose, except that they exist to be solved, and The Witness, as a game, is about taking enjoyment in that intellectual pursuit of knowledge and conquering obstacles. 

Be Enchanted: I'll give the game credit here, it is beautiful and atmospheric. The soundtrack is pleasant, the graphics are stunning, and the environments you explore are rich and colorful. This game has the visual design down scratch, but at the end of the day, it's still a video game, and IMO if your main selling point for a game is visual appeal, why not just make it a movie?

TL:DR Painfully slow movement makes exploration a chore, and the secrets you find while exploring didn't seem to have a payoff that was worth exploring for. The puzzles were simple and lackluster, and while the game's beautiful, there's not enough -game- in it to justify a 30$ price tag.

If you want a pleasant stroll around the island with some light puzzling, maybe grab this on sale, but I wouldn't pay more than 10$ for it, and even that's a stretch.

P.s. People say the ending is fantastic and the game makes way more sense in retrospect, but I don't feel like trudging for 8 hours. Did I mention the game's that long? Some people call that short, but it's longer than I wanted to spend trudging on a linear path.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138289148', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1558882021}
review:
RiME es recomendable, pero a√∫n que me ha gustado me ha decepcionado un poco.

Tiene un gameplay bastante simple, con un movimiento algo mejorable, puzzles bastante sencillos, niveles que parecen explorables pero son l√≠neas rectas con bastantes coleccionables que buscar y sobre todo muy relajante.

La banda sonora y el aspecto art√≠stico/gr√°fico es de lo mejorcito del juego sin ninguna duda. La banda sonora es bonita y √©pica. La gr√°ficos son buenos y el aspecto art√≠stico es muy bonito. Tiene bastantes opciones gr√°ficas para ser un juego de este estilo.

La duraci√≥n es muy corta, en mi caso casi 5 horas. La historia es algo confusa, pero que mejora por momentos cuando est√°s cerca del final. Es poco rejugable, a no ser que quieras recolectar todos los coleccionables y descubrir alg√∫n que otro secreto.

Con una rtx 2060, un i7-8700k y 16gb de ram el rendimiento es el siguiente: Tiene un buen rendimiento, en mi caso todo al m√°ximo menos el Anti-aliasing que he tenido que cambiar de SSAA a TXAA funcionaba a 60fps constantes. 

En definitiva, es recomendable si lo compras en alguna rebaja y te apetece jugar un juego de plataformas con algunos puzzles y una historia interesante.

Mi nota es de 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114305114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1558794977}
review:
Bonito y emotivo, pero nada original juego de puzzles y aventuras

- Historia: el juego trata claramente las fases del duelo de forma correcta. Sin embargo, el final es bastante predecible y le quita gracia a pr√°cticamente toda la campa√±a, ya que si eres avispado desde el primer nivel sabr√°s, como digo, el final. 
- Gr√°ficos y sonido: bonitos gr√°ficos y banda sonora emotiva, sin grandes alardes. La optimizaci√≥n del t√≠tulo es p√©sima, con una RX 580 de 8gb he tenido que poner varios ajustes en medio para que el juego tirara a 60fps, simplemente rid√≠culo.
- Jugabilidad: el t√≠tulo es bastante lineal y los puzzles son sencill√≠simos. No hay ninguno realmente inspirado y que te sorprenda por su originalidad. No son muy variados.
- Originalidad: aqu√≠ encuentro uno de los principales puntos negativos, y es que si hab√©is jugado a cualquier obra de Fumito Ueda ver√©is que la inspiraci√≥n raya en el plagio, sobre todo con "The Last Guardian". Todo el rato ten√≠a la sensaci√≥n de que ya hab√≠a jugado a lo mismo, pero m√°s grande y mejor. 
- Duraci√≥n: entre seis y ocho horas la campa√±a. Puede llegar a doce si quieres conseguir los coleccionables, pero no hay ninguna raz√≥n para ello ya que no aportan absolutamente nada a la historia, est√°n muy desaprovechados.

En resumen, un t√≠tulo sencillo, bonito y emotivo que no ha venido a aportar nada al mundo del videojuego. Sus puzzles son muy f√°ciles, los coleccionables no te inspiran lo m√°s m√≠nimo a conseguirlos y si has jugado a otros t√≠tulos como el mencionado The Last Guardian vas a tener una molesta sensaci√≥n de deja vu constante. No puedo recomendarlo. 

Nota: 5/10

So my friend gave me this game and I could not be more thankful to be able to experience this.
I don't say this often or lightly but this game is a work of art, the visuals are magnificent and the music is enchanting and both complement each other perfectly.

Do I recommend this game then yes wholeheartedly. 10/10

review:
Rime est un jeu d'une po√©sie √† couper le souffle. Je n'ai certes jouer que 11h, et j'ai d√©j√† termin√© l'histoire principale, mais il me reste encore plein d'objet √† trouver, de tenue √† d√©nicher ou autre petit bonus suppl√©mentaire √† collectionner. 

Rime est un jeu contemplatif. Si vous voulez vous battre avec des mobs, pass√© votre chemin! les graphismes sont une pure merveille, l'histoire est incroyablement touchante et √©nigmatique... Pour avancer dans le jeux il faudra s'armer d'une logique parfois diff√©rente √† la sienne, chercher, fouiner, et parfois un poile s'arracher les cheveux. 

Enfin bref, pour moi ce jeux est une pure merveilles, √† acqu√©rir sans h√©siter pour les amoureux des jeux contemplatifs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085557560', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1558380326}
review:
Unter Rime habe ich mir erstmal ein cooles Adventure Spiel vorgestellt, mit s√º√üem Artwork & coolen R√§tseln.
Beendet habe ich das Spiel mit einem bitteren Nachgeschmack und Tr√§nen in den Augen.

Zum Spiel:
Rime ist ein R√§tsel / Adventure Spiel was  durch Kombination aus fantastischer begleit Musik & Artwork eine unglaublich gute Atmosph√§re schafft.
Man startet als kleiner gestrandeter Junge auf einer Insel und wird ohne jegliches Tutorial dem Spiel √ºberlassen.
Nach  kurzem umsehen und bekannt machen mit den einfachen Steuerungs (Kritik dazu sp√§ter) Elementen, wie klettern, springen & rufen, findet man recht schnell den richtigen weg & nach dem 1. R√§tsel auch gleich seinen treuen Begleiter.
Sofort f√§llt einem die unglaublich gute Musik auf, die die Stimmung im Spiel stehts passend untermahlt.
Da ich hier nichts spoilern will fasse ich mich kurz.
Unser Freund der Fuchs begleitet uns fast durch das komplette Spiel & zeigt uns wo wir lang m√ºssen.
Zwischen den 5 verschiedenen Leveln gibt es immer wieder kleine Cutscenes, die einem langsam aber sicher Hinweise auf die eigentliche Geschichte geben.

Wer das Spiel, wie ich, mit der Erwartung anf√§ngt, es sei ein lustiges nettes Spiel, wird nach und nach merken, das hier etwas ganz anderes dahintersteck.

Steuerung:
Die Steuerung ist an sich recht einfach gestaltet.
Man kann springen, klettern, rufen, rollen & gelegentlich Dinge aufheben.
Da man im Spiel nicht rennen kann, gibt es ab und zu Passagen die sich etwas ziehen.
Das l√§sst sich aber verkraften, da das Spiel verhindern m√∂chte, dass man einfach durch rennt und evtl. wichtige Teile der Geschichte √ºbersieht.
Kritik g√§be es im Bereich Koordination. An manchen Stellen merkt man, dass das Spiel als Konsolentitel entwickelt wurde. Das merkt man an kletter Passagen, bei denen der Kamerawinkel festgestellt ist. Dann muss man pl√∂tzlich rumprobieren, mit welcher Taste unser Charakter nun weiter klettern kann. 
Auch bei den wenigen Kamerafahrten merkt man, dass man aufpassen muss, nicht von der Kante zu laufen.
Da diese Kamerawinkel & fahrten recht selten vorkommen, hat mich das nicht wirklich beim Spielen beeintr√§chtigt. 

R√§tsel:
Die R√§tsel sind im Gro√üen und Ganzen gut gelungen.
Ich h√§tte mir hier evtl. mehr Variation gew√ºnscht.
Die R√§tsel bestehen haupts√§chlich aus schieben, drehen, Formen verschieben & rufen.
Da all dies aber gemischt zum Einsatz kommt, entsteht mit der Zeit, eine angenehme Schwierigkeit.
Ich habe mich w√§hrend all der R√§tsel nur einmal verloren gef√ºhlt und wusste nicht weiter.
Die L√∂sung lag zwar auf der Hand, aber da das Spiel recht wenig Hinweise gibt, kann ich mir vorstellen,  dass der ein oder Andere hier das Handtuch wirft. (Bitte tut das nicht, es lohnt sich!)

Musik:
Die Musik kann ich nur in h√∂chsten T√∂nen loben!!
Sie ist mir nie als nervig vorgekommen bzw. Hatte ich nie das Gef√ºhl Sie w√§re zu repetitiv.
Im laufe der Story √§ndert sich auch die Musik. Manchmal ganz unscheinbar und pl√∂tzlich wird einem ganz anders und man hat G√§nsehaut.
Besonders gefallen hat mir der nahtlose √úbergang der Musik.
Beispiel:
Man l√∂st ein R√§tsel, oder kommt an eine wichtige Stelle im Spiel und pl√∂tzlich stimmen Violinen und ein Chor mit ein. Durch dieses kurze Volumen in der Musik habe ich jedesmal G√§nsehaut bekommen!

Performance:
Ich habe das Spiel in WQHD gespielt (Alles auf h√∂chster Stufe, au√üer Tiefensch√§rfe und bessere Wasser Effekte) und hatte die Ganze Story √ºber zwischen 80 - 155 FPS.
Intelcore i7 8700k
Asus GTX 1080 Advanced
Dabei hatte ich nie das Gef√ºhl, es w√ºrde ruckeln.
Ladezeiten sind gering.

Fazit:
Alles in allem fand ich dieses Spiel wundersch√∂n!
Gerade an einem veregneten Tag, an dem man sonst nichts vor hat, ist dieses Spiel eine wunderbare Erfahrung.
Als einer, der ehr Multiplayer Spiele spielt, muss ich sagen, dass ich in Zukunft gerne mal einen Abstecher in das Singleplayer Genre wagen werde.
Dieses Spiel ist ein Kunstwerk, was man erst zum Schluss zu sch√§tzen wei√ü!
Haltet euch Taschent√ºcher parat ;)

review: Ë†ªÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÔºåÂêÑÁ®ÆÊúâË∂£ÁöÑËß£Ë¨éÔºåÈÇÑÊúâ‰ª§‰∫∫Ê∑±ÂÖ•ÁöÑÊïÖ‰∫ãÔºåÁ∏ΩÈÅäÊà≤ÊôÇÈñì‰∏çÈï∑Ôºå‰ΩÜÊòØÁé©Ëµ∑‰æÜ‰∏çÊúÉÊãñÊà≤ÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûúÂñúÊ≠°Âú®Ê∞£Ê∞õ‰∏≠Ëß£Ë¨éÁöÑË©±ÔºåÊúâÊ≤íÊúâÁâπÂÉπÈÉΩÊé®Ëñ¶ÂÖ•Êâã„ÄÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198297019211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1558055202}
review:
Although I eventually decided to "recommend" this game, I would only purchase it if it's on sale or if you're a diehard puzzle-game fan who doesn't mind some unfortunate technical problems. 

First, if you like atmospheric puzzle games like ICO, the Talos Principle, or The Last Guardian, then you will find a lot to like in Rime. Although it doesn't approach the greatness of the aforementioned, it does hold its own pretty well.  The developers nailed the atmosphere in this game with amazing music, vibrant visuals, great sound effects, and a touching story that will have you interested in playing until the end (I finished the game in 4 hours, although I did not worry about the collectibles and other extras). 

That said, the game suffers from poor optimization, creating a laggy experience with large frame drops in many areas.  Despite running a fast rig that can max out most AAA titles, I had to suffer through dips down into the 20fps range in many parts of the game.  This ruined much of the immersion that a game like this requires to succeed.  There are also some frustrating control issues, specifically when scaling walls and having to leap between ledges.  These might seem like small flaws, but when the entire game is based around atmosphere and platform-intensive puzzle solving, these flaws add up to a frustrating experience pretty quick.

All in all, Rime is a decent puzzle game that is worth playing through once if you have any interest at all in emotional puzzle games like these. If not, then the juice probably isn't worth the squeeze, and your time and money are better spent elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993347307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4395, 'last_played': 1557878783}
review: If you liked The Talos Principle, you will like this game as well. On the surface a puzzle game, it is also full of collectibles that unbeknownst to you have a deeper meaning only fully revealed in the final chapter: a chapter which for most players will take their understanding of the game and its world and flip it on its head. For most, a twist and an unexpected but moving ending that for me elevated the game far above my expectations. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198229946292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1557680916}
review:
I can see the good and the bad views everyone has on this game. Performance wise, there are certain areas in the game where you get FPS lag which IMO should be non existent with my current PC setup. That being said, that is the only bad thing I have to say about this game.

You don't fully understand whats going on in the game until the very end (or at least I never anyways). The puzzles are not overly difficult, but the music, the music is beautiful and really makes the atmospheric setting throughout the levels.

If you play it, play right till the end, I would recommend this game to anyone who likes different/indy games but be warned, it may just get you right in the feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119499050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1557661311}
review:
No spoilers ahead.

TL;DR: The game's proficient and quite pretty, but feels a bit generic and is too pricey and long for its purposes. Gameplay by itself is ok at best. Buy at a discount.

The visual presentation is, unsurprisingly, one of the better parts of RiMe. It doesn't, however, really stand out from the genre it populates - visually pleasing adventure games with gameplay mechanics that feel a bit like formalities. Some of the "woah, that looks cool" moments feel a bit too scripted and the overall aesthetic isn't particularly distinctive, but it's all quite serviceable. Maybe open exploration would give more weight, catharsis and variability to the visual experience of the game.

The music is decent, but not especially memorable or interesting. The puzzles are pretty generic.

The game (and what it wants to communicate) would've been better served by being pricing it at around 20 ‚Ç¨ and cutting some of the content. Games like this - pretty adventures with some form of a meta-narrative - shouldn't, in my estimation, cost 40 ‚Ç¨ and/or last as long as RiME does. The gameplay just isn't engaging or distinctive enough to not overstay its welcome, especially since the game is a linear adventure without that much significant exploration. The underlying narrative is a decent one, but also isn't served that well by the length of the game. 

The game is still an enjoyable one for the most part and I do recommend picking it up if you're into the genre, but you should definitely wait for it to go on sale instead of dishing out the listed price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006138293', 'num_games_owned': 1058, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1557869723}
review:
PEGI 7 ... oui alors attention quand m√™me avec √ßa, je trouve compliqu√© de mettre ce jeu et en particulier le dernier niveau + la fin dans les mains d'un enfant car il y a beaucoup d'√©motions √† g√©rer.

C'est un bon jeu, √† la crois√© de Ico, The Witness, Journey et une touche legere d'Antichamber, sans oublier Brothers, a tale of Two Sons. Les puzzles sont malins mais pas bien complexes, graphiquement tr√©s agr√©able. Le personnage a mon sens ne se deplace pas assez vite pour la taille du monde et tout ce qu'il y a √† explorer pour completer sa colllection d'objets cach√©s (on peut revenir faire le tour des niveaux une fois le jeu fini).

C'est un jeu qui m'a impliqu√© emotionnellement, j'√©tais triste en le finissant pour pas mal de raisons toutes li√©es au jeu et je pense qu'un petit moment calme d'introspection est necessaire pour dig√©rer la fin.

Ok, un tr√©s bon jeu selon mes criteres finalement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201142753', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1557870660}
review:
First of all, this game is beautiful.
It reminds me of Journey and Abz√ª, both are games I love, and this one catches me on the same note as its soulmates.
The soundtrack and general use of music in addition to imagery or just as imagery on its own is breathtaking and really gets you in the feels at times.
I got this game in a bundle on Humblebundle, but now that I played it, I'd recommend you to buy the game either here or on a site like Humble instead of on some key reselling site like G2A or whatever.
These are the types of games that make me wonder why video games as a whole aren't considered art by many, although there's clearly a lot of thought and story and so on behind them, like movies or books.

Play this game! You won't regret it! It's an experience that I wouldn't want anyone to miss out on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035974214', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1557252977}
review:
This game is badly optimized.
I wish the character could run a little bit faster... Sometimes i felt really bored walking so slowly in areas where nothing happend.

That's it for the cons, everything else is good.
Beautiful soundtrack, story is touching, environments can be nice to look at. Nothing extraordinary like in other similar games but, good enough to be worth your time.

Considering you can get this game for very cheap, i can only recommand it. I would not spend 34.99‚Ç¨ to get it though, that's a scamm imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013646345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 824, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1557104048}
review:
If you're the sentimental type, my main piece of advice is to have a box of tissues or a handkerchief ready.

Tequila Works knows how to pull at heartstrings with the story, the environments, and the music. My only complaint is some of the platforming mechanics are unpolished or inconvenient in certain parts of the game. Beyond that, would absolutely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971316390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1557078237}
review:
Imagine a banquet laid out in front of you. Roast meats, steamed veggies, various bottles of  sparkling drinks and your favourite desserts. It a looks wonderful and smells delicious so you start to dig in. As you're almost half-way through the meal you start to notice that the meats are fully cooked, the veggies are soggy from being left steaming for too long, the bottles of drinks are flat rather than bubbly and the desserts are starting to go sour or stale. This meal is just like RIME.

As first, you look at the game and it looks really well polished. The music and ambience is stirring and initially the world seems vibrant and interesting. The animations on the character is top-notch and this is something that the game maintains throughout as each character is packed with personality and emotion. Early puzzles are varied and clearly give some nods to Legend of Zelda in that they are strictly logic based and visual clues prevent the need for referring to online guides or having written instructions. With occasional exceptions each puzzle can be solved by exploring the nearby area and you can often see the objective but need to figure out how to achieve it. However.. all of this begins to fall apart after the 2nd level. The game starts to degenerate into tedious platforming sections, lots of running between areas just to trigger buttons or events and becomes progressively more linear as you feel funnelled through one area to another when earlier in the game you had some freedom to explore.

RiME is a prime example of developers running out of ideas and not having a good quality assurance process. You can see that they started off strong and then let the remaining 2/3 of the game become extremely mundane and tedious. The musical scores are amazing in once instance and utterly forgettable the next. Some parts of the game have background music that is extremely quiet and is drowned out by the ambience and sound effects leading to parts of the game feeling very empty and unfinished. This mixture of great gameplay and music alongside utterly tedious gameplay and mundane music just makes the latter seem so much worse as RiME's quality becomes like a patchwork quilt

There was an attempt at a storyline here, quite clearly the devs started to lean into the 'this is art' angle to the point that they forgot it was supposed to be a game. I have played other games which dealt with abstract concepts portrayed via gameplay but RiME fell short by not leaning into the symbolism that is supposed to be telling the story and instead depending upon hidden collectables to actually tell the story.  If you don't find any of these you'll get to the end and suddenly be faced with a 'twist' which makes no sense. Again this patchwork quilt effect whereby the gameplay is detached from the story the developers wanted to tell.

As much as the 1st third of the game is worth seeing, I simply cannot make that the justification for recommending the game. RiME needed to go back to the drawing board, cook for a little longer with the QA teams and then finally be released but as it stands it simply isn't a worthwhile experience and with a playtime of only 7hrs it isn't even good value for money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009073659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1551985311}
review:
It's a really nice game. 
Very mellow & pleasant ambient music, very charming animation, nice environmental vistas - The opening hours are just pleasant all round.
It's a really basic 3D puzzle-platformer (classic selection of box-, perspective-, etc. puzzles).
The main draw definitely lies in the art - animation, music and presentation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032565111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1556990660}
review: I would say RiME is more of an experience than a game. I enjoy puzzle games and picked this one up on sale because I found the art work interesting. I didn't know what I was getting into. I certainly wasn't expecting the emotional turn. The aesthetics of the game are really beautiful and the story is touching. The puzzles are pretty easy, but that's really not the point of the game. It's difficult to explain without giving spoilers. I'd recommend getting it on sale. It's definitely worth having, but for $30...

author: {'steamid': '76561198285500508', 'num_games_owned': 270, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1556971150}

author: {'steamid': '76561198206999976', 'num_games_owned': 1110, 'num_reviews': 511, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1556874017}
review:
[h1]Review zu RiME[/h1]

RiME ist eine dieser Spielerfahrungen, die nicht jedem unmittelbar gefallen wird. Das kann von Person zu Person unterschiedlich sein und h√§ngt auch davon ab wie sehr man sich in das Spiel und in den Hauptcharakter vertiefen kann. Aber ich glaube man w√§re nicht hier und liest sich auf Steam Reviews dazu durch, wenn man keinerlei Interesse an dem Spiel h√§tte.
RiME hat bei mir viele Emotionen ausgel√∂st. Sei es Mitgef√ºhl, Neugier, Trauer oder Freude. Diese Anzahl von Gef√ºhlen ist gr√∂√ütenteils dem wundersch√∂nen Soundtrack zuzuschreiben und einer bewegenden Geschichte, die allerdings selbst zusammengereimt werden m√∂chte, da Hinweise dazu wie Brotkrumen verteilt worden sind.
Irgendwie habe ich mich in RiME auch wieder wie ein Kind gef√ºhlt. Vielleicht liegt das auch am Kind als Hauptcharakter. Man geht auf der Insel regelrecht auf Entdeckungstour und erforscht was das Zeug h√§lt!
Und mit Erforschung geht auch Openworld einher. Auch wenn RiME anfangs davon noch deutlich mehr bietet und sp√§ter bei der Erkundung weiterer Areale eindeutig linearer wird. Was ich √ºbrigens recht schade fand.
RiME bietet auch verschiedene Areale: [spoiler]Sei es Strand, zerkl√ºftete Felsen und Schluchten, W√§lder, Ruinen, eine W√ºste, Dschungel und noch andere kuriosere Orte![/spoiler] RiME hat mich somit immer wieder aufs neue √ºberrascht. Damit, und mit Hinweisen auf die Hintergrundgeschichte von RiME. Schade fand ich jedoch auch, dass einiges von der Story mit Collectibles erz√§hlt wird. Hei√üt, wenn man nicht gewillt ist, die einzusammeln, dann erf√§hrt man deutlich weniger von der ber√ºhrenden Geschichte.
Im Allgemeinen hatte ich mit RiME jedenfalls dauerhaft Spa√ü und es kam nicht zu einer einzigen l√§stigen Minute, w√§hrend des Spielens!

Kommen wir f√ºr die Schnellen unter uns einfach mal zur Pro-Contra-Liste:

[u][b]Pro:[/b][/u]

+ Die Musik ist wirklich ber√ºhrend. RiME¬¥s Soundtrack ist vielleicht der beste Soundtrack den ich dieses Jahr bis dato geh√∂rt hatte!
+ RiME bietet eine wundervolle Geschichte mit einem ber√ºhrendem Abschluss!
+ Mir haben die Charakteranimationen des Jungen gefallen. Die waren wirklich hochwertig gemacht und haben stets glaubhaft gewirkt
+ Der Grafikstil ist recht interessant gew√§hlt und erinnert mich pers√∂nlich etwas an [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/210970/The_Witness/]The Witness[/url]
+ Es gibt keinerlei Ladezeiten auf der Insel, lediglich am Anfang des Spiels
+ Die Insel selbst k√∂nnte faszinierender nicht sein und ist voller Wunder!
+ Hintergrundgeschichte wird teilweise mit Malereien innerhalb von Ruinen erz√§hlt. Das fand ich ganz interessant. Nat√ºrlich, wie bereits erw√§hnt, auch mit Collectibles und gegen Ende sogar mit hochwertigeren Cutscenes!

[u][b]Contra:[/b][/u]

- Manchmal hat die Kamera Probleme gehabt. Vor allem beim Schwimmen und beim Klettern
- Controllervibration l√§sst sich nicht deaktivieren. Generell sind die Optionen recht √ºberschaubar

[u][b]Prontra:[/b][/u]

+- Ich fand es etwas schade, dass das Spiel anfangs noch deutlich ger√§umiger war und mehrere Pfade angeboten hat, w√§hrend im sp√§teren Verlauf des Spiels es ziemlich linear wird
+- Nachdem man mit irgendetwas interagiert hat, sei es die √ñffnung einer T√ºr, oder dergleichen, zeigt die Kamera dies kurz auf und schwenkt dann wieder hinter den Jungen, um zu zeigen, dass man wieder selbst steuern kann. Nur ist dieser √úbergang stellenweise viel zu lang gewesen. Diese Zeit h√§tte man etwas verk√ºrzen sollen
+- Klettersystem funktioniert √§hnlich wie bei Uncharted, aber deutlich weniger fl√ºssig, ist eben langsamer und realit√§tsnaher gehalten

RiME profitiert nicht gerade dadurch, dass das Spiel im Normalpreis so teuer ist. Schlie√ülich ist das Spiel, ohne dem Erlangen von Achievements, gerade mal ca. 6 Stunden lang. 34,99‚Ç¨ sind daf√ºr deutlich zu viel verlangt. Im Sale kann man jedoch wirklich zuschlagen!

Ich danke f√ºrs Lesen und w√ºnsche sehr viel Spa√ü beim Spielen! ;-)

https://store.steampowered.com/app/493200/RiME/

author: {'steamid': '76561198067664077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1556825099}
review: I will forever remember my time with Rime as an experience rather than a gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135891109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1555268581}
review:
I bought this game thinking it'd just be a nice and simple adventure with a nice art style which I adore and search a lot in game, but it turned out to be much much more than just this.
RiME is a great game about a boy who finds himself on an island. It is an emotional journey of discovery and loss, and as you progress the island turns stranger and stranger, with beautiful surreal elements and artistic landscapes. I recommend it wholeheartedly to those who like peaceful games led by the visuals and the story. If you find the first level slightly dull, as I did for a little, don't get discouraged; the next ones are far better and the game, I think, is a piece of art and should be enjoyed as such. Take your time. Delight with the scenery and the music. And, in the end, discover the mystery of the big tower... 

I really recommended this game.
It is definitely worth your money!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035568468', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1556798390}
review: RiME is game about a young boy who, with the aid of a magical fox, explores a series of Mediterranean themed locations, progressing via platforming and puzzle solving. There's a sad story driving RiME, but giving any of it away would probably spoil it. It's a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033340053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1556779162}
review:
I'm not sure what I was expecting from RIME, I was drawn in by its aesthetics and the vague knowledge that it had a focus on exploration, I guess I was expecting a fairly basic platformer with pretty visuals and not a lot else. I'm pleased to say it turned out to be more.

You play a young boy who wakes up on a mysterious isle after a terrible storm, Its a beautiful environment to explore and straight off the bat you have some freedom to explore, theres no real tutorial to be seen but the overall controls of the game a simple and easy to get to grips with as you explore. The world isn't vast and open so theres no chance of wandering off and getting lost but the island is large enough to have multiple side areas with various collectables hidden about the place rewarding the player who looks around and maybe notices a climbable wall or cliff or small opening, theres more to the collectables than just achievements too unlockable art hints at lore, and there are music and costumes to find and unlock as well encouraging you to explore and rewarding you for taking your time to take in this world.

Now as to the gameplay its fairly basic you roam about the world heading for landmarks (towers or light pillars) scattered about the map, its actually a good way to give direction to players as rather than railroad them you guide them more naturally toward points of interest. Within each landmark will be some sort of platforming challenge or puzzle, personally I found none of these difficult and was about to make swift progress (your mileage may vary) between stops to explore and find hidden loot. In addition to these minor puzzles there is generally an overarching theme to each area/world you visit, one might add in a flying monster that will attack you if stay out in the open too long, another will have non-logical layouts (corridors fold back on each other or connect in impossible ways making navigation a challenge), combine all this with beautiful art and sold visual themes for each area and its a joy to travel through this world.

But the last part of the game is of course the story, its told entirely without words, through the world and brief flashbacks between worlds, each world has a theme, something that the title of chapter gives away, in fact the chapter titles give away abit too much so I would say avoid any guides on your first playthrough its easy enough and you unlock a chapter select if you want to go back and do achievements later. The story is bittersweet and best just experienced so I'll leave it at that.

Overall RIME is a great time, a little on the short side but still worth the price especially on sale, give it try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011595325', 'num_games_owned': 2477, 'num_reviews': 929, 'playtime_forever': 732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1556753669}
review:
Apesar do meu costume de deixar o jogo aberto enquanto me afasto do computador levei cerca de 6 horas para terminar a campanha e coletar uma quantidade  minima de extras, se for atr√°s de tudo sem guias acredito que pode demorar mais que 10 horas.
Comprei em promo√ß√£o, mas sabendo que tipo de jogo Rime √©, pagaria o valor cheio tranquilamente. √â um jogo lindo, linear mas com bastante explora√ß√£o, plataformas e puzzles n√£o muito desafiadores (gostei da primeira metade do jogo, na outra parte achei muito f√°cil), mas o que mais me chamou aten√ß√£o foi a historia contada sem nenhuma palavra, que ningu√©m deve saber antes de jogar. A trilha sonora tamb√©m √© muito boa.
--------------------------------------
Despite my habit of leaving the game open while I move away from the computer, took me about 6 hours to finish the campaign and collect a minimal amount of extras on Rime , if one is behind everything without guides I believe it can take more than 10 hours.
I bought it on sale, but knowing what kind of game Rime is, would pay full value quietly. It is a beautiful, linear game but with a lot of exploration, platforms and puzzles not very challenging (I liked the first half of the game, in the other part I found it very easy), but what caught my attention the story that was told without any word, that no one should know before playing. The soundtrack is also very good.

review:
Fant√°stico. 

Juego simple pero muy profundo y con un final predecible (si prestas atenci√≥n durante el juego) pero muy emotivo. 
Arrancas desmayado en una isla, descubr√≠s que estas solo y te mandas a explorar. Eso es todo, saca tus propias conclusiones conforme vayas avanzando por cada uno de los 5 mapas y descubras que tan acertado estabas sobre la historia.

Ning√∫n personaje pronuncia una sola palabra, lo √∫nico que escuchas son melod√≠as o gritos que el protagonista puede emitir o la banda sonora acertada para cada momento (adem√°s de todos los efectos de sonido propios del videojuego, obviamente muchachos).

author: {'steamid': '76561198062025694', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1556732331}
review:
Una aventura que sin decir una palabra, es capas de decir mucho.

Este juego es una de esas joyas que suelen pasar inadvertidas, pero que vale la pena jugar. Es un juego de exploraci√≥n y el progreso lo vas logrando a base de resolver puzzles, los cuales nunca son tan complejos, por lo que no se hace tedioso el juego en ningun momento, adem√°s a pesar de poder recorrer los distintos mapas, es bastante "lineal" as√≠ que tampoco uno se pierde.

Por donde comenzar, el apartado gr√°fico es incre√≠ble, quiz√° el punto m√°s alto, acompa√±ado de una buena banda sonora, una jugabilidad sencilla, y una historia que a medida que avanzas, se va haciendo m√°s interesante hasta el punto final. Todo esto resulta en un gran juego, disfrutable y de una duraci√≥n justa y necesaria.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004496223', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1556619753}
review:
RiME is a little adventure game that really surpassed my expectations. Beautiful and inspiring sound track, interesting puzzles, stunning graphics and a thought provoking story.

Before I begin, I will stress that this game takes TIME. The story has a very slow pace and there is no real context given to the player at the beginning of the game. Therefore, the puzzles you complete and the setting can seem a bit .. strange. But all will be explained and believe me, it is worth the wait! Only until about halfway through the game did I gain any sort of inclination as to what I was actually doing and what it had to do with anything, but nevertheless, the quest to find answers is the purpose of the game and it definitely kept me wanting to discover more.

RiME encompasses many different settings and does so beautifully, from bright and sunny to dark and melancholy. Each scene is well crafted and perfectly utilises light to encapsulate the emotion it intended (especially the last few scenes). It also includes many underwater locations which were one of my favourite environments due to the gorgeous graphics. The majority of the playtime for this game is spent like a platformer, jumping from ledge to ledge and completing a task or puzzle.

As the game is tagged, it is a puzzle game, and although there is nothing too difficult, there are many aspects to the puzzles which keep things interesting. Despite this, the focus and I believe, strong point of the game is definitely its adventure filled world and subsequent story behind it all. Possibly due to this focus, the developers have been quite forgiving and in the rare chance that you actually do die from the handful of baddies who have the capacity to kill you; you will re-spawn very close to where you died and simply just pick up where you left off. 

 As a bit of an extra, you can stray away from main objectives which are conveyed to the player by following a helpful fox and find tonnes of collectables. This also ticks the box for collectors, or those looking for a second play-through. 

Unfortunately, RiME is a victim of very noticeable frame drops. In a select few scenes it is extremely laggy for no apparent reason and it can only be overcome by simply moving to the next scene. This isn't a deal breaker for me but it certainly wasn't fun and did take away from my experience, considering the heavy immersive focus that the game intended.

Lastly, the price tag. Yes the $AU40 price tag seems substantially high for a short (4-7 hour game, depending on collectables). But before I become too pedantic, RiME is a game that is repeatedly bundled together with other games and also heavily discounted on many popular sites for as little as $4. With that in mind, it is hard to fault RiME as it incorporates everything an adventure lover looks for. Although it is difficult to truly describe what this game is about without unveiling any spoilers, I can definitely recommend this to fellow adventure lovers. Don't overlook this little hidden gem like I did, its absolutely worth your time.

If you liked this review, please follow my curator page for more: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34936724/

author: {'steamid': '76561198060522914', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1556482999}
review:
The best Story a Game ever had that I`ve played!
RiME is a beatiful game that let`s you start in a free world without any idea what`s going on and the ability to find to roam around and do what you want. As you slowly go deeper into the game it becomes more clear what everything is about and this beatiful story finnally peaces together.

All this accompanied by the best game music i`ve ever heard and really really beatiful graphic.
I can recommend this game for anyone that wants to calm down after a long day of work and just dive into a wonderful world with a magical story!

Thanks to Tequila Works and anyone involved for creating this masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066621949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1556530140}
review:
Very atmospheric and emotional game. The game is overal pretty short and has some pacing issues here and there but the atmosphere and music make up for it.
The only downside is the poor optimization that can drag the overal experience down if your PC is unable to keep a smooth framerate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029845108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1687581595}
review:
Beautiful, beautiful game in every possible way, the story, the imagery, the music, the emotional connection.  I absolutely loved the entire experience.  I'm not certain this game will be for everybody, but if you're a fan of this genre (Ico, SOMA, etc.) it's a must play.

Ok so that's the very good part.  The not so good?  Well, the PC port optimization is unfortunately not that great, so you're going to have to live with pretty poor framerates, even if you have a decent graphics card and CPU (normally I don't care that much about this, but it was sometimes quite noticeable to the point of being distracting).

author: {'steamid': '76561198440508601', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1556064629}
review: Um jogo repleto de mist√©rio e aventura... A constru√ß√£o art√≠stica dos cen√°rios √© sensacional e cont√©m uma trilha sonora linda e emocionante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068537925', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1556360052}
review:
Camera movements are very annoying. For example when you run along a long bridge the camera starts moving up and tilting.... That means if you hold W to run forward, it will run of the bridge. I can see how this would be easier with a controller, but come on... I am playing this on windows not on console and the preferred input method is mouse and keyboard. Also what a terrible game design idea of moving the camera so a person could enjoy the view... Instead you end up focusing on your walking because the controls become counter intuitive.

The triggers for keys should be increased. I have tried entering a couple and they failed... Ended up walking for 5 minutes all around just to come back and try a couple different angles where one of them worked.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024592582', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1556024770}
review:
RiME es un juego de exploraci√≥n y de puzzles. Aunque al principio me tir√© mucho tiempo recorriendo cada rinc√≥n del mapa para descubrir todos los secretos, y es algo bastante entretenido. despu√©s de un tiempo me cans√© y dej√© la exploraci√≥n de lado para centrarme en los puzzles y la historia.

Es un buen juego, los puzzles son de empujar cosas e interactuar con botones, estilo Zelda. Los niveles son bastante amplios, no he encontrado ning√∫n coleccionable por casualidad, s√≥lo los he encontrado buscando intencionadamente por zonas por donde sospechaba que se pod√≠a explorar.

La historia, aunque al principio no se entiende, se revela bastante bien y da sentido a los diferentes niveles del juego.

Lo recomiendo incluso si, como yo, no le sacas el 100% de los logros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963293186', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1697507124}
review:
RiME √© um jogo surpreendente, me atraiu visualmente por me fazer lembrar de ICO, um exclusivo de PS2 que √© at√© hoje um de meus jogos favoritos, por√©m este tem suas pr√≥prias qualidades, dentre elas um estilo art√≠stico e visual deslumbrantes, que acompanhados de uma trilha sonora maravilhosa, tornam toda a experi√™ncia um prazer imenso de jogar.

Puzzles em geral n√£o trazem grandes desafios, assim como a jogabilidade n√£o incomoda em nenhum momento, √© t√£o agrad√°vel quanto seu visual e seus sons, afinal este √© um jogo que foca em te levar aos poucos √† compreens√£o de algo muito maior, cheio de pequenas mensagens ocultas em cada momento de seus cinco cap√≠tulos. Cap√≠tulos estes que se tornam cada vez mais intensos e cheios de emo√ß√£o, com um final que ir√° mexer profundamente com voc√™.

Recomendo este jogo √† absolutamente qualquer pessoa, pois para mim √© uma verdadeira obra prima, um dos motivos pelos quais eu amo tanto os videogames e agora ocupando um lugar na minha lista de favoritos da vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979996881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1555895051}
review: I wasn't quite ready for it to end, so I guess it's a little shorter than I would've liked, but still quite a bit here to enjoy.  The puzzles felt a lot like the Zelda games of recent years without all the mucking about with combat, and I liked that.  I didn't come near to getting all the collectibles (nor even half the achievements), and I really tried to be thorough in my exploring, so there are clearly lots of hidden secrets squirreled away.

review: He de decir que en un primer momento no esperaba demasiado de RiME, tan solo un juego de puzzles con una estetica llamativa y un ritmo relajante. Cumple con lo que esperaba, un juego facil y visualmente bueno, pero ademas hay que a√±adirle una historia poderosamente emotiva y a la vez muy simple, como historia y en la forma de contarla.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018240182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1555816645}
review: Rime is a beautiful, minimalist game in the same vein as Ico, Shadow of the Colossus and Journey.  The soundtrack is amazing and truly complements the moments you experience throughout the game.  If you liked any of the games mentioned above you will probably enjoy Rime as well and I'd encourage you to give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013670433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1555728647}
review: Muy buen juego. Corto (unas 5 horas aprox.), pero muy bien hecho. Todo el dise√±o del juego es espectacular, y minimalista casi al extremo. Los puzzles son simples excusas para continuar la historia, que es muy buena. En conclusi√≥n: un juego muy recomendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086828514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1556396588}
review: Incredible, one of my favorite games of all time. It is a beautiful game and I won't say much else without spoiling anything other than get the game if you like esoteric, philosophical, atmospheric, exploration, and/or emotional games. It isn't for everyone because if you don't understand the story and pay attention the subtleties as you play through, you won't enjoy it. But if you do get the subtleties of the game, it becomes absolutely amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198362381469', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1555715586}
review:
"I wish they'd add a neutral review option... like a sideways hand." - my friend on discord.

I had a decently positive experience with this, but I still can't really recommend it. It kinda peaks in the first hour and a half and maybe again in the last 30 minutes. The game is slow, the puzzles are stupid simple, and the platforming is imprecise to a huge fault. That last part is pretty important, because nothing ruins the mood quicker than reaching the end of a platforming section and instead of jumping up, the character jumps 4 stories to his death. Shame, since the mood and visuals are easily the best thing this game has going for it.

The first couple of chapters are really great. You get to run around these beautiful, open locations. It feels like everywhere you go there's something cool to see (architecture, animals, collectibles). But starting in the second chapter, the game begins to feel more linear, mostly due to the addition of a mechanic that actively prevents you from anything other than making a beeline from enclosed location to enclosed location. The rest of the game progresses in the same kind of way, creating this upside down pyramid of limitation on how far you can explore. By the end of the game, you'll literally be running a circular maze to do puzzles. Understand that there is a thematic reason for this progression, but it kind of drags a lot of the fundamental problems with this game into the spotlight.

Outside of visiting a bunch of cool locations, there really isn't that much to do. The puzzles are easy and the platforming is restrictive. Huge missed opportunity with the vocalize command, since its really only used to initiate cutscenes and solve puzzles (read: open doors). Oh yeah, sometimes you can sing along with the soundtrack. No where in the game is it more than just 'something you can do.'

All in all, I found the first couple of chapters delivered an amazing sense of exploration and wonder, but the game lost a lot of its luster once every location became a bunch of hallways. Recommended only if you have the patience to sit through the slow sections to get to some great visuals.

This review isn't finished lol. I'll update this review later with what I thought about the story once something has coagulated into coherency (I didn't love it).

author: {'steamid': '76561198059411279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1696009960}

author: {'steamid': '76561198111571140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1555709693}
review:
[b]TL;DR[/b]
After a painful beginning to what I thought would be an underwhelming experience, RiME really shocked me with how deep its story was willing to go. The problems I had with the game were replaced with a wonderfully gentle ride through heaven, and I can't express enough how shocking it was how much I ended up loving this game. The puzzles, the graphics, the story all made for an experience so incredible it was worth the confusing introduction.

[table]
   [tr]
      [th]Area of Game[/th]
      [th]Score[/th]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Gameplay[/td]
      [td]22/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Visuals[/td]
      [td]24/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Music/Sound[/td]
      [td]24/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Story/Characters[/td]
      [td]25/25[/td]
   [/tr]

   [tr]
      [td]Verdict[/td]
      [td]95/100[/td]
   [/tr]
[/table]

If you told me 30 minutes into this game that I would fall in love with RiME and it would end up being one of my favorite games of all time, I probably would have laughed. I could have given an infinite amount of reasons why I wouldn't recommend this: it was glitchy, boring, a walking simulator, and the puzzles had no challenge to them. Let me be clear about this: I HATED playing this game for the first hour of it, but a lot of my complaints slowly... disappeared as I progressed through the game.

Before buying this game, I didn't know much about it. All I knew was the graphics reminded me of Breath of the Wild, and it was a puzzle game with very bright colors. I didn't bother to look further into it before buying because it was on sale for $5 and just thought of it as a quick buy. I had very low expectations before going in, and they were pretty much met with the beginning. I had trouble with the controls, the story seemed slow and stereotypical with the [spoiler]amnesia[/spoiler] and such. The music and visuals were good from the start, though.

As I got further and further in, my opinion slowly changed. I started to enjoy the puzzles more after getting the hang of the controls, and the story took turns I really didn't expect. [spoiler]The ending was absolutely heartbreaking, and wrapped up the story in a perfect way.[/spoiler]

Don't ignore this game. It will impact you in a way no other game will.

review:

J'en ai encore des fourmis dans les doigts de ce m√©lange d‚Äôexcitation, d‚Äôenvie de partager et d'√©motion. Je ne cesse de pleurer, parce que c'est beau et parce que la fin m'a pris aux tripes. I have just complete this game and I haven't stopped crying for the past hour. It's beautiful, touching and captivating, I still have pins and needles in my fingers from the mixture of emotions and the desire to share my feelings. I can't stop crying because it's so beautiful and the ending was breath-taking. For the people concerned by the game's subject matter, I think the game could be a wonderful aide and a deep comfort. It's delicious, troubling and almost perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157036927', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1555461208}
review:
Rime is a lovely fist person exploration game with some puzzle solving.  The story is good, but not great.  What I enjoyed most was having the ability to explore chapter by chapter, without having to worry about a huge open world.  Some people don't like collectibles, but I do and I enjoyed that part of it as well.  I also liked that once you completed the game, you could go back into each chapter and pick up anything you missed.   Best of all, it has achievements that are not ridiculously hard to get, but do require a bit of work.  Just the right balance, I think.

Issues:
 I had trouble using my 360 controller with the game -- some days it would work, the next day no.  

When I had to use keyboard/mouse the view would go out of bounds of the area you were in, especially when you were near a wall or cliff face, making it impossible to see.

The perspective was kind of wonky at times, but not enough to make it unplayable.

Overall a great game, that I would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094410904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1638164384}
review:
Having just finished this game, I almost feel like I am letting go of a good friend. Which I suppose the game devs kinda did lead me through just that sort of process. After all, this is a game about the grief associated with loss.
This was a wonderful puzzle game, but it lacks much replay value. Despite that though, I am really glad I got it. I may never play it again, but I believe I will always remember the emotional and mysterious story that they unfolded for me. I was fully absorbed throughout the process. I especially appreciated all of the thoughtful hidden extras I could go look for, or I could ignore if I wanted to stick to the story of the game without distraction. 
Overarching the rest is the wonderful artistry and vista views made the game a complete winner for me.

My one complaint:
- The controls where at times a bit difficult to deal with, especially when it was time to pick something up or drop it. It was also spotty with the call out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971395135', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1216, 'last_played': 1555443345}
review:
I was pleasantly surprised by this game.

I tend to avoid games that are too open ended/minimalist as I don't really like to walk around trying to find what to do next. But this game does a good job funneling you towards your next puzzle/objective without putting a huge arrow on the screen. I always found what I should be doing next within a minute or two.

The puzzles are mildly challenging but not frustrating. There were maybe 3-4 of points where I was stuck for 10 minutes, but the solutions were always obvious in retrospect. I only truly got stuck at one point and it turned out that it was just an issue of screen brightness (I couldn't see a ledge that was supposed to be obvious). I never needed to stop and look up a guide to proceed.

The world & story are abstract but it avoids feeling too pretentious. It's a sad tale that resonates strongly with me due to very recent events in my personal life.

I picked this up on sale and it was well worth the money.

review: "Ouch that hurt" Is what I said when I initially completed the game. but now? It's been a day, I've gone back for achievements and collectables, and I've had time to think and let my mind process the game as a whole. So now I feel more calm and at peace, and I think I really needed this in a way? I dunno. [spoiler] I think leaving this story feeling sad, but coming back to it then leaving feeling more peaceful is really relevant to the game as a whole. [/spoiler] A beautiful, thought provoking, amazing adventure that I'm gonna remember for a long time

review: RiME ist ein tolles Spiel f√ºr alle, die Atmosph√§re und Melancholische Abenteuer lieben. Die R√§tsel sind eher einfach gehalten, was aber sehr gut zum jugendlichen Protagonisten passt. Wer eine spielerische Herausforderung sucht, ist mit anderen Titeln besser beraten, aber wer in eine Andere Welt entf√ºhrt werden m√∂chte, liegt mit RiME goldrichtig. Eine definitive Empfehlung von mir!

author: {'steamid': '76561198104392527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1547011392}
review:
Similar to the game [i]AER[/i] which I just gave a little review to, this game, [i]RiME[/i], is also an exploration-based platformer with puzzles, all wrapped up with artistic design. However, [i]RiME[/i] is a much longer game, with more variety in its areas and types of puzzles. Both games have some fantasy land you are in, along with some mystic themes, where you are left to figure out what is happening. The difference there is that [i]AER[/i] had lore via text and a few NPCs, whereas [i]RiME[/i] has no text or dialogue at all, to my recollection. Nevertheless, I would say that [i]RiME[/i]'s story is much quicker to realize by the time you see the ending moments, and it had a much heavier impact on me.

Anyway, I am not quite good at reviewing artistic games like these, because there is usually minimalism in the plot design (or at least for most of the game), thus I can't really discuss that. And they tend to be games where you simply navigate and progress, solving puzzles. [i]RiME[/i] is broken up into 5 sections, each with a different environment that adds onto the puzzles you have been doing, and at some points, even adds enemies for you to avoid or "defeat" in a particular way.

In the end, these types of games are mainly focused on the journey that is going on and what everything means. If you are looking for something like that, then give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872764946', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1590253446}
review: This game is very impactful not only with the stunning visuals but with a great story as well. i got this game the day it came out on Xbox one, and got every achievement except one due to a glitch but still enjoyed the game. i soon got a PC and re bought the game to experience it all over again. It is extremely fun and i would recommend it to anyone. Once you realize the tone of the story and its symbolism it hits you hard. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198319596134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1641483173}
review:
Loved it.

1) It was greatly enjoyable to search for all the hidden collectibles and discover their own meanings by myself. I think not only the collectibles but also all the other elements of this game such as the monsters, the fox, and even how you should solve some of the puzzles have implications related to the story.

2) Puzzles and controls were not that hard or repetitive, which I also liked. Some of the motions maybe a little confusing and awkward when climbing walls, but the scenery is so satisfying that none of those seem to matter that much while playing.

3) Soundtrack is AMAZING. It really  enhances the immersion to the game and the story.

4) Except the first chapter, the mood of the game may be a little frustrating but quite thrilling at the same time, which I also pretty much enjoyed.

I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who liked playing The Legend of Zelda and who loves finding details with symbolic meanings.



<SPOIL ALERT> And to the ones who can't seem to unlock a door in chapter 2 because the bird comes right after you before you put the key in place: you shouldn't have put the first key into the keyhole and gone out of the room. Just start over from the last checkpoint, and you'll have two keys dangling on your back. Then go to the room again and the bird won't come to chase you anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025415796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1555113540}
review: Ico or Shadow of the Colossus it is not. I loved these games. Played through them at my pace . No as a "pro video game player"to see how fast I could finish them for achievement points. Although it may not be the aforementioned games, the game is beautiful. It has the same spirit of them and would easily fit in their game world if told it was part of trilogy.  It takes the best of many puzzle games, including these two, and incoporates them beautifully into game world. This game is more magical and more alive then ico or shadow, but unfortunately it's plagued by open world syndrome. Slowdowns and stutters. Same bugs that plaque fallout and elder scrolls series. I believe real time shadowing has a lot to do with it .Making the overall pc requirements much higher than advertised. Certain areas are more noticeable than others. But not so severe as to hamper gameplay. It's like a pebble in the  shoe. Annoying but still highly playable. If it was'nt for this, the game would of been a perfect 10. I give it an 8.5. The graphics and music are of epic proportion. I would of wished the developers spent more time ironing it out . Bought it on sale. Would of happily spent much more after experiencing this work of art. It shows that this game was developed by a gamers.

review: ÊØè‰∏ÄÂÖ≥ÁöÑÈ£éÊ†ºÈÉΩÊòØÊ†πÊçÆÁà∂‰∫≤Â§±ÂéªËá™Â∑±Â≠©Â≠êÁöÑÂøÉÊÉÖËÄåÂèòÂåñÁöÑ„ÄÇÁà∂‰∫≤‰∏ÄÂºÄÂßã‚ÄúÂê¶ÂÆö‚ÄùÂ≠©Â≠êÂ∑≤ÁªèÂ§±ÂéªÁöÑ‰∫ãÂÆûÔºåÂà∞ÂêéÈù¢ÂèàÂõ†‰∏∫Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑÊó†ËÉΩËÄå‚ÄúÊÑ§ÊÄí‚ÄùÔºåÂ§±Âéª‰∫ÜÂ≠©Â≠êÁöÑÁà∂‰∫≤ÊãøÁùÄÂâ©‰∏ãÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÂéª‚Äú‰∫§Êòì‚ÄùÔºå‚Äú‰∫§Êòì‚Äù‰πãÂêéÂèàÂºÄÂßãÂèòÂæó‚ÄúÊ≤Æ‰∏ß‚Äù„ÄÇÈöèÁùÄÊó∂Èó¥ÁöÑÊé®ÁßªÔºåÊÇ≤ÁóõÊ¨≤ÁªùÁöÑÁà∂‰∫≤ÈÄâÊã©‚ÄúÊé•Âèó‚ÄùËøô‰∏ÄÊÇ≤ÊÉ®ÁöÑ‰∫ãÂÆû„ÄÇ

author: {'steamid': '76561198042796164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1712221370}
review:
A fun and beautiful, yet short and easy game that was easily worth the $6 I payed for it on special.
I found it to be a perfect combination of sightseeing adventure and problem solving for a game with zero combat.
For a smooth experience I played on max settings at a stable 60fps in 1080p, because the game has some performance issues, and it ran flawlessly and looked amazing.
There is always something special about playing a game with no HUD.
Gifted to a friend after completion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108996934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1555194583}
review:
Absolutely love this game. The graphics are nice, beautiful music and smooth game play. the puzzles are easy enough to get through without too much trouble and just challeging enough to keep you alert. 
Despite the odd camera angel every now and then the game play very smooth. 

The story is quite amazing, there is no dialogue, no words or language and yet a whole story is being told.  Got to say though I did not see that ending coming, but that made it all the more worthwhile to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049669834', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1574795955}
review:
What i thought i was buying? Cartoon-ish walking simulator.
What i've got? One hellova feeltrip.
10/10 would get crippling depression again.

Jokes and spoilers aside. 
RiME is a lovely game where you explore the mysterious island and trying to figure the way out of it through puzzles. 
Graphics: The visuals of this game are just gorgeous and breathaking. Smooth animations with rich details. 
Gameplay: Casual, relaxing 'walking simulator'-you're exploring the island, solving puzzles (most of them are quite easy, yet with each level they are getting bit complicated), sometimes can be bit clunky during climbing (specially camera) but nothing what can ruin your experience.
Story: Without saying a single word, the game managed to 'tell' powerful story- especially when you paying attention to little details such paintings or statues. Exploration rewards players with more information (it kinda reminds me Dark Souls games when you must work out to get piece of information and also using imagination ((or you can go to wiki where it's spoiler-free, but where's fun in that?)) 
Sound: In short- it's beautiful. Sealing the atmosphere and capturing emotions excellently.
Last thought: While RiME isn't perfect (having few flaws) and the plot twist (or even type of the game) definitelly ain't for everyone, i'd highly recommended it anyway. Sometimes you just want to lie back a bit, chill & discover the unknown. 
Final verdict: 8/ 10 - It's an art.
