author: {'steamid': '76561198035898856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1555184318}
review:
7.5/10 . Relatively simple "adventure" gameplay bolsters a story that manages to be vague without being esoteric, and which becomes increasingly understandable as the ending approaches.

Presentation: The game looks good. The art design isn't technically impressive, but it's stylistically good. The music is really, really good. The game seems a little poorly optimized, in that my Vega 56 was humming rather loudly the entire time on Ultra at 1440p (with TSAA), but it was 60 FPS throughout the game as I could tell.

Mechanics: The gameplay of Rime is fairly basic. You can run around, jump, roll, interact with things, or yell. I never encountered a use for rolling, but the others get plenty of use. You primarily solve environmental puzzles and do light platforming. Neither is difficult, but that's not really the focus of this game. There are collectibles scattered throughout the world that you can find; most are meaningless, but at least one is related to the game's story.

Story: You play as a little boy in a world with no other people, there're no voiced lines, you have an animal friend. I didn't really have any clue what was going on until maybe an hour before the end, and even now there are elements I'm unsure of. As I mentioned when talking about the mechanics, there's one set of collectibles which seems to describe the game's story, and after the game's finished there's a pretty big hint in the Main Menu, but I wasn't able to find all of the former, and even with the latter as mentioned there are still things I'm curious about. Overall I think it broaches a meaningful subject in an interesting way.

Worth pointing out: I finished this in 5 hours. Is this worth $30? H*ll no. $15? Heck no. $10? If you're desperate for a game to play. $5? Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844129801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1555144488}
review:
Excelente obra!!! Recomendada para cualquiera que quiera ver una historia y arte hermosos. Su banda musical complementa a la perfecci√≥n con algunos momentos muy altos en su nivel. 
Con respecto a la historia es un disfrute por completo, una introducci√≥n que no da muchas pistas pero a lo largo del juego se va armando la idea. Un final espectacular y claro para que pueda ser analizado y entendido por todo tipo de p√∫blico.
Mec√°nicas de juego sencillas y f√°ciles de comprender, al igual que los puzzles (no tienen demasiada complejidad) pero no dejan de ser originales.
El √∫nico detalle que afecta, pero solo por momentos, es en las plataformas. Algunos saltos por la posici√≥n de la c√°mara no sale dirigido hacia donde uno cre√≠a (pero es un detalle m√≠nimo, luego te acostumbras).
Sin m√°s que decir, recomendado 100%.
Felicidades al grupo Tequila por un trabajo espectacular!!!
Lo disfrut√© y sent√≠ mucho!! Gracias por esta obra!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006772462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1555110503}
review:
Am Anfang war ich echt begeistert und war Beeindruckt von einem tollen Indiegame. Sch√∂ne Grafik, handgemachte Spielwelt und interessante Aufgaben. Allerdings war ich schwer Entt√§uscht als ich das letzte f√ºnftel des Spiels gespielt habe. Das Ende ist meiner Meinung nach eher lieblos gestaltet worden. Eine magische andere Welt wird einfach durch ein trauriges Ende zerst√∂rt. Dieser Handlungsbogen ist meiner Meinung nach v√∂llig unangebracht und schw√§cht das Spielerlebnis insgesamt ab. 

Wenn man schon eine andere magische Welt baut, sollte man auch dabei bleiben. Au√üerdem bin ich der Meinung das es wichtig ist bis zum Ende hin sein Niveau durchzuhalten. Hier ging den Entwicklern echt die Puste aus auf den letzten 400m.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015894150', 'num_games_owned': 966, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1581365398}
review: Por el momento y sin fix de parte de los desarrolladores , es imposible darle un positivo a este juego, es bello? si, tiene buena musica ? totalmente, es divertido? bue.. eso.. podriamos preguntarnoslo bastante, pero lo que falla rotundamente es su performance, el juego tiembla hasta con los graficos al minimo, y cabe aclarar que mi equipo se aguanta hasta el BFV en ultra. el otro tema muyy mal manejado es la camara, definitivamente los muchachos de tequila works no han sabido implementar tecnicas solidas de camaras en tercera persona, por momentos parece que solo dejaron la camara como viene en el template de TPS del UE4. Una lastima por RIME ,porque sinceramente se ve espectacular, pero se torna injugable e indisfrutable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987044828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1554977408}
review: This game is so fucking beautiful it's painful to turn off your screen and be forced to face the disgustingly ugly reality of the crappy "real world". You can truly feel the heat from the sun, the searing stones you traverse and the salty air from the pulsing ocean surrounding the island you find yourself stranded on. Great platforming as well, and a touch of mystery that constantly keeps you moving forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069912836', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1555279387}
review:
It's boring and overpriced. There is no goal, no motivation. You have no idea, what you are doing or why. Nothing has a rime or reason (get it?)

The controls are extremly reduced and irritatingly slow. And yet they are not intuitive. The game has to show button prompts at the very end. You cannot run or center the camera. Also, the camera clips with the walls all the time what takes you out and makes this feel cheap. 

There is not enough depth to the gameplay or the narrative to make you want to explore. The world is far from open. It is very linear. There are collectibles, but they are all inconsequental. Nothing you need or that's insightful. I thought about checking out the back side of a cliff but I didn't want to walk back in case there is nothing there. No game should get you this far.

All these beautiful visuals and marvelous places are without meaning or relevance. You don't need language to convey a story, but all other rules still apply and none of these were considered, therefore the game is not capitivating. The story is pretentious, anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198402214760', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1560263649}
review:
A compelling game straight off the mark that I managed to complete in 10 hours.  There were a ton of collectibles I didn‚Äôt collect and a ton of cheevos I didn‚Äôt cheev, so maybe you can get more out of this game.  At my playtime I would consider Rime a tad on the expensive side but it has been bundled and rebundled and goes on sale often.  It is an adventure platformer game featuring a great story.  Wait for a sale if your wallet can‚Äôt handle the price tag.  If you can't handle the price tag then pick up AER Memories of Old for the time being as it shares a lot of qualities with this game.
_______________________

PROS  
+ Beautiful art style.  Everything is richly coloured and detailed but at the same time a bit blocky.    
+ The soundtrack is amazing.  There are very emotional swelling pieces of music throughout the game that add a whole new level of detail to the experience.
+ Story.  Without ever saying a word Rime gives us an amazing story in great detail.  It uses powerful visuals, music and level design to push forward its narrative.
+ Excellent level design on the whole.  It is a very corridor exploration game when it is ushering you into the next area or trying to get on with the story but there are also some tougher puzzles that will have you needing some time to think how to progress.
+The sounds.  All the sounds in the game feel very real and match the environment. Everything from the waves crashing onto the beach, the thunder, the slap of your bare feet on sand or stone to the seagulls screetching are organic and sound amazing.
________________________

CONS
- Some parts of the game drag out a bit too long for me.  
- Controls can be a bit frustrating, especially in some of the platforming parts.
________________________

I‚Äôm not going to spoil Rime in any way.  It is a game with a really strong story where you are firmly in the shoes of the protagonist and are discovering this strange world exactly as he is.  It reminds me a lot of the old school Tomb Raider games where we find ourselves in self-contained areas that we have to traverse and pull levers in order to advance.  Rime has a ton of places to explore and a tons of screenshots waiting to be taken.  If you want to delve into a world that is (mostly) non-threatening and live out a story then you need Rime in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041307113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 846, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1684117659}
review:
I was initially referred to this game by people on the Quern and The Witness game forums who were comparing it to those games and putting all three into the 'Mystlike' category; now that I've played the thing I can say that's an inaccurate comparison as while the game has puzzles in it and is set on an island there isn't much else about it that is particularly Myst-like. Nonetheless, I wanted to give the game the chance to stand on its own merits irrespective of what other people are advertising it as... and there are still quite a few problems with it.

* The puzzles are not the Myst-type point-and-click puzzles but the sort from Portal or Talos Principle which involve picking up and moving around different objects with the 'use' key. I personally prefer the Myst style, but irrespective of that the puzzles here are simpler and not especially challenging.
* There also weren't very many of them. In fact, the world seems 'larger' than it needs to be, with a lot of time spent just getting from one place to another which is not helped by how slow your top speed is. The game is arguably more of a platformer than a puzzle game, but the platforming is also pretty straightforward and isn't very satisfying: it's always pretty clear where to go, and your movement is pretty restricted; it doesn't feel nimble and quick the way, say, the Sly Cooper games did. 
* As it progresses the game attempts to get increasingly symbolic and 'psychological', but it's not especially compelling or even really all that important. There really wasn't a lot *to* the game looking back; I was able to power through it in a little under a day.

If you came here looking for a Myst-like "Island Puzzle" game you are better off playing The Witness, Quern, or even Talos Principle; even if that's not what you were specifically expecting I can't say I'd recommend it unless the game is expanded in the future to be less full of itself and more full of actual content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1652632509}
review:
[url=https://youtu.be/JqYknuRXG78][b]Video review[/b][/url]

[h1]Aaaah![/h1]

This game really surprised me. I didn‚Äôt expect much, I expected a half assed attempt at a walking simulator but I‚Äôve a great platformer/puzzle game with amazing art, soundtrack and story.

You wake up on the beach not knowing what happened and start your journey. At first you take your time to admire the scenery because this game is really beautiful. Simplistic cell-shaded graphics was a good choice for artistic design. There‚Äôs also no hud so nothing get in a way and can fully immerse in the world.
The story is really sad in this one, it‚Äôs beautiful but when you realize what‚Äôs happening you understand how sad the story really is.

Gameplay is pretty basic. You run around in an open environment and explore every corner of it. Although it‚Äôs not necessary to explore everything, I highly suggest you do that. You progress the game by solving puzzles and collecting some items. Puzzles are not too hard so they don‚Äôt break the flow of the game. This is really more of a narrative game than puzzle, so difficult puzzles would just ruin the experience.

Every level is different and represents something else. You‚Äôll climbing, uncovering secrets, avoid monsters, run, jump and yell. Yes there‚Äôs a lot of yelling. You interact with thing by yelling. There‚Äôs also a cute friendly fox who will guide you through the levels.
The only downsides I notices are that camera angles sometimes are annoying and climbing controls could be better.

Graphically the game looks stunning. The visual are very clean and minimalistic from the first sight, but there‚Äôs so much detail everywhere. Levels are very well crafted. Overall graphics are a work of art. Although the performance can be little disappointing. I don‚Äôt know why this runs worse than AC origins. I had to lower some settings to get 60fps and even then I experience big fps drops. Optimization is not very good.

Soundtrack just adds another layer of awesomeness to this game. It fits the aesthetics of the game very well and makes it so much better.

I recommend this game for those who enjoys good stories, well balanced gameplay and beautiful visuals. Don‚Äôt miss this game.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Beautiful graphics
[*]Great sound design
[*]Sad story
[*]Balanced gameplay
[*]Many different locations
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Performance could be better
[/list]

review:
Rime ist ein sehr liebevoll gestaltetes Spiel mit einer traurigen aber fesselden Geschichte. Die Grafik ist zum Teil Comicartig gehalten, was aber nicht st√∂rt und insgesamt sehr gut aussieht.

Die Soundkulisse ist toll, der Soundtrack wundervoll. Die Musik ist sehr gut gew√§hlt und passend zu Stimmung hinterlegt.
In der Welt von Rime gibt es sehr viel zu sammeln und zu erkunden, was sehr positiv ist, da man dadurch mehr √ºber die Insel und die Geschichte erf√§hrt. Die Schwierigkeit der R√§tsel ist von leicht bis schwer vorhanden. Also ein sehr guter Mix von allem.

Einzig was man vielleicht als Kritik erw√§hnen kann, w√§re die Spielzeit. Man ist mit knapp 10 Stunden durch mit dem Spiel.

Definitiv zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992786274', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1553495519}
review:
RiME had me charmed in an instant. It reminded me of other walking sims/puzzle platformers and like others, it was pleasing to look at, to listen to and to explore. I never truly felt lost (until very late in the game), each direction I chose seemed to unlock something and get me somewhere. The pacing was also quite nice, with the sense of urgency and danger rising with each new location.

Since I was streaming, I skipped many of the collectibles. Luckily, the game has a great menu for selecting previous stages to acquire what I missed so if I ever go back to try to 100%, I don't have to replay it all from the beginning.

While I wasn't super impressed by the story/ending, it was really the paths that it took me through that mattered to me. When I struggled with a puzzle, it was generally because of some simple thing that I had looked over or didn't notice.

I definitely recommend this game to fans of the genre. It's a (mostly) relaxing look into another world, and who could get tired of doing that?

author: {'steamid': '76561198046881436', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1696087668}
review:
Reviews for Rime seem mostly mixed. Some think it's a walking simulator. Others think it's all bling no ding.

For me personally, Rime was as captivating and enchanting as some of the more well known titles such as Abzu and Shadow of the Colossus, similarly, Journey too.  

Rim is an interesting game in that yes, most puzzles are easily solvable, the story is a bit vague, and the gameplay is limited, but behind these rather minor concerns, you have an extremely vibrant, absolutely extravagantly designed game. The visuals are utterly astounding, some of the best, most timeless art style's paired with an absolutely phenomenal soundtrack that makes you weep and soar in all the right moments. 

I had an absolute blast playing this game. I had my fair share of frustration with certain aspects, but the pro's here absolutely outweighed the cons for me. Not many games make me genuinely cry. Kudos to Tequila Works for making such a mesmerising, and truly beautiful narrative that I could lose myself in for some of the most emotional 6 hours I've had in a while. Truly, thank you.

Pro's:

Timeless, bright and diverse art style reminiscent of the Wind Waker days.
Truly captivating and wonderful soundtrack that can and does take you on an adventure of its own.
Easy control scheme with some interesting game elements.
Vague, but decipherable story with heavy themes and strong emotional appeal.
A good dose of wonder and mystery as you unravel said story to unveil the meanings and symbolism. 
Not a 'hold your hand' styled game, get yourself out there and learn for yourself!
Well balanced puzzles that promote progress and a little thought without stopping you dead in your tracks long enough to get flustered.
Diverse environments to experience and explore, never feeling dull.

Cons: 

Though I listed this as a pro, it can also be a con. Puzzles are relatively easy, some more intermediate and even hard puzzles requiring multiple aspects of gameplay, such as the use of lights and your ability to create them would have been a bonus here.
Missable collectables create the need  for a rerun which ultimately detracts from the purity of a one time run, sadly diminishing  the emotional weight.
Somewhat slow character movement may prove annoying at times.
Steep price point for a standard 4-6 hour experience, and a 6-8 hour experience if you want to 100% it. Also expensive when considering the soundtrack is not included.


Honestly can't find much to fault with this game. I had a wonderful experience, and I hope you do too.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198055749981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1553550211}
review:
I wasn't expecting much from this game other than it looking really pretty but its more than just that. I strongly recommend this game to anyone wanting a relaxing and heartfelt story, you can tell this game was a labour of love. 

If you like relaxing puzzle adventure games then you'll most likely enjoy RiME. There is no dialogue, combat, health or even text (apart from button prompts) in this game so it ends up just being a relaxing experience which you're supposed to unwind and take at your own leisure. The only two things you can really do in this game is walk around and interact with things, which you'll be doing a lot to solve puzzles and discover collectables. If that doesn't sound appealing then it might not be for you.

The visuals of the game is absolutely stunning in my opinion as it uses shape and form to really help the environments and structures pop, add on top of that great colour and lighting and you have some amazing looking levels that you can just stare at for hours. The use of reflections in the metals and the shaders for the water look fantastic too. I honestly can't get enough of the visuals of this game!

The soundtrack is phenomenal and you owe it to yourself to listen to it. If you love the Ghibli soundtracks then this will blow you away. During gameplay it uses audio cues and blends them with the music to help make certain moments really stand out and it really adds to the feelings you'll be experiencing throughout.

Performance wise the game is mostly great, I noticed there was a huge performance hit with SSAA turned on, no matter what other settings you changed (im running a RTX 2070 and i7 7700k) it would always dip below 60fps. Turning it down to TXAA or FXAA will increase performance greatly. Other than that it ran great for me!

Oh and the game has native support for 21:9! Which is a huge plus for me.

review:
This game goes right for the feels. It doesn't need a single word to tell a better story than most games with 20 times more playtime and thousands of lines of dialogue.

It shook me up, it made me cry, it made me think about the things that happened in my life and how I dealt with them. Thanks for making this artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026069616', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1552856198}
review:
The only remarkable about this game is its visuals, everything else is very mediocre.

The camera takes away the control way too often, when it is actually not necessary. The controls didn't feel responsive. I stopped counting how often I needed to press the action button twice, just because the object to interact with was a bit too far off or not finished with its animation.

And I really don't get the story, regarding it's ending. [spoiler]Maybe your journey is the manifestation of the memories and the grief of the boy's father. Because you - the boy - are basically dead.[/spoiler]

All in all the 5 to 6 hours are definitely not worth the requested price tag of 35‚Ç¨. Play Abzu instead!

review:
Rime es un juego de puzzles y plataformas donde controlaremos a un ni√±o perdido en una isla, que ir√° descubriendo los secretos que oculta, pasando por zonas √°ridas, bosques o incluso ruinas.
LO BUENO:
- El gran punto a favor y lo m√°s destacable del juego es su calidad art√≠stica. Los escenarios son putamente preciosos, y siempre te quedar√°s mir√°ndolos y apreciando el escenario.
- La banda sonora es correcta, pero logra encajar perfectamente con todos los momentos del juego.
- Las animaciones est√°n muy trabajadas: C√≥mo baja una ladera, la forma de rodar, la forma de correr... Todos los movimientos est√°n muy logrados.
- La historia no parece ser gran cosa y puede parecer apenas inexistente, pero todo cobra sentido a medida que va terminando el juego, con un gran final.
LO MALO:
- En un juego donde destacan las plataformas puede ser bastante frustrante que algunos saltos no los haga el personaje de forma correcta, o que tengas que pasar s√≠ o s√≠ por un saliente espec√≠fico, y no medio metro mas a la derecha. Adem√°s, muchas veces el personaje se quedar√° trabado en esquinas o con alg√∫n objeto aunque no lo est√©s ni siquiera rozando, lo que supongo que ser√° un fallo con las √°reas de colisi√≥n.
- Los puzzles no son para nada complicados. Quiero entender que no buscan lastrar la aventura o atascar al jugador, pero s√≠ que habr√≠a agradecido un par de puzzles que tuvieran algo m√°s de complejidad.
- Aunque el juego intenta que conectes con √©l, yo no he logrado sentirme unido al personaje y apenas he logrado empatizar (a excepci√≥n de un par de momentos).
- Durante gran parte del juego se me ha hecho divertido el juego, pero tengo que decir una cosa: El tercer nivel es, en mi opini√≥n, innecesariamente largo, y una zona que me termin√≥ aburriendo a partir de la segunda mitad del mismo.
CONCLUSI√ìN:
En general, Rime no es un mal juego, pero me da la sensaci√≥n de que podr√≠a haber sido mucho m√°s. Lo recomendar√≠a en caso de haber una buena oferta. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197997860863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1552172453}
review:
Un peu plus de 7h, voil√† ce qu'il m'a fallu pour terminer ce jeu et vous donner mon avis que j'esp√®re objectif.

J'√©tais parti pour pour parler d'exp√©rience mais je me ravise et parle bien ici d'un jeu.

RIME se veut √™tre l'h√©ritier de jeu comme ICO et Shadow of Colossus (SOC), c'est revendiqu√© et c'est une √©vidence.
Mais tout le monde n'a pas le talent de Fumito Ueda ou des art designers de ces derniers pour immerger, voir submerger, le joueur.

Le sc√©nario est original et, pourtant rompu √† tout les types de sc√©nario, je dois bien avouer n'avoir compris ce qui se passait r√©ellement qu'au dernier chapitre du jeu.
l'immersion dans celui-ci est bi-polaire, mon sentiment est que les d√©veloppeurs h√©sitent en permanence entre y allait √† fond comme le fond donc ICO et SOC, et se retenir de nous immerger plus pour justement rendre le jeu accessible m√™me √† un enfant de 8 ans. J'entends par l√† qu'ils √©viteraient de vouloir trop nous impliquer pour ne pas trop nous √©mouvoir.
Il en r√©sulte un une fable tr√®s po√©tique √† laquelle il manque ce petit truc nous permettant de nous attacher r√©ellement, on est plus spectateur qu'acteur.

RIME arrive donc toucher du bout du doigt ICO ET SOC sans pour autant les atteindre.
Mais ne vous y trompez pas RIME est un excellent jeu, avec des graphismes au parti pris graphique tr√®s inspir√©, un gameplay minimaliste (trop d'ailleurs? simpliste?) qui le rend accessible √† la majorit√© des joueurs, tous √¢ges confondus.

La camera qui suit nos aventures est ici proche d'√™tre parfaite mais est, sans que cela soit √† outrance ou de fa√ßon r√©currente, g√¢ch√©e par de petits couacs g√¢chant justement cette immersion.
On se retrouve contre un mur et la cam√©ra est face √† celui-ci, donnant √† l'√©cran un joli √©cran gris clair ou gris fonc√© fonction du d√©cor. les quatre ou cinq fois o√π je l'ai v√©cu sur la totalit√© peuvent para√Ætre anecdotique mais personnellement, quand je vis une histoire j'aime bien ne pas en √™tre d√©croch√© pour ce genre de choses. Et c'est d'autant plus dangereux dans la partie lorsqu'on est sur une corniche...

Ce sont sans doute ces points qui me font ranger ce jeu une fois fini, l√† o√π je suis retourn√© quatre une cinq fois sur ICO ET SOC.

Pourtant le jeu b√©n√©ficie d'un level design extr√™mement  bien fichu, au point parfois de s'y perdre.
Du moins jamais longtemps, car le jeu saura vous prendre par la main pour vite vous faire poursuivre l'aventure.
J'aimerai avoir ce genre de level design plus souvent dans des jeux vid√©o.
C'est le gros point positif num√©ro 1

Il reste alors √† perler de la partie sonore et musicale.
Ici par contre le but est atteint, si les bruitages sont minimalistes, ils sont suffisant et tombent toujours √† pic.
Quant √† la musique, sans √™tre mythologique, historique, ou inoubliable, elle reste superbe avec une mont√©e en puissance fr√™le mais pr√©sente toujours au bon moment. C'est le gros point positif num√©ro 2 du jeu.

En conclusion un tr√®s bon jeu, un chouillat trop court (10h de jeu minimum cela aurait √©t√© bien), qui oscille entre le tr√®s bon est l'excellent mais qui n'atteint pas hall of fame du fait de ses h√©sitations et de ses rares petites imperfections.
Je le conseille donc mais pas au prix fort, le payer entre 7 et 12 euros me semble correct.

author: {'steamid': '76561198842724859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1552039456}
review: Waited the whole game for the game element to start. Then it ended. The scenery was beautifully done, and some game element was there, it just needed more there to be worth $20. The controls are serviceable, the only problems I ran into were the ledge jumps, which could only happen if you pushed the analog stick at wonky angles, and the fact that you have to wait a second for the prompt to appear every time you want to perform an action with an object in the game.Which isn't a big deal at first, but in a puzzle game with trial and error, it gets tiring.  Also why do the climbing ledges look like they're covered in bird shit? [spoiler]And they kill the dog, [/spoiler]which is such an overdone cliche at this point it just sours the experience. Pick this up if it's on sale for $10 or less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250544676', 'num_games_owned': 3672, 'num_reviews': 323, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1552008162}
review:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/The_dull_games_reviewer

What can I say about RIME? I'm not sure I have the words to do it justice, so I'll just use some quotes from celebrities:

"It's all been rather lovely"
John Le Messurier, actor in the BBC comedy 'Dad's army', said those words before he died. He was ruminating on his life and not this game, but he probably would have said the same thing if he'd ever played it.

"RIME was alright to play, I guess. I prefer manlier activities like sticking my boot / shotgun / chainsaw up a demons butt. No! I'm not crying! Just got some....um... acidic demonic blood in my eye...yeah....stings like a mutha! Pass me a tissue"
The DOOM guy 

"What did I think of RIME? Emotions are for girls......now, pass me a tissue. I got some, er, acidic alien blood in my eye, and it, uh, stings like the mutha-****** of all mutha-******s. I, uh, need to dab it out before the, um, acid eats all the way through my brain. Yeah! That's it. Duke, you crafty fox! Those suckers will never know you were crying. Hey! Wait! Is that thing still recording?"
Duke Nukem

I can't really sum up the plot of RIME too much, because it kind of doesn't have one - at least, not in a conventional sense. You play a boy who wakes up shipwrecked on a mysterious island, that is gradually revealed to be far less normal than it first appears. Despite looking like an ancient place in the mediterranean it has robots, shadowy creatures, strange mechanisms seemingly powered by magic, and an evil giant bird that really doesn't seem to like you very much.

How did you get there? What is going on? What are you meant to be doing? It's one of THOSE games....where what little you get told is 80% visual storytelling, and the other 20% comes from the moody / sombre / melancholy / soaring music. No dialogue. No text. 

The ending isn't too ambiguous as to its meaning, but until then it's just a "feeling" the game gives you whilst the island gets more and more weird. Not weird in a Far Cry 3 drug trip kind of way, yet enough that you'll question how this place came to be, what it's for, and what every activity you're doing in it is all about.

It's a fairly gentle platformer with some mild puzzles, and takes a few hours to finish. I honestly can't make the game play sound anymore exciting than that, because it isn't. If you can't get swept up in the beautiful, simple, music or get hooked by the emotive narrative (such as it is) / sense of discovery, then the relatively sedate action isn't likely to satisfy.

It's not a twitch platformer, or has mind bending conundrums. It's "nice", and will maybe punch you in the feels come the conclusion. I'm not that familiar with games of this type on PC, and the only one that springs to mind would be a dead giveaway as to the ending of RIME if I named it as the two aren't all that dissimilar. It's relatively comparable to the playstation games ICO / Shadow Of The Colossus / The Last Guardian mechanically, and in it's themes of love, loss and regret.

I wouldn't have said it matched the last two for emotional oomph, but it's a moot point if you don't own a playstation, and to be fair to RIME it plays better than any of them. If a long play time is your thing then this may disappoint, as I think it took about 7 hours to finish. Though that's not so short for the type of game that it is, and what's there is really well made. 

The production values are quite high, it's glitch free, and runs fairly well, so I'd recommend it...if it sounds like your "cup of tea", of course. I just can't say what that "cup of tea" exactly is without spoiling it....

If you found this review to be helpful then why not check out my curator page here:
https://steamcommunity.com/groups/The_dull_games_reviewer

author: {'steamid': '76561198050884234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1551971146}
review: great mix between Prince of Persia , a bit of Zelda, ICO and  Heart of Darkness. beautiful atlantean architecture reminiscent of some of Abzu , with a similar melancholy of a lost civilisation. chapters names are the stages of loss, which makes it conceptually and gradually from action adventure platformer more  akin to many a walking sim.  gorgeous music, tailored to the scenes . No  battles, just puzzly solutions to combat  .  10/10 . i m an older gamer, which means to me most regular games are "been there done that". i suspect if you are younger and impatient you may find it boring. if you have any doubt though  , please go for it. about 6 or 7 hours of top notch arthouse level indie game.

review:
QUE JOGO INCR√çVEL!!!
N√£o tinha ideia que a hist√≥ria me proporcionaria uma experi√™ncia t√£o f0da assim. Me arrependo de ter subjugado o jogo por ser indie...os caras s√£o muito bons no que fazem, e me surpreenderam MUITO!

Mesmo tendo alguns contras, se fosse pontuar o game de 0 a 10, minha nota seria 10. Pois fazia tempo que n√£o me sentia assim com um game!!


PROS:
* Hist√≥ria. A hist√≥ria √© de longe o que tem de melhor nesse jogo...nossa, que hist√≥ria envolvente e dram√°tica. Sem sequer uma fala durante o jogo todo, aos poucos vamos descobrindo e entendendo o que aconteceu. E o desfecho final...meu Deus, que coisa magn√≠fica...um uso do simbolismo espetacular!! Simplesmente magn√≠fica a hist√≥ria!

* Pra mim, a trilha sonora √© meio caminho para uma obra ficar incr√≠vel, e a trilha desse game √© algo digno de premio! Os caras fizeram um √≥timo trabalho. Sempre temos um m√∫sica agrad√°vel acompanhando o gameplay, que se encaixa perfeitamente com o estilo (game sem di√°logos). Por√©m, nos momentos √°pices da hist√≥ria, a trilha aumenta fazendo com que o drama ganhe for√ßa. Demais!!!

* N√£o tem como n√£o falar dos gr√°ficos desse jogo...que obra de arte!! o Jogo foi muito bem constru√≠do...cada detalhe faz parecer que foi pintado a m√£o de t√£o belo que √©.

* A ambienta√ß√£o do jogo √© √≥tima. Passamos por v√°rios locais diferentes, com estilos e detalhamentos diferentes, praias, florestas, ru√≠nas, por√©m, sempre da impress√£o de que estamos no mesmo lugar. Achei isso magn√≠fico!

* O tempo de gameplay √© curto, mesmo fazendo os 100%. Mas mesmo assim n√£o acentuo o tempo de jogo como um contra, pois acho que √© exatamente o tempo ideal para mostrar tudo o que falei acima. J√° diz o ditado, "menos √© mais"!




CONTRAS:
* As vezes os comandos s√£o meio lentos pra responder, as vezes n√£o respondem com exatid√£o;

* Puzzles s√£o relativamente f√°ceis (apesar de que √© bem complicado encontrar todos os colecion√°veis);

author: {'steamid': '76561198033126384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1551730175}
review: Ach, RiME. Du hast mich mit deinem bezaubernden Stil gelockt und mit abwechslungsreichen R√§tseln am Ball gehalten. Deine Welt ist sch√∂n. author: {'steamid': '76561198035292713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1550924088}
review:
Beautiful game with a beautiful story. 

My only quibbles with it are [spoiler] that I hate chasing/keep away elements in games like this which I thought would be just pretty and mellow. The bird was bad enough, but the shadow things chasing you made me stop playing. It's not that it was difficult to get around them, I just didn't enjoy those elements at all. [/spoiler]

[spoiler] And while the ending was gorgeous, I'm also a little tired of games with such interesting worlds and which manage to build such an amazing story without any words end with an 'it was all a dream/hallucination/in world metaphor for loss' thing. I was looking forward to finding out more about the island and what happened to the civilization on it, not for it to end up all just being an elaborate way for the father to get over his grief.[/spoiler] 

That said, I thought it was amazing how they told the story without any words. Exploring the island was wonderful and I loved the soundtrack and visuals.

review:
Nieco nudnawa z banalnymi, niezbyt urozmaiconymi zagadkami gra action-adventure. Podobno wraz z premierƒÖ technicznie pozostawa≈Ça wiele do ≈ºyczenia, ale na szczƒô≈õcie grƒô po≈Çatali i ≈õmiga na blaszaku elegancko. W grze przede wszystkim bardzo du≈ºo biegamy po mapie odnajdujƒÖc klucze i inne rzeczy, kt√≥re otwierajƒÖ nam dostƒôp do kolejnych miejsc. Czasami skaczemy sobie po platformach niczym Lara Croft, ale jednak przede wszystkim biegamy i biegamy... 

Og√≥lnie eksploracja jest nudna i w sumie uboga - mnie odechcia≈Ço siƒô szukaƒá dodatkowych, nic nie wnoszƒÖcych znajdziek i skupi≈Çem siƒô tylko na wƒÖtku g≈Ç√≥wnym, kt√≥ry przeszed≈Çem w 5 godzin. Na minus jeszcze jest kamera, kt√≥ra wg mnie jest miejscami ≈∫le ustawiona. Mia≈Çem daƒá 6, ale podwy≈ºszam o jeden punkt ze wzglƒôdu na zako≈Ñczenie. Wizualnie jest bardzo estetyczna za≈õ muzyka jest bardzo przyjemna, ale jako ca≈Çokszta≈Çt sza≈Çu jednak nie robi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387826123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1551319759}
review:
I fell in love with the experience, the journey, the essence of what this game entailed, what it showed me and in the end, gave me. 

I was astounded by the games beautiful imagery, music and the great wonder brought by exploration. What was unexpected was the emotional aspect. Making this game a rarity in its own right.

I got this game as part of a bundle and didn‚Äôt expect anything of it. But shortly after I started playing I became mesmerized. I loved the puzzles and adore this games essence. Superficially, RIME might seem like a game about simple exploration, but within its depths there is more. I found a story, a story without an uttered word. A silent movie if you will. It was a story fueled with wonder, discovery, love and loss. 

This game is a true experience. It‚Äôs creators should feel proud about giving it a soul, and in its silence, a voice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198361821357', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1607487189}
review: to be honest it's hard to put into words how good this game is, but the bottom line is that it has an incredibly powerful and moving story without a single line of dialouge, it has beautiful music and environments, and while this won't be what you're looking for if you only care about gameplay, the ending left me speechless and I would reccomend this game to anyone who cares about the story in games even a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995962613', 'num_games_owned': 982, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1551122403}
review:
Je crois que je suis compl√®tement pass√© √† c√¥t√© d'un jeu pourtant globalement bien not√© et bien aim√© √† priori.

Mais moi je me suis vraiment emmerd√©. Je l'ai trouv√© vain. On fait des trucs. On va dans une direction parce que le renard qui aboie va par l√†. On passe son temps √† escalader juste parce qu'on voit qu'il y a des zones dans lesquelles on peut, donc c'est s√ªrement que √ßa doit √™tre utile.... Les √©nigmes sont l√† juste pour faire faire quelque chose au joueur.... Tout m'a sembl√© tr√®s artificiel d'un point de vue gameplay...

Au final c'est un grand couloir. Aucune libert√© d'action, on suit un chemin tout trac√©... Mais j'ai quand m√™me d√ª regarder deux trois fois sur le net pour des √©nigmes dans lesquelles j'avais pas remarqu√© tel √©l√©ment, ou parce que j'avais pas vu tel truc sur lequel je pouvais grimper. 

Alors au d√©part c'est plaisant, les d√©cors sont enchanteurs, la direction artistique ma√Ætris√©e, la musique nous plonge aussi dedans.... Mais arriv√© √† l'avant dernier "monde" (les grottes avec des arbres), j'ai trouv√© √ßa vraiment p√©nible.... Je ne comprenais pas la finalit√© de mes actions en fait.... J'ai insist√© juste parce que je savais la fin proche et que je voulais savoir ce qu'il en √©tait...

Et le final.... C'est cens√© √™tre bim boum les √©motions dans ta face, le bon gros "ah d'accord bon c'est donc √ßa!", pour moi √ßa a juste fait "ah bah ok, c'est cool".... C'est vraiment tout √ßa pour √ßa.... Le jeu se veut tr√®s narratif et profond dans sa signification, mais on a pass√© tout le jeu √† pousser des cubes et √† escalader des murs, je trouve √ßa vraiment contradictoire.....
M√™me la musique a fini par me saouler avec ses th√®mes √† la fois larmoyants et grandiloquents...

Et d'un point de vue technique le jeu est vraiment optimis√© avec les pieds, se mettant √† saccader r√©guli√®rement dans des zones o√π pourtant y'a pas tant de choses √† afficher.

Brothers a tale of two sons, par exemple, m'a vraiment plus √©mu dans la cat√©gorie "jeu avec une fin inattendue et pleine d'√©motion" parce que tout le jeu est logique. On suit la qu√™te de deux gamins qui veulent sauver leur p√™re, donc toutes nos actions ont une signification....

C'est con parce que j'avais vraiment envie de l'aimer √† la base, j'√©tais parti avec de tr√®s bons √† priori.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043250032', 'num_games_owned': 2464, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1550634278}
review:
[h1]Simply Beautiful[/h1]

Rime is an adventure game with puzzle elements from Tequila Softworks. I picked it up for $3 and went in with fairly low expectations due to the mix of positive and negative reviews on the store page. I actually ended up being pleasantly surprised! Rime is a beautiful game that tells a story in an interesting way, and it does it with relatively few frustrations. 

[h1]Positives:[/h1]
[list][*]Rime really is beautiful, I love the aesthetic here and it remains pretty consistent throughout the game. The first three chapters are particularly beautiful, with the fourth being quite haunting. There were a couple of textures that looked a bit rough to me, but really good overall. I also think that all of the creatures in the game are really well designed.

[*]One thing I was quite pleased with was that the puzzles were quite straightforward. There were definitely a couple of puzzles that had me stumped for a minute or two, but for the most part I found them easy to figure out. Now, not everyone will think that‚Äôs a good thing, but personally I think Rime is much more of an adventure game than it is a puzzle game. The puzzles are certainly fun, but the real meat is exploring the world Tequila created and piecing together the story. I don‚Äôt think Rime would work as well as it does if less-experienced puzzle players were constantly forced to check guides/walkthroughs to figure out how to carry on.

[*]One thing you might need a guide for though, is the collectibles. I think there are four types of collectibles in the game, but there may be others that I just never saw. Seemingly they‚Äôre tied to most of the game‚Äôs achievements, as beating the game only got me 8/31. I‚Äôm usually not interested in collectibles, but I am actually interested in going back through to try and get some/all of them, which is a rarity in games. I think it adds some good replayability, especially if you‚Äôre a die-hard achievement hunter.

[*]There are some dangers in Rime, I won‚Äôt go into detail about what the dangers are lest I spoil the game, but I was glad to see a little danger thrown in, just to add some tension to the game. Though even with the tension in some parts, Rime is still a pretty relaxing game and I really enjoyed just sitting back and playing through it, it‚Äôs a good experience.

[*]I think the story is quite good, there‚Äôs some mystery that kind of strings you along through the game, and then once you see the ending of the game the story of the whole game is revealed to you. I don‚Äôt want to say too much more than that, so I don‚Äôt spoil it, but I felt satisfied by the ending. I think a second playthrough is probably required to make sense of everything though, as there are a couple of things I‚Äôm left confused by.[/list]

[h1]Neutral:[/h1]
[list][*]One thing that I noticed other reviews picking up on is the climbing mechanics in the game, with that being mentioned in some of the negative reviews. I don‚Äôt really understand why this was an issue for some people, because while it wasn‚Äôt quite as interesting as something like Grow Home, it felt like it worked similarly to an Assassins Creed or Tomb Raider game to me (just with a little less animation). This is an adventure game rather than a climbing-focused game after all, so I think what‚Äôs there is about as good as I would expect it to be.[/list]

[h1]Negatives:[/h1]
[list][*]My biggest disappointment with Rime was that it doesn‚Äôt have a photo mode. This game is beautiful, and it‚Äôs exactly the kind of game that a photo mode would work really well for. I get that this probably isn‚Äôt a huge issue for everyone, but I was definitely disappointed by it.

[*]Performance wasn‚Äôt quite as good as I expected, I had to turn the settings down a fair bit more than I would have liked and even then, it wasn‚Äôt running great. The visuals are great, but the game is simplistic and it‚Äôs not like it‚Äôs photo-realistic, I expected it to be easier to run. Probably not an issue for people with beefy rigs, but if you‚Äôre on a mid-range gaming laptop or PC like I am, it might be worth keeping in mind.

[*]There was a little too much underwater stuff for my liking. Rime really doesn‚Äôt look anywhere near as nice or play as well during the underwater sections, and while I really enjoyed the rest of the game, I could not wait for the underwater sections to be over with.[/list]

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]

I ended up enjoying Rime a lot more than I expected. It's a relaxing journey through some beautiful places, but don't come here looking for a challenge. It's worth playing through at least once. However, I don‚Äôt think there‚Äôs anything here that makes this game worth $30, I‚Äôd wait for it to be $15 or less.

If you found this review helpful, please check out my other reviews over at [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33633486/]Kemo's Corner.[/url]

review:
A very attractive looking game, lovely visuals and soundscape.

The puzzles are pretty simplistic and at times progress is tedious and non-rewarding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154854885', 'num_games_owned': 1132, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1550516177}
review:
[h1]RiME: m√°s all√° de las palabras[/h1]
[u]Rese√±a Spoiler-free[/u]

Si tuviera que describir este juego con una sola palabra ser√≠a [b]hermoso[/b]. Todos los detalles visuales est√°n cuidad√≠simos, desde lo que ves hasta lo que oyes (con una maravillosa canci√≥n de Lindsey Sterling, no te digo m√°s). El cielo, el agua de lluvia cayendo sobre la piedra, el d√≠a y la noche... No te vas a cansar de observar todo tu entorno; y es que de eso va precisamente el siguiente punto, de buscar coleccionables. Si de algo se ha preocupado Tequila Works es de que tengas que andar rebuscando en cada esquina y cada saliente en busca de un sinf√≠n de coleccionables diferentes: conchas, cerraduras, trajes...

La historia es maravillosa y, en pos de no hacer ning√∫n tipo de spoiler, me limitar√© a decir que deber√≠as jugarlo sin ver nada: ni gameplays, ni walktroughs, ni siquiera gu√≠as por escrito.

E hilando con el tema de las gu√≠as, he de decir que mi mayor pega para con este juego es que la dificultad es [i]nula[/i]: los "puzzles" son demasiado f√°ciles, el plataformeo es para ni√±os peque√±os (con los bordes CONVENIENTEMENTE cagados por palomas) y el mapa es muy lineal. La √∫nica dificultad real del juego son, como ya he mencionado antes, los coleccionables y los [b]logros[/b]. Cazadores de logros: est√°is jodidos sin una gu√≠a.

[h1]En res√∫men[/h1]
[list]
    [*]El juego es, visualmente una pasada, una historia profunda y cautivadora.
    [*]No necesitas tener el cerebro 100% conectado, con un par de neuronas te ser√° suficiente para pas√°rtelo.
    [*]Cuenta con una rejugabilidad artificial en forma de coleccionables y logros; de hecho, es imposible conseguir el 100% en una sola partida :)
[/list]
[b]¬øRecomiendo el juego? ABSOLUTAMENTE.[/b]

Heyyy, gracias por leer toda la rese√±a. Si te ha parecido interesante, te animo a que le des a √∫til/gracioso para que m√°s gente pueda leerla y decidirse por este juego tan chulo :3 ¬°Gracias otra vez!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025247073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1550099218}
review:
Before getting to my review, I just want to mention that this is one of those games are generally run horribly no matter your hardware. Some people don't have issues, but maaaany do. Including me, my PC is more than powerful enough to max out Witcher 3 at max settings, but can barely run this game at 50fps on lowest. 1080p

Anyway, still giving this game a great review, mainly because this game pulls at the heart strings super hard for me. Great story, great gameplay (however the climbing can feel a bit sluggish at times) and the games not too long nor short. Depending on your puzzle solving skills. Might not be worth 40 CAD, but if you get this on a sale, definitely pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990455763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1550087662}
review:
Do you remember in 2005 when the rock climbing in Shadow of the Colossus felt awesome? Do you remember in 1998 when the puzzles in Ocarina of Time felt complex?

If you do, you'll only think of how much they can be watered down, when playing RiME.

Nice scenery to romp through the trivial puzzles and lackluster controls though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198368306652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1156, 'last_played': 1550158254}
review:
Rime es uno de esos juegos en los que lo importante es el viaje que haces junto al protagonista y que al menos a m√≠, me ha llegado, lagrimilla al final incluida.

Gr√°ficamente me recuerda a algunos de los √∫ltimos Zeldas y como juego, no he podido dejar de pensar en otros ejemplos en los que tambi√©n se realizaba un viaje maravilloso.... Quiz√°s el m√°s obvio sea ICO, pero tambi√©n me acord√© mucho de juegos como Journey, Abz√∫ y sobre todo "Brothers, a tale of two sons" (Al que en lo emocional creo que es el m√°s similar).

En el apartado t√©cnico/art√≠stico el juego me parece estupendo, con un dise√±o gr√°fico muy bueno y sobre todo con un apartado musical brutal, acompa√±ando y contando parte de la historia con peque√±as pistas y matices muy sutiles pero excelentes.
La verdad es que para ser un juego desarrollado por un equipo peque√±o (no lo aparenta) me parece m√°s que sobresaliente. Ya me sorprendi√≥ en su d√≠a Tequila Works con su Deadlight y la verdad es que me intriga mucho su Sexy Brutale (que lo tengo en mi biblioteca).

En definitiva, recomendad√≠simo, es un viaje que guardar√© durante mucho tiempo en mi recuerdo y espero que comercialmente resulte rentable para que la gente de Tequila pueda seguir haciendo juegos as√≠.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071915150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1551118180}
review:
RiME - A tale to remember

TL/DR: I think this game is excellent [i] IF [/i] you are a story motivated player.

At first glance, RiME seems to be a fairly simple and cute puzzle game. But throughout the first region, the game starts to feed you small pieces of information, just enough to hint at something more. 
And boy was there more, and it was  a feel train.

Its hard to truly convey what made the story good without spoiling it. So just trust me, its good.

RiME is an artistic masterpiece. Each individual level has distinct moods. (That later have more important meaning)
These moods are represented through fantastic choices in colour, lighting, weather and the soundtrack. When you finish the game, and understand the story, the levels feel so much better designed now that you know what they are meant to be. 

The puzzles may have been simple, but I felt like the increase of complexity was smooth. It introduced the new concepts fast enough to keep the simple game play from stagnating. 
It is NOT like other puzzle games like "Portal" where you might spend ages in a single room. I feel it was purposely made the way it was so it did not subtract from the flow of the story.

[b] If you are after a difficult puzzle platformer, this game isn't for you. [/b]

[b] If you are after an unique approach to story telling, I honestly couldn't recommend this more. [/b]

I suggest sitting down and dedicating an entire session to knock this out in one sitting. Its on the short side so it shouldn't be to hard.

With that all said, I wouldn't spend $40USD on it. Wait for a sale to slam this artwork down.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968804401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1549919875}
review:
Rime ist ganz klar eine besondere Perle und f√ºr mich eines der bewegensten Spiele. Es erz√§hlt von einem Jungen, der am Strand einer misteri√∂sen Insel erwacht und sich aufmacht, diese zu erkunden. Im Laufe des Spiels durchquert er verschiedene Gebiete, die alle f√ºr sich √§u√üerst unterschiedlich und abwechslungreich sind. Die Grafik und das Design sind wundersch√∂n anzusehen und laden zusammen mit einem grandiosen Soundtrack zum tr√§umen ein. Langsam entfaltet sich dabei das wahre Schicksal des Jungen. Rime kommt beim Erz√§hlen seiner Geschichte ganz ohne Worte aus. Und das ist wahrscheinlich dessen gro√üe St√§rke. Wer sich auf das Spiel einl√§sst, den nimmt es mit auf eine fantastische Reise mit einem besonderem Ausgang, der mich emotional tief ber√ºhrte. Auf dem Weg muss der Spieler verschiedene R√§tsel l√∂sen, die jedoch nicht allzu komplex daherkommen. Aber Rime ist kein klassisches Puzzle-Abenteuer, sondern Punktet vor allem durch seine Erz√§hlweise. Die R√§tsel sind darum eher als Teil der Erz√§hlung zu sehen, statt als Herausforderung.

Negativ aufgefallen war mir einzig die schlechte Performance. Oft litt das Spiel unter starken Framerate-Einbr√ºchen, welche die sonst sehr sch√∂ne Spielerfahrung beeintr√§chtigten. Hier h√§tten die Entwickler etwas mehr Zeit in eine bessere PC-Otpimierung investieren sollen.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198100039957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1549851570}
review: Others have complained about the controls and the slow movement speed and that is true however I feel it was done on purpose. A forced slowing and in-expertise in movement. Especially look when the boy is running in water and he lifts his feet high then stomps down with more emphasis on splashing than moving forward (like every 7 year old). This is meant to be an emotional experience where you aren't told the destination but slowly you sense where you are being led.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027982199', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1549738657}
review:
While I really liked the story that unfolded before me, the mechanical downsides leave much to be desired.

RiME is a puzzle/platformer where you travel a mysterious island, learning more about your character as you progress.  Unfortunately, the game is extremely short and I completed it in about 5 hours.  Sure there are collectibles to gather, but considering your character's movement speed, it does not seem like a fun thing to do, even if the lore interests me.  I feel that if my character was able to move even a little faster I would have shaved off a lot of my playtime, but of course, that would break some of the puzzles.  Granted, there are positives about the gameplay, I never had to worry about falling off of ledges or about my jumps being too small, the game will appropriately snap you in place to where you need to jump everytime.

As for the graphics, I really like the art style, however, I feel like there were some optimization issues as I would get consistent framerate drops and some of the shadows would glitch in and out.  There's only one area in the game where I hit a solid, consistent 60fps and it was in one of the prettiest areas near the end of the game, but unfortunately it did not last long.  

This game is more like an interactive story, so if that's your thing, go ahead and get it, but I strongly stress that this is not worth the $30 price tag for only 5 hours of core gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091075885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2739, 'last_played': 1549505649}
review:
A lot of running/jumping/climbing just for the sake of it.. the game would take you through room after room after room where you literally just have to jump and climb a little to get through (these rooms probably had collectibles in, I don't know since it was such a chore to get around that I didn't feel like exploring). Easy puzzles. Can't go wrong, just follow the path - never felt the need to save the game. Controls slow, unintuitive and sometimes a guessing game - frustrating!

I'm an explorer. I will explore for days. I will make spreadsheets, maps, lists and notes. Absolutely love exploring. After an hour into Rime I just wanted to solve the puzzles, after 3 I wanted to quit, after 4 I got some wine and doggedly pressed on until the end (which was sad, but had very little to do with the rest of the game).

I would call this is a charming walking simulator. Great soundtrack.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997159902', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1549293051}
review:
I tried very hard to like this game, but it felt as if it fought back against me every step of the way. On its surface, this game is extremely charming, the environments are stunning, and the soundtrack is truly exquisite. But the game itself -- the interaction between player and system is fundamentally unsatisfying -- from the way the character controls down to the puzzles or challenges the game presents to you. 

Your character's movement and animations feel so slow and labored that getting from one point to another in the game genuinely just got bothersome. Even the camera moves at an painfully sluggish pace -- when you're in control, that is. Because Rime loves to fix the camera to a certain point, and then it becomes a guessing game of which direction your character will move in in response to your inputs. While I started out wanting to explore the fantastic-looking world of Rime, by my second or third hour I just wanted to mainline it. By my fourth hour I just wanted to quit. 

There is barely anything to the puzzles you're asked to solve. Zero thinking required. You see something, it clicks immediately, because you've either done this in another game already or it's just that dead obvious, and then you just execute. Next. Where is the payoff, I wonder?

I think that that's the biggest problem with Rime. It fails to stimulate the player at any possible level -- not emotionally, not intellectually, and not kinesthetically (through controlling the character). Even the world loses its shine when you dread simply getting around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200396482', 'num_games_owned': 1141, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1577816012}
review:
Resumen: una obra de arte con todas las letras.

RiME es una historia que si no te atrapa con el primer frame de sus gr√°ficos, sin duda lo har√° con la primera nota de su banda sonora. Con una calidad espectacular y cuidado hasta el m√°s m√≠nimo detalle, RiME es un t√≠tulo que no te dejar√° indiferente. Dedic√°te a explorarlo con calma, porque no hay ni una piedra colocada ah√≠ por casualidad, cada paso que des tiene su objetivo (ya sea encontrar alg√∫n coleccionable, que los tiene a patadas) y cuando llegas al final todo cobra sentido.

Hay gente que se queja de que es corto, y es cierto que 35‚Ç¨ es algo caro, pero si lo compras en rebajas s√≠ que compensa, sobre todo si te das el tiempo suficiente para saborearlo, en lugar de avanzar y avanzar lo m√°s r√°pido posible.

Es cierto que en cuanto a optimizaci√≥n no es lo mejor del mundo, tiene zonas en las que hay tant√≠simos detalles que los fps tienen que luchar por mantenerse estables, pero si tienes un ordenador decente podr√°s jugarlo sin problema la mayor parte del tiempo.

Historia: 9/10
Gr√°ficos: 10/10
Banda sonora: 10/10
Jugabilidad: 8/10
Duraci√≥n: 8/10

Global: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198408768447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 577, 'last_played': 1548857903}
review:
I bought Rime thinking it was a puzzle-platformer, which is superficially true, but boy was I in for a (pleasant) surprise. Yes, Rime does all the stuff that puzzle-platformers do: you explore various worlds, scale walls, navigate mazes, all the while solving puzzles to unlock areas. The puzzles were mostly fun to solve, although most of them were not difficult, actually some were even very straightforward. However, the main purpose of Rime is to tell you a story, the puzzle solving business is totally secondary. And that story is very intriguing. I completed the game in just two long nightly sessions, so curious was I to see the story unfold. The backstory is unclear when you start to play the game. The game consists of 5 chapters with very different moods and atmospheres. As the names of the 5 chapters indicate, the game is about dealing with loss. But only in the final chapter the backstory of the boy is finally revealed.

Apart from the story, there is much to like about Rime. To me one of the main attractions of the game is the art and visual style of the game. Each world is very beautiful and well designed, with the exception of the various extensive underwater scenes (with the air bubbles) which appear to be a tribute to Super Mario Galaxy. The character controls pretty well and runs reasonable fast, which is very important in this game as you do not want the platforming to get in the way of the story telling. In some parts of the game you are climbing massive walls and structures, which was actually fun to do because the character handles so well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034840259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1661551914}
review:
Masterpiece. I'm not easly impressed nor generous with compliments, but I'm convinced that this game deserve all the love and admiration it receives. It's incredible how a videogame like RiME can tell a story, make you experience a great variety of feelings and emotions and even bring you to tears without using a single word.

If you are going to give this game a try, I recommend to not go for an achievement or treasures hunt. All that matter, at least for the first time, is the story.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995566759', 'num_games_owned': 2023, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1548884035}
review:
Vous jouez un enfant qui se r√©veille sur une plage sur une √Æle. Au centre de cette √Æle il y a une tour gigantesque que vous devez gravir. Vous allez devoir explorer cette √Æle pour comprendre son histoire et avancer. 

Le jeu est vraiment beau avec une OST vraiment f√©erique (d'ailleurs je vous la conseille le soir dans le noir pour s'endormir tranquillement). Il n'y a par contre aucune ligne de texte, aucun dialogue, ce qui renforce l'immersion dans le jeu et surtout, le fait que l'on soit seul. 

Pour ceux qui aiment 100% les jeux il y a de bons guides pour le faire, pr√©f√©rez les guides images car il n'y a pas les solutions pour les puzzles, mais il peut √™tre parfois compliqu√© de se situer pour tel ou tel item √† collecter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078288325', 'num_games_owned': 2748, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1548633642}
review:
RiMe fait partie de ces chefs d'oeuvre vid√©o-ludiques comme l'on en voit trop peu.

Je m'y suis pris √† plusieurs sessions pour arriver au bout, l'aventure √©tant longue (pour ma part 12h pour arriver au bout), et l'on se pose beaucoup de questions tout du long sans avoir de r√©ponse (aucun dialogue). Le jeu se termine sur un grand final grandiose tout √† fait satisfaisant.

Techniquement superbe, tournant sous Unreal Engine 4, on a en permanence l'impression d'√™tre dans un film d'animation AAA non stop, avec les musiques qui vont bien et des plans √† couper le souffle de beaut√©.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1557170126

En plus d'une grande rejouabilit√© (je n'ai m√™me pas d√©bloqu√© les deux tiers des objets cach√©s en arrivant au bout), le gameplay est un vrai r√©gal, facile √† prendre en main et jamais punitif (bien au contraire), les puzzles √©tant tous tr√®s faciles ce qui peut √©ventuellement d√©plaire √† certains, on appreciera la multitude des environnements et le c√¥t√© "monde ouvert" des niveaux, avec la possibilit√© de rejouer les chapitres une fois le jeu fini.

RiMe est en must-have dans ce genre, avec son lot d'√©motions et de d√©couvertes. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197977821655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1548543596}
review:
A neat casual game with strong audio, story and visuals. 

+ Very well written orchestrated music.
+ Minimalistic but strong story.
+ Polished and nice art style and graphics.
+ Overall polished, well working controls (played with a gamepad).

- It's never super fun or challening to play. Sometimes it's a bit on rails and too easy even if there are optional stuff to collect. In some parts of the game it opens up a bit, but not enough in my opinion.
- The goal of the puzzles are easy to understand. WHICH IS GOOD! But the solution is too easy and sometimes "free". 
There are some good puzzle mechanics that starts to sniff in the realm of Zelda, but it never gets there, sadly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116193767', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1548073633}
review:
[h1]Rime - o jogo sobre a maior jornada conhecida[/h1]

Mais um daqueles jogos que a princ√≠pio despertou interesse quase imediato e acabou sendo esquecido na prateleira por qualquer raz√£o boba.
Eu tinha uma ideia do que seria o jogo, mas na verdade errei. Eu realmente esperava um jogo de puzzle e alguma historinha e o que eu vi foi sim um jogo com alguns puzzles, mas a "historinha" foi bem mais interessante e emocionante. Ele n√£o √©, dentre os jogos nesse estilo, meu favorito, mas ele ganhou um espa√ßo na minha mem√≥ria afetiva com certeza.
Um menino vagando entre cen√°rios fantasiosos e incr√≠veis, 3 locais bem distintos e uns mist√©rios a desvendar.
Aos altos e baixos ent√£o...
[h1]Bom:[/h1]
[list]
[*] A hist√≥ria. Comecei pela hist√≥ria porque pra mim √© a melhor parte do jogo, mas calma... N√£o espere A hist√≥ria. O jogo n√£o √© focado numa narrativa como aventuras gr√°ficas digamos assim, mas os mist√©rios envolvendo a figura da capa vermelha e a velejada ser√£o os pontos altos sem d√∫vida.
Quem √© a figura?
Do que se trata a velejada?
Quem √© o animalzinho?
O que s√£o esses lugares?

[*]A trilha sonora. N√£o √© sempre que as trilhas se destacam ou que eu destaco as trilhas, mas aqui ela merece o elogio. √â uma trilha bem espec√≠fica, delicada e que funciona no jogo - depois voc√™ a esquece.

[*]O visual. Tem um estilo bem fantasioso e me remeteu a alguns animes antigos. Sem sombra de d√∫vidas, vai te segurar at√© o fim. Gosto dos momentos de grande contraste entre o preto / branco e uma cor destacada (lembrei de alguns filmes - exemplo Rumble Fish)

[*]Cen√°rios. Cada local mais interessante que o outro e muito bem constru√≠dos. Quando voc√™ se perde, o pr√≥prio cen√°rio e personagens te ajudam a reencontrar o caminho. S√£o 3 principais e s√£o bem criativas:
[h1]As ru√≠nas da Raposa[/h1]
[h1]As ru√≠nas do P√°ssaro[/h1]
[h1]As ru√≠nas do Rob√¥[/h1]

[*]A orienta√ß√£o. O jogo n√£o te faz perder tempo tentando descobrir o que fazer. O foco √© te mostrar pra onde ir e o que precisa ser feito, como voc√™ o far√° √© outra hist√≥ria - mas o cen√°rio e personagens v√£o te orientar nesse sentido do "caminho". N√£o fosse isso tenho quase certeza de que o jogo teria o dobro do tempo, uma vez que em diversos momentos a ilumina√ß√£o √© escura demais ou a c√¢mera te zoa (explico nos pontos ruins). Toda ajuda ser√° necess√°ria.

[*]A raposa. Sem spoilers ou detalhes em excesso, eu "gosti" dela e foi a companheira perfeita.

[*]O desfecho. O final do jogo me encheu os olhos ------------- de √°gua. Droga de indies que me fazem isso constantemente.
[/list]
[h1]Ruim:[/h1]
[list]
[*]A c√¢mera. Avaliando o game no geral, ela n√£o compromete. Entretanto a c√¢mera √© meio zoada em diversos momentos, inclusive te atrapalhando a entender o caminho em outros tantos.

[*]Part√≠culas. 
Seu PC sangra?
VAI SANGRAR!

Cara... Talvez tenha sido porque escolhi a op√ß√£o gr√°fico no ultra, mas ainda assim n√£o justifica. Eu jogo o A.C. Odyssey no ultra e meu PC tem "ram" sobrando e posso, inclusive, deixar abas do chrome abertas de fundo. Aqui, o FPS cravado em 60 ca√≠a para rid√≠culos UM......................... UM desgramado frame por segundo na sess√£o submersa do jogo. 
Quando voc√™ for pra sess√£o "debaixo d√°gua" d√™ um pulo no menu e ponha no m√©dio ou low. 
Que?!?!
Tudo bem que eram poucos segundos, mas deixei um rolo de atadura e band-aids aqui do lado, minha placa uivou...

[*]O controle. A mec√¢nica de movimenta√ß√£o n√£o √© muito boa. N√£o chega a ser uma aberra√ß√£o e talvez quando voc√™s jogarem nem entendam o porqu√™ desta "reclama√ß√£o", mas ela √© apenas pontual - o jogo fica meio "travado" em alguns momentos e "lento" em outros. Talvez seja apenas eu ou minha prefer√™ncia, mas n√£o curti muito a movimenta√ß√£o.
[/list]

Rime √© aquele jogo que fica ali na sua prateleira e voc√™ n√£o leva muita f√©. √â aquele livro julgado pela capa, aquele filme que por n√£o ser lan√ßamento ou ter mais de 10 anos voc√™ sequer d√° uma chance. Em n√∫meros o [b][u]Rime[/u][/b] √© um √≥timo casual, com puzzles ok e de valor [h1] 8 [/h1]
Ele √© muito bom, mas n√£o chega a ser excelente. Acredito que pro meu gosto pessoal, uma orienta√ß√£o mais bem lapidada ou pelo menos mais intuitiva sem a necessidade das "muletas" que o  jogo oferece (talvez j√° pensando na sua desorienta√ß√£o?) faria a experi√™ncia melhorar.
Puzzles poderiam ser mais desafiadores inclusive, mas mesmo assim o jogo vale sem a menor sombra de desconfian√ßa a sua aten√ß√£o. Ele n√£o √© curto demais nem longo a ponto de te arrastar numa jornada cansativa (embora em alguns momentos, devido a "velocidade" da mec√¢nica eu tenha me pegado pensando - por que n√£o chego logo no fim?)

E a√≠? Compro no full ou na sale?
Compre no full se voc√™ quiser uma boa experi√™ncia com um indie incluindo cen√°rios, puzzles e hist√≥ria e n√£o tiver algo do g√™nero dispon√≠vel.
Compre na sale se voc√™ possuir outros indies dentro da mesma proposta.
Seja como for, n√£o se prive desta experi√™ncia - RIME √© um jogo legal, cativante e bem curioso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068018061', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 678, 'last_played': 1547610616}
review: This game is simply beautiful. You get dropped in with almost no context and that's all you need to enjoy where it takes you. Exploring is very rewarding. I played through it twice, the second for achievements, and it was great both times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307248836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1547508707}
review:
OK game, worth a playthrough

Pros: chill and very peaceful gameplay / decent story and graphics / semi-open world / good audio / ending has feels

Cons: game does not add anything new to the formula, gameplay-wise. What I have seen in this game I saw it all in other games. / Also nothing new or inovative in level design / Collectibles were placed in the game just for the sake of collecting. They does not alter the gameplay in any way. / Sometimes the game felt like a walking simulator / For the first three quarters of the game you just dont know whats up with the story. It only starts to make sense near the end (which is a shame, because it is actually good) / WAAY TOO EXPENSIVE for only 4-6 hours of gameplay (and for the quality of the game as well tbh). Only buy it during a sale!

Conclusion: RiME is building on the existing, good ol' formula, adding little-to-none new stuff. Decent game, and decent story but honestly nothing new. The big pro here is how peaceful the gameplay feels. 6.5/10

(sadly a few hours and achievements didnt sync at all)

review:
J'ai toujours √©t√© attir√© par les prods de la Team Ico (Shadow of the Colossus, Ico, The Last Guardian) mais n'ayant pas de console je n'ai jamais pu y jou√©. L'esth√©tique de Rime ressemblant beaucoup √† ces jeux, naturellement √ßa m'a tap√© dans l'oeil et j'ai voulu l'essayer.
Rime est un jeu de plateforme / √©nigme qui se veut po√©tique voire onirique. Le jeu coche toutes les cases attendues: un terrain de jeu vaste et √©l√©gant, des musiques avec beaucoup de violons, un compagnon animal / guide myst√©rieux, des ruines, une ancienne civilisation, une ambiance qui va crescendo... Tout cela est plut√¥t bien fichu (√† 2-3 approximations techniques pr√®s ) mais au final on s'amuse peu. Tout est bien trop scolaire et convenu, et m√™me si le th√®me principal abord√© par le jeu me touche particuli√®rement, le jeu n'a pas su m'√©mouvoir tant que √ßa. Dommage.
