review:
It's a fantastic game in visuals, a story that is told without actual words and the music is on point. Besides that, its a relaxing game which draws you into its world.  The puzzles aren't too difficult which fits with the overall feeling as too many errors would have destroyed the feelings of the game.

However, the game isn't worth it for the full price as the experience is only around 8 hours long. Surely a game to pick up during a sale as its worth playing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198282735665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1590729921}
review:
Rime is a beautiful game.  There is a lot to said about its amazing scenery and mysterious atmosphere.  However, the game falls short in player mechanics; particularly in its platforming.  

In many 3D games, the camera view is located behind the player, so controller movements align with character movements.  This alignment is important when navigating difficult environments such as a narrow bridge.  Sometimes a game will shift the camera view to better show off the scenery.  This view change can make platforming excruciatingly difficult when making jumps or walking across narrow paths.  Many games solve this problem by either locking movement controls to the character or making it impossible to fall off and fail.  

Rime has many narrow platforms and bridges where the camera shifts to an angled position rather than behind the character.  The camera sift causes most players to propel themselves off the bridge and to their deaths.  Furthermore, the save point is located behind the bridge, allowing the player to fail over and over.  Rime consistently changes the camera to an angled position, making it very difficult to platform.  

The second issue is running jumps.  Thirty minutes into the game, my character got stuck; unable to go forward or back.  I was in an area where I had to align three giant blue spheres.  To progress I had to make a running jump and hold onto a small ledge.  I failed the jump and fell onto the previous section.  However, the handholds leading up had been destroyed and my character became stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048888829', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1543182496}
review:
Al escribir una rese√±a de este juego me veo en la obligaci√≥n de separar dos elementos:
[list]
    [*][b]Referencias:[/b] 
El juego bebe much√≠simo de dos juegos, que son los del Team ICO y Journey. Ahora bien, con esto no me refiero a que una lo mejor de los dos, si no que simplemente se dedica a [i]tomar prestados[/i] ciertos elementos para un uso mayoritariamente est√©tico. De journey toma cosas como el hecho de haber varios personajes con capa en el que es la propia capa el elemento distinguible y el hecho de mostrarte repetidas veces el lugar que debes alcanzar (la torre en este caso, lo que ser√≠a la monta√±a de Journey). Esto podr√≠an ser un par de detalles tontos, pero con los del team ICO es directamente un despiporre: el protagonista lleva una especie de capa, el juego transcurre en unas ruinas en islas rodeadas de agua, las playas, hay varios puentes laaaaaargos y estrechos, los molinos (no hab√≠a suficiente con uno y por eso han metido tres), los enemigos son sombras, [spoiler] en la canci√≥n hablan de un chico de luz, que al final muere y se torna todo oscuro, como una sombra (¬øYorda, est√°s ah√≠?)[/spoiler], el prota es un ser indefenso, en ocasiones vas acompa√±ado de otro personaje controlado por la IA que va abriendo puertas y con el que intentan que te encari√±es... de verdad creo que se han pasado, especialmente cuando, como digo, la mayor√° son cuestiones est√©ticas, ni el juego va de lo mismo y ni mucho menos consigue lo mismo.

    [*][b]El juego en s√≠:[/b] 
Ahora s√≠ que s√≠, vamos a lo m√°s importante. El resumen es que el juego est√° bien. Empieza bien, luego afloja un poco y el final est√° bastante cuidado, as√≠ que deja buen sabor de boca. Jugablemente es una mezcla de walking simulator con alg√∫n objetivo (estilo Journey), mezclado con aventura ligera como ICO (con puzzles que est√°n bien, te puedes atascar en alguno incluso) y cierto plataformeo guionizado como podr√≠a ser el de Uncharted o los nuevos Tomb Raider (s√≠, con color distintivo en las cornisas agarrables, exactamente igual). En cuanto al aspecto gr√°fico de los escenarios, el juego cumple de sobra: es bonito, result√≥n y cre√≠ble. Adem√°s, el hecho de ofrecer un ambiente mediterr√°neo, relativamente infrecuente en este medio audiovisual, me parece un punto muy a remarcar. Como detalles mejorables, los personajes me parecen feos con ganas (en cuanto a estilo), demasiado sencillos (en referencia a lo puramente t√©cnico) y algunas de las animaciones dignas de un estudio indie de garaje (no todas, ojo, pero se podr√≠a pulir bastante este tema). Y para acabar pero no menos importante, la banda sonora me ha gustado bastante. Menos en un par de ocasiones, es de tipo ambiental, no pretende que recuerdes las melod√≠as ni que las vayas tatareando en el metro durante la semana siguiente, pero refuerzan contundentemente lo que se ve en pantalla. Y punto positivo a que el tema principal est√© cantado en castellano, ¬°hay que reivindicar el producto patrio, que no vamos sobrados!
[/list]

[b]Conclusi√≥n: si ten√©√≠s posibilidad, jugad a Ios juegos del Team ICO, luego a Journey, y luego si quer√©is ver un juego preciosista que remememora los dos anteriores de forma descafeinada, jugad a este, que no est√° mal. [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198404963561', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1703703769}
review:
Espectacular, art√≠sticamente bell√≠simo, la banda sonora es IMPONENTE, paisajes espectaculares, puzles sencillos pero muy disfrutables, el argumento te trapa. Todo en este juego me atrap√≥, tanto as√≠ que uno anhela estar dentro del videojuego, sentado en la arena disfrutando el paisaje, la m√∫sica, todo.
Compr√© este juego porque quer√≠a disfrutar de una aventura para un solo jugador, en la cual perderme y olvidarme de todo, solo avanzar y dejarme llevar, y eso fue lo que encontr√©, un grand√≠simo juego, es MUCH√çSIMO mejor de lo que esperaba.
Tiene muchos coleccionables por encontrar, que te van contando parte de la historia. Me faltaron muchos por encontrar, y a√∫n as√≠ dur√≥ bastante.
Los coleccionables que hay por descubrir, as√≠ como los paisajes espectaculares, hacen que quieras perderte en esa inmensdidad que se nos presenta.
Si est√°s con dudas al momento de comprarlo, sin duda te lo recomiendo al 100%
Tiene problemas grandes de optimizaci√≥n, pero aun asi se puede jugar lo m√°s bien, yo tengo un pentium g4560 y una 1050ti y arreglando un par de cosas (ya que est√° mal optimizado), puedo jugar a muy buena calidad y sin problema alguno.

actualizado:
Vale, ya me lo e pasado y eh de decir que el mensaje es claro una vez te lo pasas. author: {'steamid': '76561198073478436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1702341882}
review:
Short, but sweet game! The price is reasonable for its playtime, just don't expect too much of a challenge with the puzzles; RiME is more about exploring and experiencing the emotions the game offers.

If the base price is too steep for you, I'd highly recommend buying it on sale at least!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982622710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1555375588}
review: This is a game that feels more like an experience than a story. It's use of music, enviornment, lighting, or limiting of lighting all affect the experience you receive from this game. As you progress the art style and music make a composition of fitting you into a proper mindset for feeling what the designers what you to feel. I found this game enjoyable because primarily it left me with something to think about after I was away from the game not just the puzzle that was in the game itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993104943', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1542934795}
review:
This game is beautiful. 

The environments are stunning. The character design is excellent. The music is moving and gorgeous. The sound effects are great at bringing the world to ilfe. The level and puzzle design are delightful. And the story... oh the story. I don't want to give anything away, but let me just say that without a single line of dialogue in the whole game, the story still makes off with a part of your soul you will never get back, and you will offer it gladly.

You will probably spend much of the game grinning like an idiot at the clever puzzles, truly fun platforming sequences, and nice hat tips to games of yore, or staring, mouth agape, in wonder at the sheer beauty on your screen. (The first area will always hold a special place in my heart, I don't think I've ever seen a night sky so heartachingly lovely.) You will laugh, you will cry. But don't take my word for it, go play it!!! 

This game is beautiful.

review:
Rime is a beautiful third person world exploring puzzle adventure game.
It throws you in a dense atmospheric world with beautiful graphics and aliving sounds.
Not to mention the fantastic orchestral soundtrack, which gives an extra portion on the story telling emotions.
If you need some holiday, then grab your ticket and visit the world of Rime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141791715', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1590359732}
review:
Rime is hidden gem that all the ages of gammers will love :)
the only reason you won't love this game is if you only like action fast pase games or you don't have a soul...

The game is short however is full of emotions, breathless scenes to look at, an i LOVE! that nobody is talking and the whole
story is discaverd through music visuals pictures and flashbacks

For me this game is a small crypt that i can back whenever i want to relax have some thoughs by my self and when i close the game i am a new happy person :)  because this game speaks to the soul and not the mind ... you have to let your self go with the flow of the game.

The only con of this game is some minor BUGS like the music stops playing for some reason sometimes, or the camera snaps quicly at some places you are climbing but not gamebreaking things 

Last i will say that the game is a walking puzzle game and the world migth not be big but it has so many little details to discover and the game rewards you for that :D .... and after you finish the game check the names of the chapters you played... you migth cry a little <3 

9.2/10 for me because i wanted it longer but that only because is beutifull

author: {'steamid': '76561197988417915', 'num_games_owned': 1002, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1542823602}
review:
Si estas buscando puzzles, una isla para explorar, secretos para encontrar, entonces este no es el juego indicado.
Una experiencia extremadamente lineal, donde es muy extra√±o que uno tenga que desviarse del camino indicado. Se me canso el dedo de tanto apretar para adelanta en el gamepad. Los √∫nicos secretos que hay son coleccionables, que agregan un poco de lore, o alg√∫n que otro disfraz.
Los puzzles son muy rudimentarios, empujar cajas, alinear objetos, poner llave gen√©rica obtenida en x en y, donde no hay manera de no pasar por x primero antes de llegar a y. Subir por cornisas marcadas con pintura blanca en los bordes donde no hay caminos divergentes y es solo mantener el direccional del control y presionar el boton "A" varias veces hasta llegar al final de la secci√≥n...
La historia no es nada excepcional, y hasta el concepto del gameplay esta atado de manera muy dispar sobre la historia. Trata de evocar muchas emociones como el juego Journey de ps3, pero nunca lo logra. Es mas al estilo ABZU,. otro intento de emular a journey sin obtener ning√∫n resultado similar.
Los gr√°ficos si se pude decir que son hermosos, muy bien ambientado est√©ticamente y la variedad de ambientes. Lastima que no fue acompa√±ado por puzzles mas complejos y un poco mas de libertad de exploraci√≥n, que no estuviese atado a alg√∫n coleccionable para llenar una lista de checks.
El juego t√©cnicamente se gana en 5-6 horas, de las cuales el 50% es caminar el punto a al punto b sin hacer mas nada que ir hacia adelante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056161285', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1543769681}
review:
Really beautiful platform/puzzle game.
Even though it doesn't have any dialogue it tells a sad story with environment, action, MC's expressions.

And some slight spoilers to end the review...
[spoiler]
When I played the last chapter of the game I found myself going through 5 stages of grief myself:
[olist]
    [*][b]Denial:[/b] Nop, the boy isn't dead. I didn't see that. That was just my imagination.
    [*][b]Anger:[/b] How dare you do this to me at the end!!! You monster!!!!
    [*][b]Bargaining:[/b] This isn't the end right, I can still fix this somehow? If I collect everything I will get some kind of good ending, right?
    [*][b]Depression:[/b] Oh, damn it, now I'm sad because of this ending... 
    [*][b]Acceptance:[/b] Well, that was a nice little game with a sad ending. Really enjoyed it.
[/olist]
[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983397005', 'num_games_owned': 628, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1542833852}
review: I am pretty critical when it comes to puzzle games as I want something not too challenging but also dont want to be fed the answers. This game does that and more. Not only is it well thought out and very elegantly designed it has some amazing visuals. The transitions of the environment while solving puzzles to the day and night cycles on the island. Simple Beautiful.

Um jogo fantestico e belo em todos os detalhes,

author: {'steamid': '76561198048210862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1577380954}
review:
Bien que n'ayant jou√© que quelques heures et en √©tant loin de la fin, je trouve que ce jeu est magnifique.
Les graphismes sont simples mais envoutants, le world design est extraordinaire, laissant place √† de spendides vues tout en montrant de multiples "mondes" en un seul.
La bande son est quand √† elle en harmonie avec le jeu, agr√©able, discr√®te et m√©lodieuse. Un nectar pour les oreilles.
L'histoire ne nous est pas impos√©e, c'est √† nous de comprendre (ou pas) le pass√© et le pr√©sent du h√©ros et de ce monde.

Bref, quand on joue √† ce jeu on perd la notion du temps.
√Ä acheter les yeux ferm√©s si on aime ce genre (aventure, puzzle).

Un seul b√©mol, cit√© plusieurs fois dans les autres commentaires: les objets collectibles et les achievments, qui √† mon go√ªt, nuisent √† la bonne immersion, puisqu'il y a de nombreux points de non-retour...

author: {'steamid': '76561198073500320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1542814378}
review:
Œôt's not the destination so much as the journey, they say!

And that's exactly what Rime is. An amazing concept of art and emotions. A great journey through an enormous and dazzling world full of secrets and puzzles. Take your time with it and don't be hasty. It's not about rushing through the puzzles or to the next check point or chapter. It has a beutiful story that you should experience if you like that kind of games.
Don't miss it guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990255834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1559843470}
review:
What started out as an intriguingly innocent game quickly became one of the most emotional experiences I've ever had with any digital media. I can honestly say I was not prepared for what this game pulled me through. Do yourself a favor and take your time in the game. Find every secret you can. It is well worth it, as all of it leads up to one of the most tearful endings to a game I've yet seen.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046257814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1542486850}
review:
An artistic beauty throughout that is stylistically impressive and aesthethetically pleasing throughout with a gorgeous soundtrack to accompany it. Rime is a game that waits until its last moments to bring you into a larger picture and it is then that everything you had done prior becomes that much more emblamatic and poignant. It is a charming, symbolic, and unforgettable take on its central thematic elements, though it is hard to delve into specifics without giving too much away. 

It is worth noting that this game is a bit demanding on the hardware side at max settings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013812373', 'num_games_owned': 1762, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1542730115}
review:
Rime is the complete tonal opposite of Tequila Works' previous game, Deadlight. Where Deadlight focused on shadows, darkness and despair, Rime is a constant play of warmth, light and affirmation. This can easily been seen in the games' lovely, bright visual style but also in the overall feel of the game. Rime made me think of huge personal favorites like Journey, ICO, A tale of Two Brothers and more recently the delightful Abzu. 

Like those games Rime tells a (mostly silent) story that ends up being so much more than just a series of environments to explore, obstacles to overcome or puzzles to solve. Without going into detail and spoiling the wonderful story, Rime made my heart ache and my soul soar. This is mostly attributed to the sublime soundtrack that accompanies the games most important scenes. 

Does all that make Rime a perfect game? Unfortunatly not. The games two greatest flaws are the obtuse puzzles - which rarely go beyond pushing a button and carrying around a globe of light - and the jarring graphics. Even on my fairly powerful system I was constantly trying to ignore massive stuttering and jarring gameplay, which took away a fair bit of the enjoyment for me. 

It's a huge shame, because with some more thoughtful puzzle design and variety, and a more stable engine, Rime could have been one of those perfect games for me. As it stands, it is still a great game but it could have been so much more. 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198093782869', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1601849196}
review:
Juste une chose √† dire, Merci aux d√©veloppeurs d'avoir publi√© ce jeu!
Tu commences, tu ne sais pas trop quoi faire et tu te demande ce qui t'arrive, mais tu avances tranquilement dans un d√©cor magnifique, petit a petit les √©venements se compliquent, mais le jeu se fait tout seul, et √† la fin tu comprends, t'as l'√©quipe de dev qui se met en face de toi et qui te met une belle giffle!!
J'ai rarement vu un sujet comme celui la aussi bien maitris√© au travers un jeu. Ne cherchez pas le challenge dans ce jeu, cherchez l'histoire dans cette Oeuvre d'art!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018812709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1602794723}
review: I would consider this game to be one of the greatest, most heartfelt games I've ever played. The music was wonderful, the landscapes were captivating, the puzzles were challanging, and the story had me in tears. I will not go into details so as to not spoil anything but I would consider this as impactful on an emotional level as To the Moon, Dear Esther, and Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons. I implore you to give this game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994984293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1669907877}
review:
I did read at youtube that this game got a lot of criticism, and I can't really understand why... 

- Graphics are gorgeous (even when there are some flaws), the fact that they are cel-shading is a personal preference or taste.
- Soundtrack is... gosh, it takes away your breath, it's perfectly changing with the phases of the game and brings an emotional tension I didn't feel in any game before.
- History is driven by actions without even a sole word, which is hard to find nowadays. *SPOILER* [spoiler]The end and resolution will leave you in tears, seriously, I could barely read the credits. Only by the end you start to shape what the history is about, and when I saw the name of the 5 phases and the ending, all was clear[/spoiler].

Resuming, it's a game made out of love, for your family, [spoiler]for  those that are no more amongst us[/spoiler], for life. If I ever have a kid, I want him to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019838342', 'num_games_owned': 1070, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1542424941}
review: Short and sweet adventure puzzle platformer.  Not overly difficult, VERY pretty game, mixes up the mechanics pretty regularly for the most part.  Did a great job of guiding player without overt navigation icons (instead uses natural architecture, pillars of light, etc.) which really added to the mood.  Fantastic story and atmosphere, no spoilers but I liked the ending!  Very much recommended, that's for sure.  I actually bought it twice in two places I liked it so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075930001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1542837231}
review:
[i][b]RiME[/b][/i] is a puzzle-platformer. 
All elements of the game work well together - light puzzles and platforming sections, interesting and emotional story, beautiful and stylish graphics and soundtrack, responsive and customizable controls, hard-to-find collectibles, reasonable lenght of playthrough. There are no spoken dialogue nor combat. The story gets darker as game progresses. The only downsides, I can think of, is that parts of the story (background) are locked behind above-mentioned collectibles,  the cut-scenes are unskippable and the game occasionally stops responding (freezes).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025427208', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1542824794}
review:
I have not gotten all the way through this game yet, but I've seen enough to know that this is a real winner.  The design is beautiful and there's a fair mix of problem-solving and hand-eye co√∂rdination skills needed (heavier on the problem solving, happily).

It's also the sort of game where you can just sort of sit there for a few minutes and take in the sights.  You're not on the clock, so you're free to wander the strange little island you're stranded on.

As for how absorbing this game can be, when I first launched it, I figured I'd poke at it a little before turning in.  Two hours later, I finally went to bed (an hour later than I should have), resentful for once of the physical need for sleep because I just plain wanted to explore more.

[b]Recommended[/b] for style and substance both.  One dares hope for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216462697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1542133684}
review: Very pleasant and beautiful experience.  Taps into real emotions without any words/text.  Poorly optimized for PC.  Really chugger for me at parts, where my hardware should have been more than adequate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303417793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1542332339}
review: Es un juego muy bueno,  es muy parecido al JOURNEY que salio en PS3 o a ICO de PS2, sin duda la historia es buena aunque no tiene dialogos, es muy inversivo, un juego relax que se disfruta al pasarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978915282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1542320639}
review:
Beautiful, soothing, fascinating, touching.
I think this game is seriously underrated. It is obvious a lot of love has been poured into this work of interactive art, and I highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates mood over action, silence over exposition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063814126', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1542315002}
review: Beautiful, simple and ultimately emotional. An experience I want more of in gaming.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985345510', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1553899189}
review: Thanks for this masterpiece, so long from the last time I've enjoyed a videogame that much. It's a game of the highest quality and attended to up to the last detail of this beautiful being.... stunning scenarios that kept my mouth opened all the game,  a charming story where an image is more valuable than thousands of words, really good puzzles that didn't get me bored and  last, but not least, its amazing OST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023218150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1542305299}
review: Amazing game. The story is very heavy and emotional, with tons of subtle depth. Visually- the game is stunning, but there are some frame pacing issues that were bad enough that I had to lock the framerate for consistancy, but  well worth it. Cant really talk much about the game without getting into spoilers, but highly recommended, on sale or at full price. It's a shame this game did not sell better than it did, they dont make these kinds of game often. Think Ico but with more depth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007550545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1542302839}
review:
I felt like 'The Little Prince' while playing this, absolutely gorgeous!

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] Beatiful environments and visuals
[*] Incredible soundtrack
[*] Interesting puzzles, nothing too hard
[*] Interesting story
[/list]

[h1]Notes[/h1]
[list]
[*] A few times you will find the controls a bit clunky (in particular when climbing over things), or wish the character would run faster
[*] Supports 21:9 almost flawlessly. FOV could jump for a half a second during the end/start of cutscenes, but that's it. Nothing too bad or game breaking.
[/list]

Overally a very warmly recommended title!

review: No puedo recomendarlo lo suficiente. Un grand√≠simo juego de plataformas y una est√©tica insuperable. La historia, aunque cr√≠ptica la mayor parte del juego, es de lo mejor y el final es de los que se quedan en la memoria.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960788425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1541306898}

author: {'steamid': '76561198298908839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1541429719}
review:
[h1] About Rime [/h1]
It really touched me. This game told an amazing story, while applying in a puzzle-platformer game. However, the game itself doesn‚Äôt really shine in gameplay. The puzzle feels weak, compare to other puzzle-platformer games such as Q.U.B.E. series and Portal series, where those games open up your imaginations in solving those puzzles. The platforming sometimes seems off too. There are cetain times where my protagonist just doesn‚Äôt jump to where I want to. Precision is very important in platformer games, which is why Mario is always getting the praise. However, the graphics are suited for this game, and it unfolds a very strong story, make this game worth it. 

It is better to wait for sale tho, if you are not sure of it.

[h1] The story (Heavy spoiler ahead)	[/h1]

The story starts off with a little boy wondering around, trying to seek for something. The true story slowly unfolds when the little boy progress. For people who had not yet finished or buy the game, please do not continue, this is all you need to know.

For people who had finished the game but unable to connect to the story, [spoiler] this is a story that talks about five stages of grief, in a very superb way. The little boy tries to seek for something, which I interpret as denial. The father is not accepting the death of his son during the sail. As such, everything is seems beautiful, nice and peaceful. Then, as the masking effect of denial starts to wear off, anger comes in. The ‚Äúeagle‚Äù is the sign of anger. The metal ball is the sign of something important, and that the eagle, which representing the father, do not want to loss such important stuff/memories. As you progress in retrieving the metal ball, the ‚Äúfather‚Äù is actually slowly wearing the anger stage, and going into bargaining. However, the bargaining stage didn‚Äôt really show much from my point of view. The only significant sign is that there are times where you will see a red hood guy walks past in sight, but it slips quickly. The red hood guy is the ‚Äúfather‚Äù. ‚ÄúWhat if, I was there? What if, I was able to catch him?	[/spoiler]

[spoiler] As you reach to a statue where you have to activate 4 small statues, a ‚Äúdark aura‚Äù strikes in the little boy, and started to walk very slow. This is the stage of ‚Äúdepression‚Äù. His father, at this point, realise that his son is no longer here, despite he wished to. He starts to prepare a quiet preparation (the one-eyed robots), to accept this. As the robots starts unlocking the door, so does the ‚Äúdoor‚Äù of his heart. In the end phrase, we see the real protagonist, the father, goes into his son room. The fox figurine is right there to remind that his son is gone, and is not coming back. He later on, let go of the red hood, which in fact was belong to his son.	[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999380987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 1942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1529483686}
review: Santa montica games, your company will always have a soft spot in my heart. This company started a genre that everyone can enjoy. This game specifically though brought so many stunning visuals, beautiful sound tracks, and compelling storylines that i can say i have never expierenced in that way before. If you are looking for a game to play with someone you careabout, or even alone, i would reccomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971283341', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1551146480}
review: I stopped playing this for the same reason I stopped playing Darksiders: the camera dramatically swings around, changing the your angle, which causes the WASD keys to suddenly have all different meanings. You can be running along a narrow bridge with you finger on the 'W' key, when all of the sudden, the camera swings around to the left, causing the character to turn right and happily jump of the bridge to his death. Darksiders would do this during platforming sequences! I'm sure this is much easier to cope with using a thumbstick on a controller, but using a KBD+MOUSE (as ones does for PC games), it's so unnecessary and frustrating. Like the designers care more for the cinematic drama than the actual playability.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856243050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1601346892}
review: Love this game. The puzzles aren't extremely difficult but the amazing visuals make up for it. The style is beautiful and the story is deep and emotional.  Definitely would recomend. Has a slight Legend of Zelda vibe to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027224821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1542056150}
review: Rime is a beautiful, little game filled with melancholy moments, some unique puzzle mechanics and story that's presented without any dialogue or text. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a short experience to break up their usual blam, boom and kaboom video game experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970478045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 659, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1542048712}
review:
What a wonderful game!  I bounced off it initially- the controls are a bit 'stodgy' and it all seems a bit slow, so I put it aside.  A few months later, wondering what to play I gave it another go, and I'm so glad I did.  

The artwork is fabulous, the music wonderful, and as you go through the game, more and more things start to make sense before the beautifully moving denouement.

The game is packed with delightful moments & surprises, and though the puzzles and platforming are straightforward, I never felt frustrated at a lack of 'action'.  If you like something a little more thoughtful,  if you liked Journey or Brothers: AToTS then I think you'll like this.

Bravo Tequila Works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965211069', 'num_games_owned': 2537, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1542044638}
review:
Nice history and artwork, recommended if you like plataformers and puzzle games. Maybe the movement of the character is a bit too slow for my taste, but it's a great game.

Aproximately 5~6 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002590804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1543780946}
review:
It's been a long time since a game has given me the feels that this one has.  It reduced me to a blubbering fool.
I have been gaming for nearly 40 years across all the platforms.  I can honestly put this game in my top 10.

Only con is that there was not enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040210582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 998, 'last_played': 1542056533}
review:
Game atmosphere, look and sound great. Reminds me of "Laputa: Castle in the Sky", ancient high tech civilization and soundtrack similar. Puzzles not hard but thought behind them new to me.

Sadly WAY to short for price they originally asked. Even with replaying to find items I missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077512177', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1541959082}
review: Simply amazing.  This is one of the few games in which everything from the graphics, sounds and music all work together to tell one of the most emotional stories I've ever experienced in a game.  Do yourself a favor and play this one and don't try to hold your tears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042736162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1557690303}
review:
RiME war von anfang an, wo es angek√ºndigt wurde ein Spiel, wo ich meine Augen drauf hatte. Da ich gro√üer Zelda Fan bin und mich die R√§tsel des Spieles sehr an die Dungeons meiner Lieblings-Videospielreihe erinnerten, schlo√ü ich das Spiel schnell in mein Herzen. Wie stark jedoch die Reise werden w√ºrde, auf die RiME mich nahm h√§tte ich selbst nicht in meinen k√ºhnsten Tr√§umen erwartet. Ohne spoilern zu wollen: RiME hat es in sich. Die Story, die Atmosph√§re und der atemberaubende Soundtrack nehmen einen mit auf eine Reise, die sich selbst nicht mal hinter die gr√∂√üten Genrekollegen verstecken muss. Die Story ging mir sehr zu Herzen, mehr noch als zuletzt Breath of the Wild.

Dieses Spiel ist ein Meisterwerk! Absolute Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004485931', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1541907252}
review: Was originally drawn to this game because of its striking visual style and fantastic music, but was very surprised at the tone of the story. The game mechanics outside of the exploration and platforming may seem strange on the surface but as you piece together the story they become powerful metaphors. It's not a challenging game but it's also not intended to be. There are quite a few hidden collectables, but they're optional and while some of them give you slivers of story, I was more satisified with staying on the main path for most of the game. If the visuals and music pique your interest and you enjoy third person exploration games with light puzzles, then you should certainly check out Rime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000895832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1541817822}
review: This game is seriously a perfect 10/10. The journey this game takes you on is beautifully crafted and will leave you crying at the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979950487', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1541887847}
review: Speechless, this game was really good. Simple, nice graphics and a good story. About 7-8 hrs playtime, and the riddles was not really hard so you don't spend a lot of time stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979907069', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1541867551}
review:
L'aventure ne m'a pas du tout plu! 
Au d√©but on dirait un jeu d'aventures avec quelques √©nigmes, en tout cas pour les deux premiers mondes. Et puis apr√®s plus rien, c'est la mort du gameplay. Le jeu fait des efforts avec la musique mais la narration ne fonctionne pas sur moi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119268685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1544271796}
review:
Sin palabras. Parece mentira que obras de arte de este calibre tengan origen espa√±ol. Por que, esto no es un videojuego, es arte en movimiento que evoca sensaciones.

Despu√©s de m√°s de 35 a√±os jugando videojuegos, he visto de todo, as√≠ que s√≥lo puedo felicitar a todos los implicados en este juego, por vuestro fant√°stico trabajo.

No s√© cu√°l es vuestro techo, pero seguramente, y espero equivocarme, hab√©is creado la obra suprema de vuestra vida.

Este juego hace pocos a√±os podr√≠a clasificarse de triple A, y poco tiene que envidiarle al ICO o tantos otros.

La banda sonora magistral, las animaciones, la interrelaci√≥n de los personajes, la idea que subyace de c√≥mo contar una historia sin palabras, bas√°ndose en evocar sentimientos y emociones, lo que la hace intergeneracional, interracial y multicultural.

Pese a todo, y siempre hay un pero, es cierto lo que comentan algunos, el rendimiento no es su fuerte. Lo juego en ultra con un I5 3570K y una 1080TI, y en algunas transiciones se nota la rascada de FPS. Si no fuese por esto √∫ltimo ser√≠a perfecto.

Por otro lado los puzles son sencillitos, pero ... ¬ø por qu√© tienen que ser complejos ? Este es un juego que debe disfrutarlo desde un ni√±o de 6 a√±os hasta un viejoven como yo.

Es un MUST HAVE, necesario en la biblioteca de cualquiera que se considere jugador.

Mi nota un 9.9 de 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071626471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1119, 'last_played': 1541871409}
review:
Wow.... this game.... it really takes the words out of you....

First let me say it's not a game for anyone, the game takes pride in the little details and in no way hands you the whole story with it's full meaning just like that, while it will of course wrap it up in the ending.... how much of the journey and it's soul piercing content you really get, it's up to you and your ability to observe and distinguish the tells along the game.
The art is simple and beautiful, and along with the amazing music it can be breathtaking if you let yourself into the game and along for the journey.

It's not a game that aims to be challenging, not even difficult. It's a casual meaningful game of exploration and puzzles (not hardcore puzzles or anything). But if you do like those games and you allow yourself to immerse in the experience, this is one of those titles you need to get.

Just let yourself go and enjoy this fully

(Btw, dont be afraid to get emotionally attached ;)  )

author: {'steamid': '76561197983749619', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1541356491}
review:
MUY BUEN JUEGO, aunque no se te correr√° el RIMEl... Ba Dum Tss!

Juegazo corto, contundente y precioso. Peca en el rendimiento, que no es todo lo fluido que podr√≠a, 
ya que he tenido que limitar el framerate a 30 frames en un i5 con 16 Gb de RAM y una 970, m√°quina modesta
pero capaz de moverme algunas burradas gr√°ficas de forma decente a 1080. 
   En el aspecto puramente art√≠stico, es un portento. Gr√°ficos vistosos en un mundo lleno de detalles. M√∫sica envolvente y que acompa√±a sin desentonar, y enfatiza cuando toca.
   A nivel de puzzles, son relativametne sencillos, variados, y van moviendo el desarrollo de la historia de forma coherente. 
   La historia es la otra pata que cojea, porque pretende ser muy emotiva, que entiendas el dolor del protagonista ante algunos acontecimientos. Pero no llega a conseguirlo. Le falta tiempo, ves algunos actos que parecen impostados, no te parece coherente lo que expresa el protagonista en relaci√≥n a lo que ha vivido ante tus ojos.

   Pero estos dos fallitos que he comentado ser√≠a lo que le faltar√≠a al juego para ser redondo. Ya es un 9, una experiencia que has de probar s√≠ o s√≠. De un estudio espa√±ol que ha sabido capear un desarrollo complicado y sacar un muy buen juego que ha sobrevivido al hype.

   Totalmente recomendable!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148970075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1541781055}
review: Not used to writing any reviews at all, but this game sureley deserves it. Beautiful, scintillating and deeply moving, it is surely a one-of-a-kind game that let's you understand a wide variety of feelings and emotions related to a very disturbing and particular situation without a single word being spoken. The music and the atmosphere tell you everything you need to know. and understand. Congrats to the devs, this is a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126520825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1541542437}
review:
I really, really wanted to like this game. I came back to it a handful of times after having determined it wasn't for me just in case I'd find something amazing that would lead a total change of heart, but it didn't happen. Unfortunately, this is a game I'll have to write off as "competent, but boring". 

I'm sure the developers did a good job executing what they were going for, with a nice atmosphere, an adorable greek-ish graphical style, an understated melancholic and mysterious tone, and beautiful sprawling sceneries. I really wanted to like it because the main character really looks, sounds and acts in a likable manner, and the worlds are absolutely gorgeous. Unfortunately, the game did not "click" with me. The sad music coupled with the slow pace and long sections of nothing but uneventful corridors and rooms made for a boring experience most of the time.

Admittedly, the first thing that disappointed me about this game is the gap between what I assumed the game was gonna be like and how it actually was. When I saw that the main character was a shipwrecked kid on an unknown island, I expected it to be more of an open world platformer, and was quickly proven wrong. Very little of the world is open to exploration at any given time, and optional branching paths tend to be short and lead only to optional collectibles, so the bulk of the game is mostly linear.  Say, the game's worlds are less like a large tree and its branches and more like a centipede and its feet, if that makes sense. I can't give the game crap for this, however, it's just a disconnect between my expectations and reality.

Still, it doesn't help that the game pretty much punishes exploration in certain parts by making you backtrack through long obvious platforming sections if you drop down one too many tall ledges in search of secrets. I swear to god this happened to me like five times while exploring the desert world. I'd drop down a seemingly interesting path only to learn it took me back to the beginning of whatever structure I had to climb, forcing me to go a long way back up, at which point I'd just give up and walk towards my fox buddy to move on. Add to that the fact that pretty much every platforming section is an obvious zero-choice game of "find the right thing to jump towards" requiring no timing or skill, and you have a tedious platforming experience. Sure, one may claim that platforming is not the game's main focus, but it is still wide spread throughout the whole experience, serving as little more than a zero-stakes, zero-choice and often overlong bridge between the actually interesting bits.

To make matters worse, if you shut off the game and return to it later, you might have a hard time remembering where to go depending on where you left off, especially when the paths ahead are winding and confusing to navigate. I understand that the game does not have minimaps or pointers to avoid breaking immersion, but it'd still help to have something other than our yappy fox friend to guide us around, especially when the first thing we have to do after reloading the game is locate the bloody thing.

Dialog-free storytelling is all well and good, but after having watched a handful of cinematics and looked at some wall paintings and keyholes, all I gather is that we're a shipwrecked kid whose parents were some important folks, and the recurring pervert in the Little Red Riding Hood suit is apparently important too, as he's in our boat when it gets caught in a storm. In general, the game did not engage me enough for me to want to piece the story together. This game might contain a beautiful, deep, heart wrenching plot, but I'll never know because the game itself bored me. Maybe I'll watch a Let's Play one of these days, as having someone talking while playing feels like a sure fire way to keep it from making me fall asleep.

Anyway, let's move on to the good bits, because I do think this game has many positive traits. In spite of the linearity, and the platforming being basic and uninteresting, the game has a ton of interesting puzzles and mechanics that make for short moments of genuine enjoyment amidst the overall dragging feeling that populates most of it. While the puzzles in the first island are rather simplistic, the ones in the second island are fun and interesting, giving me that "eureka" feeling when I figured them out. One mechanic that stood out to me was the damn bird thing that jumpscares you if you stay too long under the sun, like the world's most adamant skin cancer awareness activist, because it ramps up the stakes, making us carefully and meticulously plan our route forward to expose ourselves for as little time as possible as we walk from sheltered area to sheltered area. Probably the second most fun part of the game.

All that is brought down, however, by the fact that the paths connecting every good part of the game are mostly uneventful and occasionally outrageously long, being basically a "press forward simulator", except with you occasionally having to press buttons other than forward when navigating the aforementioned boring and simplistic platforming sections.

All in all, I was disengaged. I stopped playing after a while and didn't feel like coming back to it. The game has sudden spikes in engagement when we need to overcome an actual puzzle or challenge, but those are sparsely spread out amidst mostly linear and predictable walking, jumping and swimming sections with that droning sad music. The lullaby-ish soundtrack and lack of dialog makes those sections tedious as all hell.

I really like what this game was setting out to do, but I think it took way too many liberties with the slow pace, large empty spaces, and scripted platforming sections. Maybe if there was a narrator with a deep voice or something, that might have gotten me engaged enough to plow through it, but I digress. Who knows, though, you might enjoy it more than I did, if you have a higher than average tolerance for the almost uninterrupted melancholic atmosphere, and a better brain than me to piece the story together. 

All that being said, I do think this game is a valuable little piece of art. I may come back to it one day, probably to see if I can finally try piecing the story together. Who knows, I might start liking the game after that. So yeah, my opinion of this game is more "mixed" than "negative".

author: {'steamid': '76561198040399625', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1690614607}
review:
A marvelous game, with fantastic visuals, sound design, and music. What sets RiME apart is its unique visual landscapes that vary in tone throughout the game. Cryptic images and symbols can be found all over the maps, which add to the mystery and style of the game. I was particularly impressed with how much work went into the hidden areas, which are visual gems that make the world feel even more expansive.

Some of the "puzzles" were quite inventive, especially the physics bending ones, but I wouldn't call this game a puzzle game; it was an experiential game. You explore, you travel, you see. The "puzzles" were mostly a way of getting from one place to another and weren't very challenging. That said, I like experiential games, but you should know what you're getting with RiME.

Lastly, the score. The music was what drew me initially to the game (even though the trailer was poorly made IMO), and I was not dissappointed. I savoured the lush moments of the music, and liked how it held back during most of the game to give greater impact to those special moments. I wish the music took a more unique route, especially as the game progressed, since its influences (Joe Hisaishi, Michael Nyman, etc.) were front-and-centre throughout the entire game.

Though it has its flaws, overall, I highly recommend RiME.

NB: The game requires a pretty decent graphics card to get the most out of the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972357458', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1542898563}
review:
I have tried to edit out the spoilers for those who are yet to play the game however some may remain.

Gameplay: run, jump, climb, shout, interact, that is how you play. The shouting is a form of interact that triggers the lamps and most things that have a slight glow at range, interact is used for moving blocks and picking up items. You will unlock a fox guide near the beginning of the game, and can help out with the story. The game is a railroaded story with no branches although there is plenty of space to explore for the hidden collectables. The achievements are mostly centered around exploration of the island and collecting of the optional collectables.

Difficulty: Easy, there are two types of ‚Äòenemy‚Äô in the game and are both easy to avoid and one acts as more of an environmental hazard. The puzzles are straightforward and never leaves the player feeling stuck, some collectable are protected by slightly tougher puzzles but remain in the easy category. Hints larger scale puzzles are given on a will that the camera will lock onto in a mini cutscene upon entering the area or given as a vision when the way to the puzzle area is opened.

Story: The games story of what is happening won't be revealed to the player until the end of the fourth chapter, until then it will raise more questions than answers. It is delivered without any dialogue making this game multilingual by default (except for the menu, credits and some hints) to offer any description of what the story is about would be an extreme spoiler. If you are the sort to allow yourself to get involved in the story/atmosphere of a game then have a box of tissues handy as the game has some sad moments around <Spoiler>.

Graphics and sound: The sound will help draw you in and one set of collectables is the parts of a lullaby. Wildlife makes the appropriate sounds when required such that it blends into the location seamlessly. Visually the game is stunning with the settings maxed out with the various areas conveying the feel of the area and showing even small details like lizards on the walls, schools of fish in the sea

Longevity: Rime a short game game that can be completed in about 8 hours for main story line and probably another 12 to get all the collectables. The game is replayable however if you want to recollect the collectable you will need to disable cloud save and delete the save file. Due to the nature of the story, expansions and direct sequels are highly improbable without sacrificing story quality.

Final verdict: An enjoyable game that will hit the feels right at the end. Recommended but not at ¬£30 due to short length.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024443656', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1541567542}
review:
Without giving any spoilers, RIME is a masterpiece. The amazing world design, the beauty of the music, and the deeply emotional meaning that slowly becomes clear lends to an unforgetable experience. 
The puzzles and obstacles aren't especially hard, and the game is pretty forgiving if you do manage to beef it. 
It's definitely important to take your time with this game, as there's always a secret collectable hidden just out of view. While the collectables themselves don't affect the gameplay in any way, they do help flesh out the story, and they add poignancy to the ending. This isn't a case of "find all 200 gems to unlock the true ending," it's the same either way, but it makes what happens way more meaningful. [I can't really say more without spoiling it.]
This is the kind of game I'd pay +$60 for. The care and commitment Tequila Works put into making a beautiful experience is apparent in just about every little detail, and I'm still not over the ending.

TL;DR: RIME is an amazing game and a beautiful story. Its casual puzzles are forgiving but entertaining, and the big reveal at the end will stick with you for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029508562', 'num_games_owned': 2560, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1541555721}
review: I almost gave up on RiME. The character is slow-moving and the puzzles (especially in the first 2 chapters) are rather simple and easy, so the beautiful graphics and sound weren't enough to hook me at first. Slowly I became intrigued about the story, and then also wanted to experience whatever feelings and powerful moments the game would bring next - that kept me going and made it worth my time. Not a masterpiece, but clearly positive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997013831', 'num_games_owned': 2447, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1540968554}
review:
I'm a little surprised more people aren't talking about this game. The opening hour is brilliant. While the rest of the game never quite reaches the same heights that the first impression leaves, it is still a really enjoyable and noteworthy game. Especially for the PC, which I always feel is lacking these types of well polished 3rd person adventure/puzzler games. I mean they exist, they're just not usually as clean as RIME is.

It's simple, but simple works. Some segments are tense, some are peaceful. While there might be some storytelling through the environments, I never felt like I was being beaten over the head with any 'look how important all this is' nonsense. You mostly just move from place to place, puzzle to puzzle, with a sense of wonder. It's linear, but there are alternate routes to explore which contain secrets. The music especially stands out and really carries a lot of the emotional weight, moving you along through each scenic moment.

I finished the game in just under 5 hours, but I didn't even come close to finding all the little collectibles. RIME doesn't do anything to reinvent the 3rd person adventure genre, but it is a standout release for the PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153214273', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1531, 'last_played': 1576709138}
review:
This is game is an emotional journey. It's all about that journey, magnificently so. It's not difficult -- no puzzle will stump you for long. There's no combat; the few 'enemies' you'll encounter serve as obstacles, not challenges. Rime simply presents a world to explore and a story to uncover.

And wow -- the story. Seriously. It moves me and haunts me. It is so superbly told, with no dialog whatsoever: only visuals, gameplay, and music. I will always remember this game.

Particularly if you are a fan of Team Ico games or of Hayao Miyazaki animation, absolutely buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970792772', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1541299695}
review:
If you liked Ico, you should buy this.  While it's not quite as good as Ico itself is, it shares many characteristics of it (a puzzle platformer with no spoken dialogue in a beautiful setting laden with the feels).

Puzzles are well designed, with a few core mechanics used consistently but with slightly different twists each time, so they are familiar enough to solve without getting boring.

Platforming is straightforward and forgiving; there's a few times you can get lost or miss the cues about where to go next, but the controls handle well and if you do miss a jump you're usually landed right back ready for another go without losing any progress.  (The jumps themselves tend to err on the forgiving side; on occasion your character will visibly not quite make the jump but the game will let you latch on and continue anyway rather than dropping you into the void.  I consider this a good thing.)  There are a few spots where it probably would have been better to use a controller (due to camera angles and needing to do the two-key running shuffle), but I played through using keyboard and mouse just fine.

The environments are beautiful (especially at the beginning, although later chapters are still beautiful in a different way).  The only downer here is that on my system (which is not the best, but is reasonably decent) there are quite a few spots where it's unable to maintain a stable 60 FPS, so wide angle camera motion in particular can sometimes suffer a bit.  As this only really happened during cinematic transitions it never particularly affected gameplay.

There is a definite story in the game, although it's one that's best experienced for yourself, and since it is of the "silent but evocative" type, in some cases each person might come away with a slightly different idea of what story it was actually telling, somewhat informed by their own experiences.  But this is fine, and as long as you see it through to the end (and avoid spoiling yourself beforehand) you should get something good out of it.  Several articles have been written based on interviews with the game's creators as well as other people's experiences of the story, but you really should try to avoid reading these until you've played it through at least once on your own.

For the explorers and completionists, it comes with a healthy number of hidden secrets, collectibles, and achievements, which you can either spend time hunting down on your first playthrough or use the Chapter Select feature to jump back later on to collect things you missed.  (There are only one or two things that are actually impossible to find on your first playthrough, although unless you're very thorough you're likely to miss quite a bit more than that.)

Overall, again: if you like this sort of thing, you should play this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092126420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1541293621}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965811013', 'num_games_owned': 1559, 'num_reviews': 269, 'playtime_forever': 362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1541291219}

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1541275651}
review:
Ever since Ico became popular I've seen a lot of games attempt doing something similar - a puzzle and platforming 3D game with no spoken narration, simple but beautiful artstyle, moving music and some central concept/idea to it all. And as more and more indie developers became enabled to use powerful engines that allow creating something mechanically simple, but beautiful and, hopefully, evocative, the amount of games of this type went up dramatically. RiME is just another example of this type of game. Made with lots of care, genuinely good looking, with a good story concept behind it and yet all too familiar, not particularly fun and ultimately forgettable.

The big issue RiME has lies in the fact that the game never really gets anything to truly hook you with. You run, jump, climb and scream at things to solve problems as you start the game, and that's all you do until the end, with all of these basic mechanics being rather bland. There's never any clever challenge or strategy involved with the platforming bits as they just use the modern approach to 3D platforming where you go along the only (and usually obvious) path, clearly outlined and never need to think where you are in space. Puzzles suffer from a bizarre decision to make action button work only after a short pause after a full stop and scream not working at times if another animation is playing, meaning you always come to a full stop, wait a bit and then hope that you can perform the action necessary, which isn't helping already mundane puzzle design.

And the game never properly knows if it wants to be about exploration or not, as it would give you a bunch of things to collect throughout the game world, and give you an open space, but then can just push you into a linear path when you least expect it with no way to backtrack and see if you've missed anything. In addition right from the start it gives you one of the most obnoxious "guide" I've encountered in games - a magic fox that barks (more like yaps) to "help" you find the way. With the issue being that it always does it either when there's only one way you can take, or when it's somewhere offscreen and you can't possibly know how to get to it, making it useless and annoying in both cases. And not helping if you're trying to explore.

There's no good story or even mood hook either. There's an attempt at one, but when the revelation of what this game is all about comes, it feels unexpected because the game never actually delivers on that mood at any point prior to that. Like if I'd start showing you my ninth grade pictures while punk rock plays and then at the end tell that this experience was meant to help you understand how to make better pasta. It's not completely unrelated because I like pasta, but... It still doesn't feel like that's what the experience was supposed to be about.

Not that the game doesn't try to be interesting and evocative. It does look good, it does sound good (sans that annoying fox), there are a few puzzles that aren't boring and there are moments that are genuinely interesting. And there is a certain desire to make the game feel as varied as it could. It's just that this isn't enough and it's one of those instances where after finishing the game in 5 hours you feel drained as if you spent the entire day and all your energy on it without really getting anything in return.

RiME seems to have its heart in the right place and it does feel like it tried to be an interesting moving and beautiful journey. But it's not what it turned out to be. It's not a game you should be specifically avoiding and maybe you would have some good times with it, just wondering around and enjoying the look and the mood of the areas. But I can't recommend specifically purchasing the game unless you get it as part of some bundle as your time and money would be better spent elsewhere.¬†

author: {'steamid': '76561198088547612', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1541799812}
review:
Bello da giocare per gli amanti dei puzzle ambietali e arrampicate come il sottoscritto, ma non mi ha emozionato e affascinato come Submerged o Papo YO.

Ottimo Level Design e Comparto Tecnico, 6 ore sono passate come il vento.

Per√≤ ho odiato i livelli sott'acqua se non siete amanti delle nuotate ansiogene, preparati a bestemmiare nella sezione centrale del gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327335751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1541240934}
review:
Never before I've written a review, but this gem certainly deserves it - so here it is :)
I really enjoyed the graphics, it looks beautiful! In the beginning, it was not entirely clear (at least to me), to what purpose this adventure would take you - you only get a glimpse at the real purpose bit by bit as you go further. And without spoiling too much - I was really crying at some times during the game, because the story is more than moving and intensely emotional. 
That's what great storytelling is for me - even without complex fights or gaming mechanics, which I found very nice and relaxing for a change. As some pre-writers said before, the puzzles you encounter don't need a genius to solve, but are nevertheless beautifully made and very enjoyable.
If you like games like Abzu or The Journey , you'll probably like this great game here as well! :) 
Definetly worth every cent :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198040527801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1541190455}
review:
Here the list of what i don't like in Rime :

 [list]
    [*]This game is literally way darker than his advertisement screenshots. We explore a lot of underground area, maybe half of the game, so be warned, this is bloddy dark down here... The pretty island is just the front door.

    [*]The game do not drag me into his ... i wanted to say story, but this is precisely what he lacks the most, when the main thing you end up doing is shouting to crank up brazier... and break up amphora... this is not even a side quest, but this is  the kind of regular interaction you get with the world for all of the game...

    [*]This game give you so few elements to process, you can leave you mind go his on way while playing, this is really a strange felling. But at least you can work on your review. Maybe i didn't get this game right, and YOU have to build you own story...i did this game in autopilote.
[/list] 

Maybe I am too old for this, and i fell that the target audience is between  12 and 16.
Too bad steam does not give this kind of info.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042112617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1541257145}
review:
Don't buy this full priced, so glad I got it when it was on sale the other day.

If you liked Journey on Sony's consoles, you're probably going to like this one. Buyer beware though, this game is VERY BADLY optimized due to it's lighting gimmicks. Even if you have a decently high end rig you're still going to experience lag at certain places and will have to drop settings lower.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332321244', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 494, 'last_played': 1541108706}
review:
RiME  ist ein weiteres wundersch√∂nes Beispiel daf√ºr, wie man eine absolut liebevoll gestaltete Welt auch ohne Worte entdecken kann und dabei trotzdem emotional an seine Umgebung und den Hauptcharakter gebunden wird. Der Soundtrack untermalt dabei das ganze Spiel wundervoll und passend. Die Story und Hintergr√ºnde des Spiels werden einem nicht, wie man es von anderen Spielen gew√∂hnt ist, ins Gesicht geworfen, sondern m√ºssen vom aufmerksamen Auge des Spielers entdeckt werden. Das Spiel mutet recht linear an, doch entfaltet es seine wirkliche Gr√∂√üe, wenn man vom offensichtlichen Weg abweicht und den kleinen Hinweisen in der Welt nachgeht, die einem nach und nach vom Schicksal des kleinen Protatgonisten erz√§hlen. Die R√§tsel sind nicht wirklich schwer und man k√∂nnte auch ohne das Spiel zu kennen relativ leicht und schnell durchrennen, aber das braucht RiME gar nicht. RiME erz√§hlt eine Geschichte und es erz√§hlt sie nur dem, der bereit ist sie zu finden.

Der Preis von 35 Euro ist f√ºr 7-8 Stunden Spielzeit etwas teuer, aber im Sale lohnt es sich definitiv zuzuschlagen und sich mal einen Nachmittag freizunehmen um das Spiel durchzuspielen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105445916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1541119041}
review:
RiME is a game with strong artistic design that lacks two of the most important elements in video games: a compelling story or fun gameplay. While its graphics are intriguing, the sound is mediocre with its focus on ambience rather than melody. There is practically no story for at least the first hour of gameplay, leaving you with little desire to aid this character on his quest. 

But its worst flaw is the fact that the gameplay lacks any dimension: between the simplistic "puzzles", generic platforming, and lack of any danger, RiME sacrifices fun for a sort of postmodern, minimalist, atmospheric art experiment. I HATE when games do this; this is not art, its laziness by the developers. Ultimately, RiME is a poor game not worth your time or money. Perhaps it would have been interesting as a short film, but here it just fails.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971135131', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1541070629}
review: De tr√®s beaux graphismes, une excellente bande son, un personnage tr√®s maniable, une ambiance r√©ussie... RiME a malheureusement 2 gros d√©faut : son gameplay et sa dur√©e de vie. Dans ce jeu, on passe beaucoup de temps a marcher, √† r√©soudre quelques √©nigmes simples (en activant des objets au toucher ou par le cri, en alignant son point de vue, en poussant des blocs etc.) et il y a un peu de plateforme (mais ce n'est pas un platformer, √ßa ne demande pas d'adresse). Le jeu est divis√© en chapitres et est lin√©aire. RiME n'est pas un jeu narratif, l'histoire est compl√®tement en retrait et n'est d√©voil√©e qu'√† la fin. Le tout dure entre 4 et 6 heures. A 35 euros c'est trop cher au vu des faiblesses de gameplay, mais le jeu reste relativement plaisant. Prenez le en solde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014088079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1545092602}
review:
Visuals and overall atmosphere are heavily influenced by Shadow of the Colossus, Studio Ghibli films, and a little Jim Henson's Dark Crystal.  It's an amazing, amazing A/V experience.  However, the gameplay is good, too!   The controls are tight and responsive, there's a shockingly wide range of things to do, and you can tell that the devs polished the hell out of the experience to make it as natural and flowing as possible.  For example, the game regularly introduces new goals and gameplay types without ever providing explicit instructions or using words at all, yet you are given enough clues to quickly figure out what to do.  It's very elegantly designed.

Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009282696', 'num_games_owned': 1266, 'num_reviews': 407, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1540979258}
review:
Story hits like a truck. Maybe because it's unexpected, dream kind of mythological story can be moving. First there is charm since it doesn't matter where we are looking this game is simply gorgeous. Soon enough there is much more... Good enough riddles and navigation everything is intuitive which is important considering exploration potential. There are many collectables so 6 hours is not equivalent to the possible time.

It's safe to say that "Rime" can be played and enjoyed by everyone. Without spoiling the story value, gameplay beside riddles is offering platforming sections and moving objects. It is fine sometimes I feel like movements are brutally restricted, only by the lighted edges. Bringing possibility to fail some jumps cause of clunky keyboard controls. Other than that I didn't find anything annoying.

Music is great and adding up shadows and occasional day and night cycles it's cool. Travelling through locations is real joy for the eye. Definitely they implemented some fresh gimmicks to the riddles, problem is that the game became mostly one way ticket. It's hard to feel into this more without words. Yes this game has no dialogues except shout interaction, yet it is incredibly well made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970405203', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1693325294}
review:
Wonderful journey.
Graphics and musics are great.
Puzzles are not too hard and enjoyable.
Controls are OK and the camera works well.
The game runs well, but sometimes it strangely shows less than 30fps, even on my settings (6700k@4.6Ghz 1080ti 16Gb RAM) with AA desactivated.

Artists of Tequila Works made a incredible job : the world is beautiful, the under-the-rain level is incredible, you really feel the rain.

Play this game if you liked Ico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089323010', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1540908323}
review:
The game itself has some flaws, performance could have been better, and price is way to high for a game that you can finish around in 7 hours, more if you really take your time and explore while enjoying the graphics. 
The graphics are something I would call beautiful and artistic, while the game is simple and even an absolute moron could play it.
The story, unless you're so fortified in yourself and force yourself to not feel anything, will make you cry at the end.


If the game is on sale, it's definitely worth it. If it's not on sale, I would rather watch someone else play it on youtube and buy 10 good books for those 30 Euros.
Then again, I find it hard to justify shelling out 10+ Euros on any video game unless it comes with a gold bar.



Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102567286', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1540935690}
review:
So pretty. Great characters. Like controlling a beautiful Saturday morning cartoon. A bit too dark at times, but that usually means there is something hidden near by. Not really difficult but well thought out.

The main story though is obvious and nothing new or special.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006357460', 'num_games_owned': 525, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1606074022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070405731', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1540907431}
review:
One of those games made with soul. You can tell a lot of passion was put into this.
Positive aspects: The visuals are great, sound effects and soundtrack are AMAZING, a few different areas that makes the gameplay very refreshing, some friends you will meet during the story, and a last part and ending that... are... just wow.
The game also has a lot of different collectables very relevant to the main story, which adds a bit of replayability.

Things that could have been better/improved: Puzzles (except a couple, they were simple and lacking originality). Duration (I completed the game finding half the collectables in 5 hours). Controls (a bit clunky time to time on some jumps/platforming). None of this negative aspects are really too relevant tho, the game is still enjoyable!

Grab it on sale!
8/10
