author: {'steamid': '76561197996622104', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1540919542}
review:
I usually like collectables and achievements, but this game shouldn't have them. They were fine for maybe the first hour in to the game. After that it felt wrong and kind of sad everytime I thought about where I could find collectibles for 100% completion, or checked the achievements so I wouldn't miss them, because those were second missed soaking in the atmosphere of the game. After completing the game, the feeling grew hundred times stronger. I want those seconds back.

If you play the game, play it alone, headphones on, cellphone off and forget about the extra crap in the game. You can collect and achieve on a second playthrough, just breath in the game on the first one, because the game will never be the same afterwards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1540819235}
review:
Wonderful game! Great artistic achievement, beautiful visuals, perfect music, charming moments and touching story. Puzzles and platforming isn't that hard but if you miss something you can stuck for couple minutes but not for long, this game is more about story, mystery and bringing feelings than anything else, this is not dark souls :) 

Highly recommend.

review:
Grafik und Soundtrack ist gut. Story wird durch Visuals erz√§hlt.
Jedoch hatte ich mir tats√§chliche Puzzles erhofft und wurde in dieser Hinsicht sehr ent√§uscht. Die "R√§tsel" sind leider meiner Meinung nach nicht vorhanden. Stattdessen handelt es sich hier nur um ein Erkundungsspiel, in dem ab und zu eine Box auf einen Schalter geschoben wird...

author: {'steamid': '76561198031569409', 'num_games_owned': 844, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1540815283}
review:
Very good ambiance and immersion, interesting puzzles, touching story, the world is very beautiful in exterior (way less in interior), music and FX create a nice ambiance. 

You will need a good computer to play it in High graphic settings.

I get it on cheap via a current Humble Bundle, I finished it on GOG before. It take around 7h to finish it without looking for collectibles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006606663', 'num_games_owned': 944, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1540793940}
review:
Just a fantastic journey start to finish.

This is a game you can play in a long sitting.  I would say 7-8 hours, I did the whole thing on a Sunday.  You can tell it was made with a ton of heart.  Excellent 3D platformer, clever puzzles, story isn't over-bearing but it is very touching and impactful.  Movement was sharp and very connected.  

If I had to gripe, there was occationally some visual artifacts and glitches when the camera was moving to a specific device but they were only for a split second and had no effect on gameplay.

Complete recommendation, just a great effort and a fun game to play (even family friendly).

author: {'steamid': '76561198084389822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1542601794}
review:
This is one of the games or nonviolence driven adventures, where you are to explore wonderful enviroments and discover secrets along the way. The story as you piece it together is very charming, the style of the game really suits it atmosphere. 
Similar to games like Journey, Abzu, Ico, Papo y Yo, Tale of Two Brothers...
I had some issues with framerate and a rare instance where sound was cut off completely for a second or so. It was very minor but there might be more depending on your Rig, the changes in graphics quality doesn't seem to major so I wouldnt say playing in Ultra is necesary by any means.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981476197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1540771756}
review: Was f√ºr ein Spiel. Wer Journey mag und ein entspanntes Wochenende in einer absolut sch√∂nen Spielwelt verbringen will, sollte zugreifen. Wer ein Zelda erwartet, kriegt was anderes. ;p Es gibt in dem Spiel kein Kampfmechaniken. Daf√ºr aber diese Panoramen zum Erkunden. Die Story ist nicht aufdringlich, aber hat ihre Meta-Ebene die sie durchdacht und nicht zu verkopft umsetzt. Das Spiel startet mit kindlichen Entdeckerdrang und wird mit der Zeit etwas d√ºsterer und melancholisch. Macht das Gesamtkonzept und die Story aber nur runder und beeindruckender. Kann aber auch sein, dass es nicht ganz das Kinderspiel ist, f√ºr das man es erst halten k√∂nnte. Durchgespielt hat man das Game in 6-8 Stunden. Was mir positiv auffiel, keine unn√∂tigen L√§ngen, einfach eine runde Spielerfahrung. Technisch ist das Spiel ressourcen-hungriger als gedacht. Wer ohne Action gelangweilt ist, darf weiter gehen, der Rest sollte RiME seine Chance geben, die hat es sich verdient, aber so was von!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044256109', 'num_games_owned': 1187, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1540702604}
review:
In this game you play the boy from Ico chasing the dude from Journey with the help of Okami's little fox cousin. Overall has great potential but falls a bit flat, missing a coat of polish. Things are a bit blocky and sometimes unresponsive and glitchy.

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198085642525', 'num_games_owned': 1140, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1540674242}
review:
===[ Game overview ]===
RiME is a game about a boy who washed up on an island, after waking up he wanders off the shore and deeper into the island. He begins solving puzzles to progress further and ends up coming across a fox who helps him navigate the island and in doing so, he and the fox become friends. Through his puzzle solving and exploration, he uncovers a story. The further he goes the more he uncovers.

===[ Target Audience ]===
‚òê Kids
‚òë Everyone
‚òê Casual players
‚òê Good players
‚òê Pro players
{Though some puzzles can be confusing, you'll surely get the hang of what to do and how to do it.}

===[ Graphics and Environment ]=== 
‚òê Really bad
‚òê Bad
‚òê Ok
‚òê Good 
‚òê Beautiful 
‚òë Masterpiece
{I found both the graphics and environment absolutely stunning. It gave me a Shadow of the Colossus/The Last Guardian feel. Even though the art style is simplistic, it doesn't at all take away from the overall feel of the game. The environment only adds to the overall immersion.}

===[ Requirments ]=== 
‚òê 90' PC
‚òê Minimum
‚òë Medium 
‚òê Fast
‚òê High end 
‚òê NASA computer
{Though you don't need a beast of a computer to play this game, it can be hard on your PC in certain areas. There were times where I would drop down to about 30FPS, with my average being 60FPS. But that's nothing lowering the graphics can't fix, and trust me when I say, lowering the graphics doesn't effect how the game looks, or at least it didn't for me.}

===[ Gameplay ]=== 
‚òê Boring
‚òê Ok
‚òê Fun
‚òê Very Fun
‚òë Amazing
{I found the gameplay to be amazing. Though I did take breaks, that was only to rest my eyes. I didn't find myself getting bored with this game for a sinlge second.}

===[ Sound/Music ]===
‚òê Poor
‚òê Ok
‚òê Good
‚òê Great
‚òë Masterpiece
{Along with the graphics and environment, the sound and music was breathtaking. The music added even more to the environment, it is as if they worked in tandem with one another.}

===[ Difficulty ]=== 
‚òê You just need 2 arms 
‚òê Easy
‚òë Medium
‚òê Easy to learn / Hard to master 
‚òê Hard
‚òê Dark Souls
{Though this game isn't hard by any means, it can still be difficult at some parts.}

===[ Game time/length ]=== 
‚òê Really short ( 0 - 2 hours)
‚òë Short ( 2 - 8 hours)
‚òê Few hours ( 8 - 12 hours)
‚òê Long ( 12+ hours)
‚òê Endless
{I beat it in just under 5 hours. It may not be a long game, But what it lacks game length, it makes up for with good graphics, environment, music, and story.}

===[ Story ]=== 
‚òê It doesn't have
‚òê Average
‚òê Good
‚òê Very good
‚òë Fantastic
{Instead of the story being told to you, it's rather shown to you through picture and visuals. This adds so much to the story as its relies less of your ears and more on your imagination.}

===[ Bugs ]=== 
‚òê Game itself is one big BUG
‚òê Bugs destroyed the game
‚òê Lot of bugs
‚òê Few Bugs
‚òê Sometimes
‚òë Nothing
{I didn't come across a single bug.}

===[ Final rating ]=== 
‚òë 10/10

===[ Notes ]===
I would highly recommend this game to anyone who is interested in it. Its been a long time since a game has given me goosebumps or made me feel for a character, and this game did both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095879858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1540819038}
review:
Comme beaucoup, j'ai √©t√© attir√© par la direction artistique du jeu qui est s√©duisante. Mais au final, j'ai trouv√© ce jeu ennuyeux.

L'histoire est pas mal, mais m√™me si c'est pas fou non plus, c'est le point fort du titre, surtout √† la fin o√π l'on comprend le d√©lire. Il faudra compter 6-7h pour terminer le jeu (en fouinant un peu √† gauche et √† droite). En ce qui concerne les √©nigmes, c'est toujours les m√™mes, √ßa peine √† se renouveler. En plus, l'exploration c'est surtout pour trouver les collectibles cach√©s. Collectibles qui ne sont pas totalement inutiles, m√™me si √ßa rel√®ve du bonus. 
Dans le lot il y a quelques bonnes id√©es mais pas assez exploit√©es. 

Ajoutons √† cela divers petits bugs qui m'ont pouss√©, √† plusieurs reprises, √† relancer la partie depuis le dernier checkpoint. En parlant checkpoint, ils sont assez hasardeux et le retour en partie peut √™tre un peu perturbant quand on se retrouve 200m plus loin dans une salle que l'on avait pas encore explor√©. Sans oublier des murs invisibles g√™nants. En plus, je trouve que le jeu est mal optimis√©.

Ce que je trouve le plus aberrant c'est le prix auquel ce jeu est vendu, 35‚Ç¨ √† l'heure o√π je tape ces mots. C'est beaucoup trop cher pour ce que c'est, ce prix ne RiME √† rien.. Pour ma part je l'ai eu dans un bundle et m√™me l√†... je trouve assez peu d'estime pour le titre. Attendez une baisse drastique du prix.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091558361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1540657158}
review:
RiME is one of the most beautiful games I think I have ever played. Both the visuals and audio are done with such perfection you are moved in ways most large budget titles cannot achieve, and while there is action in a common sense this doesn't hold back the title whatsoever. Not many games have actually brought me to tears but the ending of RiME did just that. However this game is purely an atmospheric title; almost an interactive story. The platforming is very slippery and there is no fighting aside from some puzzles which lead to action. That said the puzzles are quite interesting and deal with day and night, which as well correspond too the story itself.

In short RiME is easily worth your dollar. I most definitly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997839137', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1540602589}
review:
Ok, I have to be honest... I was close to abandoning this game as I was getting a little bored with the repition of some basic tasks, but I was close to the end, so I decided to stick it out.  I am REALLY glad I did.  The ending wraps everything together perfectly.

The graphics and soundtrack are wonderful too!

I do believe this game isn't for everyone, but if you've arrived on this page because it looked interesting, chances are you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972986072', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1655067554}
review:
La mayor virtud de esta producci√≥n del equipo espa√±ol Tequila Works, es sobre todo la belleza, tanto visual como sonora, pese a que realmente se nota que el estilo art√≠stico es una muy buena copia de Ghibli, en ambos aspectos.
Por un lado la banda sonora parece compuesta por el mismismo Joe Hisaishi, con temas que parecen sacados de La princesa Mononoke, y por otro lado el aspecto gr√°fico que parece que estemos viendo un hijo de toda la filmograf√≠a del estudio :D.
Respecto a la banda sonora, menci√≥n especial al tema creado por la violinista "youtuber" Lindey Stirling, y un tema vocal en espa√±ol.
Tambi√©n se puede comparar bastante con Abzu, Journey e Ico. Es m√°s, el juego ha pasado apenas sin hacer ruido, cuando no tiene absolutamente nada que envidiar a Journey por ejemplo.

No obstante donde para mi falla es en su exploraci√≥n, el juego tiene unos escenarios incre√≠bles, que daban para hacer mucho mas juego y una sensaci√≥n de exploraci√≥n mas profunda. Ten√≠an que haber creado una suerte de mundo abierto y poder recorrerlo de principio a fin y volver cuando queramos o necesitemos, sin embargo han optado por un sistema por cap√≠tulos "inconexos" entre ellos que en mi opini√≥n no le hace bien.
Los puzzles tampoco es que sean muy complejos, aunque hay alguna mec√°nica jugable algo original. 

La historia a diferencia de Abzu, o Journey, es bastante clara de entender, y no es la t√≠pica fumada mental de tantos juegos indie que salen hoy en d√≠a.

Para terminar decir que su rendimiento es bastante malo, pese a tener unos reflejos cojonudos que hacen chupar fps cosa mala.

Recomiendo el juego siempre y cuando nos gusten los juegos relajantes y te llame la est√©tica tan cuidada que tiene.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970149845', 'num_games_owned': 3732, 'num_reviews': 453, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1540145201}
review:
A truly exceptional masterpiece in atmospheric exploration, storytelling and platforming with light puzzle elements.

The graphics, sound design and animation along with visual effects, level design and lighting all play hand in hand to establish atmosphere exceptionally well. Environment and puzzle variance is good, with good pacing. The story revelations are interesting and surprising. The established world is consistent and enjoyable. The level of detail to establish it is quite good. I really enjoyed these four hours.

If you can enjoy atmospheric third person platforming exploration with light puzzle elements, definitely play this masterpiece.

+ Exceptional atmosphere
+ Exceptional sound design
++ Great music
++ Great dynamic elements and adjustments
+ Exceptional animation
+ Exceptional visual effects
+ Exceptional presentation, exceptional direction (everything coming together great)
+ Great environment and world, great level of detail, great variance
+ Great platforming mechanics
+ Good, enjoyable puzzles, quite some variance
+ Interesting story/setting (explored through action, exploration and visuals)
+ Great guidance
* 4 hours for a playthrough
- No skippable cutscenes, even after playthrough

author: {'steamid': '76561197967132117', 'num_games_owned': 4622, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1419, 'last_played': 1541979713}
review:
Fantastic game with great atmosphere, nice graphics and puzzles that are not too hard for the casual player of puzzle games... (so, myst-type players might find ths too easy as there is no hours of backtracking and so forth)

The game also has a fantastic story which unfolds between each level and in which you actively take part after level 5.

I don't want to spoil too much, but the end will have some people having wet eyes.

This game is one i really can recommend.  I really wanted to start playing it when i came back on my pc, but i tried to play a level at a sitting so i had to refrain myself when i had only like half an hour.  I probably used more time than the average player, but that's because i also went on looking for items and i have a fair amount of them (all toys, all emblems, 4/6 lullabies, etc etc). 
If you just want a game where you puzzle a bit and have really nice aestethics, then i can also recommend this game, it's got a really nice atmosphere.  For those that also go itemhunting; it gets reflected at the end of the game but i can't tell too much about it as it would spoil the story. Look at it as a little incentive you get ...

I got this game in a bundle (i believe it came with humble monthly, not sure anymore) and the quality of the game really makes the full price worth it, although if you don't search for items the playtime gets shorter and then i'd pay about 50% of it's regular price (which is ‚Ç¨17.50 instead of 35‚Ç¨) I believe 20‚Ç¨ wouldve been a better price for the game, but the level of detail they've put into the game and thus work, makes the original price not really overpriced if you appreciate the gametype and play it to it's full extend (thus searching for the extra's).

If you can ever get this game in a bundle or very cheap promo (like 5‚Ç¨/5$) then buy it, you won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 730, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1540079903}
review:
Juego similar a Ico o Journey, de exploraci√≥n, puzzles sencillos, fant√°stica m√∫sica y un mundo de fantas√≠a. Es un juego muy lineal, con algunas pinceladas muy originales aunque no es perfecto y tiene algunos problemas menores. Principalmente, bajadas de frames sin motivo (¬øtiempos de carga disimulados?) y un control del personaje bastante mejorable.

El juego bebe mucho de ICO, con un mundo colorido que se va tornando oscuro seg√∫n avanza el juego, para terminar con un final bastante trist√≥n. Es uno de esos juegos que deja muchas cosas en el aire, para ser interpretadas, aunque el final intenta ser m√°s concreto y no dejar la trama colgando (como en el Limbo o el Inside).

No es una obra maestra, pero merece la pena si lo compras rebajado ya que es una experiencia trem√©ndamente distinta a los juegos superventas de hoy en d√≠a.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119507745', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1540018049}
review:
This is a great story, it's more of a story than it is a game. 

Do not buy this game hoping for extrapolent puzzles, the ones it offer are braindead. 

If you ignore the puzzles it has, it's literally a walking sim. 

The artistic styling is quite eye pleasing, the music is decent, the story is OK. 

The game handles fine, frame rates are meh, finding all of the optional items is decently hard

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008571452', 'num_games_owned': 1233, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1539841007}
review:
Went in expecting a simple puzzle/platformer (and the first couple of areas are like that). Wasn't ready for the feels that followed  (Àö ÀÉÃ£Ã£Ã•·∑Ñ‚åìÀÇÃ£Ã£Ã•·∑Ö )


Graphical fidelity is good (runs on Unreal Engine 4) but the aesthetics are more important to lend to the perspective of the character. The theme is purposely inconsistent between the areas which is hard to elaborate on without ruining parts of the story. Puzzles are simple enough though they do better with creativity than difficulty, some puzzles use perspective, light/shadows and day/night cycle, you will never find yourself stuck though as they stay fairly simple push, pull, carry, climb type puzzles akin to Zelda (though a lot less demanding than Zelda's), pushing yourself past the first area or two is important as they feel over simplified. The controls are good and responsive (even on mouse and keyboard) but like the puzzles, the platforming stays simple to the point some mechanics (like rolling) feel unnecessary and under utilized. The more important point of the game is the aspect that is hard to talk about in a review, the story (that is told with no words) but it doesn't take long before you know something is wrong here...


Recommended but not at full price due to how short the game is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060654075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5493, 'last_played': 1514319496}
review:
It took me quite some time to understand what this game was about. The first few hours, running about, collecting, solving, were just lighthearted. But as you move on, see things, watch things change, the realisation occurs, and you comprehend the nature of the story. I'm trying to write this without spoilers, so the language might be a little vague in places. 

Further in the feeling of the game changes radically and there is strife and difficulty, over and above the simple game mechanics. You begin to get a darker sensation of narrative and the solutions to puzzles don't satisfy in the same way, there's a sense of achievement but also one of sadness. 

As a gaming experience this is not the hardest thing you will ever do. As an emotional journey, if you are open to such things, it may well be very difficult indeed.

If exploration of feeling is of any interest to you then I whole-heartedly recommend this game.

review:
Magnifique et po√©tique!

Vous incarnez un jeune garcon qui se retrouve naufrag√© seul sur une ile. Vous devrez d√©bloquer le passage pour arriver √† la tour pour comprendre ses myst√®res.

Rime ne se r√©sume pas que √† ces 2 phrases, bien √©videmment! 
Le jeu est beau, les paysages sont √† couper le souffle et la bande son est magnifique!
Les √©nigmes se corsent au fur et √† mesure, mais ne sont pas vraiment difficiles.
Le sc√©nario est bien fait, et la cerise: une belle fin! (Oh oui, avoue que tu as √©t√© d√©√ßu par ces jeux aux fins moisies plus d'une fois!)

En bref: je recommande vivement Rime!    Mais pas au pris de 35‚Ç¨, le jeu m'a occup√© environ 7h... ca fait cher du kilo. Kilo de qualit√©, certes, mais non. A prendre lors d'une promo.

Beautiful Graphics - Cuty characters, vibrant motions, make players satisfied.
Beautiful BGM - During playing, harmonized music makes you concentrate on game. 

Hard to understand stories during playing. (ex : There is no reason why stories going like this. <- You will know the reason of story at end parts but I felt awkward on here.)

A few & easy puzzle moments, mostly find the way to get destinations.

Although above things, inconvenient camera angle&controls devalue this game a little bit. But, it was bearable to me tho.

So, the point is (in my opinions)
Graphis & BGM - Satisfied enoughly.
Stories - not bad 
Angle & Controls - Uncomfortable

Conclusion : Buy this game at discount times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993709423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1579900495}
review:
RiME is a third-person non-violent adventure game, sometimes exploration, sometimes platformer, sometimes puzzle game.

The gameplay is not particularly original. It felt like I had already seen these kinds of puzzles, these kinds of adventure in many games before this one. If you already played Tomb Raider, or Zelda, for example, you'll get it. It's not much difficult either, except if you want to get all the achievements. It's also (mostly) linear: even if some places may be huge, there is always only one path. There are not many characters. You'll mostly follow a magic friendly fox, and a mysterious guy with a red cape who remains out of reach. There are some minor defaults, like a camera which sometimes takes dubious initatives, or some zones so dark that I had to switch off the light in my room. It also requires a decent computer.

But it's a utterly fantastic game, and for me one of the best games of 2017. Why? Because of the ambience.
If the vivid screenshots and the trailers didn't give you the compulsive desire to click "Buy" right now, wait, there is more:
[list]
 [*] First, like I said it's not difficult; but it's a good point, because you never feel stuck up very long, it's enjoyable.
 [*] Second, the environment is fantastic. It felt like I was visiting an abandoned crumbling civilisation and I wondered during most of the game what happened and what it was all about.
 [*] Third, the melancholic music, barely audible during the game and yet omnipresent, helps me put in this state of wonder.
 [*] Fourth, the story is great, even if it is sad, and is rarely present in the game. The game - all of it - fits the story, and not the contrary.
[/list]

In the end, the downside is that the game is not that long (9 hours for me without speeding up, including getting a good part of the achievements)... And when the end occurs, I wished I could continue exploring new green grasslands and beautiful ruins, and yet it's the end. But that, too, serves the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148242391', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1664130658}
review:
TL:DR - This game is AMAZING - Buy if your PC will run it.

Hi, I am aware that this game has no reviews currently and I heavily feel that it deserves some.

This game is excellent in every regard bar one thing, the graphics are so good that it struggles to run on my PC (however, it is playable!).

Pros:
- Excellent graphics and audio.
- Very easy to use controls.
- A very touching storyline.
- Is able to tell a story without words extremely well.

Cons:
- None that I can think of.

This game is pure gold dust, it is excellent, the graphics are beautiful as well as the audio. The music is extremely well done and the graphics are that of a triple A game. I won't spoil anything here, just please buy this game, it is well worth the money.

Thanks Tequila Works for an amazing game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970520745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1538564615}
review:
I highly recommend this game, but not for the story (which is pretty buried in symbolism). With its combination of a beautiful sound track and a painting-like art style, this game put me in a different state of mind. The platforming was slightly frustrating at times, but the puzzles were mostly easy. 

Play this if you want to expaerience something artistic and be transported into another world, without facing too much of a challenge.

review: This was pretty good but I kinda felt like the story mildly fell apart due to relying on symbolism too much. [spoiler]I'm not very fond of the "it was all in the father's mind" ending twist at all.[/spoiler] Great art direction, gameplay was alright though sometimes the level design was a bit frustrating, but nothing too bad. I often felt like relatively small changes in design could have greatly enhanced what's already there. I would give this a 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030193439', 'num_games_owned': 843, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1535475160}
review:
I bought RIME on its description as a puzzle game with exploration. What I got instead felt like a walking simulator without sufficient payoff, narrative or otherwise.

The single factor that killed this game for me is the size of the environments, combined with the glacially slow pace. Movement speed in particular would have had to be twice or thrice as high for me not to constantly get bored to tears. It's rage-inducingly slow.

And once a game screws up like that way, you know it won't work in other ways, either. For instance, despite the description of "exploration", the game is almost entirely linear except for various hidden collectables. But trying to collect those is deeply unsatisfying. Partly due to the glacial movement speed, which discourages walking around. But also because stage select is chapter-based, so trying to collect missing doodads after the fact sounds like soul-crushing pain.

There's no way to save manually, and the autosave mechanic is pretty bad; I played through the game in a few sessions and typically had to replay a small section each time.

The game is rather pretty, I do admit. But it's also full of dark areas and zones, and those didn't work for me at all.

When it comes to the puzzles themselves, there aren't that many, and most of them are mediocre or trivially easy.

A concrete plot underlies the game, but it's told in a very vague, nonverbal way. The end seems neat-ish, but also disconnected from what came before. I had to read a story explanation to make any sense of it. Not my kind of storytelling.

I hated this game. It felt like it was designed entirely to waste the player's time. Like some business guy realized the game only had 2-3 hours of content, and promptly cut movement speed by 1/2 or 2/3 to pad the playtime numbers. Instead of this mediocre game that does neither puzzles nor exploration well, I recommend purer games instead: e.g. The Witness or Stephen's Sausage Roll for puzzles; and A Hat in Time, a Mario game, or Hollow Knight for platforming and exploration.

PS: My displayed Steam playtime is wrong; the actual playtime was more on the order of 6-7h.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061080587', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1531364480}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062623579', 'num_games_owned': 749, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1535336966}
review:
Rime manages to tell a captivating and emotional story without a single line of dialogue. It conveys it's emotions only through it's enviroments and soundtrack, and it does it beautifully.

$30 is still steep, but $15 is a perfect price imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031440161', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1534972545}
review:
I've played too many artsy, allegorical games with mysterious protagonists. Once you've played Journey, ABZU, AER, Unfinished Swan or any of another dozen games of The Type, RiME just does not feel that remarkable, even though it predates or is contemperaneous with these works. I played it too late and struggled to feel engaged. Yet, I recommend it.

I recommend it, because RiME is a high-quality experience. It harkens back to the best moments from games by Team Ico and Nintendo's Zelda team. It doesn't do a whole lot new, but it does it with style and attention to detail. There's a fair bit of Disneyesque cheese here too, but it is probably necessary in a game about emotions that has no voice acting.

I didn't really feel the allegorical Deeper Themes it was trying to convey, because they were - and I rarely say this - too subtle and oblique. But that's a taste thing. You might feel differently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130049543', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1079, 'last_played': 1541092894}
review:
Premetto col dire che RiME √® uno dei migliori titoli a cui abbia mai giocato.

Ogni anno esce un nuovo Battlefield, un nuovo COD, un nuovo FIFA, un nuovo F1; microtransazioni e meccaniche di gioco rotte e frustranti pullulano nel ricco paesaggio videoludico, ma ho troncato la lista per piet√†.
Non √® tuttavia per un pessimo film che la filmografia precipita dall'Olimpo artistico, diventando mero intrattenimento.
Nonostante tutto, i videogiochi si sono guadagnati e mantengono tutt'ora lo status di [b]forma d'arte[/b].
A quelle persone ottuse e retrograde che trattano [b]ancora[/b] (dopo 30 e pi√π anni dalla nascita) il videogioco come svago fine a se stesso o peggio ancora come [i]arma di distruzione di massa[/i] o lavaggio del cervello, a quelle persone bisognerebbe far giocare giochi come RiME e chiedergli se non si sono emozionati per davvero.

Un videogioco, fosse soltanto che dura molto pi√π di un film, richiede una propria partecipazione, indispensabile. Viene da s√® che l'attaccamento emotivo ai personaggi, gli scenari, le musiche, (un po' meno spesso) le meccaniche, √®... significativo.
Per questo quando si finisce un gioco su cui si sono passate ore e ore, a volte ai titoli di coda la lacrimuccia scende.
(Spoiler [spoiler]con RiME ho   [b]q u a s i[/b]   pianto[/spoiler])
Un'opera d'arte, sia un libro, un film, un brano musicale, una poesia, un dipinto, una fotografia, non fa altro (si fa per dire) che far provare emozioni. E un videogioco ci riesce benissimo.

Grazie quindi a Tequila Works e a chi di merito per essersi distinti dalla massa con un piccolo capolavoro dai paesaggi splendidi, musica affascinante e incalzante, tematiche di spessore notevole e gameplay (quasi) perfetto.
Unica pecca √® che purtroppo non sono stato in grado di unire tutti i puntini da me, e alla fine ho dovuto guardare la trama su Internet (e non sono l'unico, ma d'altronde in un gioco senza narrazione √® un rischio da correre).

Sul fatto che valga o meno il prezzo pieno, quello dipende molto, c'√® da tenere conto che RiME non √® un gioco lungo, n√® tantomeno rigiocabile. Dovesse andare in sconto di sicuro √® da valutare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140381191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1534556313}
review:
Al igual que me ocurrio con "Ico", "Shadow of the Colossus" y "The Last Guardian", hay una palabra que define a la perfeccion el juego: PRECIOSO.

Y si, hay muchas referencias a esos juegos mencionados (quiza el que menos "Shadow of the Colossus" ya que no hay combate). Controles muy basicos y nada complejos, al contrario que su historia, que hasta que consigues llegar al final no comprenderas todo, pero es fascinante como al acabar el juego vas atando cabos de todo lo que has visto, esa sensacion me encanto, y este juego lo consigue.

La mecanica es bastante simple, y la simplicidad lo hace tan bello, resolver puzzles e ir avanzando, muy chulos todos, no muy dificiles, bien adaptados para que no llegues a momentos frustrantes y no puedas avanzar (al menos desde mi perspectiva). Por supuesto, la exploracion es bastante importante, sobre todo si quereis conseguir los coleccionables, que explican aun mas de que va la historia, mi consejo es que vuestro primer recorrido vayais a vuestra bola, y el segundo si que consigais todo para que ya la historia sea reveladora al instante. Y ademas desbloquea un final alternativo.

En resumen, precioso, vale la pena, que gran viaje.

Man pl√§tschert Schritt f√ºr Schritt (und vor allem ohne nervige Tutorials) durch wundersch√∂ne Landschaften und eine unglaublich ber√ºhrende Geschichte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078666811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1534404798}
review:
I bought this game during the summer steam sell a month or so ago. And this game is beautiful. And then the mood changes from calm and serene to creepy and chilling.
 OmO The lighting and the monsters turns dark and the music itself gives you a feeling of dread. (The black shades suck your soul out literally) They are quite scary the first few times dealing with them....this game does a great job at creating moods.

I have to redo the game to get the achievements I missed,but its worth playing it I promise!! 


*Just a heads up though, look up an achievement guide BEFORE starting. To familiarize yourself with the environment first. If you wish to collect the achievements. As you can not go back to sections once finished.*

author: {'steamid': '76561198364032661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1534325918}
review:
I'M NOT CRYING, YOU ARE CRYING!! 

With all honesty, I can't recommend this game more. It is so.... Heart touching. I won't spoil the game, but this game is truly a master piece. I hope more games like this one come out more often. Overall, the game is amazing, the only issue I had was when the camera would just do whatever it wanted randomly during gameplay. And one weird glitch where I got stuck in a wall. Thankfully I could just load back to the last checkpoint, that just happened to be a few seconds ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134383234', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1596737462}
review:
Wow - ich wei√ü noch gar nicht, wo ich anfangen soll. Dieses Spiel hat mich einfach total geflasht!

F√ºr alle, die nicht gern viel lesen - vllt solltet ihr euch ein anderes Review suchen. Das hier k√∂nnte etwas l√§nger werden.

Zu allererst: ich bin begeistert von diesem Graphikstil. Obwohl er so schlicht und einfach ist und auch irgendwo sehr kindlich wirkt, schafft er es, wundervolle Orte und Landschaften darzustellen. Auf eine Art und Weise, die bewirkt, dass ich an dem ein oder anderen Ort einfach f√ºr l√§ngere Zeit stehen geblieben bin und den Anblick habe auf mich wirken lassen oder an anderen Stellen l√§nger herumgelaufen bin, als n√∂tig war.
Jeder einzelne Ort und jede Landschaft hat ihren ganz eigenen Zauber, der einem zum Teil einfach nur den Atem verschl√§gt. Ich w√§re gern l√§nger dort geblieben ;)
Auch der Soundtrack ist von besonderer Sch√∂nheit. Ich kenn nur wenige Spiele, die es mit dem Soundtrack von Rime aufnehmen k√∂nnten. Er passt perfekt zu den einzelnen Situationen und besteht aus wundersch√∂nen Meolodien, die trotz ihrer vergleichsweisen Komplexit√§t nicht aufdringlich sind, sonder weiterhin im Hintergund das Spiel untermalen und die Intensit√§t des Spielerlebnisses noch verst√§rken.

Zuletzt das Spiel selbst: Zu Beginn des Spiels strandet man am Strand einer unbekannten Insel, deren markantestes Merkmal ein riesiger weiser Turm ist. Im Folgenden stehen die Erkundung der Insel und das l√∂sen diverser R√§tsel im Mittelpunkt des Spiels.
Eine genaue Erkundung lohnt sich hierbei nicht nur, um die verschiedenen Punkte der einzelnen Landschaften zu entdecken - gleichzeitig k√∂nnen auch verschiedenste Dinge gefunden werden.
Die R√§tsel waren relativ einfach (ich habe aber auch schon etwas Erfahrung mit R√§tseln) - nichts, was man nicht schaffen kann (auch als R√§tselanf√§nger). Manchmal ist ein wenig Geduld gefragt, zum Teil k√∂nnen R√§tsel auch erst sp√§ter gel√∂st werden (womit wir wieder bei der Erkundung der Gegenden w√§ren) und bei anderen lohnt sich genaueres Hinsehen.
Im Verlauf der Erkundungen und des L√∂sens der R√§tsel wird einem St√ºck f√ºr St√ºck in kurzen Episoden die Geschichte offenbart. Dazu m√∂chte ich ungern mehr sagen - es ist eine Geschichte, die jeder f√ºr sich selbst entdecken und interpretieren muss. Nur so viel: Lange Zeit wusste ich nicht genau, worauf die Story hinauslaufen wird und war gespannt darauf, was der n√§chste Teil bringen w√ºrde. Es lohnt sich, dran zu bleiben!
Die Charaktere, die im Spiel auftauchen sind mit viel Liebe gestaltet und jeder w√§chst einem im Laufe des Spiels irgendwie ans Herz. Es gibt keine Dialoge - stattdessen wird alles √ºber Mimiken und Gestiken ausgedr√ºckt, was eine noch st√§rkere Bindung zu den Charakteren hervorruft.
Von der Steuerung her: Ich hab mit Maus und Tastatur gespielt - kann also nichts zur Steuerung mit einem Controller sagen (obwohl ich das vllt auch mal noch ausprobier). Die Steuerung ist einfach und jeder, der √∂fter mit Maus und Tastatur spielt, sollte sie im Grunde schon kennen :) Ich hatte nur wenige Stellen, an denen es mit der Steuerung oder der Kamera nicht ganz so war, wie ich es vllt gern gehabt h√§tte. Im Gro√üen und Ganzen hat alles supergut funktioniert.

Ich pers√∂nlich bin auf jeden Fall total begeistert von diesem Spiel und werde es vermutlich noch das ein oder andere Mal neu anfangen und nochmals spielen.

F√ºr alle, die sich √ºberlegen das Spiel zu kaufen: Ich w√ºrde jederzeit wieder in dieses Spiel investieren.
Noch eine Bemerkung f√ºr alle, die es sich gekauft haben und es anfangen: Ihr werdet den Turm fr√ºher erreichen, als ihr vermuten w√ºrdet - aber keine Angst, das Spiel geht l√§nger, als man denken w√ºrde. 7h Spielzeit sind auf jeden Fall drin :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995666469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1531938553}
review:
Have you ever been on a flight where they show these short, "artsy", pretentious and shallow student-made films to entertain the passengers? 

RiME is like that, but in a video game form. Very pretty art style and animation, but pretty much everything else is uninspired or derivative. RiME tries to imitate ICO and Journey, but the similarities are skin-deep. Those games manage to build suspense over the game and merge gameplay with story to great effect, but RiME does none of that. Instead, RiME copies the superficial qualities of those games, like the minimalism. "If there are no words used in our game, that MUST mean that the game is deep!", thinks RiME.

This game is a massive wasted opportunity, and that irritates me. I wish its developers the best of luck in their next game, I'm sure they can do better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119058186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1533571449}
review:
OBRA DE ARTE.
A ver por donde empiezo...
Es un juego que, en su mec√°nico es bastante b√°sico, y donde se podr√≠a haber profundizado un poco m√°s en cuanto a tipos de movimientos del personaje, fluidez y realismo en algunas f√≠sicas... Pero despu√©s de hab√©rmelo pasado dos veces, creo que su encanto reside en esa sencillez. No es complicado de superar, por lo que es un t√≠tulo apto para todo tipo de p√∫blico, pese que la profundidad de la historia no lo sea. Es una historia arrolladora y aplastante como la vida misma... Lo que empieza como una aventura de un ni√±o que despierta en una isla desierta, sin saber por qu√© "que por cierto la isla es preciosa, con ese toque de isla griega", se convierte en un viaje cada vez mas oscuro, misterioso y l√∫gubre, para darte cuenta, y no hago spoilers, de que al final, todo era algo muy distinto a lo que el juego te estaba mostrando y darte un buen gancho de izquierdas al coraz√≥n... Vamos, que si eres un poco sensiblero como yo, acabas llorando a moco tendido con el final xDDD Y aqu√≠ reside la importancia de una buena historia se√±ores, el hecho de que al tenerla, al juego se le perdonen otros fallos, como los que anteriormente he mencionado. Ya no me importa la sencillez de la mec√°nica, ni el irrealismo de algunos movimientos o f√≠sicas... este juego me ha llegado al alma y me ha hecho LLORAR se√±ores... que hoy en d√≠a es muy dif√≠cil... Porque aunque no lo parezca, este juego trata de algo muy com√∫n de la vida cotidiana de las personas... Algo por lo que todo el mundo pasa.

Lo recomiendo encarecidamente en versi√≥n PC, ahora que no tiene DNUVO, luce genial a 60FPS.
La banda sonora es preciosa, y me encanta que el estudio de TEQUILA haya decidido poner una canci√≥n final para los cr√©ditos en espa√±ol, si se√±or! Que quede la marca ESPA√ëA en algo de tanta calidad...

Me hubiera encantado que el viaje durase mas, en unas 7-8 horas puedes pas√°rtelo en una primera pasada, depende de la facilidad que tengas en resolver sus puzzles, pero habr√≠a estado genial que el mundo de RiME hubiera sido mas basto y grande, pero supongo que el presupuesto para este t√≠tulo era algo limitado... No hablamos de un Assassin's claro...
Ojal√° les vaya bien a TEQUILA para poder hacer un RiME 2 u otro t√≠tulo diferente con la misma magia.

Felicidades chicos!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198184282673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1532966491}
review:
To be honest, this is one of such games that you should play yourself to understand, because it‚Äôs nearly impossible to describe it with words. I would actually describe Rime like that: developers took Journey mechanics, expanded it to big locations and flavored it with mystique and more or less reasonable ending. If you still do not sure whether you should buy it or not, here are the details:

Graphics ‚Äì just perfect. Seriously, about 2 hours of my walkthrough I just walked and enjoyed sceneries. The picture is far from photo-realistic but it has its own soft, vivid, saturated style, which creates just wonderful beauties, the sky at night is just something indescribable.
After completion, I collected whole wallpaper pack for my desktop, where half of the pictures were my own screenshots. 

Atmosphere is also hard to characterize. I would just say that you dive into the game‚Äôs wonders and become astonished by the sceneries. 

Music is great. It perfectly fits the graphics and atmosphere, and the only drawback is inability to by soundtrack directly in Steam. 

Story. Well, I don‚Äôt wanna spoil it, so I‚Äôll tell you shortly: itself it is not really unique, but with the local storytelling and narrative where you do not really understand what‚Äôs happening until the end of the game, it becomes just great and perfectly fits the game. 

Gameplay. Frankly, not much to say about it. It mostly resembles Journey, the only differences are bigger levels, more freedom and various goals or destinations throughout the game. The rest is quite similar: you walk through beautiful surroundings, solve easy puzzles and encounter only 1-2 aggressive creatures during the whole game. For some it may seem too meditative boring but it‚Äôs nice for such a game and complements it. 

So, all in all, RiME is great and in some part even original game, because, despite usual utilized elements, together they form something new and unique. I would recommend it for everyone, but if you are looking for some challenge or active gameplay, this game is not really for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998358012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1533029957}
review:
Recomendad√≠√≠√≠√≠√≠√≠√≠√≠simo!!!
No es un juego, es una obra de arte. Ambientaci√≥n maravillosa con una incre√≠ble paleta de colores mediterr√°nea que va cambiando a lo largo del juego. Impresionante capacidad e transmitir sensaciones sin ni siquiera necesitar palabras. La m√∫sica es maravillosa parte esencial del juego y catalizadora de las emociones que transmite (los de l√°grima f√°cil llorar√°n al final seguro, y alguno que no lo sea, como yo, tambi√©n).
Puzles muy acertados, no excesivamente complicados y muy bien integrados en el escenario juego. Tiene adem√°s una secci√≥n de plataformas, algo m√°s floja, que recuerda (al menos vagamente) a los primeros Tomb Rider. La √∫nica pega que le pongo es que en opcasiones es demasiado guiado, perdiendo un poco la libertad de exploraci√≥n que s√≠ aparece en los primeros cap√≠tulos del juego. Pero a pesar de ello es maravilloso, una aut√©ntica obra de arte...

author: {'steamid': '76561198115399415', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1550154769}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054277538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 975, 'last_played': 1659148793}
review:
16 hours in, I have to write a review now. It's easily worth $30 (I got it on sale when it was $15?
(yes, I'm a Zelda fan)

Holy shit, this game is gorgeous. It's so hard to describe how great it is, yet simple.

I of course had my frustrations with a few puzzles, but I'd say I'm significantly lower than average when it comes to puzzle solving. I go to this game when I'm stressed out or frustrated with other games and it's so beautiful and puts me at ease.

Coming from a current Violist who plays in Orchestras, the music is phenominal. It's so relaxing and sets the exact perfect mood.

The characters, while there are few, are so unique and special. It's perfect

I just got through a section where the story REALLY got to kick in. All I can say is "wow". The fact that such a simple game says that, says a lot in itself

author: {'steamid': '76561198072997489', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1531169041}
review:
The game was incredibly nice and relaxing to play at first, it gets pretty spooky and sad though. Im scared of birds now. 
It had some parts that felt a bit slow but other than that, I really liked the story.
As for the environment, level and overall game mechanic design, the game is honestly outstanding. Theres so much love in every little detail of the islands, the puzzles constantly progress in difficulty while still being super fun and rewarding to solve. In fact, ‚ÄúPuzzles‚Äù doesnt really do them justice since youre forced to interact with the entire environment sometimes, i especially loved the inclusion of light and shadow through different times of the day and the whole perspective thing.
I think it‚Äôs one if those rare non-combat games that have actual good gameplay. 
I bought this for half the price on sale and I consider that a good price for the amount of content. The full price is a little much compared to the amount of raw content the game offers. Although its hard to put a price tag on great ideas.

review:
Juego que inicialmente parece incluso hasta infantil. Es cortito y las mec√°nicas son faciles, no tiene una gran dificultad. 
Pero es muy bonito, cuidado al detalle, tiene una banda sonora preciosa...
Y sobre todo, la historia. Al principio da la impresi√≥n que el juego no tiene una historia muy profunda... nada m√°s lejos de la realidad. El final es sublime. Y mucho m√°s maduro y adulto de lo que parece todo el juego. Te deja alucinado.

Altamente recomendable :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198013586186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1523397729}
review:
It has its good points, but for me, there were too many bad points.

PROS:
-Original puzzle mechanic.
-Excellent design.
-Good Music.
CONS:
-Not challenging at all. You have to get how a puzzle work, once you get it that mechanic will repeat over and over and over.
-A tendency I've seen in other games and I hate, is the fact that it's easy to advance to some area or trigger a cutscene and loose all access to previous areas that you wanted to explore.
-Very linear.
-The story does not catch you, once you see that nothing you do will lead to any answer; until the end, which is extremly topic and overdone.
-Controls do not work properly. It is frustrating to die several times at a stupid jump.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993497500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 531, 'last_played': 1531600460}
review:
First you think it is a short game of pure exploration and some puzzles.
A bit later you realize it is not that short. Some puzzles later you realize that it those are pretty clever. And all the way you stay amazed how beautiful this game is. And the story... you go through all the game with more and more questions, and no answers until the very end.
Nice and light, not very challenging, but definitely worth to experience.

review: This game is so neat! The graphics are beautiful, the music enhances the moods, and the storyline is unique. No one in our family was allowed to play it unless we were all watching....  The puzzles aren't too hard and fit in with the story. Collections make it interesting to replay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150277730', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1517589075}
review:
Rime.

Sar√† breve, impersonerete un ragazzo che si ritrova su di un'isola sperduta, dopo essere caduto dalla barca del padre.
In questa isola non incontrerete altri umani, ma una volpe che vi far√† da guida, portandovi ad esplorare il paesaggio e e che vi condurr√† a quello che spererete sia la vostrra salvezza.
Il punto di forza di Rime √® sicuramente l'ambientazione, i paesaggi sono incantevoli, emozionanti, vi toglieranno il fiato e gli enigmi e i puzzle non troppo difficili non vi distoglieranno da questo vostro viaggio attraverso questa isola della meraviglie, mentre cercherete di risolvere i misteri che avvolgono l'isola e l'oscuro figuro che vdrete di tanto in tanto.
Solo verso la fine del gioco inizierete a capire quale sia la verit√† dietro tutto questo viaggio, le emozioni vi accompagneranno fino allo straziante finale che √® proprio ci√≤ che merita questa grande piccola perla di gioco.

Ve lo consiglio se vi piacciono i giochi tranquilli, in cui avete il tempo per esplorare e deliziarvi con la vista dei meravigliosi paesaggi.
Non f√† per voi se cercate puzzle che vi mettano seriamente alla prova o giochi con quests che vi guidino attraverso tutto il gioco, in quanto non esiste un vero e proprio obiettivo.

Come sempre lascio il link al mio playthrough del gioco, se volete darci un'occhiata epr farvi un0idea sul gioco siete liberi di farlo.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h940FqJSLvQ&index=2&t=0s&list=PLI0MWZauwpgTGgawpW0IuobajgWaQ06Rp

author: {'steamid': '76561198068417827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1531091689}
review:
Je l'avais pris il y a longtemps maintenant, commenc√© puis un peu oubli√© dan un coin de ma ludoth√®que.
et puis plus d'un an apr√®s, je me suis dit "tiens je vais le continuer".
J'ai tellement bien fait.
prenez-le mais surtout allez jusqu'√† la fin: l'histoire a un sens qu'on ne d√©couvre qu'en finissant le jeu, et tout son contenu a un sens m√©taphorique.
C'est donc une tr√®s grosse recommandation, pour ceux qui aiment l'artistique du jeu vid√©o, car ce jeu est une vraie oeuvre. 
[h1]SPOILERS, ne regardez pas si vous n'avez pas fini le jeu. j'insiste.[/h1]
[spoiler] Petit √† petit, au fil de l'histoire, on d√©couvre la m√©taphore du jeu, c'est √† dire (du moins mon interpr√©tation personnelle), on incarne un souvenir d'un enfant dans l'esprit de son p√®re, apr√®s qu'il l'a perdu lors d'une temp√™te en mer. on passe donc de zone en zone, dans l'ordre chronologique, chacune repr√©sentant des phases du deuil dans l'esprit du p√®re. √† la fin de la presque derni√®re zone, celle de la d√©pression: l'enfant que l'on controle finit par se jeter lui-m√™me dans le vide, signifiant le p√®re qui devient finalement capable de l√¢cher prise et d'accepter les choses : c'est la derni√®re phase. bien s√ªr il n'oublie pas son fils, mais il accepte son absence in√©vitable, et d√©cide que la vie continue. [/spoiler]
C'est beau, c'est joyeux, c'est tr√®s triste, et encore beau.
Bien s√ªr, tout cela sans aucun dialogue ni texte, uniquement des mises en sc√®ne, de la po√©sie et une direction artistique qui fait tout.

review:
tldr like shadow of the colossus without the colossi.

this is a pretty, somber, quiet experience that really nails the aesthetic and tone it was shooting for. it easily brings you through a gambit of emotions such as confusion, loneliness, joy and melancholy. its not so much that the story is complicated so much as it is very well told. there's no dialogue in this game so all the story telling has to be shown and not told. from a movie fans perspective i appreciate this.  its amazing how such a simple game can brig so much to the table with such a simple story. this is where the game shines. where the game could do a bit better is on the difficulty side. the puzzles and climbing sections make up the bulk of the experience and while they are clearly not phoned in they didn't really break the mold or challenge me. there's nothing inherently wrong with that of course but your not going to feel like your breaking new grounds. no completely unique mechanic that lights you up, nothing too hard. that's gonna turn some people off. there was maybe one or two puzzles that slowed me down for a sec but nothing too hard. there's a place for that in gaming in my opinion though. not everyone wants to be scratching there heads for hours on every single puzzle.for me this broke no deals.

still if your looking for a light single player puzzle and climbing game experience with a very moving tone this could tickle your fancy. would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045501637', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1530770350}
review: I bought this game thinking it'd just be a nice and simple adventure with a nice art style which I adore and search a lot in game, but it turned out to be much much more than just this. It starts as a sweet, joyful story full of magic and bright colours, becoming deeper and deeper as you play it, eventually unfolding the true meaning behind this game, which is the complete opposite of what the game conveys you for the first half (I made it last 6 hours, but depending on how you play it, it might last half of double that time. Of course I intend to complete it fully, 'cause it totally deserves it.) or so, which is bitter, but at the same time tries to teach you a lesson that is very very important in life. All this, with one of the best OST I've ever heard in my life. Impossible not to be carried by its charme. I advise you to play it in one go, so take a day for yourself, be sure no one is gonna disturb you in any way, and enjoy this masterpiece to the fullest. Definitely deserves the all the money it costs. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166043878', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1529821652}
review: Never has any form of art provoked such a profound feeling in me such as RiME has. Truly a work of masterful art. The time you spend as this character and how all the subtleties within the game influence you is done is such a way that I had not realized it as a I played. I cannot explain how I felt after playign the game because that will completely rui nthe experience for someone reading this that hasn't already played the game. I will simpyl say that it is refreshing to once again feel so heavily for a work of art. Without a doubt, for the rest of my life, I wil lrecommend this game to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250078536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1530771628}
review: My partner bought me this game. I didnt want to play it. I normally play Lego video games . I decided to install the game and give it a quick try. I could not stop playing. Everything about this game is beautiful. I loved the world, the music, the story, and the ending. This was an easy game. I get fraustrated easily in games and tend to look up the walkthroughs, but I didnt need to in this game, and I didnt want to ruin the story for myself. I have told all my friends to play this game. I loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054973039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 253, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1530659393}
review:
A Beautiful Atmospheric Palate Cleanser. Ever played ICO or Shadow Of Colossus? It's sorta like that.
Your character is unarmed in a mysterious island filled with ruins of an ancient civilization, you are drawn to a colossal tower far off in the distance, and you want to get to the top. That's basically the plot, you'll uncover clues that will reveal more of the story as you go.  This game is a great break if you want to get away from all the stress of combat and shooters, this game has no direct fighting or combat, yet it doesn't need it. You'll explore the beautiful island and its ruins, figure out the working of puzzles in order to uncover your path and reach that tower.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965722299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1530543073}
review:
I enjoyed playing RIME, loved the world, music and story.

The only thing that slightly let it down for me was the camera control, but then this isn't the first game to suffer from erratic cameras that swing around just as you jump!

The puzzles themselves are fairly straight forward but enjoyable, and never felt frustrating.

The game itself reminded bit of Journey and ICO (for its' mood), but it does stand by itself as an enjoyable game to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198067361463', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1530541738}
review:
I was looking for a game like The Last Guardian, and discovered this game what impressed me already with its trailer and gameplay. I wanted to buy it in a sale, because the game is expensive for the average gameplay hours (~7 hours).

In the Steam Summer Sale 2018 I've finally bought it. I went play it very fast and while playing I discovered much extras in this game. I liked the graphics immediately and the game felt relaxing. After a few hours of playing, the game became exiting with some boss battles and fights against weird creatures. The puzzles were at a good level. In the final became the story very clear for me, and after all it was a sensitive game. The music is impressive, from the beginning to the final.

If you want to buy this game, please buy if for at least 17 euros because it's worth!

This game is 10/10 for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071706844', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1530493926}
review:
RiME is a calm/relaxing puzzle/platformer with environmental storytelling. It features magnificent graphics, a great soundtrack, and some magic/moving moments.

On the downside, the puzzles and platforming are good but not great. In the end, RiME is a great experienceif you know what it is and it's right for you : if you're expecting complex platforming or brain-scratching puzzles or any kind of combat, RiME is not for you. If you just want to spend some quality relaxing time exploring magnificent worlds while learning more about the story, this game is perfect for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042069229', 'num_games_owned': 842, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1530482499}
review:
[b] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31067175/] If you enjoy this review please consider following my Curator page here [/url]. [/b]

RiME is a puzzle adventure game in the mold of ICO and The Last Guardian, while also evocative of other indies like Journey, Abzu and The Unfinished Swan. If you enjoyed any of those titles, then I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs safe to say that you will really enjoy RiME.

Originally debuting with 2012‚Äôs Deadlight, developer Tequila Works delivers a real gem with RiME. While I enjoyed Deadlight, a good-not-great post-apocalyptic sidescroller, I would have never guessed they had it in them to make a game like RiME. I compared the game to Sony exclusives ICO and The Last Guardian, which is funny because at one time RiME too was a Sony exclusive. I‚Äôd say the split worked out pretty well for Tequila Works and gamers as a whole since more people get to play it now. I also firmly believe that RiME is a better game, and experience, than either ICO or The Last Guardian.

Being as spoiler free as possible, you play as a young boy who wakes up on a mysterious island. On this island you solve various environmental puzzles that I found to be both fun and intuitive. The game strikes a good balance of being accessible to most people while not making its solutions obvious on first glance. The game also boasts a striking visual aesthetic than is strong throughout and wholly cohesive.

Gameplay wise, it‚Äôs most similar to The Last Guardian, albeit with much, much better controls. I actually couldn‚Äôt finish TLG because I found the controls to so offensively bad. RiME is much better with it and I rarely found myself missing a jump and falling off something. Luckily, if you do make a wrong jump the checkpoint system is quite generous, so you‚Äôll never lose too much progress. Perhaps the thing that most impressed me gameplay wise was the camera system. So often in third person games the camera can get hung up on the environment or just plain get in your way. This is not the case with RiME at all. It‚Äôs very cinematic and truthfully I rarely had to touch the camera controls. It always seems to be in the right place at the right time and more importantly does not impede you at all.

I‚Äôm keeping this review somewhat intentionally vague because I think it‚Äôs best to go in blind. If you liked the games I mentioned at the top, then know that this is a game for you. It often bests what those games do and will definitely deliver on the emotional beats as well. Tequila Works really outdid themselves with this one and delivered one of the best indie experiences of the past couple of years in my eyes. This should be a game in everyone‚Äôs collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997194818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1530472817}
review:
[i]TIP: M&K Users! Take your fingers completely off the keyboard between movement changes during climbing puzzles. I'm guessing it doesn't handle key-holding well because the game was designed for controllers. Except for that and a few issues with climb-onto-box-directly-in-front-of-you, keyboard + mouse works just fine.

TIP2: Achievement Hunters! Don't even bother looking for the various collectibles if you want to avoid a walkthrough on your first playthrough. You absolutely will not find them, and some are pretty convoluted and will require multiple playthroughs. Do yourself a favor and play the game once for the story, and then again for the achievements. I HATE using guides/walkthroughs, but it's a must for this game. Use [url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/articles/view/video-games/walkthroughs/17776-Rime-Achievement-Trophies-Guide-100-Completion]this one[/url] for 100% as the Steam guides for RiME are trash.[/i]

Recommending this game because I bought it on sale and got at least a dozen hours of playtime out of it. Under any other circumstances this would be a negative review due to poor performance, lack of manual saving, poor controls, tedious achievements, and an embarrassingly bad-looking protagonist. Aesthetics aside, the reason for making a game in this style is an easy performance win, but too much unoptimized-for-PC polish added to that makes the game run sluggishly. I'm sure it runs great on consoles, but the cool water effects just aren't worth the frame loss on PC when you have a main character whose face looks like Mr. Potatohead. To estimate 6 hours of playtime (single playthrough) seems reasonable, but $30 for a game with no replayability outside of achievements seems steep to me. For $15 though, there's enough good going on that I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017190871', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1530374359}
review:
Bonjour, je vais faire un r√©sum√© de ce que j'ai pens√© du jeu qui sera comme suit.
- Sentiment global
- Dur√©e
- Sentiment pendant le jeu
- Gameplay
- Prix
- SPOIL (ne lisez-pas cette partie si vous ne voulez rien apprendre du jeu) Je mettrai un avertissement

Ce jeu est tout simplement une pure merveille. Un m√©lange d'onirisme et de po√©sie port√©e par une ambiance graphique et sonore irr√©prochable, le tout, offrant une narration imp√©cable.

Pourtant, le jeu est court, tr√®s court en fait (pour l'histoire sans chercher tous les objet √† trouver) vu que je l'ai fini en 7 heures. Cela dit, le fait que l'histoire ne soit pas plus longue fait sens et une fois le jeu termin√©, je me suis dit que plus long, √ßa aurait pu √™tre rat√©. Mais certains aspects du jeu sont pour moi un peu trop survol√©s (je ne peux rien dire de plus ici, cela spoilerait) et auraient m√©rit√© qu'on leur accorde plus de temps.

Pendant que j'ai jou√© √† ce jeu, j'√©tais vraiment dedans, ce jeu est bien fait en tout point : On se laisse port√© par l'histoire, on ne se prend pas la t√™te, les "morts" seront rares et nullement rageante, en fait, ce jeu vous fait passer un moment agr√©able. N'est-ce pas le but premier d'un jeu vid√©o ? Vraiment, dans ce jeu, on se sens plus dans un film que dans un jeu.

Pour ce qui est du gameplay, rien √† redire de mon c√¥t√© :
- Prise en main facile : Z-Q-S-D + 3 touches dont une sur la souris.
- Plateformes simples, agr√©ables et intuitives (90% du temps) et d'une mani√®re g√©n√©rale, je d√©teste les jeux de plateforme.
- Enigmes simples et tr√®s intuitives, avec peu de variations sans pour autant tomber dans un jeu r√©barbatif, les √©nigmes sont cools jusqu'√† la fin du jeu.
- Un gameplay rapide et fluide (j'ai quelques lags en jouant mais mon PC ne supporte pas la moiti√© des jeux actuels sans avoir quelques lags).
- Ce jeu se finit tout seul, si vous n'aimez pas les jeux impossibles √† finir, celui-l√† n'offre qu'une r√©sistance minime.

Prix : Je l'ai achet√© √† 50% et je ne suis pas vraiment d√©√ßu d'avoir attendu car le jeu √† beau √™tre proche de la perfection dans presque tous ses aspects, 35‚Ç¨ les 7 heures, c'est pas excellent quand on consid√®re qu'une fois l'histoire finie, il n'y a plus grand chose √† faire. Par contre, je vous garantie que vous ne verrez vos heures de jeu pas passer.

- Jouissif au d√©part, onirique et po√©tique, on suit pr√©cis√©ment les √©motions que les cr√©ateurs veulent transmettre et cela fait du bien.
- Vos sentiments changent avec l'avancement dans le jeu au m√™me titre que le r√©cit du jeu et si, comme moi, vous rentrez enti√®rement dans le personnage, vous suivrez naturellement ses √©motions.
- La fin du jeu est triste, vraiment triste. Tellement juste et poignante, elle retrace les diff√©rentes √©tapes du deuil et c'est narr√© de fa√ßon spectaculaire.
- Par contre, certains aspects du deuil sont largement mieux repr√©sent√© que d'autres (je parle d'un point de vue psychologique, pas de gameplay ou de longueur "d'actes")
----- D√©ni : Imp√©cable
----- Col√®re : Imp√©cable
----- Marchandage : En deux parties, la prmi√®re est surprenante de justesse l√† o√π, pour la seconde, le lien avec le deuil est beaucoup plus subtil et m√™me en ayant fini le jeu, il est compliqu√© de voir le lien entre le temple et le marchandage pour qui n'est pas coutumier des √©tapes du deuil et de leurs aspirations.
----- D√©sespoir : Proche de la perfection
----- Acceptation : Trop court, trop rapide, j'aurais aim√© en avoir davantage sur la derni√®re √©tape de la d√©pression car c'est tout de m√™me celle o√π la personne s'en sort et il aurait √©t√© agr√©able que cela dure plus de cinq minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107258071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1576378730}
review:
Maybe it's because I'm in an emotional mood, but Rime hit me in ways I did not expect to get hit.  I started out going "Okay, this game is so saturated with Ico and Shadow of the Colossus that it's an irrefutable fact that it will be sad or uplifting (or sadlifting).  I'm prepared so I'll be fine."

And somewhere along the line this went to "Ok that's pretty sad" to "Ok that's utterly heartbreaking actually" to "WAIT NO NOT THIS, STOP, RIME PLEASE NO I HAVE A FAMILY."  So, fair warning, if you possess empathy, Rime will get tears out of you.

A lot of people complain that the story was vague, but it in fact seems extremely straightforward to me.  If you're confused about something then you're probably taking it too literally.  Also, just look at the names of the levels (either at the end or on a walkthrough like I did) and the nature of the game itself should be made extremely clear to you literally at first glance.  (So on that note, fair warning that looking at a walkthrough is a kind of spoiler, but this one probably enhanced more than hurt my playthrough tbh.)

On that note, yeah, I had to use a walkthrough once or twice.  There are some little finicky points in the game where things just aren't that clear (e.g.; I got stuck in an area where an enemy kept blasting me off a ledge, which no one else seemed to experience, until I figured out that I had to pass by from MUCH closer to the enemy than the game had taught me was wise, but to be fair it had also taught that moving around just under this enemy was okay, so--YMMV).  I also struggled when the game got dark, because Enu (the kid) will usually stop and hang from a ledge but sometimes he apparently just says "screw it" and jumps.  This was only a mechanic in one or two areas though.

Otherwise, the graphics are beautiful, and I didn't struggle too much with the controls.  The keyboard support is definitely nice for people like me who're short on controllers, but there are a lot of areas where it's super clear it would be more fun with an analog stick, and camera control through the mouse is very much an acquired taste on this kind of game, so I'd definitely recommend a controller where possible.

Also, yeah it runs short (and if you're an Ueda fan then you're probably used to that sad inevitability), but there's a lot of replay value.  Collectibles carry over at the end of the game, so you can play at your own pace and not worry so much about missing out.  And the multiple levels are sprawling, with a lot of different tones, so in most of them it's very easy to get distracted from your goal by exploration.  I'm definitely looking forward to poking around again without having to worry about advancing.

So yeah I recommend it.  I don't know how to end this.  I'm gonna go rest my feelings now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249107560', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1559096938}
review:
ok, i'm coming here directly after finishing the game, because i need to get my feelings about this game out somewhere. kind of long, scroll to the end for the tl;dr

GAMEPLAY: i was wary when starting out because a lot of these adventure walking-simulator puzzle games seem to have beautiful artwork and assets, while the actual controls are...not so enjoyable. but this game? the camera is amazing. the hitboxes make sense. there were maybe two or three instances where the camera was annoying and caused me to miss a jump and/or fall, but those barely affected my overall experience. 

the attention to detail in this game is ASTOUNDING. i think the very first thing that let me know this was a story made with a lot of love in the first *two minutes* of opening the game, was how the walking animation changed when MC was in knee-deep water. you know when you're at the beach and you're trying to walk through the water but it's hard because water is like, actually really heavy? the animators and devs actually kept that in mind, and changed MCs walk cycle and speed to reflect that. such a tiny detail, but one that delighted me a lot. and that's just the very first one i noticed!

now for the story...

i won't spoil it, because it's genuinely unexpected enough that to witness it for yourself is something worth doing, but despite my own doubts about it that persisted up until literally the Very End of my playthrough, there IS  a story, and it IS absolutely incredible. it changes the way you think about the entire game -- and when i say the entire game, i mean the entire game; the main parts of it, and the collectibles as well!

tl;dr: excellent controls, heartwrenching story, and while i bought this game for the summer sale, it's more than worth the standard selling price. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198064399542', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1531105710}
review: The story is simply beautiful but with a sad ending. The concepo art and visual are breathtaking, I really enjoyed the journey with this little kid and Nana the fox. Is a story about loss and how to overcome all that. The symbolism in all the game is just perfect, the meanings behind everything is so polished and well cared. I absolutely recommend this game, lot of puzzles to solve and a beautiful experience. Thank you Tequila Works

author: {'steamid': '76561198065363152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1705104019}
review:
Breathtaking vistas, clever puzzles, amazing atmosphere. This is everything I loved about 'The Wind Waker' with an extra layer of depth to puzzle solving and platforming, which the game focuses on instead of combat. 
The music is spot on, the level design is brilliant, the mystery is engaging and at times eerie. I cant say enough good about this game.
