author: {'steamid': '76561198067758848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1529199147}
review:
This game was absolutely amazing to play. I really liked the puzzles, none of them were that complicated... sometimes the only reason they took so long was because I was over thinking haha. The game is stunning, the soundtrack is phenomenal, and you really get emotionally invested in this game. I kinda got an Ori and the Blind Forest / Majora's Mask vibe from it. Prepare for some feels, and enjoy this spectacular game :)

Oh, and I definitely preferred controller instead of keyboard/mouse on this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997906247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1529535387}
review:
If you played Submerged and felt like it needed more puzzles like Hob...
If you think Legend of Zelda has way too many fights and not enough intelectual challenges...
If you remember Myst fondly for its atmosphere and carefully paced story...

You'll like this game. 

If you're looking for PUBG, you're going to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092433902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1526665819}
review:
The game itself is beautiful and has amazing story with wonderful music. As for the gameplay, it lacks some refining and smoothness and feels slightly beta. As for the game itself, the storyline is short, about 5-6 hours. Despite it's breathtaking setting, it is not enough for the price in my opinion. Puzzles are basic and easy, there are few harder places but compared to other puzzle games, they felt lacking. There are a lot of collectibles and achievements but personally they are not enough since all in all the game doesn't provide enough content for the price point, again strickly my opinion. Game also lacks option to save, only way is to have the game do autosave, which can be frustrating,

I did enjoy the game despite it's rough gameplay (which you get used to) and loved the storyline. If you are looking for a game that you can spend hours and hours on, then this will not be the game for you. If you on the other hand enjoy the casual game with good storyline and opportunity to roam free while listening to beautiful soundtrack, then I'd recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083018726', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1526287500}
review:
Rime es un juego que te cuenta una historia sin decir una sola palabra, te imbuye de sensaciones, de bellos escenarios, puzles intuitivos que en general, no son excesivamente complicados, pero que te har√°n pararte a pensar en alg√∫n momento. Una banda sonora que acompa√±a perfectamente en cada momento a nuestro protagonista, que tendr√° que seguir al peque√±o zorro para guiarse e ir tras el hombre de la capa roja. En este juego no tienes un puntero, una gu√≠a, un tutorial, o una flecha que indique a d√≥nde ir o qu√© hacer, debes ser t√∫ quien, fij√°ndote en los sucesos y el entorno, descubras el camino a seguir o la acci√≥n a realizar.

Es en definitiva, una obra maestra creada por Tequila Works, su belleza gr√°fica es de las que te hacen pararte a observar bien el escenario, un "must have" si disfrutas de los juegos de puzles o los que te provocan emociones.

10/10

Mi m√°s sincera enhorabuena al equipo de Tequila Works por el juegazo que es RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116100475', 'num_games_owned': 4782, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1524399400}
review:
[h1] Amazing. What an experience. Truly a masterpiece, this is one of the most gorgeous games I have ever played. No need for attacks, enemies, guns or vehicles. Just you, an incredible exploration Puzzle Adventure and a Story, without any Text or Story-telling. Only you in a Walking Simulator. [/h1]

[i] I'll be honest with you, when I first heard about this game, I wasn't sure what to make of it. It looked gorgeous, but I couldn't shake the feeling that it felt really reminiscent of a lot of other games (a lot of people throw around comparisons to "The Last Guardian," and I certainly see it). However, after hearing a lot more about the game and reading about it (and also seeing that it was a lower price), I decided to give it a go, and let me tell you, I had an incredible time.

I'll be the first to let you know, "RiME" is not for everyone. The game doesn't tell you anything: you interpret the story in your own way, you aren't told where to go or how to get there. Some people might get frustrated by that. Me? I was so moved by the game that I couldn't care less. The game is visually breathtaking, emotional, fun, exciting, heartbreaking, and all-around excellent (It reminded me a lot of The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker. The sound design is also incredible, and I can say without hesitation that the music really added to the experience as a whole.

Like I said, the game isn't for everyone: the story can be frustrating to understand, the puzzles can be frustrating to solve, and some may find it too slow. That's totally okay, you are entitled to your opinion. However, I personally loved "RiME," and I can definitely say that if your curiosity is piqued, then give this game a go. It was an unforgettable experience and a beautiful game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982367787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1524303130}
review:
Sublime ! Rime est une √¥de au jeu. Tout le long de cette aventure jallon√©e de superbes musiques vous d√©couvrez un univers en cell-shading tr√®s r√©ussi. C'est un v√©ritable voyage immersif qui a aucun moment ne vous donne d'objectifs ou d'indications tr√®s claires... et qui pourtant vous transporte dans une palette tr√®s compl√®te d'√©motions ! 

J'ai pour ma part pris une √©norme claque et je le recommande √† toute personne qui souhaite se voir proposer une exp√©rience nouvelle, alternative, qui se veut √™tre un tr√®s s√©rieux concurrent du cin√©ma ; car Rime est en fait un film d'animation int√©ractif ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198410735612', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1524095969}
review:
Como notas negativas: no est√° todo lo optimizado que deber√≠a y aparte a veces la c√°mara falla algo. El gameplay es bastante dirigido, aunque con cierta (pseudo) libertad, y, en general, es sencillo.

Lo positivo (gana claramente): es MUY bonito, es pura poes√≠a visual tanto por lo est√©tico como por la historia que pretende reflejar. Te apela a los sentimientos y de seguro no te deja indiferente cuando lo acabas. La banda sonora es de CINE con may√∫sculas. Se deja jugar muy f√°cil y es toda una experiencia, con un final muy emotivo. Las animaciones est√°n muy cuidadas. El sonido es muy bueno tambi√©n.

¬°Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198255241269', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1525208354}
review: This game is truely exquisite. I found the whole experience of playing this to be relaxing, fun and emotional. It is mostly puzzle based and you will not find yourself dying or losing lives. It does not work like that. It is mostly simple platforming and as stated, puzzle based, though the puzzles are not of the type you would find in say a typical point and click game that have a habit of driving one mad. The soundtrack is exceptional and the story, though may seem rudimentary, is not. The game runs on the Unreal 4 engine and is sadly poorly optimised (it is from an indie studio I believe). If you have a poor GPU it will struggle, though I mostly got a solid 60fps on a GTX 980.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073198378', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1522434748}
review:
Nun √§u√üere ich mich einmal zu RiME

Story 

Eine am Anfang etwas verwirrende  aber doch sch√∂ne Story .
Das Spiel ist sch√∂n zu Steuern , sowie auch genial Gestaltet es macht von Stunde zu Stunde immer mehr spass da die ,Story einen mitrei√üt und das auf geniale weise . 

Die R√§tsel sind gut gemacht in manchen hinsichten ein wenig zu einfach ^^.
 
Nun kommen wir zu den Pro und Contras.

Pro
-   Geniale Story /Tiefgreifend
-   Sch√∂n Gestaltete Welt 
-   Gute R√§tsel


Contra

-   Kurze Spielzeit
-   Begrenzte wege (man muss auf Sch√§tze aufpassen man kommt nicht zur√ºck)


Im gro√üen und ganzen hat das Spiel viele St√§rken aber auch ein paar schw√§chen , ich pers√∂nlich bereue es nicht das Geld daf√ºr ausgegeben zu haben ( im Sale). Das Spiel hat eine wirklich geniale Story und das Geld ist das Spiel alle male wert selbst da es (kurz) ist . 

Ich hoffe es wird von diesem Publisher mehr in dieser Richtung geben aber mit einem besseren Ende , die Bewertung ist meiner Meinung nach  von 10 Punkten eine  8 wert .

review: $30 seems pricey for a 5 hour game.  If you catch it on sale, you must buy this game. The environments are gorgeous.  The soundtrack is exceptional.  The story is very well told.  [spoiler] This game doesn‚Äôt tug at your heart strings.  It grabs a fistful and yanks. [/spoiler]    The puzzles aren‚Äôt very challenging but they serve their purpose and the gimmicks are used just enough to be interesting without getting boring. The only complaint I have is that the character would sometimes get stuck on nothing but I was able to jump and get unstuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124418310', 'num_games_owned': 321, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1604107702}
review:
This is an amazing short game, that is visually good and peacefull looking while also maintaining a nice playable expierence. The game puzzles are not that hard which for the average player is not a problem, I actually enjoyed the simple puzzles because it means that you won't get stuck on one section for way to long. Visually the game is very pleasing on the eyes and it gives you a relaxing expierence while progressing through the game.

The only downsite is that the game is hard to run, so i reccomend playing with controller because playing at 30 fps with a controller feels better then playing it with keyboard and mouse.
Some sections will run smoothly, others don't but appart from that it's just an amazing game overall and it is definitely worth playing. it only takes around 5 pleasant hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157718507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1550086234}
review:
RiME got me so excited and now, after finishing it, I'm absolutely amazed about this beautiful game. 
All components are fitting perfectly together and result in an harmonic atmosphere. I'm a huge fan of it's graphical design, the music, the puzzles and it's somehow interpretational storyline. But what thrilled me the most, was this unexpected ending. *Ninja's cutting onions.* 
It's worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198330425429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1521518707}
review:
Just beat the game. I was not ready for that ending. By the time the credits rolled everything sort of blended together to give the full picture of what was happening. I loved this game. I don't have a single bad thing to say about it.

The story was pretty gripping, the characters were all very emotive as you knew what they were feeling without them having to say a word, and  the mechanics were pretty unique. I bought this game a while ago placed it on the backlog. Had I played this the year it came out I'd be screaming GOTY CONTENDER.

Anyway if you liked games like 'The Witness' or 'The Talos Principle', this game is right up your alley although I didn't find the puzzles to be as mind-numbingly difficult.

The pace of the game for me personally was perfect. I walk up to a puzzle, don't understand it one bit. After some pondering and playtesting with the physics/mechanics the eureka moment hits and it all makes sense. I never felt like pulling my hair out.

If you like an immersive, well paced story, progressively harder puzzles with different mechanics for most, and an eye for the art style (It only gets more beautiful) GET THIS GAME :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198099882601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1521478383}
review:
This game is a hidden gem in the gaming world. Gorgous graphics, amazing storyline, and great gameplay. The game is one of very few on steam that I absolutly love that has no violence in it whatsoever. While some darker areas on the map may scare small children, and certain mobs as well, overall it is a very great game I could recommend to anyone looking for something to sink their money into. However, without spoiling the game I will say this, the objects and objectives in the game are highly symbolic. I recommend AFTER completing the game to go look for a simpler explanation online as the game, espeacially the ending, is not very obvious in its meanings. This is also a very puzzle and story centric game, keep that in mind before purchasing if your looking for something faster paced, as this game is generally very slow, and mostly aims to invoke different emotions in the player.

As for the cons, there aren't very many. They are on the development side, but here they are in order from greatest complaints to least:

For one, Anti-Aliasing in this game is broken. I am running a Vega 56 card overclocked and I COULD NOT run SSAA even in 1080p medium settings. I was getting 20fps tops with horrible input lag. TXAA also has issues barley letting me hold on to 40-50 fps with some massive frame rate spikes dipping into the 20s. Honestly however, FXAA looks fine and seems to work great in this game. I was able to hold 60fps (as the max allowed in this game is 60fps for some reason) at 2k resolution max settings with FXAA on. I really wish the developers would fix this, but since this game is ported from console I can see why they would have issues like this.

Second, the parkour mechanics (at least on PC) can be frustrating at times. The main character you play has issues grabbing onto ledges you are supposed to climb or jump onto if you are already on another platform. Even if the distance is small and it is obvious that is where you need to go next. To make your life easier here is a TIP: While climbing be sure that your character is reaching out for the next platform BEFORE your make any jumps, this will tell you if he will make the jump or not without uneccesarily falling to his death.

Third, even without VSYNC, Freesync, Gsync, or whatever else you have, 60FPS is the max allowed in this game, I don't see why but that is just the way it is. Mabey it's for the physics engine or something but I doubt it. You really don't need more then 60fps in this game but I thought I would mention it.

Fourth: By far the most minor complaint, but it shows a small lack of polish with the port of this game to PC. MINOR SPOILER AHEAD!!!!!!!!!....... With that being said in certain spots in the game where you have to run from a mob (like in the above game pictures and preview section where you are running away from the bird) you character does not run straight across the bridge because of the camera angle. Because of this it is way to easy to fall off the bridge while running for your life. Its easy to fix this by just tapping the direction you need to go to compensate for the slight drag you have while trying to go straight but it needed to be mentioned so a dev can fix this small issue in an otherwise amazing game.

Overall: This game recieves 8/10 for what it is, and only loses the 2 points due to some issues with the port to PC. Keep in mind, I am a harsh critique. With that said, if you are on the fence, BUY THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081493847', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1521398522}
review:
Rime √® un gioco che nei suoi mood e paesaggi, ma specialmente nella sua poesia ricorda moltissimo Journey. Ma la storia che si dipana davanti al giocatore via via che prosegue e colleziona i giocattoli, gli emblemi e le serrature nascoste nei vari mondi, √® molto diversa. 
La soundtrack √® qualcosa di veramente pazzesco e la voce sar√† un elemento importantissimo tanto nei puzzle quanto come elemento ricorrente nella storia. 
Se volete una vera sfida per quanto riguarda i puzzle, beh questo forse non √® il gioco per voi, ma se siete collezionisti incalliti, vi dar√† spesso filo da torcere.

RiME √® un gioiellino, consigliatissimo per chiunque voglia immergersi in una storia diversa dalle altre, come anche i nomi dei mondi suggeriscono. Era da parecchio che non mi emozionavo cos√¨ e in mio parere merita un acquisto full price.
Davvero complimenti ai ragazzi della Tequila Softworks per questo piccolo pezzo di poesia videoludica.
Non dar√≤ ulteriori informazioni, quindi eccovi i miei pro, contro e voto finale.

PRO 
+ Atmosfere magiche e fantastiche, leggermente malinconiche riuscitissime
+ Soundtrack veramente emozionante
+ Personaggi credibili e storia eccelsamente raccontata 
+ Numerosi (ma non troppi) collezionabili, spesso nascosti in maniera veramente malvagia ma intelligente.
+ Possibilit√† (una volta finito) di rivivere i capitoli per collezionare tutti i trofei
+ Camera fluida, che potenzia i momenti topici lungo la storia e segue bene il personaggio
+ Level design interessante e quasi mai ripetitivo

CONTRO
- Sarebbe stato meglio, a gioco finito, permettere al giocatore di rivivere determinati momenti all'interno del capitolo, piuttosto che farlo ricominciare dal principio dello stesso
- Quando la camera si sposta, cos√¨ fanno anche i comandi, quindi se si percorre un ponte ad esempio, e la camera si sposta per motivi cinematografci, il nostro personaggio andr√† in diagonale piuttosto che orizzontale
- A volte √® tedioso rivistare luoghi o tornare sui propri passi per la relativa lentezza del personaggio 
- Avrei inserito all'interno del gioco qualcosa per far capire al giocatore che dopo quel determinato punto, non sarebbe stato pi√π possibile tornare indietro

VOTO: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198345553779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1953, 'last_played': 1520972716}
review:
[h1] Einfach perfekt. [/h1] 

Es kommt selten vor, dass ich ein Produkt als "perfekt" bewerten w√ºrde, aber RiME hat es aus meiner Sicht verdient:
Das Spiel bietet ca. zwei Tage lang ein spannendes Abenteuer, das nahezu gewaltfrei und damit auch f√ºr Kinder ab ca. 10 Jahren empfohlen ist. Aufgrund teilweise d√ºsterer Passagen halte ich es f√ºr kleinere Kinder eher ungeeignet. (Die k√∂nnen z.B. "Seasons after Fall" spielen.) Kann der Protagonist, ein schiffbr√ºchiger Junge, im ersten Kapitel noch eine idyllische Insel recht ungezwungen und in Ruhe erkunden, so sind die sp√§teren Level deutlich linearer aufgebaut, und es gilt stellenweise auch, Gefahren aus dem Weg zu gehen. Ein s√º√üer Fuchs leitet einen durch den Gro√üteil der Geschichte, aber wer nur ihm folgt, √ºbersieht manch versteckte Wege...
Unterwegs kann der Junge durch Schl√ºssell√∂cher Fragmente einer (seiner?) Geschichte erfahren, aber ich finde, erst am Spielende erschlie√üt sich √§lteren Spielern der tiefere Sinn.

Die Grafik ist, wie man Trailer und Screenshots entnehmen kann, zwar cartoonhaft, aber die Szenerien im Wechsel der Tageszeiten trotzdem so stimmungsvoll, dass ich als Hobbyfotograf h√§ufig von der "digitalen Kamera" (Screenshot-Taste) Gebrauch gemacht habe, und sei es nur zum Einfangen eines kitschigen Sonnenuntergangs mit Ruinen. √úber 500 Fotos und "Selfies" sind so entstanden. Immer wieder gibt es R√§ume oder Orte, da fiel mir so richtig die Kinnlade runter! Auch die eingestreuten animierten Sequenzen f√ºgen sich nahtlos in das Spiel ein.

Neben der Grafik kann das Spiel zudem noch mit einem tollen Soundtrack punkten (im Handel erh√§ltlich), und auch das Gameplay fand ich gut. Die von mir gespielte Version 1.0.4 ist nie abgest√ºrzt und hatte keine nennenswerten Fehler. Auch das ein Pluspunkt. Es gibt kein "Game Over" und keine Sackgassen, aus denen man nur durch Levelneustart wieder herauskommt - stattdessen werden Fehler (etwa Fehlspr√ºnge) verziehen und man bekommt schlicht eine neue Chance. Selten kommt es auf exakte Pr√§zision oder Timing an. Das macht das Spiel auch recht frustarm. Die Puzzle sind selten schwer, und das Spiel l√§sst einen meist auch eindeutig wissen, was funktionieren soll und was nicht. Wer allerdings auf die Suche nach den ganzen Sammelobjekten geht, wird gute Augen ben√∂tigen. Manche sind leichter, andere schwieriger zu finden oder zu erreichen.

Wenn es etwas zu kritisieren gibt, dann ist das wohl die Armkraft des vielleicht 12-j√§hrigen Protagonisten, die Profi-Freikletterer neidisch machen w√ºrde. Na ja, k√ºnstlerische Freiheit halt. H√∂henangst hat er offenbar auch keine. ;-)

Wer sich √§rgert, dass das Spiel nach vielleicht zwei Tagen schon vorbei ist, kann sich noch an die Suche nach (bzw. die Herausforderung von) den restlichen Errungenschaften machen ... irgendwas gibt es garantiert noch zu entdecken.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196156261', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1522772598}
review:
"Oh I wish there was a game like journey on steam!"
well here you go.

[b]visuals: 10/10[/b] this is a bit subjective since you could dislike the artstyle though they absolutely nailed what they were going for and nothing feels out of place

[b]soundtrack: 8.5/10[/b] gets boring after long play sessions of time but fits this game really well most of the time

[b]gameplayy: 7/10[/b] smooth and solid, doesn't run very fast and kdoesn't have many cool moves. basic movement at its best

[b]polish: 9/10[/b] you can get sort of stuck on small invisible ledges, sometimes when you jump to grab a ledge you won't grab it and you'd have to try again, though nothing major like crashes or weird bugs. Very solid experience.

It's a really good game but that doesn't mean you'll like it.
The pace is fairly slow and it gets more fun when you've played for at least 45 minutes.
I don't think this game is worth it full price for the average gamer but if you consider games as art, go buy this because the environments always look and sound great!

Game similar to this one: ABZU (and journey of course but that's not on pc so it doesn't count ;) )
I got this game for free in an nvidia giveaway so don't worry about me being biased just because I got this game for free.

I hope my review helped you about deciding whether you want to buy the game or not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198217647932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1100, 'last_played': 1540356249}
review:
RiME was a mixed bag for me. I was very excited about this game because of how beautiful it looked. But in the end, I have mixed feelings:

+ beautiful graphics: water, rocks, metal and other textures are all breathtaking. The color palette is also perfect.
+ ‚Äénice soundtrack
+ ‚Äénot super long
+ ‚Äécan be fun to play: climbing, swimming, exploration and puzzle solving

- framerate drops in certain areas even with specs above the recommended
- ‚Äéfew characters and no dialogue AT ALL. I personally prefer games with different characters, dialogues and interactions
- ‚Äépuzzles were mostly too simple and repetitive. A lot of the time, I wouldn't even call them "puzzles". It's more like acting a script in a movie because you just go and do the obvious. Only a couple of them were fun for me.
- ‚ÄéI found the ghost-like figures too creepy
- ‚Äéa map would have been very welcome, I felt lost a lot of the time after stage 1.
- ‚Äéno manual save points... Sometimes you just can't keep playing anymore and you wish you could just save and leave it there.
- ‚Äémy biggest complain: the story, the "adventure". First, it's way too vague for me. I hate stories were you have very little concrete information and are left wondering and theorising, absolutely hate them. I didn't expect this game to be like this and it totally is. Also, the story itself... Spoilers ahead: I was totally disappointed to see that this island was somehow not actually real and the quest, the adventure I thought I was living, was totally not like what I had imagined. I thought this would be a great adventure were we would end up saving the island somehow, that we would have a victorius and happy ending. But it turned out to be a vaguely defined tragedy. I don't play video games to get depressed or confused while theorising. I play to go on a wonderful and exciting adventure that leaves me feeling satisfied and happy in the end. Think Zelda. The problem is that you advertise the game like it's this great magical adventure, like something super exciting, when it turns out to be a sad and tragical story, not very exciting at all. You should hint at this in your description so that people like me don't end up disappointed.

I really loved the visuals though. Props, thanks for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062979402', 'num_games_owned': 798, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1510517229}
review:
RiME is a 3rd person exploration platformer, and graphically a feast for eyes - such vibrant colours, beautiful stylized environment, lots of stunning vistas, changing night/day cycle. Top notch aesthetics! There are few locations visually quite distinct from one another. And while I did prefer chapters 1 & 3 for their brighter palette, all of them painted a really nice atmosphere. 

The game features some puzzles too, but if you're following the main route, they are all quite easy and fairly obvious to figure out what needs to be done. The difficulty raises only if you decide to go for all the collectibles - many of them are tricky to obtain & hard to spot. Although there are way too many sets of objects to collect that don't serve any other purpose than collecting for the sake of collecting. Only few types were useful, like outfits, lullaby song parts (such a beautiful tune btw), or metaphorical story panels. But I can stand behind making the difficulty dynamic depending on how the player chooses to play :)

The story was vague and enigmatic most of the time, but when the reveal came at the end it turned out to be very emotional. I quite enjoyed the game overall. Personally, I do like exploring breathtaking & well crafted surroundings in a non-verbal setting, but I recognize that might not be enough for everyone.

[i]Written after completing the game with 9.5 hours played & 31 of 31 (100%) achievements earned.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197984104850', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1519588531}
review:
√âste es un juego dise√±ado con mucho mimo, con un apartado art√≠stico brutal y una historia m√°s interesante de lo que pueda parecer.
Es cierto que es muy corto, pero pudiendo sacarlo por un precio bastant reducido en gXa y en IG o aqu√≠ en las ofertas de steam, es bastante recomendable.

Si te gustan los juegos 'alternativos' y que te ofrezcan una experiencia diferente a los tiros habituales y los MOBA de turno, para tener una experiencia realmente interesante, de un solo jugador, y con puzzles (que no son ninguna locura) que no entorpecen la experiencia como pudiera pasar en otros t√≠tulos, como por ejemplo Hellblade, os lo recomiendo totalmente.

8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1485, 'last_played': 1520026057}
review:
Il est des jeux qui vous mettent une claque et d'autres qui vous font l'effet d'une caresse. [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] n'est pas vraiment du nombre. Ou, plut√¥t, il est des deux mondes √† la fois. Du genre √†... disons, √† vous [i]ass√©ner[/i] une caresse. Une [i]careque[/i], en somme. √áa commence comme une caresse et se termine comme une claque.

La caresse, elle, vient de ce qu'il est beau. Pas d'une beaut√© superficielle, qui s'imagine que, pour plaire ou susciter le d√©sir, il faut √† tout prix se couvrir de fard. Un fard qui masquerait d'ailleurs l'essentiel, une mani√®re de supercherie s'apparentant √† un bel √©crin vide. Non, [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] est d'une beaut√© simple, authentique, sans fioriture. Une beaut√© touchante. Une beaut√© √† qui vide et silence ne font pas peur, une beaut√© que ne d√©grade en rien quelques menus d√©fauts. Une beaut√© libre, sinc√®re, au sens o√π ce qu'elle montre est le reflet fid√®le de ce qu'elle rec√®le. Une beaut√© qui ne craint pas que coule son maquillage, sous quelque d√©luge de pluie. Apr√®s tout, elle n'en porte aucun.

Seulement, la caresse finit t√¥t ou tard par se muer en claque. Oui, t√¥t ou tard, selon votre degr√© de perspicacit√©. Me concernant, ce fut tardif au possible. Peut-√™tre parce qu'il m'a d'une certaine mani√®re subjugu√©, de sorte que je suis pass√© √† c√¥t√© des indices qu'il avait pourtant sem√©s sur ma route. Ou peut-√™tre parce que, depuis toujours, en particulier en mati√®re de jeu vid√©o et de litt√©rature, j'aime √† me laisser surprendre. C'est plus fort que moi, que voulez-vous, j'incline par-dessus tout √† fermer les yeux sur ce qui les cr√®ve, pour mieux reconstituer le fil de l'intrigue a posteriori. Mais ne vous m√©prenez pas ! la gifle en question ne r√©sulte aucunement d'un vice cach√© ou de d√©fauts qui prendraient le pas sur ses qualit√©s. Non, cette gifle-l√† √©mane en r√©alit√© d'une prise de conscience aussi poignante qu'am√®re : sur le charmant visage de cette beaut√© simple, la pluie se m√™le aux larmes.

Vous me permettrez de taire les d√©tails, sous peine de vous g√¢cher la d√©couverte. Pour me faire pardonner, je pourrais vous d√©crire la chose par le menu, avec des consid√©rations d'ordre technique, dont certaines confinent au pinaillage. Des consid√©rations du style "[i]chargements longs, mais tr√®s rares[/i]", "[i]parkour pour ainsi dire t√©l√©phon√©[/i]", "[i]quelques chutes de framerate[/i]", "[i]impression de libert√© appr√©ciable, qui cache en fait une aventure lin√©aire[/i]", "[i]narration muette, assez n√©buleuse, reposant pour partie sur des collectibles tr√®s - trop ! - bien dissimul√©s[/i]", "[i]√©nigmes nombreuses, vari√©es, tr√®s bien con√ßues[/i]" ou "[i]ambiance, notamment sonore, et direction artistique en g√©n√©ral de haute vol√©e[/i]". Honn√™tement, l'envie me manque d'autant plus qu'une analyse chirurgicale de cette beaut√©-l√† ne lui rendrait pas hommage.

Et puis, pour sa d√©fense, l'aspect [i]parkour[/i] est secondaire. Il ne constitue pas le coeur du jeu, tr√®s loin de l√† : une v√©tille, donc. Vous noterez du reste que ce qualificatif ne figure pas parmi les tags du jeu ; √† juste titre. Tout d√©pend sans doute des raisons qui vous auront pouss√© vers [i][b]RiME[/b][/i], mais sachez une chose : si le [i]parkour[/i] en fait partie, vous n'√™tes assur√©ment pas au bon endroit !

Enfin, j'ajouterais que vous incombe la responsabilit√© de rendre cette exp√©rience non lin√©aire, tout comme il vous appartient d'√©lucider les grandes lignes de son histoire, autant que faire se peut. Vous vous devez de ne pas la parcourir en ligne droite. Vous vous devez de vous √©carter des sentiers battus. Sans quoi cela reviendrait √† juger de sa beaut√© sans lui avoir accord√© le regard qu'elle m√©rite.

[u]EDIT[/u] : Est-il n√©cessaire de pr√©ciser que [i][b]RiME[/b][/i] compte, au nombre de ses influences, l'oeuvre d'un certain [b]Fumito Ueda[/b] ?

[h1]Verdict : 5/5 - Le sans-faute, √† acheter les yeux ferm√©s ! Et √† jouer les yeux grand ouverts.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198096354229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1522501665}
review:
Prima volta che scrivo una recensione, ma questo gioco la merita davvero.

Apparso come un fulmine a ciel sereno mentre guardavo il mio pannello di Nvidia, mi sono approcciato a questo gioco che avevo fugacemente visto un paio di volte tra le notizie, lasciandomi catturare dalle sue peculairit√† in poco tempo.

Ci troviamo a vestire i panni di un bambino, apparentemente naufragato su un isola tropicale, che deve riuscire a ritrovare un modo per tornare a casa superando i vari enigmi dell'isola, mentre una figura rossa incappucciata lo osserva sempre da lontano...

La prima cosa che mi ha colpito √® stato l'impatto visivo.
Il design cartoonesco e i colori vividi sono elementi che saltano subito all'occhio del giocatore, risultando facilmente apprezzabili.
Questi elementi sono poi messi in ulteriore risalto dal level design delle varie zone, il quale oltre che nella struttura varier√† anche nella palette di colori utilizzata, facendo trasparire da parte dell'autore una forte ispirazione artistica.

Questi e anche altri elementi (come la totale assenza di dialoghi in game o la bassa e calcolata presenza di nemici nel gioco) fanno percepire mentre si gioca una certa vicinanza ai titoli di Fumito Ueda come Ico, Shadow of the Colossus o The Last Guardian, e infatti anche questa √® una storia che si racconta in silenzio, senza Npc simili a noi con cui interagire o parlare, con dettagli nascosti pensati apposta per coloro che sanno/vogliono osservare... 

...ma non per questo preclusa per coloro che vogliono vivere un esperienza, ossia il viaggio questo bambino attraverso questo strano luogo, fino al commovente finale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005667285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1518498239}
review: If you're looking for a captivating visual narrative and casual puzzle platforming in a semi-open world environment, then RiME is the game for you. The score is moving, and the feels are real

author: {'steamid': '76561197987192312', 'num_games_owned': 1052, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1518320182}
review:
First and foremost, this is an exploration game, I'd say one step up from a walking simulator. 
It isn't fully open world, but there's plenty of opportunities to veer off the beaten path to find collectibles and see the sights.

The puzzles are mostly simple, only a few take a moment to ponder. 
The game is visually stunning and the animations are beautiful. The game is a work of art.
The soundtrack is simply brilliant and really engaging.
The game is an emotional rollercoaster. When you realise what's happening it will shock you.
Another game that tells a great story without saying a word!

If you like: Abzu, Brothers, The Vanishing of Ethan Carter etc. Then you'll love this.

Nitpicking: 
The chapter select feature could have more load points for those hunting collectibles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350967245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1518319505}
review: Awesome game! Puzzles are just challenging enough so you don't lose focus on the storytelling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109944754', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1518291159}
review:
Rime is definitely one of the best games I've played in the last few years. 

First of all, the graphics are amazing. Every once in a while I would stop playing just to admire the magnificent scenery. Well done. Really, beautiful.

The gameplay itself is very interesting and engaging. I loved the imagination that went in this game. 

As for the story, I wouldn't like to spoil anything so I'll just say that it is perfect for an Indie game and also very beatifully approached.

All in all a great game that will provide very good quality entertainment for all audiences. I definitely recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035684164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1518113754}
review:
It's like Journey and a Zelda game rolled into one. I had fun playing it. The last chapter is an emotional roller coaster that left me sitting here in silence for quite awhile. I don't even know....

Visually, I thought the game was beautful. Performance wise, it suffers from frequent frame rate drops. I'm using a 1080ti and all throughout the entire game the frame rate would go from the 70's to the 20's at any given moment. That's my only complaint.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010773088', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1623646660}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198130858345', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1517462099}
review:
It have it own charms but alot of mechanic are just unfinished such as the climbing mechanic which feel like a clickable cutscene because u can't basically do nothing expect jump and grab and there is no choice at all it just that you jump from one place to another and sometime they use it too often it became boring af , the soundtrack are really good at first but it gone repeititive really quickly like in 1 place I hear the same track over and over for almost 40 mn.

The story tho is good (atleast to me.) it made sense when the ending revealed and the environment also look good and beautiful but sometime it just too dark and sometime it just uninspired af.

The puzzle are super ez which is good for someone who just want to feel the environment this game made but for me I think it's super lazy, I mean it shown you some good puzzle and then use it over and over and then it made you feel great again with new puzzle and then they use it over and over and the loop continue..

author: {'steamid': '76561198025085865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1518433390}
review:
This game has stunning visual design, a subtle (and emotionally impactful) story and fun (but not particularly difficult) puzzles.

The design of the world is beautiful, but in terms of render quality it's not really close to the top new games. The camera behaviour is also a bit irritating at times (although certainly not the worst I've seen).

I found the puzzles engaging but not particularly hard (once I'd worked out the mechanics of a new puzzle piece). If you are primarily interested in challenging logic puzzles, there are other games that will do that better. This is a more relaxed style of puzzle.

The story is not handed to you on a plate, and it's not clear what's going on until the end (and even then, there's a reasonable amount left to the player's interpretation). The ending packed a real emotional punch, though, and a lot of that comes from the subtle build up.

To get the most out of it, I would recommend avoiding anything that might be spoilery, and taking the time to explore the world as you go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010029868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1514923709}
review: Great visuals and ambiance, but is sadly fairly shallow and frustrating when it comes to the platforming and puzzles and story. Some sections were very frustrating to get through, turning the experience into a slog. The game also spoils what's in a new area if you quit out (a natural stopping point) and play at a later time. I was really hyped to play this game, but it didn't live up to my expectations. Still serves as a nice study in game tech though, as the very large world looks great!

review: I'd love this game if it wasnt the case that everytime the camera touches the wall, it goes through said wall and half the world disacpears. I'm only an hour in and this one single factor is so bad that I'm struggling to play past the first hour. This is a shame since ive been looking forward to playing this game for weeks just to find its a buggy mess. The camera sometimes locks into place asweel in the weirdest places, There's also massive lag between my mouse and the camera movement.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983817188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1516505747}
review:
Giving this a very weak recommendation.

It's a very pretty game and you can tell the developers really put a lot into it.  It's another "mysterious boy wakes up and must run through the world solving puzzles in order to contine proceeding through the world" games.  Its okay...it's fun in some parts, over-long in others.  I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it either.  By the end, I was wondering when it was going to end since it started to drag on and on. 

So here's the biggest issue...It wants to be Ico, but the problem is, the character you play is so generic.  In Ico, the boy stumbles around in a way that gives him character.  He has a girl to interact with and you get to care about him because he has personality in his body language and the way he interacts with her.  In Rime, you're just some kid who shouts at things a lot.  There's no emotion, and even when there is a part where he is crying, it still doesn't come off very realistic...now we just have a generic character who is crying.  Even worse is the lovely score hits you over the head literally trying to violently pull some feelings out of you, but it feels so cloying, it just comes off as "meh."

The end, well, I get it...and it was probably the only part that gave me a few goosebumps, but it's a little too Deus Ex Machina for me.  It's lazy.  I'd rather have a game like The Witness not even pretend to have a story but be somewhat entertaining, then the ending here that felt a little too tacked on.  Like they got to the end and went, "Oh, we really do need to find some time to make up a reason why the player is doing all these things..."

Anyways, I recommend it because it is pretty, has a nice soundtrack and it's a pleasant way to spend a couple of evenings.  Just don't expect to remember it for long when you're done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078840356', 'num_games_owned': 833, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1514577555}
review:
[h1]Spoiler free review, with a short and longer version:[/h1]

I got this game as a Xmas' gift from a friend. Let's roll:

[b]TLDR version[/b]

buy this game if:

+ you love games that visually and emotionally are able to stimulate 
+ you like story driven games with a [u]side puzzle component[/u]
+ you fancy games that show different scenarios and setups quite often

don't buy this game if:

- you don't have a "decent" / above "mid-tier" pc
- you believe that spending 40$ on a 5 hour game might be too much
- you love games heavily based on puzzles

Verdict 8/10, well done, deep (expensive too) and meaningful gaming experience 
Time required to complete the main game : 5 hours
Time required to 100% the game: 8-10 hours 

[b]Detailed version[/b]

A quick summary of the most important subjects:

1- [b]The price tag[/b] can be discouraging and intimidating. The game hasn't any replayability value: replaying the story chapters will only grant you the chance to grab those collectibles you'll be needing for the real ending. Now... im not a business or budgeting manager, so i don't know why this price tag has been decided. I'm not saying that this title doesn't deserve its money, just keep in mind that for 40$ you can get many good indie titles at the same time rather then getting only this gorgeous, deep and terrific looking one that will last only for 5 hours.

2- [b] The pacing and story telling is extremely well structured [/b] as the game will start off with a sunny seaside landscapes, ruled by a peaceful environment and will keep changing throughout the whole game by switching themes, songs, enemies and situations, while being able to be and to seem fresh and never repetitive through the whole experience, which will be heavily puzzle based at the start and will get more and more platforming centered after.

3- [b] Frame drops aside, the game is really polished and meaningful [/b] as shown here:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1275327542

just to give you an example, when the young protagonist has to climb a slope, has to lean, sit down or just performing physical activity...he's actually realistic as his moves are properly represented. 
You will his see his legs moving accordingly and his whole body reacting naturally. Many puzzles and rooms are based on "dignity and magnificence" so you'll always have a chance to admire the landscapes, secrets and clearing out the game areas without any abrupt shifts or pauses (unlike Hob, just to give you an example).

TO SUM UP:

Play this game if you want to be enchanted by a gorgeous, expensive and short puzzle - story driven game. If you're looking for a long puzzle game only, you might have to look for something else.

Thanks for reading and for bearing up with me, leave a comment below if you have any questions or observations, have an amazing day/night, feel free to follow my other reviews at: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32344423/

author: {'steamid': '76561198055482659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1516065277}
review:
I was really looking forward to this game. It looked gorgeous and relaxing - just the type of game I love to play. Unfortunately, I was a bit disappointed.

Pros:
-Absolutely stunning.
-The soundtrack is fantastic.
-Puzzles aren't too difficult (definitely don't overthink them or you will get stuck).
-Super interesting visuals and ideas.

Meh
-The story is simple but you don't really understand much until the very end. Once the ending was revealed, a lot of the gameplay mechanics and symbolism really made sense, but I would have liked to have understood a bit more as I went through the game. Going OH repeatedly at the end of the game took away from the story. This is the type of game you need to replay to get the full value of the story/symbolism.
-Controller controls are a bit meh.
-Maneuvering the boy can get a little annoying - you have to hit some things just right or you have to start all over.
-The game is essentially a jumping/parkour simulator. This isn't necessarily a bad thing, but it is not what I wanted out of a game, so I got super bored quickly. Especially when I kept missing jumps and had to start all over.

Cons
-The camera is horrible. It locks in certain areas, making it impossible to look around and see where you need to go. Other times it positions itself weirdly and the angles make it seem like you're closer to something than you really are, resulting in missed jumps.
-Sometimes it is really hard to figure out where you need to go/what you need to do. The level layout is a bit wonky. It allows for a lot of exploration if you're into that kind of thing, but it can become a maze-like convoluted mess to those who just want to run through the game.

I really, really, really wanted to adore this game. And in some respects I do. It is stunningly beautiful. The soundtrack really adds to the atmosphere. The story is emotional and interesting. Yet, at the same time, the game is boring. The first chapter consists of running around 'collecting' a few things. The second chapter consists of running from spot to spot while being chased. The third chapter is by far the absolute best - the puzzles are great, the gameplay mechanics are wonderful, and the story bits are fantastic. Then the fourth chapter is basically a repeat of the first chapter but with rain. I think, overall, I was just disappointed that the game wasn't what I expected. I wanted a super compelling story game with puzzle mechanics. Instead I got a jumping simulator with a story that doesn't really make sense until the very end. Nothing that continuously compelled me to continue playing.

A playthrough of just the story will take you about 5 hours. Collecting all the things and achievements might take you around 10 hours. You will likely be super bored. I still recommend the game but definitely get it on sale. $30 is too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034274574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1514692879}
review:
RiME had a very troubled development. The Spanish team Tequila Works, known for Deadlight (2012), began working on it in 2010 with the temporary title of Echoes of Siren; it should have been an action RPG with isometric view, crafting and survival mechanics, building of fortifications, strategic battles, exploration. Microsoft initially supported the project but later rejected it; the ball passed into the hands of Sony, which made it an exclusive for Playstation, until in 2016 Tequila Works repurchased the rights to distribute it on all platforms. Meanwhile, the concept of the game was completely transformed; the title became RiME, which I think it‚Äôs for Rest in MEmory and alludes to the meaning of the whole adventure that I leave you to unveil: this review is spoiler free.

It is a third-person 3D adventure characterized by a pleasant cartoon-style cell shading graphics; it is set on a mysterious and fascinating island that offers a great variety of breathtaking scenery. You impersonate a child with a red cape that is shipwrecked on the island and wakes up on the seashore; the starting scene is reminiscent of the final scene of ICO, one of RiME‚Äôs inspirational sources; other sources of inspiration are certainly The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker (2002), Journey (2012) and The Last Guardian (2016). From the beginning you are captured by the magical atmosphere of the island, and stimulated to thoroughly explore it for understanding its many mysteries. Sceneries offer majestic architectures that remind of the ones of ICO and The Last Guardian and therefore refer to the metaphysical paintings of Giorgio De Chirico and in part also to some visions of Salvator Dali. A certain spiritual, mystical, and ancestral aura is strengthened by the rapid cycling of day and night, with effects of light and color enchanting eyes and spirit. If you have a romantic and sensitive soul, I advise you to play immersed in the quiet of the night to get the maximum enjoyment.

Main components of gameplay are initially exploration and contemplation; later on, environmental puzzles prevail. Puzzles make use of the alienating architectural perspectives and of light and shadow effects; they are well-designed and help to keep high the enigmatic and mystical atmosphere of the experience. Their locations are full of symbols that recall the unconscious, the past and the memory; they are not too difficult, do not require particular skills. Some of them are cooperative and have to be solved with the help of your companions; yes, you are not alone on the island: a little fox will be your guide spirit, and a strange automata, a sort of Wheatley from Portal 2 but bigger and on iron stilts, will lead you towards the end of your journey.

Gameplay will be sometime interrupted by enigmatic cut scenes concerning child‚Äôs past; they help to keep attention high and feed the desire to go on and understand the meaning of the experience. Aura of mystery is strengthened by frequent and suggestive encounters with a black and faceless man wrapped in a red cloth. Pace is well calibrated thanks to some moments of action where you have to face a few threats; in particular a big prehistoric bird that will give you a long hard time, and some strange hooded beings, a sort of dark priests who fear the light. Challenge is really minimal, and it is right for a game that focuses on contemplation; in any case you do not run the risk of dying: if you happen to fall from a ravine or get caught by the prehistoric bird or the dark priests, by magic you would start the game from the previous checkpoint, just a bit confused and bruised, just like in The Last Guardian.

And now we come to the less successful aspect of the game: narration.....

( for a deeper analisys and rating, continue on VGArt Website: https://vgartsite.wordpress.com/2018/01/15/rime/ )

Steam group: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/VgArtInt

Curator Page: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26168615-Video-Games-Art-International/

review:
Lo primero que pense cuando lo recibi era que tenia que ser malisimo pero me he llevado una gran sorpresa con este titulo, acostumbrado a ser el portador de la muerte en la mayoria de juegos aqui la mayor agresion que puedes hacerle a una criatura es "gritarle" literalmente, aun asi RiME es toda una experiencia su mundo es magico su dise√±o artistico maravilloso y su banda sonora es preciosa, no entiendo de arte pero diria que es como si de una obra de arte hecha videojuego se tratase.
Su jugabilidad me gusta bastante, ese plataformeo al estilo Prince of Persia y los puzles que quizas no son muy dificil pero no todos se hacen a la primera, en alguna ocasion note caidas de FPS pero en general diria que el juego en si esta bien pulido

author: {'steamid': '76561198048101201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 200, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1515599130}
review:
RiME is a lovely game with little danger, simple puzzles, and beautiful places to explore. There's no verbal story - everything is conveyed through murals and flashbacks and visual metaphor, for the most part. It's got a lovely soundtrack, too, and the art style is really stunning in places. Some of the puzzles are really cool conceptually - I love some of the light amd shadow puzzles in particular - but they're almost never confusing or frustrating. Overall, this was a really artistically resonant experience. The ending isn't exactly surprising, but it was nicely done.

That said, there are a few moments where I thought the game lacked polish. Some of the climbing segments twist the camera at odd angles where the controls stop being predictable, and it becomes difficult to orient the character for a jump to another ledge. Some of the scenes are very visually dark, which can be difficult to look at, let alone complete things in (thankfully, the puzzles are all pretty simple). The art style is also so beautiful, especially as evidenced in the first and third levels, that it's a shame how often the game goes dark and dim.

Still - lovely game overall, simple and curious, well-orchestrated and great to look at. I'd absolutely recommend people give it a shot if they're looking for a journey more than a challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066581794', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1581611943}

La innovaci√≥n est√° en la dulce y cuidada narraci√≥n de un proceso mental tan complicado y oscuro, y en c√≥mo ense√±a sus fases perfectamente reflejadas en el arte, la m√∫sica y la atm√≥sfera que se crea con estos. Son capaces de crear escenas misteriosas y √©picas de aventura a la par que deprimentes y reflexivas. 

Aunque me parece que sus referencias est√°n muy claras, han sabido llevar todo esto a un producto personal y con identidad. Hellblade y Rime son mis juegos del a√±o.

review: A beautiful game with a sad story and equally gloomy music. The game is straight up linear, based around a small boy trying to solve puzzles on a mysterious island. My 9 year old daughter finished the game in 9 hours with minimal help from me so perhaps a bit pricey at ‚Ç¨34.99 so get on on sale and it will be definitely worth it. It's very much like Submerged in terms of climbing and exploring stuff so a nice introduction for kids to gaming and getting used to a gamepad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127291795', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1515383902}
review:
This is a great Indie 3D platformer with beautiful art style, fun puzzles and touching story. 
The graphics are stylised, very similar to Wind Waker and Pyre and look really good.
The atmosphere is well crafted with fantastic music 
The puzzles are fairly simple but fun and rewarding. 
The story is very intriguing and will have you thinking. Eventually the story becomes emotionally touching and twists and turns in clever, unexpected ways.
If you enjoyed other atmospheric, emotional classics like Ico, Shadow of the Collosus and Limbo you'll absolutely love Rime. A must buy !

author: {'steamid': '76561197997925177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 331, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1515356343}
review:
After "Men who stare at goats" - "Kid who shouts at flames"

A land of discovery (actually just 4 discrete levels, no continuous land) stretches out before you. Explore the beautiful, rugged world of RiME (where some poor sod had to paint every climbable edge with white paint). Armed with your wits (or lack of options to the wrong thing) and a will to overcome (rather the will to push every button, pull every lever and expect
 progress) ‚Äî and the guidance of a helpful fox (cute, yes / helpful not so much)‚Äîyou must explore (climb, jump, push and puzzle) the enigmatic island, reach the tower's peak (not because there is a reason to do so, it is just the only thing to do), and unlock its closely guarded secrets (i think the game contains more optional collectables than enything else)

Quality over Quantity. It took me 4.5 hours to finish the game (the rest was idling while afk). I'd rather have 4 hours of quality entertainment than 300 hours of repetitions). Grab it at the next sale if the asking price is too much for you.

Bit bummed that the soundtrack can't be bought

author: {'steamid': '76561197985023772', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1515340505}
review:
To me, the only thing RiME has going for it is its visuals, which are super pretty.

Otherwise, the game has:
- puzzles, which aren't very good puzzles (they often contain new, unpredictable elements; you usually just fiddle with things until some walls shift and some weak solution becomes obvious)
- controls, which are often frustrating and awkward
- a story, that's very thin and opaque; it's told through small, cryptic vignettes, some environmental stuff, but remains very confusing even at the end

So, uh, I played through the game and it was mostly a chore.

review:

The graphics are really nice (yet still simple), 
the music is beautiful and perfect,
the controls are simple

If i were to make a comparison it would be to the likes of Journey, Unfinished Swan, Rain and to a lesser extent ICO. 
Definitely worth a play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044037864', 'num_games_owned': 1252, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1515123735}
review:
A breathtakingly beautiful exploration and puzzle game with a world and story to really draw you in.

There really isn't much to say about the game that can't be gleaned from the screenshots and videos on the store page. What starts out as a well-executed puzzle game with some light platforming will quickly draw you in with its world building, story and varying mechanics, and turns into what I have no trouble calling a piece of art.
While the gameplay suffers from a little bit of a slog around the late middle of the game, don't discount it, don't quit. If you're going to play this, see this through until the end. The atmosphere and setting should easily help you with that.

I will put a caveat about my recommendation, however:
The game not only suffers from performance issues, but is also quite short, and aside from catching up on collectibles offers almost no replay value. With less than 6 hours of playtime it is hard to justify a 35‚Ç¨ price point for this product, especially if you're looking for lots of content for your money. Only buy this full price if you absolutely value a short, focussed and directed experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964273287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1515045518}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072325646', 'num_games_owned': 11297, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1514168037}
review:
[h1]RiME conta a curiosa hist√≥ria de um menino √≠ndio e mudo que sobe em trepadeiras, nada como peixe, urra feito Jureg e corre atr√°s de uma raposa que late. RiME √© uma obra de arte.[/h1]

Sabe aquele jogo que voc√™ joga em um final de tarde no feriad√£o e que depois de um tempo nem lembra que jogou? Pois √©, RiME [b]n√£o[/b] √© um desses jogos. Apesar de possuir uma hist√≥ria simples, ela consegue te conquistar por ser emocionante e marcante, al√©m disso, a forma que ela √© contada √© admir√°vel, praticamente todos os elementos art√≠sticos do jogo se encaixam perfeitamente e tornam a experi√™ncia ainda melhor.

A sinopse do jogo √© a seguinte... Voc√™ acorda em uma praia de uma ilha misteriosa sem nenhuma explica√ß√£o aparente, a partir da√≠ o objetivo √© explorar o local e descobrir quem √© voc√™, que ilha √© essa e o que est√° acontecendo, o game abusa do mist√©rio e praticamente te obriga a explorar bastante, enfim, a curiosidade que ele te proporciona em rela√ß√£o ao enredo faz parte da experi√™ncia e acredito que ir al√©m dessa pequena descri√ß√£o seria cometer um baita pecado com quem pretende jog√°-lo, pois como eu disse, a hist√≥ria √© simples.

O game bebeu de uma fonte muito rica, pois se inspirou em jogos como LIMBO, INSIDE, Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons e principalmente nas obras de Fumito Ueda (Ico, Shadow of the Colossus e The Last Guardian), jogos que conseguem facilmente encantar o jogador atrav√©s de seus visuais e mec√¢nicas minimalistas, sem falar na facilidade que esses jogos t√™m em contar uma hist√≥ria de maneira satisfat√≥ria, mesmo n√£o possuindo interface (HUD), barra de vida, skills (habilidades), textos e outros.

‚Äî ''H√°√°√°!'' ‚Äî Al√©m da maravilhosa trilha sonora e dos efeitos sonoros de qualidade absurda isso √© tudo o que voc√™ ouvir√°, ali√°s, √© assim que grande parte dos quebra-cabe√ßas do jogo funcionam... o menino grita ou cantarola para ativar certos mecanismos e avan√ßar pelos cen√°rios, destravar portas, ativar recursos, liberar objetos necess√°rios, entre outros tamb√©m existem os puzzles mais ''cl√°ssicos'', aqueles relacionados a mover objetos e mecanismos. Na minha humilde opini√£o nenhum dos puzzles apresentados √© desafiador ou inovador, por√©m, acredito que isso tenha acrescentado positivamente para a casualidade da obra, talvez isso seja um ponto negativo para os que buscam por um desafio mais complexo, para mim n√£o foi.

Balde de tinta, mistura de cores, explos√£o de √™xtase e... arte! √â o que o jogo parece, uma linda pintura feita com as m√£os. S√©rio, o contraste que os gr√°ficos e o visual proporcionam √© deslumbrante, o azul intenso do mar, o branco das constru√ß√µes e o verde da vegeta√ß√£o se mesclam de maneira espl√™ndida, √© at√© dif√≠cil descrever. Apesar das cores serem muito vibrantes, ele n√£o √© o tipo de jogo que depois de certo tempo incomoda quem est√° jogando (ao contr√°rio da falta de satura√ß√£o que [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/corvinho/recommended/360430]MAFIA III[/url] apresenta ou do excesso de satura√ß√£o que Battlefield 4 possui). H√° somente um ponto negativo que eu gostaria de comentar sobre o visual, o fato de alguns cen√°rios serem muito escuros, escuros mesmo, escuros ao ponto de voc√™ nem mesmo saber para onde est√° indo, creio que isso tenha sido uma escolha pessoal dos desenvolvedores, mas depois de algum tempo jogando percebi certa falta de sintonia entre os trechos iniciais e os finas, isso poderia ter sido facilmente corrigido se aprimorassem o sistema de ilumina√ß√£o dos cen√°rios, ou at√© mesmo se alterassem as cores das texturas (de preto para branco), enfim, apenas um detalhe pessoal que achei v√°lido mencionar.

Infelizmente nem tudo √© perfeito, a vers√£o para computador deste game possui v√°rios problemas e mesmo ap√≥s in√∫meras atualiza√ß√µes de corre√ß√£o o jogo ainda conta com muitos problemas t√©cnicos e isso √© desanimador...
[list]
[*][b]Desempenho:[/b] A primeira vez que adquiri o game ele estava injog√°vel, literalmente, pois o desempenho era rid√≠culo, simplesmente n√£o ''rodava'', foi ent√£o que efetuei o reembolso. Agora, depois de muitos tempo, grande parte dos problemas de otimiza√ß√£o foram resolvidos, entretanto, ainda existem trechos (principalmente em locais fechados) em que o desempenho cai para a metade e se mant√©m inconstante mesmo em uma m√°quina de √∫ltima gera√ß√£o, confira o v√≠deo abaixo;
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cQyHDlIU_hA
[*][b]Crashes:[/b] Nas 16.5 horas jogadas o game fechou sozinho duas vezes, como eu estava monitorando o desempenho da m√°quina posso afirmar definitivamente que n√£o foi problema no hardware;
[*][b]Problemas gr√°ficos:[/b] N√£o cheguei a notar delays de renderiza√ß√£o, por√©m, pude notar paredes desaparecendo e reaparecendo em diversas situa√ß√µes;
[*][b]Jogabilidade:[/b] A movimenta√ß√£o do personagem em determinados momentos me irritou e prejudicou meu jogo, por exemplo, ao executar um pulo de uma plataforma para outra o boneco errar o local por falta de precis√£o, isso me lembrou um pouco Uncharted: Drake's Fortune, por causa da velocidade em que o personagem anda;
[*][b]Outros bugs:[/b] Al√©m do desempenho, esses foram os problemas mais s√©rios que tive. Ao cair ou pular de um local meu personagem simplesmente travou no ar e tive que voltar o checkpoint, isso aconteceu cinco vezes e foi extremamente frustrante. At√© fiz uma grava√ß√£o do ocorrido, segue v√≠deo abaixo.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=77xxtpFRXbQ
[/list]

[b]Conclus√£o:[/b] Depois que terminei de jog√°-lo e em meio a uma profunda reflex√£o sobre o sentido da vida foi que decidi recomend√°-lo, mesmo ap√≥s os v√°rios problemas t√©cnicos que encontrei. Penso que, se um jogo conseguiu me fazer ''parar de viver'' para refletir sobre algo assim, definitivamente ele merece a recomenda√ß√£o, mesmo que n√£o seja a full price... RiME √© essencial para os amantes dos jogos do mestre Fumito Ueda, um jogo artisticamente encantador, visualmente indescrit√≠vel, agrad√°vel de se jogar e com certeza agradar√° jogadores que buscam jogos de puzzle casuais, ricos em narrativa, ambienta√ß√£o, visuais, imers√£o e trilha sonora, mas infelizmente ainda apresenta muitos problemas t√©cnicos que podem degradar sua experi√™ncia, por isso talvez seja melhor compr√°-lo somente com um bom desconto (talvez algo entre 40-50% dependendo da situa√ß√£o e do jogador).

Cr√≠ticas e sugest√µes s√£o sempre bem-vindas, s√≥ pe√ßo que, por favor, seja educado(a) nos coment√°rios e n√£o poste spoilers sem usar a [url=https://steamcommunity.com/comment/Announcement/formattinghelp]tag spoiler[/url].

[h1]An√°lise fortalecida atrav√©s do Curador do grupo [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/magnaway]Magnaway.[/url][/h1]
[h1]Apoie-nos seguindo nosso [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26745635/]Curador[/url] para futuras an√°lises.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030034851', 'num_games_owned': 1149, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1514855268}
review:
This is a really beautiful game, I really love how you really dont know a thing about whats going on until the very end.  its not very challenging but honestly I was able to get past that really easily because the game had me wanting to play more just to find out what I was doing the whole game lol.  the soundtrack is absolutely amazing and the story is full of metaphors that you wont understand till the very end and I love that about this game.  The only problem I had with the game really is that its pretty short, first run I beat it in 6 hours although I will go back and play it again to get all the collectables.  The steam awards are currently going on and todays category was best soundtrack,  I wish this game was on the list of nominees so i could vote for it.

scenery 5/5
controls 5/5
story 4.5/5
soundtrack 10000000000000/5

author: {'steamid': '76561197991630874', 'num_games_owned': 1615, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1514846323}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054773976', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1514845283}
review:
RiME is a wonderful adventure, a game I didnt think I would enjoy but after finishing the game, and finally piecing everything togheter it made the whole thing a really great experience.

Just as Hob and other games, RiME does not tell you the story by dialogue or text, but instead it tells you by visual queues or by soundtrack, ultimately revealing the whole story at the end. Its hard to describe without spoiling but I will say this, you wont expect the ending. I enjoy obscure story telling and RiME did a good job at it. 

Visually, RiME looks incredible. You will progress through lots of varied zones, from sunny beatiful islands, to dark caverns. Whats great about the levels is that every single one is tied to the story and once you finish it, you'll understand in what way. Theres also a time of day in the first map which was fantastic. 

Gameplay basically consists of platforming and puzzle solving. All are incredibly easy and straightforward. I would've enjoyed a bit of a challenge though. Still, it never gets dull and it always feels cool. 

Soundtrack, as with everything else in the game is tied to the story as well. The more you progress the soundtrack shifts its tone. The songs are well made and arguably touching. 

Overall, what I was expecting to be just an okay adventure game, turned out to be a really great experience. Highly recommended 8.5/10.
