author: {'steamid': '76561198039726690', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1514781296}
review: This game was beautiful, and, in almost all aspects, nearly perfect. Some things are better left unsaid, and RiME perfectly demonstrates that by telling an engaging story with no dialogue and next to no hand-holding. Huge recommend for this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198431940167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1514786251}
review:
Rime es una experiencia que la verdad no se puede explicar con palabras. Si le tienes un m√≠nimo inter√©s te recomiendo encarecidamente que lo compres. Graficamente es espectacular, tiene un cuidado de detalles que es asombrante, su dise√±o art√≠stico es precioso y la banda sonora es perfecta, acompa√±a muy bien cada situaci√≥n y/o ambiente. La historia me ha dejado impactado ya que en de primera mano puede parecer una cosa muy distinta de la que al final es. Tiene momentos super tiernos y emotivos que te har√° poner los ojos humedos, por as√≠ decirlo.
Mecanicamente hablando, es un juego principalmente de puzles y con un poco de exploraci√≥n si quieres encontrar todos los coleccionables que se esconden por los mapas. Los puzles si que es cierto que no suponen ning√∫n reto, alguno m√°s enrebuscado tardar√°s m√°ximo 10 minutos en resolverlo, pero la verdad es que agradezco que no hayan hecho los puzles complejos ya que considero que se romperia el ritmo del juego y, Rime busca explicarte una historia no hacerte comerte la cabeza para seguir avanzando. Su duraci√≥n me parece la ideal para este formato de juego, ya que no se hace pesado en ning√∫n momento y tampoco te quedas con ganas de m√°s, simplemente, satisfecho y contento por el producto (por lo menos por mi parte).
En resumen: Me parece que es un juego de los imprescindibles que hay que jugar, con una gran historia, graficos, banda sonora y jugablidad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969279963', 'num_games_owned': 2918, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1514765132}
review:
Oh my, this is a truly beautiful game, in every aspect! I really loved it from start to finish! The graphics in the game feels hand made, almost sculpted out of stone and clay rather than modeled with a regular 3D modeling program or something like that. It reminds me a lot of the graphical style that The Witness used, it too felt hand made and sculpted. The music is touching and simply beautiful to the ears, this is a soundtrack I could listen to outside the game as well.

I'm a slow gamer, that likes to explore, so on my first playthrough it took about 5-6 hours to complete, and in total 13,5 hours to 100%.

The game is a good combination of exploration, some platforming and simple puzzle elements, if any of that sounds interesting to you, then you should go ahead and give it a try! Highly recommended!

[h1]My grade: 9/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970287529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1514695559}
review:
Similar in sense to Limbo in that both games have strong starts and then, after a certain beat is resolved, they just meander.

RiME builds a beautiful world with stunning cel-shaded style artwork and a soaring soundtrack, and entices you with early ideas about where things might go. But then, after a memorable area of hide-and-seek (like Limbo's spider), the plot gets lost. Mechanics that are introduced get a little bit of iteration and then are never used again.

You're supposed to be climbing a tower, but then randomly you'll just be in some other area entirely. One part has a groundhog day-esque section, then in another you're really just following some magic robots. The forest area was a confused mess, with no clear goal. Neither does the rainy area have a sense of place - it's just an arena to run around and solve four simplistic platforming puzzles. Where is it? Is it on top of the tower? It looks too big to be there. If these were meant to be inside the tower, it sure didn't feel like it. If these were meant to be around the tower, the tower should have been there in the background as a reminder of where we were and what our main goal is.

The game tries to give a sense of emotional weight to its narrative, but it doesn't spend enough time developing it. The fox for example, you bring it into being at the start and then it just acts as a guide of where to go. You don't really interact with it further, and then it rushes through its beats at the end. The nameless spirits are sometimes scared, then they're dangerous, then they're indifferent. Sometimes the soundtrack perfectly picks up the pace and setting, other times it's curiously absent.

With a better sense of progression of the tower, more interaction with the few characters so that their stories carried more weight, it could be greatly improved. It's an enjoyable experience, maybe a 6.5/10. Worth playing, but certainly a game with many rough edges that loses its direction in the later acts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089775834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1585802610}
review:
I like it. There, I liked a game on my own merit, it's not impossible. It's also not impossible for me to like a game despite being biased against it.

I bought the game after having only seen a few bright, colorful, and cheerful advertisements about this kid solving puzzles and chasing after a spirit fox. I did not sign up for a depressing story about a family death, finding graves and ghosts, and overall the plot/story being representative of the cycle of grief. Especially when one of the achievements hints that the fox might "die" too.

I find myself a simple person. I like amazing graphics, exploration, feeling successful, and solving puzzles or otherwise feeling witty and special. I, having had family deaths in my history, do not like stories where a person or animal you become attached to passes away. I do not like admitting that the cycle of grief exists or that I have problems accepting the past. I especially didn't like the symmetry between my mom passing away and the scene witnessed through the keyhole.

Still, I like this game. It throws trials at you that may require some poking at times, but are simple enough to enjoy the scenery. I love the way you move through the water, considering few games realize how difficult it can be to be partially in the water.There's also the way the grief cycle is represented; it hit the feels. The biggest puzzle is the metaphors presented, not the puzzles themselves. There's the story you read on Wikipedia and then the alternate stories within RiMe. I'd love to talk about it more, but I'm also trying to be vague and let you figure it out yourself.

I recommend looking into it; the puzzles aren't as tough to solve as those presented in The Legend of Zelda, but it's got a way more complex story than rescuing a princess from a tyrant. Besides, it's beautiful; story and graphics-wise. I would put this at ... probably a nine out of ten for recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040888536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1514147390}
review:
Intriguing Game. 5-6/10

If the character could run 2x faster I'm sure I would have finished this game in 4 hours.

The story is quite weak and even if there are plenty of collectibles to find, exploration is just such a chore with a character that is this slow.

The controls are also a tad weird and dont always respond like you'd think based on other games youve already played with the same mechanics.

The ending also came a tad out of nowwhere and felt like a film students first ever script.

For 40$ it really isnt worth it. I'd say for 20$ you can get a few hours of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302281255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1514215529}
review: Je n'ai qu'un mot: MAGIQUE! Les musiques sont sublimes, les graphismes sont originaux, le personnage est attachant et il fait vraiment ressentir ses emotions au joueur. Il chantonne pour dire qu'il va bien ou tremble quand il a peur... L'histoire est reversante et marquante. Un jeu imprevisible et √©mouvant. Son seul defaut est qu'il est tr√©s court. Mais vraiment magnifique.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018894646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1514559722}
review: That was THE most emotional game I have ever played. And likely will ever play in my lifetime. It's so powerful I feel I have to give you a warning going in. Prepare yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999042291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1496, 'last_played': 1544382844}
review:
First, and most importantly imo, RiME features incredible storytelling. The symbolism and foreshadowing that are almost ubiquitous throughout the game have led to countless "oh FUCK that's what that meant" moments for me, which is always a great feeling. 

The soundtrack is probably one of the best I've heard in a very long time, such that I threw literally all of my money at that shit and it'll be the only I listen to while I starve because all my money went into buying hundreds of copies of the soundtrack. Worth it. 

In terms of gameplay and difficulty, RiME is very forgiving, which is great for those who prefer to focus on things like story and exploration instead of aggravating precision platforming. In that same vein, the puzzles are relatively easy -- I was never stumped for more than 10 minutes on any one puzzle -- but they were still fun and satisfying nonetheless.

It also goes without saying that the graphics and art style are stunning; it's very easy to sit at the top of a tower overlooking the ocean for ten minutes because that shit is gorgeous as FUCK.

Finally, if you're one of those people who, like me, enjoy getting your heart ripped out of your FUCKING chest, you need to drop whatever the fuck it is you're doing and play this game now.

10/ fucking 10 would get emotionally ravaged again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046108501', 'num_games_owned': 52, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1623169563}
review:
So I finished this game approximately, uh, fifteen minutes ago, and I'm only just regaining the ability to breathe correctly.

The ending hits fast and hard. The gameplay wasn't particularly deep if you didn't go looking for extras (which I forgot to do throughout half the dang thing) but all of a sudden everything comes together and it's an emotional punch to the gut.

Don't get me wrong, though. I loved every second of this game. The puzzles were interesting but not frustrating, the mechanics were really cool, not to mention the amazing visuals. Those colors! 

It had its glitchy moments, every game does, but it never took away from my experience. 

Loved it. Thanks for an amazing game, y'all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198192026045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1514440833}
review: This game is beautiful, and you will never be fully prepared for the ending even if you suspect it. I have never had a game affect me this deeply; seriously I am a mess as I write this. I've watched other reviewers reactions and you'll either love it or you'll hate it, either way if Tequila Works was aiming for the player to relate and feel a sense of loss they nailed it. I really like how the ending is up to interpretation as to whose, if not both, perspectives you are viewing. Even if you are not the kind of person to view a guide to hunt down collectables I suggest you do so and collect all the toys and visit the white shade all four times...the ending is a little more sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040002911', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1514334300}
review:
A really beautiful game that was a bit mismarketed. Has far less to do with "a land of discovery" and puzzles as its a mostly linear narrative driven game. There's more Dear Esther than Myst in this game's bones. That said, I really enjoyed the story it told and it reminded me a lot of Nocturna in pacing, tone, and use of magic realism. Design wise, this is the best use of affordances I've ever seen. There's no UI or tutorial pop ups, but I never felt lost or confused even during the game's  moments of open exploration. Every action had a clear response from the game and the path forward was never impossible to find. 

My only gripe with the game is that the collectables are often tucked away in a way that detracts from the wonderful story they've developed. I would have rather done without them quite franky and begain to enjoy the game a bit more once I decided to ignore them entirely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242388328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1514172388}
review:
I went into RiME expecting an easy-going game; one that had nice visuals and a few puzzles. That was far from the game that I played. The visuals were gorgeous. The puzzles were numerous, and not overly difficult, but still fun. The story, however... That was what drew me in, and it would not let go.

I started the game at about 10AM. When I finally finished the game 10 hours later, I had tears streaming down my cheeks, and I needed a hug. The story definitely did not go where I was expecting it to go, and it was a ver pleasant surprise. The completionist in me needs to play this over and over until I get all of the collectables, a majority of which are VERY well hidden.

TL;DR: This game is fantastic, and everyone should play it at least once. 10/10, will definitely play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963683045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1510262885}
review:
Wow. What a twist.
If you like puzzles and exploration this game is for you, but be warned that there is not a really happy end (if you got the feels for such things).
The maps and game mechanics are very nice and each section of the game has it's own look and feel which is tied together by the story which finally unfolds at the end.
If you like the exploration kind of gameplay this game is foor you and I found the time I played this game quite ok for the price I payed.
Replayablility is low, once you managed to complete the main story line and collected the achievements, but overall a very nice and well done game. Looking forward from more done by these developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165776895', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1621015250}
review:
The game visuals are absolutely phenomenal as well as the soundtrack. The story is deep and interesting and the puzzles aren't too hard at all, not taking away from the game whatsoever.
The controls could possibly use a little touch up but nothing gamebreaking. FPS drops in some places but it didn't damage how I played the game so all in all the game is amazing.

10/10 In my opinion. It's everything I love in a game like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045567704', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1521267197}
review:
I hate to be one of those users who complains about tech issues in a review before resolving it first, but there's a major issue that interfered with the enjoyment of the game: framerate.

I don't have a particularly good GPU, but even on lowest graphics settings I'm getting ~5-10 FPS in some areas with this game (15-20 in others, depending on "visible" detail) whereas with other games it's been ~20-30FPS.  Apparently this has been a long-standing issue even after the removal of Denuvo, yet nothing appears to have been done about it.

Update: I managed to power through it.  This game's atmosphere was the only thing stringing me along.
At the end, I was... mind blown, to say the least!  RiME is an amazing adventure, but in the end, [i]es tan triste![/i]  Like Life Is Strange, the writers had the courage to embrace sadness.

...and, well, I might as well bring out the pros & cons:

++10/10 Mediterranean atmosphere and gorgeous music that will surely draw you in if nothing else.  It's very much like The Witness, but with the dreaminess of TRI (actually dreamier than that).
+Captivating story √† la Journey, told through adventure and panels
+Good puzzles (nothing hardcore though)
+Surreal (reminded me slightly of NaissanceE, or perhaps Antichamber)
+Quick death respawn

-Controls when platforming feel a bit weird and counterintuitive, as Jim Sterling has mentioned in his review.
-Camera movements in these same areas (and a few others) were likewise wonky.  Sometimes I just wanted to look around.

...and the biggest con of all:
---Graphics and framerate issues, as mentioned above.  In fact, I was [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/493200/discussions/0/1621724915787261571/]almost[/url] about to refund this game!  Because of this, I've decided to stay comitted to my downvote, but that doesn't mean I hate the game as a game (as opposed to a product)!  It's truly an indie-team darling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007487970', 'num_games_owned': 1297, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 399, 'last_played': 1513981238}
review:
I held off on this thinking that it would be a two hour game but It definitely feels fully fleshed out. Few game make me explore like this one, Ico, Journey and Abzu are the only ones I can think of in this style that really make you want to search every nook and cranny. Great art style, great music, great narrative. 

It is a performance hog, GTX780 was barely running 30 so I had to drop down to high.

Man this game was slept on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065427243', 'num_games_owned': 2551, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1513962927}
review:
Im my most recent years I started to prefer experience oriented "games" and this one is my favorite from the last few years. I would recommend for those who enjoyed Journey/Abzu otherwise it risky to pick this game up. It's less polished than Journey but more than Abzu.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Amazing soundtrack, really. Just amazing.
    [*] Amazing colors and scenes.
    [*] Nice overall athmosphere
    [*] Stunning underwater areas, full of life
    [*] Story telling without any spoken word.
    [*] Emotionally immersive
    [*] Easy to pick up if you can't finish in one go.
    [*] Cool achivements.
[/list]


[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Sometimes clunky controls. (Both with XBox controller and keyboard + mouse)
    [*] Kinda short ~ 4 hours
    [*] Somewhat weak story; the ending was unexpected, weird and .
    [*] Crashes & Freezes. Oh god, the last 15 minutes took me like 2 hours to complete. I almost gave up.
    [*] Random lag spikes
[/list]

Note: I would love to complete the game for 100% but due to the absuld number of crashes I won't even bother.

review: Very nice atmosphere. I love the story in it aswell, very original. Some quite simple puzzles but I loved every bit of it. The music in this game is top-notch, already added the OST in my spotify playlist. The only downside of this game is that I only played it for 6 hours. I haven't done any achievements or anything but just for the story it's pretty short imo. To sum it all up; Great game, great music although the playtime is not that long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025419474', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 575, 'last_played': 1556809843}
review:
If you are like me and love those adventure games that blend puzzle with exploration like Zelda, Shadow of Colossus, Ico, Brothers: a tale of two sons and those games that are more "experiences" than a proper game like Abzu or Journey, you will love Rime. Beware: this game has NO attack moves or anything like that, this game is all about discovering and going forward. 

Is amazing how a game can transmit so much without telling you a single word. You will try to understand the story as long as you play and maybe you won't be able to do so, but keep playing to the end. I'm sure it will amaze you.

Is a short game, and that's good, an average of 6-8 hours to complete, and that's it. But the game will stay in your heart for its art, its style and the music...
If you love adventures, play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072983090', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1523732038}
review:
Non so come definire il gioco se un Puzzle Game o un'avventura grafica, ma comunque:
RiME si presenta bene graficamente e anche il gameplay non √® male, ci√≤ che non si presenta bene (purtroppo) √® l'ottimizzazione di questa versione per PC; 
Partendo dal presupposto che con la mia GTX 960 riesco a far girare DOOM a impostazioni Alte (non Ultra) tenedo una temperatura di massimo 73-74 gradi mantenendo anche un massimo di 75 FPS con drop fino a 58, non mi aspettavo che RiME (mettendo tutto alle impostazioni minime) mi avrebbe dato problemi dato i requisiti minimi nemmeno troppo esigenti.

[list]
    [*]Nella prima zona del gioco, un massimo di 44 FPS, questo si √® andato a risolvere man mano che ho proseguito
    [*]Nonostante le impostazioni settate al minimo, la mia GPU dava di matto, 80-81 gradi per tutte e 7 le ore di gioco
    [*]Nei caricamenti, MSi Afterburner mi dava addirittura la bellezza di 281 FPS, per poi scendere miseramente al valore che ho scritto prima (wtf)
[/list]

Insomma, si poteva fare di pi√π per l'ottimizzazione.

Mentre il gioco in s√® non √® niente male, alcuni puzzles sono noiosi, ma non troppo difficili da intuire per proseguire nel gioco. Trama interessante e curata ma poco dettagliata se non recuperate gli oggetti e non guardate nelle serrature nascoste per le aree del gioco (come me che ho pensato qualcosa solo alla fine, ma sembra una trama a libera interpretazione). Ambientazioni fantastiche e colonna sonora magnifica. Consigliato per chi ama questo genere di giochi ma soprattutto per chi vuole provare degli indie un p√≤ diversi dal solito. Magari prendetelo quando ci sar√† qualche sconto perch√® per il lavoro di ottimizzazione pessimo, nessuno lo prenderebbe a prezzo pieno.

[list]
    [*]Grafica = 8/10
    [*]Longevit√† = 7/10
    [*]Ottimizzazione = 4/10
    [*]Voto finale = 6,5
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198039108757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1511586161}
review:
Rime deserves far more credit than it's been given during its rough development history. Quite glad this was re-acquired to become a multi-platform release. I'm disappointed that this sat in my library for such a long time before getting around to it, I think part of the problem was the story seemed ambiguous to me.

[b]It's by design.[/b] After completing this story your perspective on the entire adventure changes. So much thought was put into keeping you in the dark about the reality of what's happening and it's going to slap you in the face when you complete it. Potential spoiler - [spoiler]The only true hint may be the boat in the desert, I feel it represents limbo,[/spoiler] and even if you interpret that you still don't have the whole picture.

Rime is absolutely beautiful to play in both visual and audio design. There's no dialog though you can shout using basic words/sounds. Its world has a dynamic weather and day/night cycle which really brings it to life. Music presentation is outstanding, changing with your actions and the environment to set the tone for the story.

This is listed as a puzzle game, and to some extent it is, but don't jump into this expecting some Myst-style adventure where the puzzles are difficult. The puzzles feel interactive more than anything, they're put in place as obstacles and it's clear the writer doesn't want them to interfere with the story.

Rime absolutely gets my recommendation, hands down what a total surprise this one was. It'll leave you with an ICO meets Journey sort of feel.


Technical bits:
In game v-sync and AA has issues, possibly due to porting, and it causes stuttering. Disable both in game and instead force v-sync and AA through your video card control panel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982996152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1512288207}
review: This is a beautiful, well-polished game that has a great cinematic feel.  The artwork has an original, relaxing aesthetic with no outlines.  Combined with a cinematic soundtrack gives it a very Miyazaki-inspired feel that I enjoyed.  The gameplay is somewhat similar to Tomb Raider--third person perspective climbing, jumping, diving, swimming around large environments and finding your route to objectives.  Puzzles are similar to Tomb Raider--moving objects around to logical positions.  Unlike Tomb Raider there's no shooting or combat, so it has a more relaxed, peaceful theme.   Dying is pretty painless with minimal backtracking, so I seldom felt frustrated.  If you are looking for an adrenaline rush, this probably isn't your game, but if you are looking for a game with a lot of sense of discovery and exploration with some moderate to low difficulty puzzles mixed in, this is a nice experience.  You can't help but feel some emotion at the end of the story.  Short by some standards (check hours played of reviews), but like a good movie, I found it about right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962872327', 'num_games_owned': 2329, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1484, 'last_played': 1512057268}
review:
I want to preface this short review to state that this is one of the best games I have played in the category of atmosphere, soundtrack, and story.

Story: The story is really good. I did not expect it to wrap up in the way it did. At first, it seemed to be all over the place but by the end of the game. You begin to fill the pieces, and the story becomes clear to you. I really enjoyed the story of this game. One of the better ones in recent memory.

Gameplay: Controlling the protagonist is fun. This game is a puzzle platformer, and it does its job decently. You won't be disappointed. I encountered less than a handful of bugs throughout my experience. Most of them did not repeat after the first time, and they did not hinder my experience throughout the game since they only occurred in circumstances.

Graphics: I really really loved the art style of this game. At first, I thought the developers would use the same style throughout the game, but they changed it up multiple times. The game has varied environments, and each one looks just as good as the other. There are plenty of moments where you will look at it, and say wow! That looks awesome! To put it simply, it's gorgeous in many cases.

Sound: I loved the soundtrack of this game even more than its graphics. I'd go as far to say that without the soundtrack, this game would not have impressed me as much as it did. I wish they released a digital download of it (I would buy it asap). It picks up when it needs to, and it slows down when it needs to. It's done so well. It won't disappoint you at all.

I recommend this game for those that are looking for a great puzzle platformer. If you're the type of person that does not enjoy solving puzzles. There is a good chance that you will not enjoy this game because it might get frustrating for you. The puzzles are not difficult, and they are laid out in a pretty logical way in most cases. There are not many games in which I wait for the credits to finish, but this is one of the games in which I did exactly that. It left a strong impression on me, and I wish there were more games like this one. If you are a numbers person, I would give this a 10/10 (It's not the perfect game, but it gets damn close to it for me).

author: {'steamid': '76561198372432559', 'num_games_owned': 2039, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1544544374}

I was shocked to a large extent by its good soundtrack + beautiful scenary + incredible innovation when I was once streaming the video on Youtube concerning RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057387962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1553427036}
review:
RiME is a game where you play as a little boy wandering around in this beautiful world. The story consists of 5 chapters, 5th being very short, making the playtime around 5-6 hours, unless you look for unlockables and want to be a completionist.

Positives:
-Let's start with the important one, story. The story is.... AMAZING. One of the best stories I've played through, even though it was short, I really enjoyed it. At first the story seems a bit weird but slowly it all starts to make sense. The story even got very touching towards the end.
-The camera angles are most of the time in the scenes well done, but this also makes the movement sometimes different, since you move your character with for example W, you move your character forward, no matter where you look. This only happens in "locked" camera angles and otherwise the camera moves with your characters movement.
-The details on the textures and animations are amazing. There are so many cool little details that make the game just a slighty better. One of my favorites is that if you run for a while and run into a wall, your character will fall and get up.
-The sounds and soundtracks fit perfectly into the game and in every scene are just perfect. It really made every part of the game better just by being really fitting to the part of the story.

Negatives:
-It isn't that well optimized. Even with a GTX 1080 with max graphics, I was able to get 50-80 fps in most parts, and on some very detailed areas and such, it dropped down to 40ish. The game was still enjoyable, and I could've set down anti aliasing and such small, but very performance eating settings.
-It's too short. The story is full and amazing, but I want more just because of the soundtracks and graphics.
-The price. I got it for free from a giveaway (thankfully, because I wouldn't pay 35‚Ç¨ for this even after I've played it). But if it goes on sale and you want an amazing game, buy it. it might be worth it depending how much you are ready to spend on a game with only max 10 hours of gameplay, unless you play it all over again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285698978', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1504082625}
review:
Rime is a beautiful little game where you can immerse yourself in a gorgeous captivating world 
and it generally left me in awe with its simplicity of graphics, it's haunting soundtrack and it's interesting characters you meet along the way. Rime takes you on a emotional roller coaster ride with scenes in the game that range from confusion, wonder, joy, anger, sorrow and grief.  
 That being said; this is a game which left me feeling like I wanted more and that it was somehow still missing something. As other reviews have stated they are correct that this game is short and could use more material within it, however I saw no problem with the controls of the game or the operation of it, making Rime an easy win in my book for performance. if you have ever played a little well known game called Ico, you will surly like this game. Replay value is not too high here, completing a collections and adding more achievements does not really add much, the outfits are cool, but Rime's ending really cuts it for me. So should you invest your time in this game? sure!  the first play through would be no problem and generally worth it, but besides selecting stages for a second play through I don't see myself going back and playing the whole game again and that's sad. Rime has a great recipe of all the good ingredients that generally makes a really good game, what it lacks is enough support and enough material to expanded. It is fixable, easily adding some DLC creating more stages and background stories would help round out this game and complete it. All in all (FAIR) 7.5 out of 10
Rime gets my "Cried my eyes out" Award

author: {'steamid': '76561198015438848', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1511723456}
review:
Nichts gro√üartiges erwartet. Und am Ende hat es mich besser unterhalten als so manche AAA Spiele dieses Jahr.  Dabei f√§ngt Rime alles andere als spannend an. Man strandet als kleiner Junge auf einer gro√üe Insel.  Ohne zu wissen wer wir sind und wa spassiert ist erkundent man die Insel die Anfangs noch wirklich sch√∂n aussieht aber mit der Zeit immer....na ich will nicht Spoilern ;) Allgemein hat mich das Spiel ziemlich √ºberrascht. Sei es von den Gameplay her oder den Ausgang des Spiels.  Gro√üartig gelungen ist √ºbrigens der Soundtrack! Mitf√ºhlend und k√∂nnte daf√ºr sorgen das manch anderer ein feutches Auge bekommt.  Grafisch ist das Spiel h√ºbsch gemacht.  

Weniger gelungen ist die PC Umsetzung.  Auf MAx Settings habe ich mit mein I57600K/10606Gb GTX fast eine Diazshow was aufgrund der Kantengl√§ttung geschuldet ist.  Dreht man die runter l√§uft soweit.  Aber auch sonst hat das Spiel leider oft mit mini rucklern zu k√§mpfen ( wie auf der PS4) was leider sehr schade ist weil es doch etwas nerven kann.

Fazit:
Wer ICO von der PS2/PS3 mochte der k√∂nnte auch Rime sehr gut finden. Das Spiel ist nichts f√ºr Spieler die nach Action suchen.  Sondern mehr f√ºr Entdecker die in der kurzen Spielzeit mal in einer komplett anderen Welt abtauchen m√∂chten und von den R√§tseln und der Musik leiten lassen m√∂chten.

review: To this day, one of the best experiences I've had in gaming. While not a small part of my reason for buying the game is reliving some of that Wind Waker nostalgia, I can't say I regret it. review: A heart-wrenchingly beautiful game. It felt like it had a few glitches and frustrating environment issues, but overall, gorgeous and thoughtful with a tragically lovely story. author: {'steamid': '76561197993177875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1503098253}
review:
I had a great time discovering the sights and places of that island. At least when I wasn't trying to keep up with that strange fox, but the cute little creature made me smile on a lot of occasions. I am not a big fan of puzzles, so it was a relief to see they are not that hard, more like an incentive to explore the surroundings a little better. And what amazing ones there are, even when it gets darker at the end.
This game was one of the most relaxing and rewarding gaming experiences in a long time. Simply a piece of art.

review:
Dieses Spiel hat es geschafft mich zu begeistern, zu verwirren und noch mehr zu begeistern. Es gibt kaum andere Spiele wo man im Laufe der Geschichte mit so vielen Vermutungen aufkommem kann was passiert ist und vielleicht selbst am Ende noch irritiert ist. 

Ein Spiel das es schafft, einen traurig und gleichzeitig gl√ºcklich zu stimmen. Vorallem zu erw√§hnrn war hierbei die musik welche immer perfekt zu der Szene passte.  

Ich w√ºrde das Spiel jedem empfehlen der Lust hat auf einige Stunden dramatische Story im einfach gestalten Stil. Und auch nach dem offiziellen Spielende gibt es viele kleine Geheimnisse die ebenfalls wichtig sind um weiter Theorien zu der Storyline zu schreiben.

review: RiME, a very pretty game, but i cant say that i enjoyed the ending. In fact, when i got to the end i was all like, "Ahhhh Man!" And if the game would have cost 5 cents more, i would have been like: 'AHHHH MAN!!!' But since it was the price that it was, i was all like "Ahhhh Man!" Witch is'nt good for me. But if your like an "Ahhh Man!" kinda gamer, then you probably wouldn't mind the ending. Although you may not enjoy the price. But These kind of preferences are purely subjective, (Market prices being what they are) and are not quantifiable in any standard know to me short of clairvoyance. Clairvoyance, I wonder if Clare is short for Clairvoyance. I'll have to ask my friend "Clare". But first I'll have to find a friend named Clare. Tomorrow, I'll advertize in the paper. Any-who... RIME is fun untill your dime runes out then it leaves you hanging. Their is a big bird in the game, which is cool, and some very nice shadow puzzles. But its not enough to keep the game going. So thumbs down and scrunchey toes for this one. Its not a bad game, I just didn't like it. Save your money for a steem sale.

review: A combat-free exploration and puzzle game that sees you, as a shipwrecked young boy, wandering round an island and the caverns below it solving environmental puzzles and piecing together the story of what happened there. There are shades of Tomb Raider in the mild platforming and the environmental puzzles, plus massive globs of ICO/Shadow of the Colossus in terms of the atmosphere and subtle audio work. In fact, despite it's beautiful cel-shaded aesthetic even visually it's got a lot in common with ICO/SotC in terms of the landscapes and overall design. In terms of gameplay it starts off very strong and I was utterly entranced by it. That never faded entirely, but the later sections in subterranean tunnels lost some of the charm without the sunny topside setting to marvel at and certainly the game seemed to drag a bit as it went on. Still brilliant and still highly recommended but maybe a bit less than the sum of it's parts by the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990276284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1503001627}
review:
Rime, an aesthetically superb exploration/puzzle game. It features varying environments which are all beautifully crafted. The game doesn't feature any combat, so when you do meet an enemy, you defeat it by outmaneuvering it. The puzzles are entertaining. When I didn't pay attention, some puzzles were challanging, but most weren't. The approach to narrative is: show don't tell. In my opinion, it works, but not necessarily as well as other parts of the game. I fell in love with the vibrant colors and carefree atmosphere in the beginning of the game, but like with all good things, they don't necessarily last.

Overall, I had a good experience with this game. My biggest complaint is that I felt like some story telling came at the cost of gameplay. It doesn't happen until the very end, so I can easily overlook it, because  the overal experience was very satisfying.

Do check this game out. It's well worth your time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024472516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1563231313}
review: I initally bought this game and returned it because my computer couldnt run it at 60 frames. From the little time I played it before returning it, I got hooked. After a few days of mullin over wanting to play it again, I rebought it and played without 60 frames. It was worth it. The visuals and non-verbal storytelling was astounding. I loved Journey on PlayStation and this was a close second to that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041972985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1511469809}
review:
Visually stunning, and the music is awesome.
It's a very nice experience of exploration and discovery.

However, don't expect too much from the gameplay : even if the environment changes a lot and a few things are introduced, the gameplay will still revolve around jumping and climbing over specific areas. You're too much directed to where you can or cannot go, and I feel it hurts an exploration-based game. Basically, there is the main path, and secondary paths where you get collectibles. However, straying from the main path will often be rewarded, especially if you go for the 100%.
One other bad design choice is that camera orientation defines the direction where you'll be moving forward. So if you want to look around to enjoy the stunning environment, you'll have a hard time keeping moving straight at the same time. This flaw is especially bad in the few bridge cutscenes when you don't control the camera angle and have to walk straight on a bridge despite the camera being oriented sideways. The visual effect is good, but the gameplay requires you to sidestep in order to advance forward on the bridge (or fall and die)

All in all, it feels like playing a beautiful movie : follow the script, and enjoy the show. Damn worth it.
So, is it worth the price ? Well maybe not completely, it's pretty expensive, and these flaws prevent you from fully enjoying the experience. I think you better get it on sales.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991614736', 'num_games_owned': 1235, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1511764139}
review:
RiMe is an incredibly beautiful game that managed to just suck me in. Even though there isn't any dialog, it has a fun and engaging story. In that way, it reminds me of ABZU.

The game has puzzles, but they are always easy enough that I never got frustrated and was able to keep a good pace. 

My one criticism about the game would be with a certain segment of the story that just frustrated the heck out of me. I can't really say without spoilers. Otherwise, the game is quite good.

review:
What a breath of fresh air this game is. Looks fantastic, plays very nicely. No really annoying puzzles, some good challenges. An intriguing story set in a dream-like series of discrete eposides. Very compelling and now I have finished it I need to play it again to uncover the things I missed the first time round. I know it will be a joy to play again and a challenge to try and find all the nooks and crannies where the secrets and clues reside.
Excellent game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014914403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1496346427}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198027141250', 'num_games_owned': 1729, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1511255434}
review:
Like many others, I got this game for free from the nvidia giveaway. I've had it on my wishlist for awhile, and was pleasantly surprised to get the free game key.

I want to like this game, but ultimately it's not really the game advertised on this page. Contrary to what the description would have you believe, this is not an exploration game, but rather a highly linear adventure with a few small side areas with collectibles. Which is really a shame, since the strongest part of the game is the world. I've always enjoyed the ancient sci-fi theme, and I wish I could actually really explore a world based around it instead of being railroaded through it.

The graphic aesthetics are great. The world, especially the first few areas, are beautiful and beg to be explored. Music is just okay, it's very much mood music and gets repetitive pretty quickly. 

The puzzles are fairly simplistic, and the only reason they can be difficult at times is because the game can be very vague and even directionless at times and you won't see the ledge you're supposed to climb (or realize that you can interact with the critical object you need to move forwards) until you've run around for quite awhile. The game literally throws you into the world with no inkling of what you're supposed to do or what the controls are or how they work. I get that many AAA games handhold the player too much and the devs want to encourage exploration (as limited as it is), but mant times it felt like this was taken a little too far.

On top of that, the controls are quite clunky and unresponsive at times, and only being able to save at checkpoints is something that should stay in the past and not be dragged into the present. At times, the camera can be a nuisance as well with the forced perspective changes.

I've also run into a few bugs with puzzles that let you get into previous areas, but then can't get back to where you're supposed to be so you have to reload the checkpoint. Checkpoints are a little too far apart for being the only place to save, resulting in having to replay good sized chunks of the game if you have to quit in the middle or run into a bug.

I also had some issues with optimization, this game is very heavy on the CPU for no good reason that I can see given the simplistic gameplay. Might be a result of this being a console port with the PC version taking a back seat.

Then there's the story. I'll try not to spoil it, but the ending is depressing, and I think this would have been a better game is the devs had kept it as ancient sci-fi with a fantasy story instead of having the depressing link to reality it is now.

There's also the issue of length. I have no problem with short games, but I do have a problem when they're priced like much larger ones and don't have much in the way of replay value. As you can see from my playtime, it takes about 3 hours to finish the game. I didn't hunt for collectibles, if you wanted to go back and get those it would add a few more hours, but you're still not really getting a great value at the asking price. Especially since I didn't really find the story rewarding.

Overall, not bad at all for a free game, or even for a modest price, but I'm glad I didn't impulse buy it earlier when it was on sale. I'm giving it a thumbs down because overall, the only really good thing the game has is the aesthetics and the world, yet you're not really given a chance to explore it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045061508', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1624683588}
review: It can be fun playing this game, walking around, solving puzzles. But it can also get boring quickly. Some of the puzzles are the same, just solved differently by moving objects. There are a lot of collectables too, however, I'm not sure that they do anything other than add more gameplay time. I recieved this game for free from the Nvidia giveaway. The game is worth maybe $10 in my opinion. I reccomend the game if you enjoy solving puzzles and walking around, but only if purchased during a sale. Not sure why the $29.99 pricing point was chosen and I feel as if they are asking for too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061316382', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1553438850}
review:
This is a 7 hour beautiful game, an impressively composed soundtrack (I think it's procedural)  and with a memorable ending. It's definitely  worth buying even though I got frustrated a couple of times and the puzzles were  easy.

Pros:
-As beautiful as Journey or I'd say even more.
-Incredible Soundtrack like you have never heard in a game.
-Ending that gives you goosebumps. You might even cry a bit.

Neutral:
-It feels like a bit open world but I didn't have the feeling that it encourages you to go off the beaten path.
-Sometimes you have to cross long distances just because. But it wasn't a real problem since the game is gorgeous.
-Puzzles are easy and the mechanics felt like a mixture of other things that we've seen before.

Cons:
-It felt a bit frustrating sometimes. e.g. [spoiler] When hiding from the massive crow, shadows aren't clear and sometimes you aren't safe under a shadow and sometimes you are safe under the sunshine. Sometimes it's not very clear that you can interact with something, e.g. because it isn't in front of the camera  but the character is in front of it or because the button is not displayed. [/spoiler]
-There are lots of rocks and obstacles that are small enough to be climbed but you can't.
-No SLI support (At least out of the box). I run a GTX980x2 and the performance wasn't bad but not particularly good either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001254214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1510759123}
review:
RiME is an extraordinary little game full of charm. There is not a word of dialogue (that is comprehensible), yet it knows to tell a story and guide you along through a beautifully designed world. What struck me the most is that you could feel the passion of the developers, there is a lot of raw emotion injected into the game which reveals itself slowly but surely and leads to a satisfying conclusion. The game itself is not difficult, it has fairly straightforward puzzles but the pacing is great. It's relatively slow, but it suits the vibe of the game and it builds the intrigue more and more as you go on. 

The game starts out in a world that's seemingly open and ready for exploration, which it is to an extent, but it's mostly secrets and collectibles that hide in the corners of the world. The game itself is linear and that's okay. The world is interesting enough that the exploration feels satisfying just to make your way through the beautifully crafted design. I definitely felt drawn to investigate the nooks and crannies and interact with all the objects that allowed it.

The main character is part of what makes the game awesome. The entire game revolves around this boy that finds itself in this mysterious place, guided by a little fox while the full story gets revealed through flashbacks and symbolism throughout the course of the game. His design is absolutely adorable, with a bright red cape and an innocent appearance. There is a dedicated 'yell' button (which activates certain objects in the game) which is the best. I love yelling at stuff. I love how flames flair up as he screams and I basically couldn't stop screaming (or humming depending on the situation). His animations are also just lovely. He feels genuine and lovable in a world that caters to his mystery.

All in all a very recommended game. It takes obvious inspiration from Team Ico games, especially Ico. If you enjoy those types of games then this is right up your alley. At times there are some janky moments with the camera or controls, but honestly it's not to the point of frustration. I just frigging loved playing RiME.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976114663', 'num_games_owned': 1997, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1510564156}
review:
Its a good game. Its got a beautiful world. Lots of simple exploration. And cute experiences.

But, its completely linear. None of the puzzles have any difficulty to them. You'll never be wondering where to go next, or how to solve a puzzle. So its effectively a walking simulator.

So its a good game to play when your stressed out, and want to play something pretty, easy, that you know you'll succeed at.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971197452', 'num_games_owned': 133, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1582389109}
review:
En fait Rime n'est pas un jeu vid√©o dans le sens ou nous ne pouvons en aucun cas int√©ragir de fa√ßon √† ce que nos actes aies des cons√©quences. Rime est tellement lin√©aire qu'il n'essaye m√™me de donner l'illusion de ne pas l'√™tre. C'est un comte qu'on regarde en gardant la touche Z appuy√©e et en cliquant de temps √† autre. Ce qui fait que le challenge est absolument inexistant.

Malheuresement aucun des personnages ne parle et ces derniers n'√©voluent que tr√®s peu voir pas du tout durant l'histoire. Rime √©tait un paris assez dangereux de jeu po√©tique et abstrait qui pour moi est rat√©. Il manque de sensibilit√© et de profondeur philosophique.

Les graphismes me rappellait ceux de "The witness" (qui est pour moi un chef d'oeuvre), c'est ce qui m'a attir√© chez Rime. Ils sont beaux et riches en couleurs malgr√© qulques paresses au niveau de certains effets visuels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027616114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1510529775}
review:
*Possible Spoilers Below*

......

After reading relatively mixed reviews, I balked at the price, as I usually try not to pay this much for a game nowawadays. In the end, being a sucker for art styles of this kind, I bought Rime expecting a gorgeous puzzle game with a relatively balanced difficulty and clear nods to ICO, an old PS2 favorite from my college days. What I got was an unexpectedly emotional journey, told mostly through level design alone, about loss. Having recently had a family member pass away, I can only say that this game cut deep, and while the conclusion hurt like hell, it feels oddly providential to have played it this close to my family member's stepping beyond the Veil. Granted, I also did not see this story coming and only in hindsight does the way this game is built, make sense. 

Good old hindsight. Life is always a little clearer looking back. Rime is no different. I've played a few games similar to this one. Again it reminded me of ICO and Shadow of the Collosus and Journey and a few other expected note strikers lots of critics have hit in their reviews. With this game though, the epic setting and mythical atmosphere, really touch on a sense of loss and the process of grief that frankly, hit much closer to home for me than any of the previous titles, because it isn't a prince trying to save a princess by killing Gods, or a boy leading a blind girl out of a fortress. This is about a broken family, and the peices that must be picked up after that breaking occurs. You may be guiding this boy through a quest, but you're also piecing something together, that was broken, all so that you can let it go. 

Being a puzzle platformer that is more about the amtosphere of the journey than the puzzles themselves, this kind of game is not for everyone and for others, it may be best to wait till it's on sale. For me, this was a kind of catharsis, that I guess fate decided I needed to experience at this point in my life and given the love the devs put into it, as well as the thank you's they write in the end credits, well, that kind of heart ended up being worth $30.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100944531', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1509594103}
review:
When RiME was first announced it went way under my radar. However when I won a giveaway for this game I decided to give it a try, and boy was I happy I did. I personally love these types of games, and RiME definitely filled a hole in me that I didn't even know I had. RiME is not for everyone, but for the niche audience it is for, you are in for one ride, and it is one hell of a ride.
[i]Note: the game does suffer from some minor optimization issues, but is more than playable[/i] 
[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1] 
RiME's artstyle and visuals are the best I have every seen. Every frame is awe-inspiring, with crisp textures and an amazing artstyle that is reminiscent of Abzu or The Witness. I found myself stopping and admiring the environment every minute or so, it's that good. Animations look amazing and feel extremely smooth. RiME also focuses on letting the player take a high ground and observe the entire area that they just explored and that only adds to how beautiful this game already is. 
SCORE 10/10 
[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1] 
RiME is a game mostly about exploration and puzzle solving. Puzzles are fairly easy and don't require too much thought to be put into them, but they are enjoyable and have some great concepts behind them. Puzzles feel like they are built into the environment, which makes them feel natural. Exploration is enjoyable, mostly due to the fact on how amazing the graphics are. However, most of the game is a walking simulator which might be a problem for some people, but not for others. RiME is also a fairly short game, only being 5-6 hours long, which wasn't that big of a problem for me since it's obvious to see how much the developers tried to put in into those 5-6 hours.  
SCORE 8/10 
[h1]AUDIO[/h1] 
The musical score in RiME is fantastic. The music is incredibly relaxing and matches the tone of the game perfectly. I'm not a big fan of classical music, but RiME's soundtrack obviously has so many emotions thrown into it that it's hard not to appreciate it. I'm not really a music guy so there's not much else I can say other than the music really is amazing. 
SCORE 9/10 
[h1]STORY[/h1] 
After playing through the game and reflecting on the story I am truly amazed. There is no real lore about what is going on around you, but the characters and the deeper meaning behind the story are extremely well made. There is no dialogue, just the environment and a few cutscenes. That only makes the story more interesting and makes you want to find out about the world around you. The only gripe that I have with the story is that it is way too cryptic. It's ok to have your story just be the environment and few cutscenes and to make you think about the story, but there is a real lack of explanation for a lot of things, at least a point in the right direction would go a long way to helping everyone understand the story. 
SCORE 8/10
[h1]SUMMARY[/h1] 
RiME is one of the most beautiful exploration game that I have ever played, with great music and an interesting story. However, the story is a bit cryptic and it's a bit short. Apart from that though, I would say RiME is one of the coolest games I've played in 2017.
[i]OVERALL SCORE 8.75 [u]GREAT[/u]
+Amazing artstyle 
+Great music 
+Nice exploration 
+Great story 
~Game is a bit short
~The game is mostly a walking simulator 
-Story is unnecessarily cryptic 
[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197979867148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1509928033}
review:
What the others said, overprized for 5-6 hours, at $15 ($10 on sale) I might have recommended it. More "walking through giant rooms" - which is a beautifull experience! - but a lot of running around and searching for clues than actual puzzle. Well, maybe for children aged 10-12 because it's so easy, but then, the end is not really for children... Maybe for casual gamers who just need some time out in a lovely environment.

I feel like the psychology lesson is a bit too much in your face, like Whispered World (hated the end). Papo & Yo was more fun (the end felt okay), and it gets nowhere near the sadness and beauty of "To the Moon".

author: {'steamid': '76561198084266823', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1497963752}
review:
Misterio, belleza, amistad y encanto serian los primeros adjetivos que le pondria a este juego de Tequila Works, el recorido se hizo largo tras su primera presentacion en la Gamescom de Sony, paso por altos y bajos incluso con el riesgo de no salir nunca, suerte la nuestra la historia acaba bien y al fin pudimos difrutar del juego. Siempre soy partidario de apoyar todo lo que sea local, de proximidad y siendo el estudio espa√±ol sent√≠ la necesidad de apoyarlo econicamente y probarlo. Todo lo que voy a comentar esta basado en mi opinion personal con echos del juego que a mi parecer son objetivos. 

Positivo
Lo primiero e indiscutible es su apartado artistico el cual podriamos describir como colorido, bello e misterioso. Lugares externos que recuerdan al mediterraneo y lugares internos de civilizaciones perdidas. 

Esta pintura en movimiento no podia ser acompa√±ada con tal epica banda sonora que en mas de una ocasion te remueve por dento, sublime de lo mejor del juego y me atrevo a decir a la altura de otros juegos similares. 

Estos dos puntos anteriores para mi son lo indiscutuble del juego a partir de aqui son cosas que para muchos seran diferentes:

La historia es buena, no esperes nada epico ni tampoco algo nulo, la histria se cuenta a traves del mundo , su banda sonora y las pocas cinematicas que se encuentran. Durante la aventura puedes incluso deducir una historia que al final resulta ser otra, en muchos tramos te emociona. 

A resumidas cuentas si te gustan los juegos tipo Journey o Abzu no lo dudes compralo. Con un pero...

El juego se basa en los puzles y si esperas algun reto de ello este no es tu juego ya que personalmente la mayoria de ellos son relativamente f√°ciles, bajo mi punto de vista no es algo malo ya que creo que el tipo de historia no le encaja unos puzles demasiado complicados pero debes tener eso en cuenta

Tecnologicamente hablando tube algunos problemas de frame rate y creo que podria estar mas bien optimizado.

Personalmente el juego me ha llegado, me ha emocionado y asombrado a partes iguales, si buscas una experiencia unica no debes perdertelo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007740462', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1509631612}
review:
The game is very pretty and athmospheric, but is lacking in many ways:

- Very short for the pricetag, ~5h of playtime. Can spend some more time finding unlockables and bonus objectives, but those are not very rewarding or tell any additional story.
- Pathing and puzzles are too obvious and leave no room for problem solving - everything that is interactable is clearly marked out for you already
- Game forcibly changes camera angle when climbing, sometimes in a very inconvenient way for mouse&keyboard

Overall, it is not awful, but wouldn't recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198290897430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1629351258}
review:
I totally and absolutely loved this game. Specially the ending was quite touching.

The artistic landscapes are just eye candy and the mechanics good.

This is not your average fast paced game, you should relax and enjoy the ride.

I strongly encourage the developers to release something new with this view in mind.

10 out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198137327141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1559577027}
review: wow ! serieux une super belle experience et une fin inoubliable ! jai rarement eu des jeux qui mon donner beaucoup demotion fort mais avec ce jeux jai eu une fin que je noublirais jamais ! Je le recommend a tout ceux qui veulent des puzzle , des enigme et une tres bonne histoire . Wow..... juste la fin fais de RIME un jeux apare des autre.... Avec des decores magnifiques et des pesonnages inoubliable RIME est devenue pour moi un jeux culte et incontournable . Perso je lui donne 9.8 sur 10 ! Ne manque pas loccasion di jouer ! En tout cas merci au studio de nous avoir partager un si formidable jeux vraiment merci !

author: {'steamid': '76561198207837927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1507771102}
review:
going into RiME, i expected to love it. everything hinted at something that i would enjoy - a mysterious island, a cryptic story to uncover, and a challenging or at least perplexing puzzle game.

unfortunately, the game failed to deliver on all of those parts.

i had major issues with this game, but i'm still recommending it for a couple reasons. one, the final sequence of the game's story almost made the game worth my money - without any spoilers, it was emotional, heartwrenching, and wondrous. it was the perfection that i had anticipated from the game beforehand. and two - even with these major flaws, i still ended up enjoying RiME and what it had to offer, an beautiful artwork and art style that it presented so wonderfully.

one of the main problems i had with RiME was the lack of what it promised to offer. story clips were only found at around 5 points within the 8-hour game and never lasted more than a minute or so, and were often disappointing and had so little emotional impact. most seemed like they were sped up and went by so fast that the watcher had little time to wonder and realize what was going on. even the final sequences, which i loved, were so short and felt like they could definitely be much longer and magnify that impression of emotions on the player.

but that's not to mention that the story didn't have its good parts either. i enjoyed the plot and how the events of the story were implied and ultimately left to the player to figure out. the final sequences almost had me in tears, and it was nice to see a story that was definitive but also left some details up to the player to decide on what had happened.

another problem i had were the puzzles. for a puzzle-game that even developed its own interesting mechanics and puzzle devices, the puzzles themselves never really developed beyond go-get-that-block or pull-this. they clearly were thought to be second-hand to the story, which was disappointing because the story didn‚Äôt really live up to its expectations. increasing the puzzle difficulty a little more i feel would interest the players a little more, and especially make the game more interesting in its slower areas.

then there are the collectibles. these are interesting and fun to find in your first playthrough, but the sheer amount of them (about 30-50 i would hazard) made me annoyed as i went through the 8-hour game again to find them, and my reward was often nothing more than a worthless sentence in the final moments, a brief song clip, a playable costume, or even simply an image on the menu screen. there needed to be a better reward system in place besides some simple achievement that made these worthwhile to the player.

a final problem i had were some faulty mechanics and frame rate issues. the art and shadow quality is automatically set to high, which stifled the frame rate even with a fairly good computer (i'm no expert on computer specs). i had to lower both to medium quality which was ultimately weird as when playing i didn't seem to find any major difference between the medium and high quality. and with the mechanics, there were about three major problems, and all of them had to do with ledges. RiME, for some reason, has a "boundary" on edges of cliffs and such where the character wobbles around like he's about to fall off a cliff whenever he's on a ledge, which was helpful in some cases where i would rather not fall off, and not helpful in others where i was purposefully trying to jump down. and the fact that the player controls the camera on some ledges made the controls very weird depending on the camera angle ‚Äì almost like the forward button meant left or vice versa, and somehow when the camera control was fixed it was also annoying, as i either couldn't see where i was supposed to go or i missed that lack of freedom with the camera. and that's not even mentioning the problems i had RiME's death animation. pretty much the only way to die is to get your soul sucked out by vicious passive-aggressive dementors or to jump off a cliff. the soul-sucking is fine, i guess. but when you jump off a cliff, within a millisecond the game realizes that you're gonna die and the screen goes black and you respawn. there's nothing interesting about the animation. for example, what if, when you fell off a cliff, you could watch the boy fall right until he was about to hit the ground and then the black screen? this gives the player more emotional connection with the character and a better reason to not try and jump off cliffs.

but that's not to say i didn't love RiME. again, without any spoilers, i loved the final moments of the game, and i really enjoyed the atmosphere, artwork, and even the story at times. i'm not so certain that it's worth its full price of $30, (maybe at $20 or $15 is a better price) but i enjoyed my time with RiME overall, and i'm certain that if you're into these types of games that you will, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032892475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1508600202}
review:
This is one of those games you absolutely don't play for its mechanics and general gameplay. This game is an interesting experience that you will enjoy for its visuals and amazing Soundtrack, as well as its story. I finished it in five hours without collecting anything and then went back and replayed the levels to find the collectibles. You can see how much time I have put just into finding them and re-interpreting the story (which is kind of simbolic).

Overall I loved it and would recommend if you're into this sort of game. Bit expensive though, would wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193211899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1503971432}
review:
Tengo sentimientos encontrados con este juego . 
-partir√© por lo malo . es corto . algunas veces el juego se volvia realmente lento con tanta geometria y lo mas extra√±o era que el menu ponia lento todo el juego .
- ahora lo medio (ni bueno ni malo) no tienes una barra de hp por lo que "no puedes morir" pero hay enemigos que te chupan el alma y eso cuenta como morir o si caes a un abismo vuelves . especialmente para gente que quiere relajarse y no andar sufriendo por que el personaje se esta por morir. 
-ahora lo bueno . es triste y melancolico pero rompe el esquema de hacer escenarios tristes y melancolicos , transmiten otra cosa ...esperanza ,su dise√±o de niveles es bastante bueno .los colores bien cuidados y con cierto gui√±os a wind waker (sobre todo esa torre sospechozamente parecida a la torre de los dioses del juego antes mencionado y si bien los niveles son pasilleros te dejan la libertad de ir a buscar otras cosas conforme avanzas. la musica es hermosa .la historia se cuenta sin palabras asi que conforme lo vez puedes hacerte una idea de que esta pasando .
-comprenlo solo si esta en oferta eso si

author: {'steamid': '76561198067073758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1631476071}
review:
The Pros and Cons are listed under the video review link!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nErrNv30EVs

Pros:

+Gorgeous Graphics
+Amazing Music
+Good size world
+similar to Journey and ICO in some respects.
+6 hours of content (add 2-3 MORE hours if your going for 100%)
+the game actually makes for a more interesting second playthrough.

Cons

-Gameplay while changes throughout the game, is not deep enough, did get a little tired of the game by the end.
-lack of character upgrades like faster running hurts this game slightly, considering all the exporing you'll be doing if you plan to go for a 100%


Conclusion: 

all in all, i would say the game is worth its asking price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971537739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1508666874}
review:
RiME is a beautifully crafted atmospheric exploration game.  However, don‚Äôt let the product‚Äôs screenshots and trailer cinematic fool you‚Ä¶ because when you finish it, the narrative will leave you heartbroken, and very possibly a bad aftertaste; YMMV.

Also, there seems to be some serious optimization issues with the game‚Äôs highest graphics settings that causes severe framerate drops.  I played on 2nd highest setting due to that, since the minor drop of sharpness didn‚Äôt bother me.

Despite all that, I still recommend this game, especially if it‚Äôs on a discount.  Maybe because it being wordless, atmospheric, touring of dreamy and exotic landscape really being my cup of tea.  When you are prepared for the revealed truth of this gorgeous journey being less of a happy ending, sail onto RiME, and let your emotion be the current, from a veiled denial to the final acceptance.

review:

√à davvero un gioco stupendo: il comparto audio/visivo √® qualcosa di sublime, la storia si capisce a poco a poco ma il finale √® qualcosa di davvero commovente‚Ä¶
Il gioco in s√© √® abbastanza lineare: vai avanti, risolvi l‚Äôenigma, esplora un poco la zona e ripeti, ma a me la cosa non √® dispiaciuta per niente, anzi, alla fine ti trascina in maniera molto piacevole nell‚Äôatmosfera.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079602187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1508188485}
review:
Une belle fable po√©tique, mais nous laissant radicalement sur notre faim.

Si Rime est s√©duisant par ses tr√®s beaux graphismes et son level design attrayant qui tend vers le myst√©rieux et invite √† la d√©couverte, ses puzzle-games minimalistes, ses probl√®mes de cam√©ra qui peuvent √™tre tr√®s aga√ßants et sa trop faible dur√©e de vie coupent net dans le joli paysage. 
C'est un jeu qu'on prend grand plaisir √† parcourir, mais ne vous attendez pas √† un chef d'oeuvre. Rime n'est pas un must du genre. 

L'intrigue aurait gagn√©e √† √™tre d√©velopp√©e, la fin du jeu donne l'impression d'avoir √©t√© lamentablement b√¢cl√©e, on a l'impression de nous avoir coup√© l'herbe sous le pied.  

Dommage car il avait pourtant de bons √©l√©ments pour √™tre un bon jeu, comme ses environements tr√®s r√©ussis. 

Rime n'est malheureusement pas √† la hauteur de ses ambitions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083454801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1508187589}
review:
Rime es una obra maestra.  Visualmente, es precioso. Su banda sonora es espectacular. Su jugabilidad y animaciones, lejos de ser perfectos, son el medio perfecto para contar la historia.

Pero sin duda alguna, y como padre que soy, lo mas importante del juego es lo que transmite. El camino que se recorre y el mensaje que se traslada al jugador, es sin duda lo que hace de este juego tan especial.

Gracias Tequila, por habernos ofrecido esta joya, y sobre todo, porque me habeis ayudado a recordar las cosas importantes de la vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005634226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1507817851}
review:
Un grand jeu.

Loin d'un simple walking simulator, ce jeu se pr√©sente comme un jeu d'exploration dans de grands niveaux recellant nombre de choses cach√©es. L'univers est d√©pict√© en utilisant un style graphique absolument ph√©nom√©nal et la narration est amen√©e assez subtilement, il est ainsi possible de d√©duire le sens des diff√©rents niveaux en payant attention. L'histoire est d'ailleurs port√© par des personnages muets auxquels on se surprend √† r√©ellement s'attacher.

Le gameplay accuse quelques √©cueils d√ªs au genre: certaines plateformes qui devraient √™tre accessible ne le sont pas et certains angles de cam√©ras sont probl√©matiques, mais rien de fonci√®rement rat√© en soit, le gameplay reste solide pour ce qu'il a √† offrir.

Bref, je vous incite fortement √† vous le procurer pour vous rendre compte par vous-m√™me et pour entendre l'histoire qui vous est cont√©e dans ce titre.
