author: {'steamid': '76561198046311355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1694040028}
review:
I'm at a loss why Steam responds to certain games with absolutely overwhelming support, and then lets other games like Fossil Echo or Papo and Yo just sit there. Seems like the arthouse crowd is sometimes too lazy to buy anything on this platform, and some people have absurd expectations with budget titles, which is a shame because games like this deserve better sales. 

Rime is an amazing experience. It's as simple as that. I played this on PS4, and all I can say is the graphics are even better here, and the FPS is a solid 60 on my 1070/2600K setup with 1080p. Anything more and you might run into some troubles without better hardware.

It's totally acceptable that this game wears its inspiration on its sleeves, and yet who cares when it all comes together this well? Miyazaki films, Joaqu√≠n Sorolla paintings, and the games Journey and Ico come to mind. This world is so profoundly lovely and attractive that I can basically overlook almost any flaws with the game.

The gameplay experience is actually soothing and fun to me, and I enjoy a very wide variety of games and difficulties across genres. No, you aren't going to be challenged like some SMB platformer or a PUBG gun game. It's not meant to be that way. It wouldn't even work that way. This is a relaxing puzzle game that swings toward the easier side, but it makes up for it with a decent amount of collectibles, and the game never overstays its welcome.

The graphics and world here are like some amalgamation of a Miyazaki film, Wind Waker, and ABZU/Ico. Honestly, I wasn't sure I was going to be impressed by their world, as there is limited interaction, but it is actually a breathtaking accomplishment. I am injecting SMAA at 1080p and the image quality is fantastic. While not overly detailed the bloomy resonance of the island recalls games like Ico and Shadow of the Colossus in tone to the point you really got to congratulate the team of 18 people in Spain that made this over the years. It was a struggle, but what a diamond that struggle birthed. There is just something wonderful about running around a deserted place that has no equivalency in the modern world.

I cannot help but love this thing. It's too charming to hate, too pretty to leave behind, and overall the experience is something that the whole family can enjoy. You would think there would be a bigger audience for such an indie, but with time more and more people will find this gem as it releases on all the platforms.

Anyone looking for a beautiful world spanning day and night that wants to solve a few puzzles and gaze at some gorgeous visuals is in for a treat here. Some of the collectibles are hidden fairly well and will take some logical thinking to collect. It's all very peaceful and heartwarming. Highly recommended.

review:
Sei Enu, bimbo di 8 anni spiaggiato su un'isola fertile ma priva di altra presenza umana. Tuttavia non sei un naufrago alla "Robinson Crusoe": questo non √® un gioco di sopravvivenza in senso stretto, ma in senso lato. Infatti dovrai sopravvivere agli enigmi insidiosi e alle altre presenze che allignano l'isola, mentre scoprirai, tramite frammenti e flashback, chi tu sia e cosa tu faccia qui.

Puzzle abbastanza semplici, grafica cartoonesca e colonna sonora dolce non traggano in inganno: l'apparenza cela una realt√† profonda come l'oceano. 
Non sar√† molto longevo, ma la presenza di numerosi collezionabili vi porter√† ad assaporarlo pi√π di una volta.

review:
Rime conta a hist√≥ria de um garoto ao sofrer um acidente com sua embarca√ß√£o em meio a uma tempestade. O game faz isso atrav√©s de uma jogabilidade puramente intuitiva e sem qualquer di√°logo ou orienta√ß√£o. A hist√≥ria √© bastante profunda nos conceitos sobre a nega√ß√£o, a raiva, a negocia√ß√£o, a depress√£o e a aceita√ß√£o.

Os puzzles s√£o simples mas ao mesmo tempo conseguem cativar o jogador a continuar o seu caminho na busca da verdade.

Os gr√°ficos s√£o cartunescos de uma arte bel√≠ssima. A sonoridade √© relaxante e reflexiva.

Para quem gosta de uma hist√≥ria imersiva, uma jogabilidade simples mas prazerosa, Rime √© o jogo da vez.

Lo siento, porque es un producto patrio, pero no he conectado con la narrativa (o ausencia de ella). La impresi√≥n final que he tenido es la de alguien intentando imitar a Fumito Ueda sin tener muy claro qu√© hace que sus juegos dejen huella m√°s all√° de lo obvio.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970653174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1507057198}
review:
This... is a seriously good experience.

On the superficial end of things, it has excellent music and level design.  It's not tough, but it doesn't need to be.

On the harder-to-implement end of things, such as character development and storytelling, is where it _truly_ shines.

Don't go into this expecting "Teh Bestest Game in All The Univerrrrse!" - nothing can live up to that.

Instead, expect to be wandering around, confused, for the 1st level, and then the game will slowly come together in your mind.

Oh, and one tip: Aiming your cursor in the air and holding 'E' will throw whatever you're carrying a little ways - okay, the one puzzle that relied on that just sucked because the game doesn't tutor you on the mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066959401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1506261738}
review:
RiME, interamente creato con il nuovo Unreal Engine 4, √® un indie game della casa Tequila Works. Il gioco si presenta subito con una grafica alla Zelda: Breath of the Wild mista con The Witness. La storia, come nella maggior parte dei giochi di questo tipo, √® una storia strappalacrime che per√≤ non risulta sia vista e rivista. Il comparto grafico e la colonna sonora sono eccellenti. Ottimi anche gli enigmi con i giochi luce/ombra. Il gioco richiede circa 7/8 ore per essere completato al 100% con tutti i collezionabili e i vari achievements, la storia di per se dura un 5/5,30 ore. Il finale √® qualcosa di indimenticabile, lo consiglio a tutti a prezzo pieno.

[b]+ Comparto grafico e sonoro eccellente, ottimi paesaggi con rispettive soundtracks coinvolgenti
+ Enigmi creativi con i giochi luce/ombra
+ Storia ben elaborata, il gioco gi√† dall'inizio mette molta curiosit√† facendovi venire voglia di completarlo al piu' presto
+ Longevit√† discreta per un gioco di questo tipo, diciamo che supera di poco la durata media di un gioco indie

- Alcuni enigmi risultano troppo facili[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016646963', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1506757537}
review:
De vuelta una vez m√°s por el universo Steam y tras finalizar los Assassins Brotherhood y Revelations, y tambi√©n el Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands y el Farcry Primal; le toc√≥ el turno a este fabuloso y espectacular juego: RIME. Duod√©cimo juego terminado de este 2017 y s√≥lo se pueden decir cosas positivas sobre √©l. Una banda sonora espectacular, unos gr√°ficos sobresalientes (el efecto de la lluvia es una pasada), una historia sencillamente genial (no voy a poner m√°s calificativos para no destriparla)... En fin, un juego del estilo del Tomb Raider de toda la vida pero sin armas ni necesidad de matar a nadie, con unos puzles f√°ciles de interpretar.

El √∫nico pero que le pongo es el tiempo en terminar la historia que se me ha hecho muy corto (8 horas y media), aunque tambi√©n hay que decir que no me he puesto a sacar logros y secretos con lo que dir√≠a que ser√≠an unas 8 horas m√°s.

Resumiendo, nota final 9 sobre 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140204288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1506315460}
review:
RIME is a slow burn even for a game of this brevity, which may come across as an undesirable trait however it is very intentional. The story is told without any dialogue whatsoever, leaving atmosphere and emotional suggestion with most of the heavy lifting. The design will feel almost random as you piece together the hints within, a form of ordered chaos if you will. I found it difficult to feel invested in the game until the latter levels where the entire vision begins to come together and you understand and appreciate the how and why. While you may begin to figure out the general concept about halfway there are certain details that do not truly hit home until the game is finished.

That being said the game sometimes felt like a chore to play, with the reward and satisfaction being reserved for the final scenes, but I am glad I carried on. If you play the game and feel uninspired to finish I urge you to push through, it is worth the effort and may just prompt a second playthrough. While nothing in the game is particularly difficult the brilliant story telling through the game world is a lost art in interactive entertainment in recent years, an art that Tequila Works has shown can still be powerful and effective.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041696103', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1689876907}
review:
This game is more like art than a game. It's very simple to play, no real challenges and very easy to complete. But even so, I loved it. This game takes you on an adventure and the story that unfolds is just heartbreaking and pure. The story unfolds during the playthrough, and in the end had me in tears. Through sound and visual effects the games takes you on an emotional journey that you will remember for a long time.
It lets you explore a world filled with magnificent views and fitting music. As I said earlier, there is no real challenges and it can easily be cleared, even finding all the secrets aren't too hard. But at the same time I don't find it too rewarding to find them all. I will definetly play through it again, but I doubt I'll go look for every secret hidden within.
This game is a great piece of art, and I suggest anyone who likes a mysterious heartaching story, to play this through to the end.

TLDR; Loved the visual, sound and story. Gameplay itself is a bit tedious and not very rewarding, but you wanna play this for the highly emotional story.

review:
Das Spiel ist einfach sch√∂n. Tolle Soundtracks! Athmosph√§risch alle mal. Es ist leicht alles herauszufinden, aber nicht leicht alle versteckten Sachen zu entdecken. 1 weiteres Mal durch spielen ist auf jedenfall drin.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991829620', 'num_games_owned': 1470, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1505946656}
review:
Both massively overpriced and overhyped. 
You start as a boy who stranded on an island and trying to figure out what this game is about. You get the feel "well i guess i have to explore this island". But then the first revelation there is nothing or at least not much to really explore. That island really feels like a level that tricks you into thinking it is an island. And seriously why is this game running to piss poor, i have a 1080ti and R7 1700x and this game runs with 40fps on max details on 1440p, the looks of this game and size of levels don't justify this performance. Then you start to enjoy the art style but the feeling that the developer were just lazy. You can make a minimalist artstyle but then you have to make up for it so it doesn't feel cheap and empty and yes this game feels cheep and lazy. 
A big problem what comes in hands with it is the massive hand holding, it is impossible to miss the goal because first you have a fox that leads you to every spot they can't mark white and second because well they made every edge of importance white. This little detail should have used on almost every edge, not just on spots where the game wants you to go and would improve the graphical quality of the game.
I am pretty aware that many games are dumbed down compared to games that were released in the 80s and 90s but this game shouldn't have that massive amount of hand holding and lack of stakes. You are playing a boy who is on an adventure...but there are no stakes not sense of real adventure. Where is the adventure when the game holds your hand and says "you go there, then there and then there oh and by the way you can't really fail". I would hate that as a child, it's like going to the playground with your parents and never leave their side. It doesn't make any sense in the context of this game. And don't come with "well that big bird can snatch you" at me, you totally know that it was so easy to avoid that from happening. The puzzles-if you want to call them that- are way too easy and obvious because of the handholding. So you don't get any feel of accomplishment. You are basically just running to spots where the games leads you to, then walk to different spots where the game leads you to to collect keys to open gates and doors from previous spots. Yep no thinking or figuring out involved, just running from spot to spot, no puzzles in this game folks.
Nothing to say about the story, very surface level and not very interesting or engaging. But they still figured out to ruin this experience. The last scene of the game is a big "DO YOU GET, THIS OBJECT REPRESENTS THIS AND THAT OBJECT THIS, DO YOU GET IT?" which really made me angry. The game was over with the scene on the boat, everything what comes after ruins any attempt, since the actual scenes with story are so scarce. 
Last point i have 6.1h on the clock but real play time is about ~4h. I bought it on the sale but it still overpaid for the play time this game offers. This game isn't worth 34,99‚Ç¨, 10‚Ç¨ at best. It doesn't have the content, depth or quality to justify the asked price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082062749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1062, 'last_played': 1507144244}

author: {'steamid': '76561198289725695', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1648315598}
review:
El juego es hermoso pero un poco corto, en mi caso tarde 5,7hrs en terminarlo, la rejugabilidad est√° en los coleccionables (algunos MUY escondidos) y en los logros (solo saque 9 al terminarlo la 1ra vez) , despu√©s de m√°s de 26hrs dando vueltas y terminando el juego varias veces me rend√≠ y busque una gu√≠a para encontrar lo que me faltaba, eran solo 3 cosas: el fragmento del 5to emblema en el nivel 3, la Sombra Blanca en el nivel 4 y el logro m√°s confuso (al menos para m√≠) ‚ÄúPaciencia‚Äù, despu√©s de eso me divert√≠ bastante encontrando todos los coleccionables y logros. En cuanto a la historia se me hizo algo confusa por el final, todo el tiempo me estuve preguntando ¬øQue es esta isla? ¬øQui√©nes construyeron todo? y ¬øQue les paso? para que al final... bueeee, no puedo decir nada por tenas de spoiler, pero es muy emotiva y m√°s con ese final que siempre me dieron ganas de llorar cuando lo vi todas y cada una de las veces. Los puzles no son muy dif√≠ciles y me gusto esa mec√°nica de ver por un "altar" para que pasara algo. El juego no es perfecto, el problema m√°s grande sigue siendo la optimizaci√≥n incluso despu√©s de que le sacaran el DRM, a partir de "Medio" le costaba ir a 30fps y tengo una PC que puede correr Fallout 4 entre 50 a 60fps, creo que se equivocaron de motor, a primera vista parece el mismo de Slime Rancher pero con mejores texturas, podr√≠an a ver usado otro pero bueee se ve hermoso de todas formas y m√°s con la banda sonora que tiene, adem√°s del rendimiento podr√≠an poner la opci√≥n de guardar cuando uno quiere y poder saltar las cinem√°ticas (solo un detalle menor).
Me gustar√≠a ver una expansi√≥n basada en "ustedes ya saben qui√©n" con la misma cantidad de niveles o m√°s y con puzles un poco m√°s dif√≠ciles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029837806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1505279134}
review:
Nice and beautiful game I enjoyed all the way through.

PROS :
- beautiful art design
- slow pace
- relaxing to play

CONS :
- No real purpose in the puzzles
- no real puzzles either


Overall Rime is a enjoyable and relaxing experience. 
I wish there was more clear goal to the game, instead of just progressing clueless through the levels.
Or at least have real puzzles to solve to make the game more interesting.
But I still loved the game, and it also all make sense at the end, so I recommend it, maybe wait for a sale :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028959851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1504927828}
review:
Obra maestra de Tequila Works. 
Sublime aventura de corte muy sentimental, con un trasfondo que se va desvelando seg√∫n te acercas al final.
La historia del juego es bastante corta, tiene partes de plataformeo y otras de puzzles, estos √∫ltimos bastante sencillos. Perfectamente se puede terminar en unas 6 horas u 8 aproximadamente, dependiendo de lo habilidoso que seas. 
Aun as√≠, la historia te va atrapando y una vez metido de lleno no puedes parar hasta el final.
No puedo m√°s que recomendarlo, es la mejor obra de Tequila Works hasta el momento, bien optimizado y con un final que har√° que se te escape alguna lagrimita.

review: Juegaso que te invita a descubrir el misterio que rodea a la isla en la que has naufragado.Eres un ni√±o que tendr√° que abrirse paso resolviendo puzzles,explorando y disfrutando de esta maravilla visual.Vas a fliparlo durante unas cu√°ntas horas, y otras m√°s,si quieres ver el final alternativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989304140', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1503342238}
review: Spectacular graphics and a moving storyline more than make up for what are often quite pedestrian puzzles.  Anyone with experience of platform puzzlers won't find this particularly challenging - but I wholeheartedly recommend it. You will not regret playing all the way through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012640010', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1504803915}
review:
Najwieksza niespodzianka 2017!!!
Ta niezbyt skomplikowana logiczno-zrecznosciowa platformowka moze sie pochwalic robiaca niesamowite wrazenie oprawa. Slicznej grafice korzystajacej z cel-shadingu towarzyszy przepiekna sciezka dzwiekowa, w ktorej prym wioda wiolonczele, fortepian i skrzypce. Dzieki tej estetyce i szczatkowej, ale posiadajacej odpowiedni ciezar emocjonalny narracji fabularnej RiME nasuwa silne skojarzenia zarowno z wydana w 2012 roku na Playstation 3 gra Journey jak i z filmami animowanymi Studia Ghibli typu Nausica√§ z Doliny Wiatru, Laputa ‚Äì podniebny zamek czy Ksiezniczka Mononoke. Sama rozgrywka jest niespieszna, zdecydowana wiekszosc zagadek srodowiskowych nie stanowi duzego wyzwania dla szarych komorek, a jedyna trudnosc moga stanowic nieliczne fragmenty, w ktorych projekt poziomu nie prowadzi nas za reke i sami musimy wpasc na to, w ktora strone nalezy isc. 

RiME to trzecia, po bardzo fajnym Deadlight i pelnym czarnego humoru The Sexy Brutale, gra studia Tequila Works. Po raz trzeci Hiszpanom udalo sie stworzyc klimatyczna produkcje, ktora choc nie nalezy do kategorii najbardziej kasowych tytulow AAA z poteznym budzetem, to jest naprawde warta uwagi. Dzieki temu tworcy gry trafiaja na moja krotka liste najbardziej cenionych developerow i z niecierpliwoscia bede oczekiwac ich kolejnej produkcji. A ze przy RiME bawilem sie bardzo dobrze i jego nieziemska estetyka na dlugo zapadnie mi w pamiec, to z czystym sumieniem polecam ten tytul kazdemu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013741629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1504788065}
review: From watching the trailers I had the mistaken impression that RiME was some kind of open-world, puzzle-exploration game. Well, I quickly learned that RiME is more akin to Ico, and at one point even Half-Life 2 popped into my mind... It's a linear adventure game with light puzzle-platforming. The puzzles occasionally increase in complexity but never to anything major. I'd call it a "guided adventure". I wouldn't call it a walking simulator although the game is reminiscent of Abzu like other reviewers have said. After an opening hour of confusion (about what kind of game RiME actually was), I grew to enjoy the game, especially the third level. It's questionable whether there is enough "meat on the bone", gameplay wise, to justify the price, but at the same time the length of the game feels pretty much perfect and it's not a game that would benefit from being longer I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971840965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1504708807}

tut einiges dazu.

Absolute Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960546294', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1504707262}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000138626', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1504316235}
review: This is visual storytelling at it's finest. Few games have wowed me more from start to finish than RiME. The color palette, structure designs, symbolic imagery, landscape, weather, puzzle mechanics, even small behavioral actions--everything plays a role in RiME's beautifully woven narrative. People who enjoy exploration, puzzlers, and a more casual pace will love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393817448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1527323420}
review:
Ho appena finito il gioco.
Devo dire che sono rimasto molto soddisfatto:
- sia la grafica sia la colonna sonora sono di alta qualit√†, con ambientazioni che vale la pena osservare a "360¬∞" ed un accompagnamento musicale che crea la giusta atmosfera;
- la trama √® molto ben strutturata e "ben raccontata".
Di contro, gli enigmi sono abbastanza semplici (non si pu√≤ avere tutto...).
Non aspettatevi combattimenti; non ce ne sono.
Il gioco si basa sull'esplorazione e la risoluzione di enigmi per poter avanzare. L'esplorazione dell'ambiente circostante √® anche un punto chiave per il completamento degli extra (facoltativo) e la possibilit√† di visualizzare il finale completo (che vale la pena vedere).
La trama √® molto godibile, anche in assenza di dialoghi (ebbene s√¨, non ci sono...). Il gioco, infatti, pu√≤ essere definito un racconto introspettivo che, man mano che si avanza con la storia tra i vari capitoli,  ha come punto di forza la capacit√† di trasmettere emozioni al giocatore facendo un sapiente uso di immagini e suoni.
Il finale resta uno dei pi√π commeventi che abbia visto in un videogioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015848527', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 1048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1528564237}
review:
Rime, what to say about it. I enjoyed it, despite some small issues I had with it. It had an interesting narrative which had a bittersweet feel to it throughout. Art style is brilliant, and it caused me to constantly hit that F12 button throughout as there were so many wonderful shots. Music fit the feel of the game perfectly, and its impact on mood should not be overlooked. Game is relatively short, but I don't have a problem with this, as it tells the story it needs to in the time it takes up. I'm sure when I return to the game to try to get a 100% completion (with colectible stuff hidden everywhere) it'll add a bit more to the played time, but a standard play through will take less than 10 hours. Just something to consider if you think long play time to be a deciding factor.

Really the only issue with it is that sometimes the controls feel a little clumsy, especially in regards to camera movement. Why can't I adjust zoom manually?

Overall an enjoyable game, though I'd recommend waiting for a sale. I get all my games on sale though, so eh.

EDIT: OK so I did a 100% walkthrough and I enjoyed it more the second time through than the first time. Getting the locked ending is something worth trying to achieve at the very least. Maybe it was just the mood I was in, but the ending hit me harder the second time around, and was incredibly touching.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066673553', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1504535959}
review: Rime doesn't introduce new quality in the business of interactive storytelling but borrows good things from the best. You'll find echoes of The Last Guardian, Ico or Zelda, then you'll appreciate tons of passion, and in the end you will probably become very fond of this game and remember it for a long time. Sit back, relax and enjoy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198022312102', 'num_games_owned': 5431, 'num_reviews': 335, 'playtime_forever': 646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1504306746}
review:
Rime is a heart breaking story about a boy who is stranded on an island. It's hard to sum it up better without spoiling anything. 
 I fully recommend RiME for anyone who likes adventure and story driven games without any narration, the music was beautiful and the visuals were fantastic (there's also a very good plot twist in late game).

 I'd give RiME a solid 8/10, the main reason for not being a 9 or 10 is because there's some heavy performance issues when set on Ultra settings (playing on a 1070 and a 4790k and the fps would be lower than 40fps), setting it to High will fix that issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054739532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1504534461}
review: This is a very enjoyable little puzzel game, great art, fun, and pretty relaxing. I've had no problem with performance issues and I don't consider my PC to be particularly high end--I'm running it on a stock (new, middle of the road) laptop. My only complaint about the game itself is that sometimes the camera sacrifices controllability for a good view. I would also say to buy it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008145228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1504718524}
review:
Colpisce subito al cuore.
Un titolo che sembra colpire molto emotivamente,l'ambientazione e' qualcosa di spettacolare  e sicuramente le musiche orchestrate portano a vivere una piccola poesia.
Gli enigmi attualmente non sono complessi e l'esplorazione e' quella che prevale nelle meccaniche di gioco.
Non esito a consigliarlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004778857', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1595625026}
review:
Never have I played a more beautiful game that makes you solve puzzles, and most of the time the answer is easier than you'd think.

First 5 minutes: I have no idea what I'm doing
First hour: Okay ... I think I'm getting a hang of it
Five hours: I don't want this to end

So many intelligent puzzles and for the little story I saw (apparently I need to go back and be more thorough so I can get all the collectibles) I really don't think I'll forget this game anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198320460742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1358, 'last_played': 1511398964}
review: RiME is a really magical game that's like a mix between journey, the witness, and zelda. It's a little more linear than I was expecting, and the puzzles aren't all that hard, but it gives me that feeling of wonder that not many games nowadays can give (that is, until the deus ex machina plot twist at the end. smh) Regardless, it's still a really great game that you should definitely play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960462483', 'num_games_owned': 10581, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1503808211}
review:
This is not perhaps the most challenging puzzle/exploration game out there - there's perhaps a few puzzles that required me to double check all that I could do and missed a climbable platform, but otherwise the solutions seem pretty simple. That said, the puzzle elements are introduced in a good "platform learning" manner with no writtent text and only minimal on-screen prompts so that you can recognize how certain things will behavior to quickly figure out how to solve the puzzles. There are some nice ideas used in the puzzle designs, particularly with the play of light and shadows, that could make for a more fulfilling game. There are a number of collectables to find with additional exploration and/or level navigation to give this replay value.  The core game took me about 6 hours to complete, and I felt that's about the right value for the price.

What does make this game excel is the relatively simple story. It might be straight forward when you start, but the game uses a number of sublte tricks that lead to a great end-game twist. It is an emotional-driven story and the suprise at the end caught me off guard.  The music and setting all plays perfectly to that tone.

I've seen other reviews that complain of performance issues. I didn't encounter any save for two unreproducable crash-to-desktops early on (this was mid-August 2017) and the rest worked smoothly. It is a bit graphically taxing so low-end computers might have problems, but I don't think it suffers the performance issues that appeared to be a problem when this first launched.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045934390', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1607617536}
review:
It has no dialogue, but a lot to tell!

I finished the game after around 9 Hours and its my game of the year 2017!

Why?

- the graphic looks amazing
- the artdesign is in some way similiar overall, but then very different from location to location
- the puzzles are all very intuitiv and not too hard, or way too easy, so the fuid of playing is not quite fast
- exploration is hell of fun, as every location is huge and has a lot to offer in many ways
- the interactions are ot much, but somehow you find out very soon what you can do
- they way the game teach you how to do stuff is very intuitiv, you don't even recognize it (not text)
- there is also no HUD, no lifebar, just pure gamepla and graphic, which is very refreshing
- no talents, no exp to gain and no crafting, it sounds like a downside, but this is one of the parts why i looked forward toplay this game, it has no ballast
- the soundtrack is really well made, it suits perfectly the gameplay and also feeld rewarding when you find secretcs and progress in the game
- the emotional part is incredible, when you find your partner for your journey, when you met new creatures and if you part ways

I played 8-9 Hours and thought originaly i was going to finish the game in below 5 Hours, but i was so wrong, but i explored a lot while i didn't even found everything, only 1/2 of all secrets. 

The ending was expected from middle to finish, but i got the wrong person, so at the end it was a bit of a shocker and i was truly sad when i saw the final ending.

Tequila Works, iam so happy i played your game, it was in many ways one of the best experience i had.

If you like games like

- Abzu
- Journey
- Bound
- NaissanceE
- Ico
- Shadow of the Collosus

..you may like this game a lot, as it is in some ways similiar (pure gameplay, good soundtrack, fantastic and very special artdesign, intuitiv, not HUD) but still different enough to gain some new experience. 

Again, thank you very much for the great experience!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066275502', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1521641650}
review: Excellent game. It's certainly not a game for everyone but if you like puzzle, atmosphere and relaxing games, this should be a good pick up. The price is a bit steep for it's content but I still recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042582734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1542321750}
review:
SPOILER ALERT

So this game is totally about the five stages of grief. 

Obviously each area is one stage. The first beach area is Denial

The second area is Anger because that bird is pissed and wants to eat you

The third area is barganing because you have to work with the robots 

The fourth area is obviously depression

and the last cutscene is acceptance.

I know it's all pretty obvious! But this game is a perfect painting next to majora's mask about the five stages of grief.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354487609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1508832235}
review: I walked into this game thinking it would be a fun, casual playing game, pick up and play every now and then. I was wrong. This is a solid game that was well worth what I paid for it. Charming art styling throughout, and a story that keeps you curious until the end. Absolutely would recommend for anyone who enjoys puzzle-solving adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033239936', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1536102523}
review: This game has very beautiful artwork and a great soundtrack. The designers did a great job. Proof that video games can also be very artistic. My GTX 1070 did great with the settings on ultra. There are a few spots that will cause drops in framerate. The game is pretty linear and the puzzles aren't too difficult, but the beauty is worth it. I don't think I've every come across a game quite like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089437780', 'num_games_owned': 1194, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1503439184}
review: De los mejores Juegos Indie que he jugado de unas 7H, gran banda sonora y apartado grafico y una historia emotiva, es un juego de puzzles y exploracion no espereis un zelda o un ico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082757678', 'num_games_owned': 1240, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1503492094}
review:
One of the best games i ever played. And that should be enough BUT... i have to be honest and say that i wasn't expecting this game to be THIS good. It exceeded my expectations and just like that became one of my all time favorites.

Amazing art style, music, story... Fun and fluid gameplay with puzzles and platforming... And that ending...

"Do you recommend this game?" lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197987192902', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1626043342}
review:
I was disappointed that its not really a puzzle game. Its more of a jump to next platform type game. I had some framerate issues on a titan x. I initially gave a "cant recommend" rating.
By the time I finished it, I was won over by the art and the idea it conveyed.
Its pretty nonviolent, so kids might enjoy it more than me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970513433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1709000303}
review:
This is an absolutely beautiful experience. One large seamless, lovely world, full of moments of wonder. The puzzles, while not yet terribly difficult, are well-constructed, and the level-design has a great sense of flow. I'm rarely frustrated by puzzles or traversing the landscape, and there's very little backtracking.

Despite having a pretty similar control scheme to a 3D Legend of Zelda title, they've refined the controls to better fit a game filled with puzzles, but no enemies. While I'm a huge fan of Zelda games, Link seemingly has little regard for self-preservation, and likes to hurl himself off of every available ledge, whether I tell him to or not. Our nameless hero in Rime, on the other hand, notices ledges, and stops himself.

The music should be remarked upon as well. A mix of traditional and modern elements, with some beautiful cello work. It's wonderfully atmospheric, and makes you feel as if you're playing through a studio Ghibli film.

As for complaints, I have very, very few. Originally when I played, the camera was super buggy indoors, and would clip through walls, obscuring your view of the level and character. This has been fixed. It was also poorly optimized, and did not run well on my machine despite it exceeding the system requirements significantly. This too seems to have been fixed. There was, at one point, some sort of invasive DRM software. This was removed early on. The devs seem to be really responsive, and very much willing to fix issues in order to make the game a better experience for players.

This game is one of the best I've played in a long time. It's a beautiful, lonely, immersive experience. I've not finished it, playing it only a little bit at a time, so that I can make it last. This should be played by more people.

review:
RiME is a story
A story about being lost
A story about new experiences
A story about new companions
A story about seeing the world in new ways
A story about familiar faces
A story about bleak horizons
A story about courage
A story about fear
A story about overcoming obstacles
A story about remembering
A story about taking life away
A story about giving new life
A story about making new friends
A story about teamwork
A story about losing loved ones
A story about self sacrifice
A story about losing everyone you care about
A story about losing yourself
A story about despair
A story about seeing the truth
A story about accepting what is
A story about remembering what was
A story about never forgetting
A story about letting go

RiME is not just a story
RiME is amazing work of art

author: {'steamid': '76561198047289935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1503276695}
review:
Exceedingly well-executed concept, and while I confess I didn't catch on as to the over-arching significance of the whole until the very end, I still found it to be very moving.

5/5 From me.
(Or 10/10 if you want to use that scale.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974314237', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1509053838}
review:
Only 2 hours in the game, but from the first time I saw screenshots for this game I knew I would like it. So far it is even better than I thought.
Looks stunning, lots to explore and really gripping, you want to continue exploring further and further.
Controls are nice, not too difficult to proceed but challenging enough.

Only downside is some performance issues, although that does not really spoil the fun it is noticable sometimes.

Overall highy recommended.

After finishing the game I can only recommend it more, great original story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263450178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1503245715}
review:
Could've been potentially a very good game if the developers actually [u]finished[/u] it.

Developers present this game as a game where you have to solve difficult puzzles however, all puzzles are very straightforward and the game turns into a boring walking simulator where you hopelessly walk from one puzzle to another and think when it's going to finish. The story which is also supposed to be here is almost non-existent. It feels like developers said - "You go and find story yourself, we just provide you with cutscenes occasionally".

While you progress through your [b]'adventure'[/b] you also face a horrible camera. Its movements are confusing and even though they suppose to help the gameplay, they ruin it. Texture bugs don't help to improve game experience either. Your character can get stuck in textures and the only way to deal with it is to restart. Sometimes he just doesn't hold on to the edge where he should [spoiler]( the game is so easy developers even painted the edges you can climb, but bugs disagree with them),[/spoiler] so you have to spend extra time. Also when you are underwater sometimes you can see black textures.

Adding to what I said earlier about 'adventure' the game is extremely linear and you barely have a choice. It's like developers said to you that you can buy the game but you can only watch them play. There's absolutely no freedom. It's very sad that developers had a decent idea but didn't manage to produce anything good. Anyway, you shouldn't buy this game, [u][b]it's an unfinished project.[/b][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561198277504441', 'num_games_owned': 1041, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1503228253}
review: A great game. It's hard to explain what is special about it. Don't trust people who says it's a clone of Journey & Abzu etc. It takes a lot from those games, but it's still a unique and worth playing experience. You'll get the feeling of playing one of your favorite games from your childhood. Very simple but satisfying platforms and puzzles. The level design is well done because it feels like you can explore an open world but in truth it's a linear experience. The world is not just an island, it got a lot of surprises and variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082217146', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1509570663}
review:
The debate has often been made as to wether or not video games are to be defined as a form of art. RiME, better than any other, illustrates the beauty, wonder, and raw emotion that games can communicate. So as to not ruin the plot, and stellar ending of the game, I will end my quick, vague review with this: RiME will take you on a journey, tell you a story, and is capable of reducing you to tears. 

I can not reccomend this game enough, and applaud all who had a hand in crafting this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965361589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1503176812}
review:
This is only just a "no", rather than "yes".

The game looks very good at all times.
Doesn't quite run great with the higher settings.

The journey and puzzles are pleasing enough, but never feel challenging enough to bring much satisfaction.

The story... it didn't resonate with me. Changed direction very quickly near the end which left it feeling more confusing than fullfilling.

I mananged to find most of what was hidden along the way, but after finishing just short of 8 hours I didn't feel a desire to go through and find what I'd missed.

review:

Una historia breve, cuya belleza de los escenarios y los secretos por encontrar har√°n que disfrutes durante m√°s horas. La narraci√≥n de la historia es visual, haci√©ndote sumergir en los significados que van transmiti√©ndote en la historia. La banda sonora que acompa√±a tu viaje es es-pec-ta-cu-lar. author: {'steamid': '76561198146710618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1503147646}
review:
This is my first time ever writing a review for a game, its not something I would normally do.

But when I completed the game I felt compelled to review it. I know some people gave this game negative reviews mainly because they expected it to be something else.

But for me it was one of the most beautiful and emotional games I have played. The soundtrack in the game is incredibly beautiful, I found myself just getting lost in the music at times. And the visuals are just as incredible. 
 
The game play itself is not that overly difficult or challenging, but I don't think it that type of game anyway. I think the game is more relaxing and even meditative at times, I truly was in awe of the music and visuals at times.

Overall the story is quite profound and also a little sad. Something about the whole game just spoke to me, I honestly think it had some of the most beautiful music I have ever heard in game. 

I would highly recommend people give this game a chance. And ignore the negative reviews from some people. I think the game when combining the visuals, the beautiful soundtrack and the moving story comes together to form a master piece.

Id give this game a solid 8.5 out 10 it was well and truly worth the time and money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992059881', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1503197302}
review:
I enjoyed RiME. The music was perhaps my favorite aspect. I loved how smoothly the score adapted to the situation. The clean graphical style and shadows stand out as well. RiME reminded me most of Journey on PlayStation but with ledge climbing elements borrowed from Tomb Raider.

Now for cons: RiME was short. I played through and found half the collectables in about 7 hours. Movement didn't feel quite right. Animations were drawn out and disconnected, and interacting with objects required careful positioning. Journey had much better movement and a more engrossing story.

I'd recommend RiME to a friend if it dropped to $20 again. I'll also watch for future games from this Spanish developer. ¬°Con gusto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198180247498', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1521254152}
review: RIME provides intricate gameplay, accompanied by stunning visuals and music that brings you into a deep and meaningful world that stuns all the way to the end. The puzzles are fairly simple and repetitive, but I feel that the constant suspense makes up for this deficiency. Many critics say that this is a shallow game, but I found that through careful analysis and the connection of major plot points, RIME makes for a deep and thoughtful game that can be extremely enjoyable when you begin to piece together the details.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971202050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1561058736}
review:
I give it an 9/10
What an awesome puzzle/platformer/adventure game.
No bugs, beautifull graphics, very good music.
I did all puzzles without peaking at guides, so this game is not myst difficulty.
Insanely nice story, but I warn you, I cried at the end.
There are achievements ingame, things to discover and to collect.
I would say this makes it playable more than once.
Please try it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100793235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1597388802}
review:
purchased the game. installed the game. played the game. unlocked achievements and everything. did not manage to finish the game. got to the secton after windmill area. 

then the game became corrupted. better said....my file from the cloud became corrupted.
after getting through windmill section. the game has frozen during the loading screen every single time.
i validated my game using steam validator.
i uninstalled then reinstalled the game. i even turned steam could sync off.
i then installed it onto my older other computer that is by a different pc manudacturer...still same result.
something happened regarding my save states from the steam cloud which somehow is corrupting my game files.
since the freezing during the load screens is happening on two different pc that have completel different components.
so it is not a hardware compatibility issue.
i was really enoying and loving the game but i must sadly give it two way big thumbs down. its a broken game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082765773', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1503063689}
review:
AVIS GENERAL : 

Rime, c'est une histoire po√©tique m√™lant imaginaire enfantin et psychologie humaine. Une merveilleuse aventure aux allures de conte. Un subtil m√©lange de r√©f√©rences : les myst√©rieuses cit√©s d'or, Atlantide, Zelda et plus largement les civilisations mayas et √©gyptiennes. 

Comme d'autres jeux avant lui (notamment Abz√ª), le r√©cit sera d√©livr√© au travers du d√©cor, d'√©l√©ments parfois VRAIMENT bien cach√©s. Nul dialogue : tout est dans l'observation.

Les musiques, quant √† elles, vous envo√ªteront d√®s les premi√®res notes pour vous plonger dans de somptueux niveaux.

Et cette fin... un plotwist qui vaut clairement le d√©tour ! Je ne peux pas tellement en dire plus, de peur de vous g√¢cher l'exp√©rience. Mais en tout cas, Rime est r√©ellement une belle occasion de voyager en un ailleurs somptueux et riche en √©motions. 

GAMEPLAY

C√¥t√© gameplay, ne vous attendez pas √† des √©nigmes alambiqu√©es. Elles invoqueront bien souvent le temps, l'ombre et la lumi√®re, ainsi qu'une logique de placements d'objets. Peut-√™tre un ou deux puzzles plus ardus qu'√† l'accoutum√©e... mais rien de bien sorcier en somme.

La principale difficult√© r√©side dans la recherche des fragments, trous de serrure, habits, etc. Mais ne vous en faites pas, si vous loupez certains d'entre eux, vous aurez la possibilit√© de rejouer les diff√©rents chapitres en fin de partie. Ce qui est plut√¥t pratique au vu de certains chemins devenant par la suite inaccessibles... de quoi vous faire recommencer encore et encore ! De m√™me, des succ√®s s'activeront apr√®s certaines interactions pas forc√©ment √©videntes. Donc vraiment, soyez attentif √† votre environnement, ouvrez l'oeil ; ce dernier rec√®le quantit√© de chemins cach√©s et d'actions dissimul√©es. 

POINTS NOIRS 

Un souci d'optimisation graphique qui peut vous occasionner quelques lags. Pour une bonne config comme la mienne, je n'ai pas pu profiter de l'ultra, ce qui est assez dommage car la diff√©rence est assez nette. Ce sera tr√®s certainement mon seul gros point noir. 

Pour ce qui est de la dur√©e de vie, elle me semble satisfaisante. Plus longue et cela aurait pu devenir bien vite redondant. Par contre, si vous rushez, vous pouvez facilement diviser votre temps de jeu par 2. Et √ßa, peut-√™tre que √ßa en g√™nera quelques uns. 

Enfin, pour chipoter, certains chemins sont vraiment compliqu√©s √† discerner. Notamment celui menant √† la fin alternative (enfin, je dis "fin alternative" mais ce n'est en v√©rit√© qu'un seul √©l√©ment qui appara√Ætra lors de la sc√®ne finale, vous donnant droit √† un succ√®s). 


- Note : 17/20 -

Je pense en avoir fini avec ce petit avis. En esp√©rant vous avoir √©clair√© sur le jeu. Si votre porte-monnaie vous le permet, foncez, c'est un petit bijou.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011428156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1503196311}
review:
First thing I will say is the music for this game is worth the 30 dollars alone. No exaggeration. 

I mainly play FPS's and open world/survival type games, and wanted a break from the norm. 

This game is simply beautiful. It is a linear game but tells a great story with no dialogue, and there is always beautiful music and visuals every second of gameplay. The puzzles in the game aren't too difficult, but I have found myself stuck in rooms for 15 minutes trying to figure them out - they are very creative and clever. I noticed that some reviews said this game has little storytelling, but if you pay attention to all the details (i mean ALL of the details) while playing this, you'll find out it has a very compelling story of an island that once thrived with life. And this game tells that story very well without saying a word. It's very hard to find games as well made as this these days with how saturated the market is with endless indie games and open alphas. I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012020367', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1359, 'last_played': 1503009911}
review:
Just finished this amazing game...worth it, especially on sale! Not suitable to play on potato, saw many negative reviews due to performance issues. If you got a decent setup it's pure eye candy and runs smoothly. Gameplay is easy and fluent.

GET IT! GET IT! GET IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198734392430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1503010474}
review: Even though it may run like a potato on even good systems it is absolutely worth your time. I didn't expect a gripping narrative from a voiceless puzzle/platformer. If you are on the fence about this game you will thank yourself for buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027239685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1502996017}
review:
It's a well made game with relaxing gameplay and puzzles, and quite different "levels" with unique atmosphere. Unfortunately the deeper meaning of the story is hard to grasp for me. I read some interpretations which might make sense, but there are too few cues for me. When I finished the game I didn't quite know what to make of it.

Still I recommend this game for the unique experience, just don't expect to understand the hidden meaning of everything you do there.

review:
Kinda over-hyped.

There's not much open-world and only some useless collectables to get. Puzzles are simple and nowhere reach Zelda-quality. 

Nice as an athmospheric walking simulator with easy puzzles but I was expecting some more exploration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164124490', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1939, 'last_played': 1670639284}
review: First, let me say that I had a lot of problems running this game in the beginning.  After I repaired my MB, all was good.  After getting the game working, I found this game to be one of my very favorite games.  The puzzles are logical and the goals were easy to monitor.  I am not a big fan of shoot 'em ups, platformers, or gambling games.  What I do like is games that tell a good story and tell a good story it did!  I could not put my controller down for hours, just to find out what the next story part told.  This game has a very gut wrenching ending that leaves the player near tears if the player is very involved in the game and has a heart.  I make this review after deleting my previous negative review because of a faulty mb.  I have just finished playing this game for the third time and I still did not find all the collection items.  Oh well! Starting game four now.  Goodnight everyone.

review:
RIME a √©t√© pour moi une tr√®s agr√©able surprise.

J'avais √©t√© un peu √©chaud√© avec les performances plomb√©es par Denuvo (depuis retir√©) mais je ne regrette pas mon achat.

Il y a un petit c√¥t√© Windwaker m√¢tin√© de Myst√©rieuses cit√©s d'or assez plaisant.

Certes, les √©nigmes ne n√©cessitent la plupart du temps pas un niveau √©lev√© d'intelligence et de logique, mais j'ai quand m√™me but√© quelquefois sur quelques puzzle, en particulier lorsque le titre se fait un peu moins dirigiste.

Il s'agit avant tout d'une aventure tr√®s contemplative, vous l'aurez compris, et non d'un challenge hardcore de plateformes, cette partie du jeu √©tant tr√®s secondaire (avec les fameuses prises et corniches remplies de fientes de mouettes pour √™tre bien rep√©rables).

Je me suis laiss√© bercer par cette aventure finalement pas si convenue et m√™me √©mouvante par certains aspects (en particulier √† la fin du jeu).

author: {'steamid': '76561198012164178', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1502956955}
review:
What a fantastic, melancholy story!  I"m not one to talk about spoilers, though.  The animation is top-notch, the game is intriguing, and the incidental music fits the storyline just right.  I'm planning on playing this again and again, especially since I didn't find all of the toys, the keyholes, and such.

   This is one of those immersive games where you miss out on so much if you don't explore your environment.  I give it 5 out of 5 stars.  I hope that the people involved in making this game (I feel funny calling it a game) will make much more in the near future.

   This game is worth EVERY penny!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981494251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1502893344}
review:
Had seen this advertised heavilly on Facebook, and although I actively avoid products that are shoved in my face non-stop, I decided to repent in this case as the game looked stunning, and I dig a good puzzle game. 
¬£20 (on sale) is about right for this title. I finished it in around 5 hours, although I'll admit I didn't hunt every corner for every secret, I ended with about half. 

My first impressions of the game itself were rather breathtaking. I love this style of graphics design, and the music really shone out as exceptional. I don't normally give too much attention to music in games, as frequently its mainly an annoyance. However much like Little Inferno, the music in RiME drastically added to the game, and it really one of its greatest features. The music brought out emotions (to the point of, I was worried I was going to cry!) that completely immerse you in what is going on. 

The gameplay itself was fun, although not ground breaking, I enjoyed it for the mostpart. Some of the puzzles get quite repetitive in areas although it was not overly noticable whilst playing through, more an afterthought after completing the game. The sidequest of collecting toys, looking through keyholes etc seemed pointless whilst playing. It wasn't until I finished that I regretted not getting all of them.

The real selling point of this game is the story (which is heavilly complimented by the musical score).
As someone who does not generally play single players, and extremely rarely cares about story, I feel RiME shines brightly. 
It doesn't really start coming together until towards the end of the game, which is where you can begin to put all the pieces together, and as there is no dialog in the game, that in itself is difficult to do until you have actually finished. However this adds a wonderful mysticism about the game.
The fox annoyed me most of way through, and I suspect I'm not the only person who told it to 'shut up' on multiple occasions as it was barking at me while I was trying to find another toy. However by the end of the story which I will not ruin, I found it to be such a compelling character, I almost felt more attached to it than the protagonist. 
The mechs are a good example of something which shouldn't have worked, which did spectactularly (if that makes sense?). 
The first mech to come to life in the game, confused me to no end, it didn't make sense in the world I was in (and to be frank... still doesn't?). However it did not take long at all for me to be emotionally attached to the mech I had just saved, and the following level(s) with their company gaved me a lot of satisfaction, and heart-break.

There are negatives about the game however:
-It is very poorly optimised for PC - I had a lot of frame drops (1080gtx) 
-Camera control is sluggish, and in areas, completely frustrating
-Jumping can be just as frustrating (mainly wall-wall jumps)
-I have some continutity issues with the story telling - The 'character' in the red cloak just stops appearing about half way through with no reasoning (unless I missed it) 
-The angry bird - There didn't seem to be an explanation of what it was/represented at the end, which I was acutely dissapointed about (again, unless I somehow missed it)

In summary, I would pay ¬£20 for this again, however would be reluctant to suggest it to a friend for more. 
I had a lot of fun playing, and will play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009384622', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1309, 'last_played': 1502828362}
review:
I have mixed feelings about [I]RiME[/I]. The core of games like this - light on gameplay/puzzles, more focused on presentation - is the general atmosphere and story. Both need to be great for the overall experience to be good, and while I enjoyed [I]RiME[/I] deeply while playing it, after the ending and with some reflection I'm really not sure what to think.

Starting with the good, the art design and music is excellent. Levels are well thought out and designed to seem as if they actually exist. Each stage is self-contained but all aspects of that stage are consistent with the boundaries that we can see - nothing seems to exist in hammerspace as it were. There's tidbits of story that exist as murals and miscellaneous architecture and given the rather esoteric nature of the beginning plot finding these is its own reward. There's also a decent number of collectibles for those that like treasure hunting.

The issue I have with [I]RiME[/I] comes from its ending. My view is somewhat hard to explain without spoilers, but essentially the entirety of the game is a red herring. After the ending the intended symbolism of the levels is explained directly, but even still the details of the levels don't fit with the ending. That's not really too big of a deal in of itself, but I feel that if the details of the levels actually did relate directly to the story the game would have been better for it, and it still would be possible to implement the ending that's already there. When examined independently the ending isn't particularly weak - in fact I think it gives an excellent message and that message is treated with care - there's just wasted potential when there was obviously the opportunity for a more detailed setting and story that could have been told while also keeping the original moral.

I'm still not sure if I would recommend [I]RiME[/I] or not. It's not a game that I have any interest in replaying, but I don't regret the experience either. I suppose that's enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011936841', 'num_games_owned': 708, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1701892237}
review: Wonderful platform puzzler with a beautiful story that's however very subtle for most of the play time and only clears up towards the end, but then it gets some ‚ÄúBrothers - A tale of two sons‚Äù vibes. Play time is good (not too long to drag things out too much, not too short so as to cause buyer's remorse), graphics are beautiful, and so is the music. The world has been beautifully and creatively realized throughout its five chapters/settings. Puzzles are easy and timing is only relevant on occasion,  making the experience rather relaxing. Also, the game does entirely without any speech or text and still manages to get its story across nicely. Collectibles in conjunction with a chapter selection becoming available once you've finished the game lend it some replayability. Highly recommended!

Art style.
Soundtrack....at least if you don¬¥t listen too long to it...
Some puzzles, not too hard. Some are too easy though.


SUMMARIZATION: get it on sale for maximum 5‚Ç¨ - it¬¥s tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009996058', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1502361059}
review:
[h1] [i] RiME, 	[/i] una experiencia inolvidable	[/h1]

Todo en conjunto hace de este t√≠tulo una cautivadora aventura en un paraje mediterr√°neo. Su banda sonora, su apartado art√≠stico, su trama y su jugabilidad, lo convierten en un imprescindible de este a√±o, o quiz√°s de la d√©cada.

Solo unos pocos me han emocionado, pero con [i] RiME	[/i] me he visto por encima de esa experiencia, llegando a sentir algo que ni [i] Brothers: A tale of two sons	[/i] consigui√≥ ni creo que otra obra lo haga jam√°s. Podr√≠amos decir que este juego desprende m√°s pasi√≥n que la planteada por los desarrolladores del mismo.	

[h1] An√°lisis sin destripe	[/h1]

Deber√≠a hacer una rese√±a en fr√≠o, pero me ha entusiasmado tanto esta m√°gica y emotiva aventura, que he decidido analizarlo desde mi m√°s cercana experiencia cronol√≥gica, pues es un t√≠tulo que puede variar su propuesta seg√∫n tu estado, ya sea solo o acompa√±ado, al jugarlo prestando atenci√≥n al detalle, etc.

Respecto a la jugabilidad, en principio aparenta simpleza, pero la mec√°nica de utilizar la voz del protagonista es tan √∫nica que convierten una aventura con plataformas sencillas en un mundo construido a base de puzles. Arrastraremos bloques, "cantaremos" y nos moveremos cual marsupial en la jungla por los salientes, todo con un detalle impresionante. 

La primera ver que vi a la [i] IA	[/i] me qued√© at√≥nito de lo impresionante que es. No s√© si depender√° del motor gr√°fico, que es el [i] Unreal Engine 4, 	[/i] pero igualmente nos har√° sentir como ni√±os curiosos, tal como mencionaron los creadores. El mundo nos gu√≠a como un chaval√≠n a la aventura, cada vez m√°s inmersiva.

Con relaci√≥n a el apartado t√©cnico, [i] RiME	[/i] no pretende ser un portento gr√°fico en ning√∫n momento, y para ello lo demuestra mediante su apartado art√≠stico, que es lo que dota de identidad a los mejores t√≠tulos. Sin esa belleza de dibujos, que pueden semejarse al espl√©ndido [i] The Legend of Zelda: Breath of The Wild, 	[/i] no cautivar√≠a lo mismo.  

Todo este cuidado al m√≠nimo, tanto los cangrejos de la playa como el fondo submarino, pasando rayos de luz desde el agua m√°s bella que he visto, a excepci√≥n del oc√©ano de [i] Sea of Thieves. 	[/i] Ello acompa√±ado de unas animaciones espectaculares me incitan a revivir esos grandiosos escenarios, sobre todo los de lluvia, que, para m√≠, son los m√°s destacables.

En cuanto a la trama, es una parte esencial del videojuego, y los se√±ores de [i] Tequila Works, 	[/i] la desarrolladora, saben c√≥mo contarnos una historia sin palabras. Esta empresa espa√±ola est√° formada por exempleados de maravillosos estudios como [i] Blizzard Entertainment	[/i] (algo cuestionable seg√∫n quienes), [i] MercurySteam	[/i] (creadores de [i] Castlevania: Lords of Shadow) 	[/i] y otros estudios. Esto es perceptible a la hora de llevarnos por la senda de la exploraci√≥n, la cual nos incitar√° a descubrir m√°s sobre esta in√©dita historia, con un tr√°gico final que resultar√° en alg√∫n que otro sollozo.

En lo relativo al apartado sonoro, podr√≠a ser catalogado como la mayor identidad del t√≠tulo. Desde el comienzo hasta el final, nos acompa√±ar√° la excelente banda sonora y los redundantes efectos de sonido que convertir√°n nuestro camino en toda una experiencia.

Absolutamente digo y dir√©, que es una de las mejores, aunque hay otras muy destacables tambi√©n, bandas sonoras que he escuchado en mi corta vida. Emotiva cuando debe serlo, cautivadora, y, por supuesto, tr√°gica en los mejores momentos. Asimismo, los efectos de sonido son una delicia. Desde los peque√±os pasos del chico, hasta el briznar de la lluvia o el soplido del viento en la naturaleza son meros ejemplos que se extienden a lo m√°s m√≠nimo del plano.

En conclusi√≥n, creo haber conseguido englobar [i] RiME	[/i] en esta min√∫scula rese√±a, que ha pasado a ser una de mis obras preferidas por siempre. Viv√≠ de todo: curiosidad, impresi√≥n, alegr√≠a, tristeza y lo principal, lo he vivido yo, as√≠ como t√∫ tambi√©n deber√≠as.

[i] *An√°lisis reeditado en octubre de 2018. Publicado el 10 de agosto de 2017. 	[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198114157228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1502288000}
review:
Para mi, el mejor juego Indie y atmosferico al que he jugado. Banda Sonora de 10 (mi lista de reproducci√≥n de m√∫sica ya contiene todos sus temas principales), emocionante historia que te lograr saltar una lagrimilla que otra aun esforzandote por no llorar. 
Graficamente me ha dejado tambien sin palabras, muy luminoso y vistoso, a la par que oscuro y brillante cuando ten√≠a que serlo y siempre acompa√±ado cada bioma por una bso impresionante y acertada al momento.
Espero m√°s juegos de esta compa√±ia por favor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998642227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1567108266}
review:
This game gives me a double feeling, there are a lot of neat ideas and I actually liked playing the game but I can't really recommend it though.

It looks really nice, the graphics are clean with excellent lighting and a lot of attention has been spent on the artistic side. The sounds and music all fit very well and add to the immersion. 

I knew what to expect before I bought this, it's more or less a linear walking simulator with some puzzle elements and some minor storytelling. A bit like Abzu you could say.

So why am I still giving it a negative review?
- It's rather short for the price.
- not good optimized for PC, I'm getting a lot of fps drops which really break the immersion, even on lowest settings. (I can run games like DOOM and KF2 on very high-ultra without fps drops)
- It can be a bit boring at times, there is no action and not a lot of life in the game (unlike abzu which is brimming with life).
- navigating the character can be a bit tricky sometimes.


I do recommend it to people who like:
-pretty and relaxing games,
-exploring ruins,
-mediterranean climate,

but I would wait untill the price drops

author: {'steamid': '76561198114873144', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1502043213}
review: Best pleasant color harmony since Mad Max the game. Rime is definitely an eye candy especially if you are a sucker for a visual aesthetics. Cell shaded look reveals somehow minimalistic but very compelling experience. You can find a mix of zelda, ico, shadow of colossus aesthetics in here with a good taste. The gameplay is ok. Not groundbreaking, just standard walking, jumpings, simple puzzles but it's ok for me. Everything works great and you can absorb the story wiyhout any frustration. Overall a solid spiritual take by Spanish guys immitating a Japanise style of team ico but in a good way. Recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561197996121797', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1502042240}
review:
Mucho ha llovido desde que se vio RiME por primera vez.
Lo mejor que pudo hacer SONY fue perder los derechos del juego, si no lo hubiera hecho no hubiese podido disfrutar de esta grandiosa aventura. La sombra de la cancelaci√≥n ha estado rondando much√≠simo tiempo, demasiado tal vez.
Quiz√°s RiME no sea un juego de los que te llevar√≠as a una isla (a pesar de que se desarrolla en una), quiz√°s no est√© en ning√∫n Top-algo de casi ning√∫n jugador. Quiz√°s no sea ese juego que le guste a todo el mundo... Pero, eso... quiz√°s.
No considero a RiME como un superventas, ojal√° lo sea porque realmente se lo merece, pero pienso que es de esos juegos que todo jugador deber√≠a de jugar al menos una vez en su vida. Pocos juegos de este tipo, creado con mucha pasi√≥n se hacen estos d√≠as.
Lo primero que entra por los sentidos es el estilo gr√°fico e inmediatamente despu√©s es la m√∫sica, sublime para mi gusto. RiME quiz√°s no se pueda entender o jugar igual sin la m√∫sica que lo acompa√±a.
Me parece incre√≠ble como los chicos de Tequila han contado una historia sin usar ni siquiera unas breves l√≠neas de texto.
Cierto es que recuerda en parte a Journey o a ICO e incluso a The Last Guardian, pero RiME tiene una identidad propia que los hace a la vez muy distintos a los t√≠tulos mencionados.
Los primeros compases de RiME sean probablemente los m√°s sencillos del juego y nos sirven para poder aprender los controles. √âstos son muy b√°sicos ya que s√≥lo usamos tres botones y los sticks. Los primeros puzles que nos pone el juego nos dan una idea de que, sin llegar a ser complejos, nos va a poner a pensar un poco con bastante frecuencia. 
He de decir que la resoluci√≥n de todos los puzles est√° en la misma habitaci√≥n, casi siempre a la misma altura o en la planta superior. La primera zona es llamativa con √°rboles y sombras y una maravillosa playa para nosotros solos. El peque√±o zorro que pronto se nos une (su misi√≥n es parecer para indicarnos a d√≥nde ir para a continuaci√≥n desaparecer) consigue que le cojas cari√±o y te alegras cada vez que lo encuentras de nuevo.
Gr√°ficamente el juego luce bastante y bien y va muy fu√≠do, aunque he sufrido un bug que me ha hecho perder no m√°s de cinco minutos.
El sonido fx es correcto, pero sin duda, lo mejor del juego esla m√∫sica, al menos para m√≠. Y, es que como he dicho antes no concibo RiME sin su banda sonora. Simplemente de las quince mejores soundtracks de juegos de todos los tiempos. Se adapta como un guante a lo que se est√° viendo en pantalla en todo momento.
Los puzles a medida que vamos avanzando van haciendo que tengamos que pensar un poco m√°s, pero no llegan a ser desesperantes y una vez que los superas te das cuenta de que no son para tanto y que con un poco de intuici√≥n y picard√≠a no son realmente dif√≠ciles.
Si el apartado gr√°fico es bonito, sin duda es en parte por los escenarios que componen el juego. Desde la playa del comienzo a la zona del diluvio universal (por lo menos lo parece) del final son paisajes realmente bellos. La zona submarina est√° muy lograda y es realmente bella, sin embargo, la zona del desierto ha sido la zona que menos me ha gustado.
Las cinco zonas del juego, o los cinco estados (cuando os pas√©is el juego lo entender√©is), est√°n bien realizadas y tienen arquitectura y estilos distintos. Comenzamos en una paradis√≠aca playa, para dar paso a una zona desierta que nos lleva hasta una zona bajo las aguas para llegar a una zona de arboleda interior que nos lleva a una zona, la final, que llueve a mares. El agua de √©sta √∫ltima zona est√° representada de una manera muy realista. 
Los dos aspectos negativos que le he encontrado es que no se puede tener m√°s de una partida a la vez. Es decir, si yo empiezo una partida, mi hija o sigue por donde voy o empieza una nueva borr√°ndome todo lo avanzado. Y el segundo, y esto es una opini√≥n personal, es el final.
¬øQu√© les pasa √∫ltimamente a los que dise√±an las historias? Sinceramente creo que esta historia merec√≠a un final m√°s‚Ä¶ Otro final.
Como nota yo le dar√≠a un 8.5 ya que, aunque sublime, tiene unas m√≠nimas carencias que lo hubiesen encumbrado al olimpo de los videojuegos actuales. 
Muy bueno, pero levemente mejorable. Para los autores: Por favor cambiad el final.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962228863', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1501983963}
review:
Really good game, beautiful artstyle/graphics and atmosphere that the music adds, the puzzles are not overly complicated so should be playable for kids.

Some parts af the game do feel a bit choppy altho its above 45fps all the time(GTX 1080 on 3440x1440) that and considering the short playtime(6-8hours), i would recommend getting it on sale... if you get it for around 15$ it would be worth every penny :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197978330367', 'num_games_owned': 4132, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1502003517}
review: Enjoyable puzzle-platformer that's clearly inspired by games like ICO and The Last Guardian. You play a young boy who explores a mysterious locale by platforming and solving puzzles. None of the platforming or puzzles were particularly difficult but they were involved enough to be compelling. There's a little bit of jank, with occasionally clunky camera and controls and some pretty bad performance drops in a few areas. However, for the most part, the game runs and plays fine. Also, the game is a bit short (~6 hours) for $30. $15-20 seems more reasonable. Definitely worth a look within that price range.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025288449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1501985223}
review:
Although the middle of the game felt rather padded (pseudo-puzzles, lots of climbing/backtracking), the final act was emotionally impactful enough to warrant a recommendation.

PROS:
Beautiful aesthetics, lots of care went into the environments
Great score, music rises and falls at the perfect moments
The story really picks up in the final act of the game, very satisfying ending

CONS:
Lots of climbing "puzzles" which just constitute holding a direction and hitting jump for a period
Middle of game had a little too much backtracking
Puzzles were extremely easy

review: I haven't finished the game yet but can only see that I'm completely taken away by the visuals of the game. Such a beautiful game and loving the solving puzzles. I would recommend this to anyone who just wants to sit back relax and play.
